original: me dang bud shing de gnyis ni bud shing ni rgyu yin la me ni rgyu can yin pa'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa yin no zhes grags pas des na de dag na re me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin yang phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa'i
analyzed: me dang bud shing de gnyis ni bud shing ni rgyu yin la me ni rgyu can yin pa'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa yin no zhes grags pas des na de dag na re me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin yang phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa'i
translated: Since it is well known that fire and fuel are mutually dependent, because fuel is the cause and fire is the effect, they say that although fire and fuel are different, they are mutually dependent.

original: phyir dbu ma pas sngar me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin na ltos pa med pa'i phyir rtag tu 'bar ba dang 'bar byed med pa dang / rtsom pa don med pa dang las med pa la sogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes ci skad bstan pa de dag kho bo cag bye brag pa'i phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phyir dbu ma pas sngar me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin na ltos pa med pa'i phyir rtag tu 'bar ba dang 'bar byed med pa dang / rtsom pa don med pa dang las med pa la sogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes ci skad bstan pa de dag kho bo cag bye brag pa'i phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, they say that the faults previously explained by the Madhyamaka, that if fire and fuel are different, they would be unrelated, that there would be no ignition and combustion at all times, that undertaking would be pointless, that there would be no karma and so on, do not apply to our Vai≈õe·π£ika position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de dag kyang /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de dag kyang /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says here:

original: gal te shing las me gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te shing las me gzhan na //
translated: If fire were different from fuel,

original: shing med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shing med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: it would arise without fuel.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par ci skad bstan pa dag gis dgag pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par ci skad bstan pa dag gis dgag pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: and so on, extensively.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the following:

original: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: It would always be burning.

original: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las 'byung //
analyzed: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las 'byung //
translated: It would arise without a cause.

original: rtsom pa don med nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: rtsom pa don med nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Initiation would be pointless.

original: de lta yin na las kyang med //
analyzed: de lta yin na las kyang med //
translated: If that were so, there would be no karma.üîΩThese lines indicate the error that fire and fuel would be different.

original: ces bya ba dag gis me dang bud shing gzhan nyid yin pa'i skyon ci skad bstan pa dag kyang bsdus te /
analyzed: ces bya ba dag gis me dang bud shing gzhan nyid yin pa'i skyon ci skad bstan pa dag kyang bsdus te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes these.

original: gzhan nyid dgag pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid dgag pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: The following is the statement of the refutation of difference:üîΩUltimately, the illuminator is not fire because it is an element, like the other elements.

original: don dam par snang byed ni me ma yin par gzung bar bya ste 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba dag bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang /üîΩdpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: don dam par snang byed ni me ma yin par gzung bar bya ste 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba dag bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang /üîΩdpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the proposition, the proposition, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na snang byed las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba chu la sogs pa dag ni 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir me ma yin par gzung bar bya ba de bzhin du snang byed kyang 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir me ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: dper na snang byed las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba chu la sogs pa dag ni 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir me ma yin par gzung bar bya ba de bzhin du snang byed kyang 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir me ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: For example, just as the other elements such as water are not fire because they are elements, so also fire is not fire because it is an element.

original: de ni bye brag bdag na re rim gyis snang byed kyi rdzas brtsams pa me nyid dang 'brel pa'i phyir me yin la zhes zer ba de mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni bye brag bdag na re rim gyis snang byed kyi rdzas brtsams pa me nyid dang 'brel pa'i phyir me yin la zhes zer ba de mi rung ste /
translated: The Vaibhasikas say that fire is fire because the substance of fire is generated in a series connected with fire.

original: snang byed me'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas me'i rdzas ma grub pa'i phyir sngar me ni bud shing @217b sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snang byed me'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas me'i rdzas ma grub pa'i phyir sngar me ni bud shing @217b sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical because since fire is not the essence of fire, the substance of fire is not established.

original: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smos pa de grub par bstan to //
analyzed: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smos pa de grub par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it has been demonstrated that fire does not burn fuel because it is an element, just as water and so on are not.

original: rtsom pa dgag pa yang don dam par me'i rdul phra rab dag ni me zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsom pa dgag pa yang don dam par me'i rdul phra rab dag ni me zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, in terms of refuting the composition of fire, ultimately the subtle particles of fire do not compose the substance called fire.

original: rdul phra rab yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i rdul phra rab dag bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i rdul phra rab dag bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Because they are subtle particles, for example, like other subtle particles.üîΩFor example, other than fire, the subtle particles of water are not formers of the substance called fire because they are subtle particles.

original: dper na me las gzhan pa chu'i rdul phra rab dag ni rdul phra rab yin pa'i phyir me zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du me'i rdul phra rab dag kyang rdul phra rab yin pa'i phyir me zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsomüîΩpar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na me las gzhan pa chu'i rdul phra rab dag ni rdul phra rab yin pa'i phyir me zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du me'i rdul phra rab dag kyang rdul phra rab yin pa'i phyir me zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the subtle particles of fire are not formers of the substance called fire because they are subtle particles.

original: des na me'i rdul phra rab dag me'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: des na me'i rdul phra rab dag me'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin pas /
translated: Therefore, the subtle particles of fire are not formers of the substance of fire.

original: me'i rdzas ma grub pa'i phyir sngar me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: me'i rdzas ma grub pa'i phyir sngar me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the substance of fire is not established, fire does not burn fuel.

original: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smos pa de grub par bstan to //
analyzed: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smos pa de grub par bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are elements, like water, etc.‚Äù This is the proof.

original: ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin ci gzhan dag rtsom par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin ci gzhan dag rtsom par byed pa yin nam /
translated: But what is the meaning of that thesis? Do others compose it?

original: rtsom par mi byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga mas me'i rdul phra rab dag me zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don des ci me'i rdul phra
analyzed: rtsom par mi byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga mas me'i rdul phra rab dag me zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don des ci me'i rdul phra
translated: Or do they not compose it? The opponent‚Äôs reductio is this: The previous reductio argument of the Madhyamika shows that the subtle particles of fire do not compose a substance called ‚Äúfire.‚ÄùüîΩBy that meaning of the reason, what is the point of the subtle particles of fire?

original: rab dag me zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin na de dag chu la sogs pa'i rdzas gzhan dag rtsom par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: rab dag me zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin na de dag chu la sogs pa'i rdzas gzhan dag rtsom par byed pa yin nam /
translated: If they do not compose a substance called ‚Äúfire,‚Äù do they compose other substances such as water?

original: 'on te ci yang rtsom par mi byed pa yin zhes gal te gnyis su rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ci yang rtsom par mi byed pa yin zhes gal te gnyis su rtog pa yin no //
translated: Or do they not compose anything at all?

original: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshur dri ba yin no //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshur dri ba yin no //
translated: What is the point of this? This is the question.

original: de'i lan du gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar na ni dam bcas pa nyams so zhes bya ba ni de ltar na sngar dbu ma pas rdul phran thams cad so sor nges pa'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin par dam bcas la /
analyzed: de'i lan du gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar na ni dam bcas pa nyams so zhes bya ba ni de ltar na sngar dbu ma pas rdul phran thams cad so sor nges pa'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin par dam bcas la /
translated: If it is as the former analysis, then the thesis is undermined because the Centrist previously asserted that all minute particles are not the compositional basis of discrete substances,

original: da 'dir gzhan dag rtsom par byed pa yin par khas blangs pas dam bcas pa nyams so //üîΩci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar na ni dpe med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta na 'dir rtsom par mi byed par sgrub pas sngar /
analyzed: da 'dir gzhan dag rtsom par byed pa yin par khas blangs pas dam bcas pa nyams so // ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar na ni dpe med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta na 'dir rtsom par mi byed par sgrub pas sngar /
translated: but now here it is accepted that they are the compositional basis of other things.üîΩIf it is as the latter analysis, then there is no example.üîΩIf it is as the latter analysis, then the example is refuted because the previous proof that they do not compose this is stated with an example,

original: dper na de las gzhan pa'i rdul phra rab dag bzhin no zhes dpe bstan pa bsal bas des na dpe snga ma dag bsgrub par bya bas stong pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa'i rdul phra rab dag bzhin no zhes dpe bstan pa bsal bas des na dpe snga ma dag bsgrub par bya bas stong pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: for example, like other minute particles.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary states:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: brtag pa snga ma ltar khas ma blangs @218a * //
analyzed: brtag pa snga ma ltar khas ma blangs @218a * //
translated: The former analysis is not accepted.üîΩ

original: pa'i phyir dang brtag pa phyi ma la yang sa la sogs pa me rtsom par byed pa ma yin par grub pa dag las gang yang rung ba dpe nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir dang brtag pa phyi ma la yang sa la sogs pa me rtsom par byed pa ma yin par grub pa dag las gang yang rung ba dpe nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the former analysis is not accepted, and in the latter analysis, since it is established that earth and so on are not the instigators of fire, any one of them is a suitable example.

original: gzhan dag rtsom par byed pa yin par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dam bcas pa nyams pa yang ma yin pa la sa la sogs pa me rtsom par byed pa ma yin par grub pa dag dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pas dpe med pa yang ma yin
analyzed: gzhan dag rtsom par byed pa yin par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dam bcas pa nyams pa yang ma yin pa la sa la sogs pa me rtsom par byed pa ma yin par grub pa dag dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pas dpe med pa yang ma yin
translated: Since others are not accepted as instigators, the thesis is not undermined, and since any one of those established as not being the instigator of fire is posited as an example, there is no lack of example.

original: no // yang na don dam par me ni me'i rdul phra rab dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: no // yang na don dam par me ni me'i rdul phra rab dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Or, ultimately fire should be held to be not initiated by the fire particles.

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na chu bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na chu bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and because it is an effect, like water.

original: dper na chu ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir me'i rdul phra rab dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ba de bzhin du me yang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir me'i rdul phra rab dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na chu ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir me'i rdul phra rab dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ba de bzhin du me yang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir me'i rdul phra rab dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: For example, because water is an effect, it is apprehended as not composed of the subtle particles of fire. In the same way, fire is apprehended as not composed of the subtle particles of fire because it is an effect.üîΩIn the same way, one should state the reasons: ‚ÄúBecause they are produced, they are perishable,‚Äù and so on.

original: de bzhin du byas pa nyid dang chud za ba nyid kyang skye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma'i sgrub pa'i chos ni 'di dag kyang yinüîΩpar sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byas pa nyid dang chud za ba nyid kyang skye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma'i sgrub pa'i chos ni 'di dag kyang yinüîΩpar sbyar te /
translated: The property of the subject in the former inference is also applied to these.

original: don dam par me ni rdul phra rab dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par me ni rdul phra rab dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Ultimately, fire is not composed of subtle particles because

original: byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang chud za ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / skye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na chu bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bur sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang chud za ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / skye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na chu bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bur sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: it is produced, it is perishable, and it arises, like water.

original: des ni me ni me'i rdul phra rab dag gis brtsams pa ma yin pas me'i rdzas ma grub pa'i phyir sngar me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des ni me ni me'i rdul phra rab dag gis brtsams pa ma yin pas me'i rdzas ma grub pa'i phyir sngar me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: This argument demonstrates that since fire is not composed of the subtle particles of fire, the substance of fire does not exist.

original: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smos pa de ma grub par bstan to //
analyzed: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smos pa de ma grub par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it demonstrates that the previous statement, Fire does not burn fuel because it is an element, like water and so on, is not established.

original: grangs can dag gis snying stobs dang rdul shas che ba'i sgra dang reg pa dang gzugs dag ni me yin la /
analyzed: grangs can dag gis snying stobs dang rdul shas che ba'i sgra dang reg pa dang gzugs dag ni me yin la /
translated: SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that sound, touch, and form that are dominated by sattva and rajas are fire.

original: mun pa shas che ba ni bud shing yin par smra zhing des de la khyab par 'dod pas bud shing gi rgyus me 'byung bas bud shing ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir me ni bud shing la ltos pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: mun pa shas che ba ni bud shing yin par smra zhing des de la khyab par 'dod pas bud shing gi rgyus me 'byung bas bud shing ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir me ni bud shing la ltos pa nyid yin pas /
translated: Since fire depends on fuel, they say that the error of nihilism is completely avoided.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon yongs su spangs so zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag me dang bud shing dag rang bzhin gcig pas gzhan nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon yongs su spangs so zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag me dang bud shing dag rang bzhin gcig pas gzhan nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that because fire and fuel are the same nature, they are not different.

original: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i shas che chung las me dang bud shing zhes kyang bya zhing phan tshun ltos pa dang / @218b bcas pa yang yin pas gzhan nyid kyi phyogs la skyon gang dag bstan pa de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba'i gzhung yin te /
analyzed: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i shas che chung las me dang bud shing zhes kyang bya zhing phan tshun ltos pa dang / @218b bcas pa yang yin pas gzhan nyid kyi phyogs la skyon gang dag bstan pa de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba'i gzhung yin te /
translated: Since they are called fire and fuel due to the predominance of sattva, rajas, and tamas, and they are also mutually dependent, the errors that are taught in the position of difference do not exist in our position.üîΩThis is the text of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.

original: de dag gi gzhung las sa la sogs pa 'byung ba thams cad la snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa zhes bya ba yon tan gsum yod de /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung las sa la sogs pa 'byung ba thams cad la snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa zhes bya ba yon tan gsum yod de /
translated: In their texts, all elements such as earth are said to possess the three qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: da la snying stobs ni yang ba dang gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: da la snying stobs ni yang ba dang gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: Sattva is the nature of lightness and clarity.üîΩRajas is the nature of movement and activity.

original: rdul ni g-yo ba dang 'jug par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pas de'i phyir gzugs dang sgra dang reg pa de tsam gang la snying stobs dang rdul shas che ba ni me yin te /
analyzed: rdul ni g-yo ba dang 'jug par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pas de'i phyir gzugs dang sgra dang reg pa de tsam gang la snying stobs dang rdul shas che ba ni me yin te /
translated: Therefore, fire is the predominance of sattva and rajas among the elements of form, sound, and tactility.

original: me ni gzugs dang sgra dang reg pa'i skye mched dang ldan par 'dod do //
analyzed: me ni gzugs dang sgra dang reg pa'i skye mched dang ldan par 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that fire possesses the form, sound, and tactility bases.üîΩTamas is the nature of heaviness and stability.

original: mun pa ni lci ba dang gnas pa'i bdag nyid yin pas gzugs dang ro dang dri dang reg pa de tsam gang la mun pa shas che ba ni bud shing yin te /
analyzed: mun pa ni lci ba dang gnas pa'i bdag nyid yin pas gzugs dang ro dang dri dang reg pa de tsam gang la mun pa shas che ba ni bud shing yin te /
translated: Therefore, fuel is the predominance of tamas among the elements of form, taste, smell, and tactility.

original: sa ni gzugs dang ro dang dri dang reg pa'i skye mched dang ldan par 'dod do //
analyzed: sa ni gzugs dang ro dang dri dang reg pa'i skye mched dang ldan par 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that earth possesses the form, taste, smell, and tactility bases.

original: de bas na me des bud shing de khyab cing sreg pa ni yon tan gsum po dag gi rang bzhin gcig pas gzhan nyid kyang ma yin la byed pa po dang las kyi tshul du ltos pa dang bcas pa yang yin par 'dod do zhes grags te /
analyzed: de bas na me des bud shing de khyab cing sreg pa ni yon tan gsum po dag gi rang bzhin gcig pas gzhan nyid kyang ma yin la byed pa po dang las kyi tshul du ltos pa dang bcas pa yang yin par 'dod do zhes grags te /
translated: Therefore, since the fire pervades and burns the fuel, it is not different from the nature of the three qualities, but it is asserted that it is related to the fuel in the manner of an agent and object.

original: des na dbu ma pas sngar gzhan nyid kyi phyogs la rtag tu 'bar ba dang 'bar byed med pa dang rtsom pa don med pa dang las med pa la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gang dag bstan pa de dag grangs can dag gi phyogs
analyzed: des na dbu ma pas sngar gzhan nyid kyi phyogs la rtag tu 'bar ba dang 'bar byed med pa dang rtsom pa don med pa dang las med pa la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gang dag bstan pa de dag grangs can dag gi phyogs
translated: Therefore, the Followers of the Middle Way have previously shown that if things were inherently other, the absurd consequences would ensue that things would be constantly burning, that there would be no difference between that which ignites and that which is ignited, that all endeavors would be pointless, that there would be no such thing as karma, and so on.

original: la med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la med do zhes zer ro //
translated: The Enumerators say that these consequences do not apply to their own system.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary here says the following.

original: de dag kyang don dam par me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes snga ma bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag kyang don dam par me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes snga ma bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Moreover, ultimately fire does not burn fuel because it is an element, like water and so on.

original: grangs can dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i me ni 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir don dam par sreg pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: grangs can dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i me ni 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir don dam par sreg pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: The fire imputed by the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas is not ultimately the nature of burning because it is an element.

original: dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar bstan to //üîΩci ste dam bcas pa'i don rnam par brtags nas de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo nyid dam ngo bo nyid med par rtog na phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dpe med do zhes rgol bar byed na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i rjes
analyzed: dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar bstan to // ci ste dam bcas pa'i don rnam par brtags nas de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo nyid dam ngo bo nyid med par rtog na phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dpe med do zhes rgol bar byed na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i rjes
translated: For example, like water and so on.üîΩIf, having analyzed the meaning of the thesis, one argues that the example is not established because there is no other nature or non-nature, then the opponent,üîΩhaving analyzed the meaning of the thesis, argues that the example is not established because there is no other nature or non-nature.

original: su dpag pa snga ma me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te zhes bstan pa'i gtan tshigs de la dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: su dpag pa snga ma me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te zhes bstan pa'i gtan tshigs de la dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
translated: The opponent, having analyzed the meaning of the thesis, argues that the example is not established because there is no other nature or non-nature.

original: me sreg par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de las gzhan pa gsher ba la sogs @219a * //
analyzed: me sreg par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de las gzhan pa gsher ba la sogs @219a * //
translated: It is not that fire is not by nature a burner.üîΩ

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid yin nam 'on te gang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin /
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid yin nam 'on te gang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin /
translated: It is not the essence of fire, but is it the essence of something else, such as water, or is it not the essence of anything?

original: des cir 'gyur gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar na ni dam bcas pa nyams so //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar na ni dam bcas pa nyams so //
translated: What follows from that? If it is the former, then your thesis is undermined.

original: ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar na ni dpe med do zhes rgol bar byed na'o //
analyzed: ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar na ni dpe med do zhes rgol bar byed na'o //
translated: But if it is the latter, then there is no example.

original: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de la 'dir dgag pa de ni sreg pa nyid dgag pa kho nas mthu zad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sreg pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i sgra'i don ni sgra gzhan gyis bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa yang med la sa la sogs pa sreg pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par grub pa dag nyid dpe yin pa'i
analyzed: de la 'dir dgag pa de ni sreg pa nyid dgag pa kho nas mthu zad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sreg pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i sgra'i don ni sgra gzhan gyis bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa yang med la sa la sogs pa sreg pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par grub pa dag nyid dpe yin pa'i
translated: Here, since the refutation is exhausted by the mere refutation of burning, and since the meaning of the term ‚Äúnon-burning‚Äù is to be expressed by another term, there is no fault in the opponent‚Äôs position, and earth and so on, which are established as not having the essence of burning, are the example.

original: phyir dpe med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyir dpe med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But it is not that there is no example.

original: me ni sreg ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dgag pa de ni dpe med par dgag pa'i don yin gyi ma yin par dgag pa'i don ma yin pas des na me de chu la sogs pa gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin par khas ma
analyzed: me ni sreg ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dgag pa de ni dpe med par dgag pa'i don yin gyi ma yin par dgag pa'i don ma yin pas des na me de chu la sogs pa gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin par khas ma
translated: The meaning of the negation ‚Äúfire is not by nature hot‚Äù is a negation that does not imply the opposite, and it does not mean a negation that implies the opposite. Therefore, since we do not accept that fire is by nature something other than fuel, such as water,

original: blangs pa'i phyir dam bcas pa nyams pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: blangs pa'i phyir dam bcas pa nyams pa yang ma yin la /
translated: we do not contradict our own tenets.üîΩSince we posit such things as earth, which are established as not being by nature hot, as examples,

original: sa la sogs pa sreg pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par grub pa dag dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pas dpe med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa sreg pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par grub pa dag dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pas dpe med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: we are not without an example.üîΩEnough of this extensive analysis.üîΩThis is the commentary on the twenty-first chapter, having twenty-one

original: dpyad pa rgyas pas chog go zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma dag gi don dpyad pa rgyas par bstan pas chog gis /
analyzed: dpyad pa rgyas pas chog go zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma dag gi don dpyad pa rgyas par bstan pas chog gis /
translated: verses, called the examination of fire and fuel.

original: da ni tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma dag gi skabs nyid bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: da ni tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma dag gi skabs nyid bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Now, the meaning of the following verses will be explained.

original: yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du khas len pa'i phyogs la glags yod pa'i tshig 'di dag tu yang 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du khas len pa'i phyogs la glags yod pa'i tshig 'di dag tu yang 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: Moreover, the following verses also demonstrate that the statements of the opponent who accepts that fire and fuel are different are subject to the following objections.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: gzhan na mi phrad phrad med na //üîΩsreg par mi 'gyur mi sreg na //
analyzed: gzhan na mi phrad phrad med na // sreg par mi 'gyur mi sreg na //
translated: If different, they would not make contact;üîΩif they did not make contact,üîΩthere would be no burning; if there were no burning,

original: 'chi bar mi 'gyur mi 'chi na //
analyzed: 'chi bar mi 'gyur mi 'chi na //
translated: there would be no cessation; if there were no cessation,

original: rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas //üîΩzhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas // zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: they would remain with their own characteristics.

original: gzhan na mi phrad ces bya ba bstan pa'i phyir me gzhan yin na bud shing dang mi phrad de gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na de nyid bud shing dang ma phrad pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan na mi phrad ces bya ba bstan pa'i phyir me gzhan yin na bud shing dang mi phrad de gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na de nyid bud shing dang ma phrad pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the line ‚Äúif different, they would not make contact,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúIf fire were different from fuel, it would not make contact with fuel, because it would be different, just like that which is not fuel.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / bsgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / bsgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na me de nyid bud shing thag ring po na 'dug pa dang ma phrad pa ni bud shing de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir bud shing de dang mi phrad pa de bzhin du me gzhan yin pa de yang bud shing las gzhan yin pa'i phyir @219b bud
analyzed: dper na me de nyid bud shing thag ring po na 'dug pa dang ma phrad pa ni bud shing de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir bud shing de dang mi phrad pa de bzhin du me gzhan yin pa de yang bud shing las gzhan yin pa'i phyir @219b bud
translated: For example, fire that is distant from fuel and not in contact with it is different from that fuel, and because that fire is different from the fuel, it is not in contact with the fuel.

original: shing dang mi phrad do //
analyzed: shing dang mi phrad do //
translated: If there is no contact, there is no burning.

original: phrad pa med na sreg par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir phrad pa med na sreg par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phrad pa med na sreg par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir phrad pa med na sreg par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, If there is no contact, there is no burning.

original: 'dir me dang bud shing dag kyang byed pa po dang las kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel cing phrad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir me dang bud shing dag kyang byed pa po dang las kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel cing phrad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, fire and fuel are related and in contact because they are characterized as agent and object.

original: ci ltar me bud shing dang ma phrad pa la byed pa po nyid med cing bud shing me dang ma phrad pa la yang las nyid med pa de bzhin du 'dir yang me dang bud shing phrad pa med pa la sreg par byed pa dang bsreg par bya
analyzed: ci ltar me bud shing dang ma phrad pa la byed pa po nyid med cing bud shing me dang ma phrad pa la yang las nyid med pa de bzhin du 'dir yang me dang bud shing phrad pa med pa la sreg par byed pa dang bsreg par bya
translated: Just as fire does not exist without contact with fuel, and fuel does not exist without contact with fire, so too here, since there is no contact between fire and fuel, the characteristics of the agent and object of burning are not related.

original: ba'i mtshan nyid du 'brel pa med pas phrad pa med na sreg par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i mtshan nyid du 'brel pa med pas phrad pa med na sreg par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no contact, there is no burning.üîΩBut if there were burning without contact, then since it would exist in one place, the entire world would be burned.

original: ci ste phrad pa med kyang sreg par 'gyur na ni phyogs gcig na 'dug pas 'gro ba mtha' dag sreg par 'gyur bas de'i phyir phrad pa de mi 'thad pas gzhan nyid yin yang sreg bzhin pa na bud shing yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni mi
analyzed: ci ste phrad pa med kyang sreg par 'gyur na ni phyogs gcig na 'dug pas 'gro ba mtha' dag sreg par 'gyur bas de'i phyir phrad pa de mi 'thad pas gzhan nyid yin yang sreg bzhin pa na bud shing yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni mi
translated: Therefore, since that is untenable, it is not tenable to say that fuel is burning when it is different.üîΩIf it is not burning, it does not ceaseüîΩbecause it is not established that it exists without fuel.

original: 'thad do // mi sreg na 'chi bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir mi sreg na 'chi bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'thad do // mi sreg na 'chi bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir mi sreg na 'chi bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not burning, it does not cease.

original: bud shing med pa yang grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bud shing med pa yang grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is established that it exists without fuel.

original: 'di ltar mes bud shing sreg na ni bud shing zad pas 'chi bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mes bud shing sreg na ni bud shing zad pas 'chi bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If fire burns fuel, it would extinguish due to the exhaustion of fuel.

original: mi sreg pa la 'chi ba rgyu med pa las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi sreg pa la 'chi ba rgyu med pa las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it does not burn, it would not extinguish without a cause.

original: bud shing med par yang me grub na bud shing mi sreg kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud shing med par yang me grub na bud shing mi sreg kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If fire were established without fuel, it would not extinguish even if it did not burn.

original: mi 'chi na rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'chi na rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If it did not extinguish, it would endure possessing its own attributes.

original: mi 'chi na rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'chi na rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: If it did not extinguish, it would endure possessing its own attributes.

original: rang gi rgyu med par ther zug tu gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu med par ther zug tu gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It would endure as an enduring entity without its own cause.

original: mi 'chi na me'i rang gi rgyu bud shing med par rang gi rtags 'bar ba dang snang ba dang sreg pa la sogs pa dang ldan zhing theg zug tu gnas par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: mi 'chi na me'i rang gi rgyu bud shing med par rang gi rtags 'bar ba dang snang ba dang sreg pa la sogs pa dang ldan zhing theg zug tu gnas par 'gyur ro ;
translated: If it did not extinguish, fire would endure possessing its own attributes, such as blazing, shining, and burning, without its own cause, fuel.

original: / ci ste me de bud shing las gzhan nam 'on te gzhan ma yin te de las gzhan nyid yin par dam 'cha' ba la ni ci skad bstan pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni de ltar gzhan nyid du khas len pa'i phyogs la
analyzed: / ci ste me de bud shing las gzhan nam 'on te gzhan ma yin te de las gzhan nyid yin par dam 'cha' ba la ni ci skad bstan pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni de ltar gzhan nyid du khas len pa'i phyogs la
translated: If one asserts that the fire is different from the fuel, then the error stated would ensue.üîΩHaving thus shown that those are the terms that would apply to the position that asserts difference, here he asks, ‚ÄúDo you accept that they are different or not?‚Äù

original: glags yod pa'i tshig de dag tu 'gyur bar bstan nas 'dir pha rol po dag gzhan nyid du khas lan tam mi len ces brnan te dri ba dang / gal te gzhan nyid du khas len na mi phrad pa dang sreg par mi 'gyur ba dang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba dang rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: glags yod pa'i tshig de dag tu 'gyur bar bstan nas 'dir pha rol po dag gzhan nyid du khas lan tam mi len ces brnan te dri ba dang / gal te gzhan nyid du khas len na mi phrad pa dang sreg par mi 'gyur ba dang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba dang rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so zhes bstan to //
translated: If one accepts that they are different, then the error of non-contact, non-burning, non-death, and remaining with its own characteristics would ensue.

original: de la 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig @220a * //
analyzed: de la 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig @220a * //
translated: Here, the terms that would apply are as follows.

original: yin pa'i phyir mi phrad pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi skabs kyi don bsgrub par nus pas de'i dbang gis rjes su dpag pa brjod par mi bya ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid yin par smra ba'i phyogs de la tshig le'ur byas pa gong ma'i skabs
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir mi phrad pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi skabs kyi don bsgrub par nus pas de'i dbang gis rjes su dpag pa brjod par mi bya ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid yin par smra ba'i phyogs de la tshig le'ur byas pa gong ma'i skabs
translated: This is the context of the earlier verse that refutes the position that maintains difference.

original: 'dir gzhan yin na mi phrad do //üîΩphrad pa med na sreg par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan yin na mi phrad do // phrad pa med na sreg par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, if they are different, they do not contact each other.üîΩIf they do not contact each other, they do not burn.

original: mi sreg na 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi sreg na 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do not burn, they do not die.

original: mi 'chi na rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'i glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir mi phrad pa dang sreg par mi 'gyur ba dang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba dang / rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams kyi skabs kyi don phrad pa dang sreg par 'gyur ba dang 'chi bar 'gyur ba dang rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par mi 'gyur ba dag sgrub nus pas glags yod pa'i tshig de'i dbang gis
analyzed: mi 'chi na rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'i glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir mi phrad pa dang sreg par mi 'gyur ba dang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba dang / rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams kyi skabs kyi don phrad pa dang sreg par 'gyur ba dang 'chi bar 'gyur ba dang rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par mi 'gyur ba dag sgrub nus pas glags yod pa'i tshig de'i dbang gis
translated: Because it is a statement that can be refuted, it is able to prove the opposite of the meaning of the context of phenomena that do not meet, are not burned, do not die, and remain possessing their own attributes, namely, that they meet, are burned, die, and do not remain possessing their own attributes.üîΩTherefore, because of that statement that can be refuted,

original: gzhan yin pa dang mi phrad pa dang sreg par mi 'gyur ba dang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba dang rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni brjod par mi bya'i zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa dang mi phrad pa dang sreg par mi 'gyur ba dang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba dang rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni brjod par mi bya'i zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: it is said that the inferences of being different, not meeting, not being burned, not dying, and remaining possessing one‚Äôs own attributes should not be stated.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar rjes su dpag pa brjod par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar rjes su dpag pa brjod par mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why should those inferences not be stated?

original: de'i phyir gzhan nyid rang la ma grub pa'i phyir dang / mi phrad par bstan par mi bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩme dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin par nged dbu ma pa rang la ma grub pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par rjes su dpag pa brjod par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan nyid rang la ma grub pa'i phyir dang / mi phrad par bstan par mi bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te / me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin par nged dbu ma pa rang la ma grub pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par rjes su dpag pa brjod par mi bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, since otherness is not established for us, and since it is not to be taught that they do not contact each other,üîΩsince fire and fuel are other, we MƒÅdhyamikas do not assert that they are other, so it is not to be stated that they are other.

original: nged dbu ma pas mi phrad pa dang sreg par mi 'gyur ba dang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba dang / rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par yang bstan par mi bya ba'i phyir mi phrad pa la sogs par rjes su dpag pa brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: nged dbu ma pas mi phrad pa dang sreg par mi 'gyur ba dang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba dang / rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par yang bstan par mi bya ba'i phyir mi phrad pa la sogs par rjes su dpag pa brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Since we MƒÅdhyamikas do not assert that they do not contact each other, that they do not burn, that they do not perish, and that they remain with their own characteristics, it is not to be stated that they do not contact each other and so on.

original: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad ces tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don gzhan yin no zhes bya ba dang mi phrad do zhes bya ba dang sreg par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de dag sgra ci bzhin kho nar gzung bar bya ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad ces tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don gzhan yin no zhes bya ba dang mi phrad do zhes bya ba dang sreg par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de dag sgra ci bzhin kho nar gzung bar bya ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary states:

original: sgra ci bzhin yang ma yin te //üîΩzhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: sgra ci bzhin yang ma yin te // zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: It is not to be taken literally.

original: 'o na ci lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, how is it?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar gzhan nyid dgag pa bstan pa'i tshig gi don yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar gzhan nyid dgag pa bstan pa'i tshig gi don yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúIt is the meaning of the words that teach the negation of difference.‚Äù

original: glags yod @220b pa'i tshig de dag ni sgra ci bzhin ma yin te de dag las bzlog pas me dang bud shing dag gi gzhan nyid dgag pa bstan pa'i tshig gi don yin no //üîΩgzhan nyid dgag pa de yang bsdigs pas bstan par bya ba ma yin gyi 'di ltar byed pa po dang las dag gi gzhan nyid dgag pa bzhin du grags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing dag gi gzhan nyid dgag pa de yang glags
analyzed: glags yod @220b pa'i tshig de dag ni sgra ci bzhin ma yin te de dag las bzlog pas me dang bud shing dag gi gzhan nyid dgag pa bstan pa'i tshig gi don yin no // gzhan nyid dgag pa de yang bsdigs pas bstan par bya ba ma yin gyi 'di ltar byed pa po dang las dag gi gzhan nyid dgag pa bzhin du grags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing dag gi gzhan nyid dgag pa de yang glags
translated: The words that are open to objection are not literal; their meaning is to be taken as the opposite of what they say, namely, the refutation of the thesis that fire and fuel are different.üîΩThis refutation of difference cannot be established by mere words that are open to objection; rather, it is established by what is commonly recognized, just as the refutation of the difference of agent and action is established.

original: yod pa'i tshig tsam gyis bsdigs pas gzhan nyid ma yin par mi 'grub kyi /
analyzed: yod pa'i tshig tsam gyis bsdigs pas gzhan nyid ma yin par mi 'grub kyi /
translated: The refutation of the difference of fire and fuel cannot be established as nondifference by mere words that are open to objection.üîΩIt must be established by the valid knowledge of inference.üîΩTherefore, here, in order to establish that fire and fuel are not different, the inference that establishes that is as follows.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas bsgrub dgos pas 'dir de dag gzhan nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni sngar byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i skabs su /üîΩbyed pa po la brten byas shing //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas bsgrub dgos pas 'dir de dag gzhan nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni sngar byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i skabs su / byed pa po la brten byas shing //
translated: In the section on the analysis of agent and action, it was said:üîΩThe agent depends on the action,

original: las kyang byed po de nyid la //
analyzed: las kyang byed po de nyid la //
translated: And the action depends on the agent.

original: brten nas 'byung ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: brten nas 'byung ba ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from dependent origination,

original: 'grub pa'i rgyu ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'grub pa'i rgyu ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: no cause for their establishment is perceived.

original: zhes bstan pa bzhin du grags pa yin pas de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa bzhin du grags pa yin pas de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: Since this is well known, it should be applied in the appropriate way.

original: yang na / gang zhig gang dang lhan cig pa //
analyzed: yang na / gang zhig gang dang lhan cig pa //
translated: Or, since it will be shown later thatüîΩit is untenable that one thing is different from another, it should not be taught here.

original: gzhan nyid du mi 'thad do zhes 'og nas ston par 'gyur bas 'dir bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni yang na gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'og nas phrad pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa las de skad du ston par 'gyur bas
analyzed: gzhan nyid du mi 'thad do zhes 'og nas ston par 'gyur bas 'dir bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni yang na gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'og nas phrad pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa las de skad du ston par 'gyur bas
translated: Or, since the inference refuting difference will be taught later in the chapter

original: da 'dir bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: da 'dir bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: examining contact, it should not be taught here.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: gal te khyed skyes pa dang bud med dag gzhan nyid yin yang phrad pa khas mi len na ni des na me dang bud shing dag kyang phrad pa med pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gal te khyed skyes pa dang bud med dag gzhan nyid yin yang phrad pa khas mi len na ni des na me dang bud shing dag kyang phrad pa med pas 'di lta ste /
translated: If you do not accept that men and women make contact even though they are different, then fire and fuel would also not make contact.

original: gzhan na mi phrad phrad med na //
analyzed: gzhan na mi phrad phrad med na //
translated: If they are different, they do not make contact. If they do not make contact,

original: sreg par mi 'gyur mi sreg na //
analyzed: sreg par mi 'gyur mi sreg na //
translated: they are not burned. If they are not burned,

analyzed: 'chi bar mi 'gyur mi 'chi na // rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas //
translated: If it does not die,üîΩit would endure possessing its own attributes.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon de dag tu 'ang 'gyur grang na //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon de dag tu 'ang 'gyur grang na //
translated: And so on.

original: 'jig rten thams cad la skyes ba dang bud med dag gzhan nyid yin yang phrad par grags pa bsnyon par mi nus pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la skyes ba dang bud med dag gzhan nyid yin yang phrad par grags pa bsnyon par mi nus pas de'i phyir /
translated: But since it is well known in the world that men and women, though different, do meet, and this cannot be denied,üîΩthen just as a man meets a woman

original: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
analyzed: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
translated: and a woman meets a man,

original: gal te shing las me gzhan yang //
analyzed: gal te shing las me gzhan yang //
translated: if fire were different from fuel,

analyzed: shing dang phrad du rung bar 'gyur // zhes smra bar nus so zhes bya ba la 'dir pha rol po dag gi bsam pa ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: gal te skyes pa dang bud med dag gzhan nyid yin yang phrad par mi 'gyur na ni de las me dang bud shing dag gzhan yin pa la'ang phrad pa la phrad pa med pas /

analyzed: gzhan na mi phrad phrad med na //

analyzed: sreg par mi 'gyur mi sreg na //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i de skyon dag tu'ang 'gyur @221a * //
translated: If you say that, then it would also be the case that the faults of the other would be yours.üîΩBut you cannot deny that in the world it is well known that men and women who are different from each other meet.

analyzed: grang na / 'jig rten thams cad la skyes pa dang bud med dag gzhan nyid yin yang phrad par grags pa khyod kyis bsnyon par mi nus pas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore you can say:üîΩJust as a woman meets a man,

original: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smra bar nus te /üîΩdes na gzhan nyid yin yang phrad par rung bas khyod kyis /
analyzed: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra bar nus te / des na gzhan nyid yin yang phrad par rung bas khyod kyis /
translated: and a man meets a woman,üîΩso too a self meets another self.

original: gzhan ni mi phrad ces bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni mi phrad ces bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Thus, since it is possible for those who are different to meet, the fault of saying that ‚Äúdifferent things do not meet‚Äù and so on does not apply to us.

original: bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra ma gsungs kyang ci ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra'i rjes su dpag na zla yin pa'i phyir yod par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra ma gsungs kyang ci ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra'i rjes su dpag na zla yin pa'i phyir yod par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Although the word ‚Äújust‚Äù is not stated, it should be seen as implied by the word ‚Äúhow,‚Äù because it is a counterpart.üîΩJust as a woman meets a man,

original: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
analyzed: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
translated: and a man meets a woman,üîΩso too a self meets another self.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs kyi bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra mdo mdzad pas dngos su ma gsungs kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs kyi bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra mdo mdzad pas dngos su ma gsungs kyang /

translated: it is inferred from the term ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the passage, ‚ÄúJust as a man and a woman‚Ä¶‚Äù

analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba dang de bzhin zhes bya ba ni don gcig pas 'dir yang de yod par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba sgra bsdeb pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The terms ‚Äúlike this‚Äù and ‚Äúlike that‚Äù have the same meaning, and therefore the phrase ‚Äúone should see that it exists‚Äù is a compound word.üîΩThe first half of the verse should be explained by reversing the order of the words.

analyzed: phyed gong ma shos bsnor nas rnam par bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa 'di mdo mdzad pas ni /
translated: The author of the sutra says:

analyzed: gal te shing las me gzhan yang //
translated: If fire were different from fuel,

original: shing dang phrad du rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shing dang phrad du rung bar 'gyur //
translated: it would be tenable to contact fuel.üîΩJust as a man and a woman

analyzed: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //

analyzed: zhes go rims de ltar gsungs mod kyi 'dir 'grel pa byed pas phyed gong ma dang 'og ma bsnor te de rnam par bshad par bya'o //

analyzed: ci'i phyir bsnor zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir smra bar 'dod pa'i don bstan sla ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /

translated: If the example is mentioned first, it is easy to teach the meaning of the actual text.üîΩHere the meaning of the words is as follows: In order to show that it is not ascertained because the property of the thesis is stated even in regard to the discordant side,

translated: the meaning of this verse is as follows.üîΩJust as a woman and a man,

analyzed: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
translated: and a man and a woman come together,

analyzed: zhes bya bas gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan nyid la yang sgrub pa'i chos phrad pa'i mtshan nyid yod par bstan pa'i phyir sngar dbu ma pas /
translated: in order to show that the property of the thesis, having the characteristic of coming together, exists even in regard to the discordant side, which is not different, the MƒÅdhyamika previously stated:

analyzed: gzhan na mi phrad ces gang smras pa de ma nges pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt does not contact another‚Äù is an expression of the uncertainty of your position.

translated: Then, another person says, ‚ÄúJust as impermanent form is not permanent, sound is also like that.‚Äù The first person should understand that the second person‚Äôs statement is an expression of uncertainty.

translated: Then, a certain NaiyƒÅyika says, ‚ÄúThe subsequent position is that sound is impermanent.‚Äù The first person should understand that the second person‚Äôs statement is an expression of uncertainty.üîΩIn the same way, you MƒÅdhyamikas

original: 'dir kho bo cag gis /
analyzed: 'dir kho bo cag gis /
translated: Here we say:üîΩJust as a woman contacts a man

original: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
analyzed: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //

analyzed: zhes bya bas skyes pa dang bud med dag gzhan nyid yin yang phrad du rung bar smras pas khyed dbu ma pa'i tshig de ma nges pa nyid du bstan par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //

original: dad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phrad pa yang med pas dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa snga ma gzhan na mi phrad ces bya ba de ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes ston to //üîΩgal te me dang shing dag gcig gis gcig bsal bar gyur na zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang las su 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid med par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni /

original: shing las me gzhan nyid yin yang //
analyzed: shing las me gzhan nyid yin yang //
translated: Even if fire were different from fuel,üîΩit would depend on contact with fuel.

original: shing dang phrad bar 'dod la rag / ces bya ba ni khyod 'dod pa dag bud med dang skyes pa dag bzhin du phrad par 'dod la rag na zhes glags yod pa'i sgo nas khas blangs na lan 'debs par 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dbu
analyzed: shing dang phrad bar 'dod la rag / ces bya ba ni khyod 'dod pa dag bud med dang skyes pa dag bzhin du phrad par 'dod la rag na zhes glags yod pa'i sgo nas khas blangs na lan 'debs par 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dbu
translated: This is a reply that accepts the opponent‚Äôs position as if it were tenable and then responds.

original: ma pa'i phyogs la don dam par me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pas phrad pa yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: ma pa'i phyogs la don dam par me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pas phrad pa yang med mod kyi /
translated: The MƒÅdhyamika‚Äôs position is that ultimately fire and fuel are not established as different, and therefore they do not contact each other.üîΩHowever, if they were not different, it would be impossible for them to contact each other.

original: gzhan nyid ma grub na phrad pa yang mi 'grub pa'i glags yod pa'i sgo nas pha rol po dag zer ba ltar bud med dang skyes pa dag bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ma grub na phrad pa yang mi 'grub pa'i glags yod pa'i sgo nas pha rol po dag zer ba ltar bud med dang skyes pa dag bzhin du /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is like that of a man and a woman.

original: me dang bud shing dag kyang phrad par dbu ma pas khas blangs nas phrad pa med par lan 'debs par 'dod pa yin na //
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag kyang phrad par dbu ma pas khas blangs nas phrad pa med par lan 'debs par 'dod pa yin na //
translated: If the Madhyamika accepts that fire and fuel come into contact, and then wishes to respond that they do not come into contact,

original: glags yod pa'i sgo nas khas blangs pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar kho bos gal te phan tshun ltos pa med pa dag gzhan yin pa'i phyir yul tha mi dad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phrad pa bsal bar gyur na ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa
analyzed: glags yod pa'i sgo nas khas blangs pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar kho bos gal te phan tshun ltos pa med pa dag gzhan yin pa'i phyir yul tha mi dad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phrad pa bsal bar gyur na ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa
translated: in order to demonstrate that he has accepted the possibility of contact, he says, ‚ÄúIf the reason is not ascertained,

original: nyid du 'gyur zhing dam bcas pa'i don de yang 'thad par 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nyid du 'gyur zhing dam bcas pa'i don de yang 'thad par 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and if the meaning of the thesis is tenable, then I would accept that.‚Äù

original: dbu ma pas me dang bud shing dag phrad pa med par bsal ba de /
analyzed: dbu ma pas me dang bud shing dag phrad pa med par bsal ba de /
translated: The Madhyamika refutes the contact of fire and fuel.

original: gal te de dag phan tshun ltos pa med cing gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis yul tha mi dad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phrad pa med par bsal bar gyur na ni des na dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan na mi phrad
analyzed: gal te de dag phan tshun ltos pa med cing gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis yul tha mi dad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phrad pa med par bsal bar gyur na ni des na dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan na mi phrad
translated: If the reason ‚Äúbecause they are different from each other‚Äù were to eliminate contact, which is defined as the occurrence of two things in one place, then the Madhyamaka reason ‚Äúbecause they do not contact each other‚Äù would be indeterminate.

original: ces bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur zhing pha rol po dag gis dam bcas pa'i don /
analyzed: ces bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur zhing pha rol po dag gis dam bcas pa'i don /
translated: And the opponent would accept the meaning of the thesisüîΩJust as a woman and a manüîΩmake contact,

original: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
analyzed: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
translated: so it is with two things that are different.

original: zhes bya ba de yang 'thad par 'gyur ba zhig na zhes glags yod pa'i sgo nas khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de yang 'thad par 'gyur ba zhig na zhes glags yod pa'i sgo nas khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: This is how the opponent accepts the meaning of the thesis by way of a counterargument.

original: glags yod pa'i sgo nas khas blangs nas de las bzlog ste skabs kyi don nyid kyis phrad pa med par lan gdab pa bstan pa'i phyir me dang @222b bud shing dag ni rnam pa de ltar mi 'dod de de dag la byed pa po dang las su 'brel
analyzed: glags yod pa'i sgo nas khas blangs nas de las bzlog ste skabs kyi don nyid kyis phrad pa med par lan gdab pa bstan pa'i phyir me dang @222b bud shing dag ni rnam pa de ltar mi 'dod de de dag la byed pa po dang las su 'brel
translated: In response to the opponent‚Äôs objection, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains that fire and fuel are not asserted to be related in this way.

original: pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phrad pa gzhan med na mi 'byung ba med pas zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩme dang bud shing dag ni phan tshun ltos pa med pa dang / gzhan nyid yin pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa de ltar dbu ma pa mi 'dod de /
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phrad pa gzhan med na mi 'byung ba med pas zhes bya ba smras te / me dang bud shing dag ni phan tshun ltos pa med pa dang / gzhan nyid yin pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa de ltar dbu ma pa mi 'dod de /
translated: If they were not related through the characteristics of agent and object, they would not arise without mutual dependence.üîΩThe Followers of the Middle Way do not assert that fire and fuel are unrelated to each other and that they are different from each other.

original: de dag phan tshun ltos te gdags pa dang gzhan nyid ma yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun ltos te gdags pa dang gzhan nyid ma yin par 'dod de /
translated: They assert that fire and fuel are mutually dependent imputations and that they are not different from each other.

original: de ltar gzhan nyid ma yin pas me dang bud shing de dag la phrad pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan nyid ma yin pas me dang bud shing de dag la phrad pa med do //
translated: Since they are not different from each other, fire and fuel do not make contact.

original: phrad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir byed pa po dang las su 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phrad pa gzhan med na mi 'byung ba zhes smos te /
analyzed: phrad pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir byed pa po dang las su 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phrad pa gzhan med na mi 'byung ba zhes smos te /
translated: To explain the characteristics of contact, he says, ‚ÄúContact is the non-independence of the agent and object.‚Äù

original: byed pa po dang las su 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ni phrad pa yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las su 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ni phrad pa yin la /
translated: The characteristic of contact is the relation of the agent and object.

original: phrad pa de ni gzhan med na mi 'byung gi gzhan yod na 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: phrad pa de ni gzhan med na mi 'byung gi gzhan yod na 'byung ba yin no //
translated: That contact is not independent, but rather occurs when the other is present.

original: de lta bu'i phrad pa de dag la med de de dag gzhan pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i phrad pa de dag la med de de dag gzhan pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Such contact does not exist for those two, because they are not established as different.

original: de ltar me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir phrad pa med pa yin pa las /
analyzed: de ltar me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir phrad pa med pa yin pa las /
translated: Thus, since fire and fuel are not established as different, they do not contact each other.

original: shing las me gzhan nyid yin yang//
analyzed: shing las me gzhan nyid yin yang//
translated: Even though fire is different from fuel,üîΩit is still asserted that it contacts fuel.

original: shing dang phrad par 'dod la rag / ces glags yod pa'i sgo nas khas blangs pa bstan pa'i dgos pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: shing dang phrad par 'dod la rag / ces glags yod pa'i sgo nas khas blangs pa bstan pa'i dgos pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of this argument that exposes the opponent‚Äôs contradictions?

original: de'i phyir gzhan nyid du smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa la glags yod pa'i sgo nas yang dag par chos kyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan nyid du smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa la glags yod pa'i sgo nas yang dag par chos kyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, we have shown that the assertions of those who advocate that the object of refutation by reasons and the seer are different are undermined by the possibility of their being in contact.

original: rang dbang rjes su dpag pa bstan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang dbang rjes su dpag pa bstan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: We have not taught that it is possible to infer that they are different.

original: shing las me gzhan nyid yin yang //
analyzed: shing las me gzhan nyid yin yang //
translated: The purpose of the statement ‚ÄúFire is different from fuel,

original: shing dang phrad par 'dod la rag / ces smos pa'i dgos pa ni gang la gzhan nyid yod pa de la phrad pa med de /
analyzed: shing dang phrad par 'dod la rag / ces smos pa'i dgos pa ni gang la gzhan nyid yod pa de la phrad pa med de /
translated: but it is asserted to come into contact with it‚Äù is this. If something is different from something else, it cannot come into contact with it.

original: dper na snang ba dang mun pa lta bu yin pas pha rol po dag me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin par 'dod pa de dag gi dam bcas pa la gzhan nyid yin na mi phrad pa'i glags yod pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: dper na snang ba dang mun pa lta bu yin pas pha rol po dag me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin par 'dod pa de dag gi dam bcas pa la gzhan nyid yin na mi phrad pa'i glags yod pa'i sgo nas /
translated: For example, light and darkness cannot come into contact. Therefore, we have shown that the assertions of those who advocate that fire and fuel are different are undermined by the possibility of their being in contact.

original: don dam par sgrub pa'i chos phrad pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan pa yin gyi phrad par 'dod la rag ces bya ba'i tshig rang dbang du phrad ba yod pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: don dam par sgrub pa'i chos phrad pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan pa yin gyi phrad par 'dod la rag ces bya ba'i tshig rang dbang du phrad ba yod pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: This is teaching that ultimately there is the fault of the distinction called ‚Äúcontact of the established base‚Äù but it is not teaching an independent inference of contact.

original: / skabs kyi don gyis phrad pa med par lan gdab pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩdes na skyes pa dang bud med dang skyes pa dag phrad pa ci skad smras pa dag mi srid pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin pas pha rol po'i tshig de ni 'khrul ba tsam ste rang gi blo gros @223a *
analyzed: / skabs kyi don gyis phrad pa med par lan gdab pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir / des na skyes pa dang bud med dang skyes pa dag phrad pa ci skad smras pa dag mi srid pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin pas pha rol po'i tshig de ni 'khrul ba tsam ste rang gi blo gros @223a *
translated: To summarize the reply that there is no contact,

original: // yangs par ston pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: // yangs par ston pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible to say that a man, a woman, and a man come into contact, the opponent‚Äôs words are just confused talk, because there is no counterexample, and it reveals the opponent‚Äôs limited intellect.

original: sngar pha rol po dag gis /
analyzed: sngar pha rol po dag gis /
translated: Previously, the opponent said:üîΩJust as a man and a woman

original: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
analyzed: ci ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
translated: And a man and a man come into contact,

original: zhes gang smras pa de grub na ni des na dbu ma pas gzhan na me phrad ces bshad pa'i gtan tshigs de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshig de ma nges pa nyid yin pa zhig na /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de grub na ni des na dbu ma pas gzhan na me phrad ces bshad pa'i gtan tshigs de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshig de ma nges pa nyid yin pa zhig na /
translated: If that were established, then the Madhyamaka reason ‚Äúbecause fire and fuel would touch‚Äù would have a discordant class, and so that Madhyamaka reason would be indeterminate.

original: skyes pa dang bud med dag gzhan nyid kyang yin la phrad pa yang 'dod pa de ni ci ltar me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid ma yin pas phrad pa med par bsgrub par bya ba de dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i khongs su
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med dag gzhan nyid kyang yin la phrad pa yang 'dod pa de ni ci ltar me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid ma yin pas phrad pa med par bsgrub par bya ba de dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i khongs su
translated: But you assert that men and women are different and they also touch. That is similar to the reason to be proven, ‚Äúbecause fire and fuel are not different, they do not touch.‚ÄùüîΩSince it is included in the reason to be proven, there is no discordant class. Therefore the Madhyamaka reason is not indeterminate.

original: gtogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin pas pha rol po'i tshig / ci ltar bud med skyes ba dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
analyzed: gtogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin pas pha rol po'i tshig / ci ltar bud med skyes ba dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs words, ‚ÄúJust as a woman and a man,üîΩand a man and a woman touch,

original: gal te shing las me gzhan yang //
analyzed: gal te shing las me gzhan yang //
translated: if fire were different from fuel,

original: shing dang phrad du rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shing dang phrad du rung bar 'gyur //
translated: it would be suitable for it to touch fuel,‚ÄùüîΩare similar to the reason to be proven.

original: zhes bya ba de ni khams 'khrugs pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni khams 'khrugs pa'am /
translated: This is a disturbance of the elements.üîΩ

original: gdon gyis brlabs pa 'khrul pa'i tshig dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gdon gyis brlabs pa 'khrul pa'i tshig dang 'dra ste /
translated: This is like a confused statement of someone whose elements are disturbed or who is possessed by a demon.

original: don 'grub pa'i 'bras bu med pas rang gi blo gros yangs par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'grub pa'i 'bras bu med pas rang gi blo gros yangs par ston pa yin no //
translated: Since it has no result that is accomplished, it shows that your understanding is limited.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: pha rol po dag 'dod pa lta bu'i dngos po phan tshun ltos pa med pa yul tha dad par byung ba gzhan nyid yin pa dag la ni phrad pa med de ;
analyzed: pha rol po dag 'dod pa lta bu'i dngos po phan tshun ltos pa med pa yul tha dad par byung ba gzhan nyid yin pa dag la ni phrad pa med de ;
translated: Things that are not mutually dependent, as you assert, arise as separate objects and are different from each other. They do not make contact.

original: 'di ltar gzhan nyid yin pa la phrad pa med de mi mthun pa'i phyir dper na snang ba dang mun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan nyid yin pa la phrad pa med de mi mthun pa'i phyir dper na snang ba dang mun pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus, if they are different, they do not make contact, because they are not compatible, just as light and darkness are not.

original: gal te gzhan nyid dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid yin na ni ci ltar phrad ci ste phrad na ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyid dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid yin na ni ci ltar phrad ci ste phrad na ni /
translated: If they are different, and their characteristics are different, how can they make contact? If they make contact,

original: ci ltar gzhan nyid dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin /
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan nyid dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin /
translated: how can they be different and have different characteristics?

original: 'on te dus gcig tu phrad na ni gzhan nyid ces kyang byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'on te dus gcig tu phrad na ni gzhan nyid ces kyang byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Or if they make contact at one time, it is not suitable to say that they are different.

original: gang dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pa de dag la phrad pa yang mi 'grub pas des na dbu ma pas /
analyzed: gang dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pa de dag la phrad pa yang mi 'grub pas des na dbu ma pas /
translated: But if they are not established as different, then contact is not established. Therefore, the Madhyamaka‚Äôs

original: gzhan na mi phrad ces gang smras pa de grub po //
analyzed: gzhan na mi phrad ces gang smras pa de grub po //
translated: statement, ‚ÄúIf different, they would not contact each other,‚Äù is established.

original: gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces phrad du zin kyang skyes pa'ang bud med nyid du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces phrad du zin kyang skyes pa'ang bud med nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: If the opponent says, ‚ÄúEven if they do contact each other, the male would not become female,

original: bud med kyang skyes pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas des na khyod kyi gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: bud med kyang skyes pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas des na khyod kyi gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub po zhe na /
translated: and the female would not become male. Therefore your reason is not established because it is not concomitant with the predicate,‚Äù

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: that is not good.

original: don dam pa dpyad pa la ngo bo nyid dang yang dag pa nyid dang dngos po nyid gzung par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam pa dpyad pa la ngo bo nyid dang yang dag pa nyid dang dngos po nyid gzung par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: In the analysis of the ultimate, an entity, reality, and an entity itself are to be accepted.

original: skyes pa dang bud med dag gi rdul phra rab dper na chu dang 'o ma dag gam gdon dang rims nad lus la zhen pa ltar @223b yan lag dang yan lag can gyi bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad pa ma yin pa dag phrad pa'i ngo bo nyid
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med dag gi rdul phra rab dper na chu dang 'o ma dag gam gdon dang rims nad lus la zhen pa ltar @223b yan lag dang yan lag can gyi bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad pa ma yin pa dag phrad pa'i ngo bo nyid
translated: The atoms of men and women do not touch each other in all ways, like water and milk, or like a demon and a disease that afflict the body.

original: dang yang dag pa nyid dang dngos po nyid yin par gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dang yang dag pa nyid dang dngos po nyid yin par gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: They should not be grasped as having the nature of contact, as real, or as entities.

original: skyes pa dang bud med dag gi pags pa'i phyi rol gyi rdul phra rab dag phrad ba ni phyogs gcig phrad ba yin gyi bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med dag gi pags pa'i phyi rol gyi rdul phra rab dag phrad ba ni phyogs gcig phrad ba yin gyi bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad pa ma yin no //
translated: The atoms of men and women that touch each other on the outer skin touch in one part, but not in all their parts.

original: gal te phyogs gcig phrad pa de la phrad pa zhes brjod na ni de lta na phrad pa zhes bya ba tha snyad pa yin gyi dngos nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te phyogs gcig phrad pa de la phrad pa zhes brjod na ni de lta na phrad pa zhes bya ba tha snyad pa yin gyi dngos nyid ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that contact is contact in one part, then contact is a convention, not a reality,

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyi phrad pa de la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyi phrad pa de la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because contact in all parts does not exist in that.

original: ci ste yang pha rol po dag 'di skad ces gal te skyes pa dang bud med dag la bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad pa med pas kho bo cag gi dpe ma grub kyang /üîΩci ltar khyod zer ba ltar dper na chu dang 'o ma dag gam gdon dang rims nad lus la zhen pa dag yang lag dang yan lag can gyi bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad pa bzhin du me dang bud shing dag kyang bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad
