analyzed: ci ste yang pha rol po dag 'di skad ces gal te skyes pa dang bud med dag la bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad pa med pas kho bo cag gi dpe ma grub kyang / ci ltar khyod zer ba ltar dper na chu dang 'o ma dag gam gdon dang rims nad lus la zhen pa dag yang lag dang yan lag can gyi bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad pa bzhin du me dang bud shing dag kyang bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad
translated: But if the opponent says, ‚ÄúIf men and women do not make contact in any way, then our example is not established.

original: par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: par 'gyur bas /
translated: Just as you say, for example, just as water and milk or a spirit and a contagious disease adhere to the body, fire and fuel make contact in every way through the nature of the possessor and the possessed.

original: des na kho bo cig gi dpe 'grub pas khyed kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa'i phyir khyed kyi gtan tshigs gzhan na mi phrad ces bya ba de ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: des na kho bo cig gi dpe 'grub pas khyed kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa'i phyir khyed kyi gtan tshigs gzhan na mi phrad ces bya ba de ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since our example is established, your reason, ‚Äòbecause they do not make contact in any other way,‚Äô is not established,‚Äù

original: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: that is also not good.

original: kho bos skyes pa nyid dang gzhan nyid bkag zin pas dngos po rnams la gzhan nyid med do //
analyzed: kho bos skyes pa nyid dang gzhan nyid bkag zin pas dngos po rnams la gzhan nyid med do //
translated: We have already refuted that they are produced or that they are different. Therefore things do not exist as different.

original: gzhan nyid med pas kho bo gang gis ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir phrad pa med do zhes phrad pa sel bar mi byed kyi gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir phrad pa med do zhes phrad pa sel bar byed bas chu dang
analyzed: gzhan nyid med pas kho bo gang gis ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir phrad pa med do zhes phrad pa sel bar mi byed kyi gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir phrad pa med do zhes phrad pa sel bar byed bas chu dang
translated: Thus he does not eliminate contact by saying, ‚ÄúThey do not contact each other because they are not different.‚Äù He eliminates contact by saying, ‚ÄúThey do not contact each other because difference does not exist.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, since water and milk, the demon and the plague, and the body and purity are not different in reality, they also do not contact each other.

original: 'o ma dag dang gdon dang rims nad dang lus dag pa la yang don dam par gzhan nyid med pas de dag la phrad pa yang med pa'i phyir khyed kyi dpe de dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i khongs
analyzed: 'o ma dag dang gdon dang rims nad dang lus dag pa la yang don dam par gzhan nyid med pas de dag la phrad pa yang med pa'i phyir khyed kyi dpe de dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i khongs
translated: Thus your examples are similar to the probandum, and they are included within the probandum.

original: su gtogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: su gtogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, since there is no dissimilar example, my reason is not indeterminate.

original: khyed kyis dam bcas pa nyid ma 'thad pa nyid so na gnas so //
analyzed: khyed kyis dam bcas pa nyid ma 'thad pa nyid so na gnas so //
translated: Your own thesis remains untenable.

original: de'i phyir de ltar me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i sgrub pa'i dpe ma tshang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni de yang chad du me dang bud shing dag gcig pa
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i sgrub pa'i dpe ma tshang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni de yang chad du me dang bud shing dag gcig pa
translated: Therefore, since fire and fuel are not established as the same or different, the example of the proof stated at the beginning of the treatise is incomplete.

original: nyid dang gzhan nyid du brtag pa gnyi ga'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i @224a * //
analyzed: nyid dang gzhan nyid du brtag pa gnyi ga'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i @224a * //
translated: This is the conclusion of the analysis of whether fire and fuel are the same or different.

original: 'bras bu yin te /üîΩde ltar me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol pos rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por don dam par nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin te / de ltar me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol pos rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por don dam par nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: It is also the result of the valid knowledge.üîΩSince fire and fuel are not established as the same or different, the example of the proof stated at the beginning of this treatise by the opponent is not established.

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir dper na me dang bud shing bzhin no zhes smras pa'i sgrub pa de'i dpe ma grub bo //üîΩ'dir smras pa //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir dper na me dang bud shing bzhin no zhes smras pa'i sgrub pa de'i dpe ma grub bo //üîΩ'dir smras pa //
translated: The opponent said, ‚ÄúUltimately, the appropriator and that appropriated exist because they are mutually dependent, like fire and fuel.‚Äù

original: don dam par me dang bud shing dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par me dang bud shing dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: In reality, fire and fuel exist,

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mutually dependent.

original: 'di na gang dag med pa de dag la ni phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di na gang dag med pa de dag la ni phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid de /
translated: Here, those that do not exist are not mutually dependent,

original: dper na ri bong gi rva dag bzhin no //üîΩme dang bud shing dag la ni me 'di'i bud shing ni 'di'o //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva dag bzhin no // me dang bud shing dag la ni me 'di'i bud shing ni 'di'o //
translated: like the horns of a rabbit.üîΩBut fire and fuel are mutually dependent, because it is said, ‚ÄúThis is the fuel of this fire,‚Äù

original: bud shing 'di'i sreg pa ni 'di'o zhes phan tshun ltos pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir me dang bud shing dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bud shing 'di'i sreg pa ni 'di'o zhes phan tshun ltos pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir me dang bud shing dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: and ‚ÄúThis is the burning of this fuel.‚Äù Therefore, fire and fuel exist,

original: de dag yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag yod pa'i phyir /
translated: because they exist.üîΩThe meaning of the text is established

original: dngos kyi don 'grub po zhes bya ba ni yang pha rol po dag dpe sgrub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa gzhan ston pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos kyi don 'grub po zhes bya ba ni yang pha rol po dag dpe sgrub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa gzhan ston pa yin te /
translated: The opponent presents another inference to prove the example.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, the example of the dissimilar class, the application, and the conclusion.

original: 'di na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gang dag med pa de dag la phan tshun ltos pa med kyi /
analyzed: 'di na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gang dag med pa de dag la phan tshun ltos pa med kyi /
translated: Here, those things that do not exist, such as the horns of a rabbit, do not have mutual dependence.

original: me dang bud shing la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag la ni phan tshun ltos pa yod pa'i phyir de dag don dam par yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: me dang bud shing la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag la ni phan tshun ltos pa yod pa'i phyir de dag don dam par yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: But those things that do exist, such as fire and fuel, do have mutual dependence. Therefore they exist only in the ultimate.

original: dper na me dang bud shing de dag yod pa'i phyir dngos kyi don dam par nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba de 'grub po //
analyzed: dper na me dang bud shing de dag yod pa'i phyir dngos kyi don dam par nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba de 'grub po //
translated: For example, because fire and fuel exist, the appropriator and that appropriated exist in reality in the ultimate.

original: de'i phyir de grub pas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de grub pas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: This is established. Therefore, because that is established, the aggregates and so on exist only in the ultimate.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The appropriator and that appropriated are taught in dependence on those.

original: de ltar gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa 'grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa 'grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the reason is established in that way, the thesis is established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgal te shing ltos me yin na //üîΩgal te me ltos shing yin na //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te shing ltos me yin na // gal te me ltos shing yin na //
translated: Here it is said:üîΩIf fire is dependent on fuel,üîΩif fuel is dependent on fire,

original: gal te ltos pa'i me dang shing //üîΩdang por grub pa gang zhig yin //
analyzed: gal te ltos pa'i me dang shing // dang por grub pa gang zhig yin //
translated: which of the two, fire and fuel,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: that are mutually dependent is established first?

original: phyed gong mas ni pha rol po'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan la phyod 'og mas ni tshu rol gyi phyogs bstan to //
analyzed: phyed gong mas ni pha rol po'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan la phyod 'og mas ni tshu rol gyi phyogs bstan to //
translated: The first half of the verse teaches the opponent‚Äôs position, and the second half teaches our own position.üîΩIn order to teach that, the root text says:

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ci bud shing gang @224b la ltos nas me grub ba 'am /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ci bud shing gang @224b la ltos nas me grub ba 'am /
translated: What is the fire that is dependent on fuel?

original: 'on te me gang la ltos nas bud shing 'grub pa'i me dang bud shing dag las dang por grub pa gang zhig yin te de dag la gang la ltos nas gang yang rung ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i dang por grub pa gcig kyang med do zhes bya bar
analyzed: 'on te me gang la ltos nas bud shing 'grub pa'i me dang bud shing dag las dang por grub pa gang zhig yin te de dag la gang la ltos nas gang yang rung ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i dang por grub pa gcig kyang med do zhes bya bar
translated: But which of the fire and fuel that are established in dependence on each other is established first? There is not even one of them that is established first, in dependence on which the other would be established.

original: dgongs so zhes smras so //
analyzed: dgongs so zhes smras so //
translated: This is what is intended.

original: de nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize that and to show the result of valid knowledge, he says:

original: de ltar don dam par ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang dpe'i skyon de nyid yod do //
analyzed: de ltar don dam par ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang dpe'i skyon de nyid yod do //
translated: Thus, because it is untenable that they are ultimately dependent, the meaning of the reason is not established, and the fault of the example still remains.

original: kun rdzob pa'i gtan tshigs yin par rtog na ni don 'gal ba nyid dang sgrub pa'i dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i gtan tshigs yin par rtog na ni don 'gal ba nyid dang sgrub pa'i dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: If you imagine that the reason is conventional, then the fault of the contradiction with the meaning and the incompleteness of the example still remain.

original: ci ste yang bud shing dang por grub pa'i phyir skyon med do snyam na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad dgu na ma byung ba'i snga rol du bud shing sdud par byed pas de ltar bud shing sngar grub
analyzed: ci ste yang bud shing dang por grub pa'i phyir skyon med do snyam na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad dgu na ma byung ba'i snga rol du bud shing sdud par byed pas de ltar bud shing sngar grub
translated: then the opponent says: ‚ÄúThis is not the case, because fuel is collected prior to the arising of all the world. Thus, fuel is established first.

original: pa la ltos nas phyis me yod par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: pa la ltos nas phyis me yod par 'gyur bas /
translated: In dependence on that, fire exists later.

original: de'i phyir ltos pa yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas dpe 'grub po zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ltos pa yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas dpe 'grub po zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since dependence exists, the reason is established and the example is established.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gal te shing ltos me yin na //üîΩme grub pa la sgrub par 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te shing ltos me yin na // me grub pa la sgrub par 'gyur //
translated: If fire depends on fuel,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it would establish what is already established.

original: gal te bud shing dang por grub la de la ltos nas me yin par 'gyur na de lta na me grub zin pa la yang sgrub par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te bud shing dang por grub la de la ltos nas me yin par 'gyur na de lta na me grub zin pa la yang sgrub par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If fuel were established first and fire were to exist in dependence on that, then in that case fire would establish what is already established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar me grub na bud shing la ltos par 'thad kyi me ma grub cing med na ci ltar bud shing la ltos par byed de de'i phyir bud shing med par yang me rang gi grub par ltos par nus pa la khyod yang bud shing la ltos nas
analyzed: 'di ltar me grub na bud shing la ltos par 'thad kyi me ma grub cing med na ci ltar bud shing la ltos par byed de de'i phyir bud shing med par yang me rang gi grub par ltos par nus pa la khyod yang bud shing la ltos nas
translated: Thus if fire were established, it would be tenable that it relies on fuel. But if fire is not established, if it does not exist, how could it rely on fuel? Therefore, since it is possible that fire is established without fuel, it is not tenable that you rely on fuel.

original: sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it would be a fault to establish fire in reliance on fuel, that is not tenable.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: me grub pa la brjod pa khyad par can bsnyad pa nyid kyi phyir bud shing la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: me grub pa la brjod pa khyad par can bsnyad pa nyid kyi phyir bud shing la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the distinctive statement ‚ÄúIt is established in reliance on fuel‚Äù is made, it is said that the meaning is that fire relies on fuel.

original: gal te bud shing la ltos nas me yin par rtog na me sngar ma grub na bud shing la ltos par mi nus pas me sngar grub zin pa bud shing la ltos nus pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gal te bud shing la ltos nas me yin par rtog na me sngar ma grub na bud shing la ltos par mi nus pas me sngar grub zin pa bud shing la ltos nus pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas /
translated: If you think fire is established in reliance on fuel, since fire that is not previously established cannot rely on fuel, it would be a fault to establish fire that is already established as having an essence that relies on fuel.

original: tshig de ni me grub zin pa la me 'di'i bud shing ni 'di'o //
analyzed: tshig de ni me grub zin pa la me 'di'i bud shing ni 'di'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis is the fuel of this fire‚Äù is made in reliance on fire that is already established.

original: bud shing 'di'i sreg pa ni 'di'o zhes brjod pa khyad par can bsnyad pa nyid kyi phyir bud shing la ltos pa yin pa'i @225a * //
analyzed: bud shing 'di'i sreg pa ni 'di'o zhes brjod pa khyad par can bsnyad pa nyid kyi phyir bud shing la ltos pa yin pa'i @225a * //
translated: The meaning of the sutra is that since the fire is said to be distinct from the fuel, in the sense that ‚Äúthe fire burns this fuel,‚Äù it is established as dependent on fuel.

original: phyir me sngar grub zin pa la khyad par de tsam zhig sgrub pa yin gyi des me snga na med pa bsgrub par mi nus pas de ni mi rung ngo zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
analyzed: phyir me sngar grub zin pa la khyad par de tsam zhig sgrub pa yin gyi des me snga na med pa bsgrub par mi nus pas de ni mi rung ngo zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
translated: The fire is already established, and the sutra merely establishes that it is dependent on fuel. It is not tenable to say that the sutra establishes that fire is not previously existent.

original: de ltar rtog pa la skyon de 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur bar yang ma zad de /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa la skyon de 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur bar yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only does such a conception entail that error,

original: skyon gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩbud par bya ba'i shing la yang //
analyzed: skyon gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir / bud par bya ba'i shing la yang //
translated: but in order to demonstrate another error,üîΩthe root text says:üîΩThe fuel would also exist

original: me med par yang 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: me med par yang 'gyur ba yin // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: without fire.üîΩIf fire were dependent on fuel,

original: de lta na bud shing la'ang me med par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na bud shing la'ang me med par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: the fuel would also exist without fire.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar bud shing yang grub na me la ltos par 'thad kyi bud shing ma grub cing med na ci ltar me la ltos par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar bud shing yang grub na me la ltos par 'thad kyi bud shing ma grub cing med na ci ltar me la ltos par byed de /
translated: If fuel were established, it would be tenable to say that it is dependent on fire. But if fuel is not established and does not exist, how could it be dependent on fire?

original: de'i phyir bud shing de nyid kyang me med par rang gis rab tu grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bud shing de nyid kyang me med par rang gis rab tu grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that fuel would be established by itself without fire.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩbud shing de sngar me la ma ltos par yang bud shing nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / bud shing de sngar me la ma ltos par yang bud shing nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,üîΩbecause fuel would be established as fuel prior to depending on fire.

original: mi sreg pa'i tshe me la ma ltos par yang bud shing nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi sreg pa'i tshe me la ma ltos par yang bud shing nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He means to say that when it is not burning, it is accepted as fuel without depending on fire.

original: de ni mi 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sngar me la ma ltos par bud shing nyid du grub pa de ni khyed kyang mi 'dod pas so //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sngar me la ma ltos par bud shing nyid du grub pa de ni khyed kyang mi 'dod pas so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat is not accepted,‚Äù because you do not accept that fuel is established as fuel prior to depending on fire.üîΩHere, he says, ‚ÄúBecause it is a statement that can be refuted,‚ÄùüîΩbecause it is a statement that can be refuted,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúAn inference is clearly implied.‚Äù

original: 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa mngon te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa mngon te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He says,

original: bud par bya ba'i shing la yang //
analyzed: bud par bya ba'i shing la yang //
translated: ‚ÄúThe fuel that is to be burned

original: me med par ni 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: me med par ni 'gyur ba yin //
translated: would be without fire.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni bud shing de sngar me la ma ltos par yang bud shing nyid du 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa skabs kyi don gyi sgo nas rjes su dpag pa mngon te zhes bya bar sbyar
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bud shing de sngar me la ma ltos par yang bud shing nyid du 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa skabs kyi don gyi sgo nas rjes su dpag pa mngon te zhes bya bar sbyar
translated: Therefore, the opposite of that is the meaning of the context, and it is to be applied as ‚Äúis inferred.‚Äù

original: ro // de'i phyir don dam par bud shing ni me'i snga rol na grub pa med de ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ro // de'i phyir don dam par bud shing ni me'i snga rol na grub pa med de ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, in the ultimate sense, fuel does not exist prior to fire because it is related to it, just like the self of fire, for example.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid ni bud shing la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bud shing gi snga rol na grub pa med pa de bzhin du bud shing yang me la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir me'i snga rol na med do //
analyzed: dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid ni bud shing la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bud shing gi snga rol na grub pa med pa de bzhin du bud shing yang me la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir me'i snga rol na med do //
translated: For example, the intrinsic reality of fire does not exist prior to fuel because it depends on fuel. Likewise, fuel does not exist prior to fire because it depends on fire.üîΩThe extensive explanation is the same as before.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa yin te /
translated: If the opponent says, ‚ÄúThe reason that the Madhyamaka state, ‚Äòbecause they are dependent,‚Äô is indefinite.

original: 'di ltar rdza mkhan dang tha ga pa dag ltos pa dang bcas pa yin yang @225b rdza mkhan gyi snga rol na thag pa grub pa yod par mthong bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdza mkhan dang tha ga pa dag ltos pa dang bcas pa yin yang @225b rdza mkhan gyi snga rol na thag pa grub pa yod par mthong bas /
translated: For example, although potters and weavers are dependent, a weaver is seen to exist prior to a potter.

original: des na ci re zhig ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du bud shing me'i snga rol na grub pa med par 'gyur ram 'on te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na rdza mkhan dang thag pa bzhin du bud shing
analyzed: des na ci re zhig ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du bud shing me'i snga rol na grub pa med par 'gyur ram 'on te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na rdza mkhan dang thag pa bzhin du bud shing
translated: Therefore, is it that because it is dependent, like the self-entity of fire, fuel does not exist prior to fire? Or is it that because it is dependent, like a potter or a rope, fuel exists prior to fire?

original: me'i snga rol na grub pa yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de mi rung ngo zhes zer na /
analyzed: me'i snga rol na grub pa yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de mi rung ngo zhes zer na /
translated: Since it is not certain, the Madhyamaka argument is not correct.

original: de'i lan du rdza mkhan dang thag pa dag kyang ci ltar don dam par me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pas bud shing me'i snga rol na grub pa med par bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i khongs
analyzed: de'i lan du rdza mkhan dang thag pa dag kyang ci ltar don dam par me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pas bud shing me'i snga rol na grub pa med par bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i khongs
translated: In response to that, how are a potter and a rope similar to fire and fuel in that they are not ultimately established as different? Since it is established that fuel does not exist prior to fire, the example is similar to the probandum.

original: su gtogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes snga ma bzhin du lan gdab pa yin no //
analyzed: su gtogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes snga ma bzhin du lan gdab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no discordant position that it belongs to, the Madhyamaka reason is not indeterminate.

original: de ltar me dang bud shing dag phan tshun ltos te 'grub par mi 'thad pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa de nyid son gnas so /üîΩ// / bam po bzhi bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: de ltar me dang bud shing dag phan tshun ltos te 'grub par mi 'thad pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa de nyid son gnas so / // / bam po bzhi bcu bdun pa /
translated: Thus, since it is untenable that fire and fuel are established in mutual dependence, the meaning of the opponent‚Äôs reason is not established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: de dag las gang yang rung ba dang por grub pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de dag las gang yang rung ba dang por grub pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough it is the case that neither of them is established first, nevertheless . . .‚Äù

original: yang pha rol po dag gtan tshigs dang dpe bsgrub pa'i phyir me dang bud shing dag las gang yang rung ba dang por grub pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang de dag dus mnyam du ltos te 'grub pas gtan tshigs dpe grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs sngaüîΩma ston to //
analyzed: yang pha rol po dag gtan tshigs dang dpe bsgrub pa'i phyir me dang bud shing dag las gang yang rung ba dang por grub pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang de dag dus mnyam du ltos te 'grub pas gtan tshigs dpe grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs sngaüîΩma ston to //
translated: This shows the opponent‚Äôs position, which is that although it is the case that neither fire nor fuel is established first, nevertheless they are established in mutual dependence at the same time, and therefore the reason and example are established.

original: de'i phyir me dang bud shing dag ni dus mnyam du 'grub par 'gyur te ltos pa can yin pa'i phyir dper na ba lang gi rva dus gcig tu skyes pa dag la g-yas pa dang g-yon pa nyid du 'grub pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir me dang bud shing dag ni dus mnyam du 'grub par 'gyur te ltos pa can yin pa'i phyir dper na ba lang gi rva dus gcig tu skyes pa dag la g-yas pa dang g-yon pa nyid du 'grub pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore fire and fuel are established as simultaneous because they are dependent, just like the right and left horns of an ox that are born at the same time are established as right and left.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na ba lang gi rva g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag ni ltos pa can yin pa'i phyir dus mnyam du grub pa de bzhin du me dang bud shing dag kyang ltos pa can yin pa'i phyir dus mnyam du 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi rva g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag ni ltos pa can yin pa'i phyir dus mnyam du grub pa de bzhin du me dang bud shing dag kyang ltos pa can yin pa'i phyir dus mnyam du 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: For example, just as the right and left horns of an ox are established as simultaneous because they are dependent, so too fire and fuel are established as simultaneous because they are dependent.

original: des na kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs dang dpe 'grub bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs dang dpe 'grub bo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore our reason and example are established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: gal te dngos po gang ltos 'grub //
analyzed: gal te dngos po gang ltos 'grub //
translated: If an entity is established in reliance on another,

original: de nyid la yang ltos nas ni //üîΩltos bya gang yin de 'grub na //üîΩgang @226a * //
analyzed: de nyid la yang ltos nas ni // ltos bya gang yin de 'grub na // gang @226a * //
translated: Then that which is relied upon is established in reliance on that.üîΩIf that which is relied upon is established in reliance on that,

original: la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub //üîΩces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub // ces bya ba smras te /
translated: Then in reliance on what is that established?üîΩIf an entity is established in reliance on another,üîΩThen that which is relied upon is established in reliance on that.

original: gal te khyod 'dod pa ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po me'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni bud shing gi dngos po gzhan la ltos nas 'grub cing /
analyzed: gal te khyod 'dod pa ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po me'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni bud shing gi dngos po gzhan la ltos nas 'grub cing /
translated: If that which is relied upon is established in reliance on that,üîΩThen in reliance on what is that established?üîΩIf, as you assert, an entity that is characterized by fire is established in reliance on another entity that is characterized by fuel,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po me'i mtshan nyid de nyid la yang ltos nas bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po me'i mtshan nyid grub par bya ba'i phyir ltos par bya ba'i dngos po bud shing gang yin pa de 'grub na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po me'i mtshan nyid de nyid la yang ltos nas bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po me'i mtshan nyid grub par bya ba'i phyir ltos par bya ba'i dngos po bud shing gang yin pa de 'grub na /
translated: and if that which is relied upon, the entity characterized by fuel, is established in reliance on that which is relied upon, the entity characterized by fire, in order to establish the entity characterized by fire,

original: gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub ste gang yang mi 'grub po zhes ston to //
analyzed: gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub ste gang yang mi 'grub po zhes ston to //
translated: then in reliance on what is that established? Nothing is established.

original: dang por zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba bzhi pa'i mjug nas gang zhig 'grub ces 'byung ba ni dang por zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /
analyzed: dang por zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba bzhi pa'i mjug nas gang zhig 'grub ces 'byung ba ni dang por zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /
translated: The root text of the verse says, ‚ÄúIf you think that they are established in mutual dependence, like short and long.‚Äù

original: gal te khyod 'dod pa ltar dus mnyam du phan tshun ltos te 'grub par brtags na /üîΩgal te me rang gi ngo bor grub par gyur na de la ltos nas bud shing 'grub par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te khyod 'dod pa ltar dus mnyam du phan tshun ltos te 'grub par brtags na / gal te me rang gi ngo bor grub par gyur na de la ltos nas bud shing 'grub par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If you think that they are established in mutual dependence, like short and long,üîΩthen if fire were established in its own intrinsic reality, fuel would be established in dependence on that.

original: bud shing rang gi ngo bor grub par gyur na de la ltos nas me 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: bud shing rang gi ngo bor grub par gyur na de la ltos nas me 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or if fuel were established in its own intrinsic reality, fire would be established in dependence on that.

original: de lta na gang la ltos nas dang por gang zhig 'grub ces brtag pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na gang la ltos nas dang por gang zhig 'grub ces brtag pa yin no //
translated: In that case, what is established first in dependence on what?

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te khyod 'dod pa ltar me'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gang yin pa ni bud shing la ltos nas 'grub cing /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te khyod 'dod pa ltar me'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gang yin pa ni bud shing la ltos nas 'grub cing /
translated: To demonstrate this, the root text says, ‚ÄúIf you think that the thing that has the characteristic of fire is established in dependence on fuel, and the thing that has the characteristic of fuel is established in dependence on fire.‚Äù

original: me de nyid la yang ltos nas me grub par bya ba'i phyir ltos par bya ba bud shing gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gang yin pa de grub na gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: me de nyid la yang ltos nas me grub par bya ba'i phyir ltos par bya ba bud shing gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gang yin pa de grub na gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: In reliance on that fire, if the thing characterized as fuel, which is to be relied on for the sake of establishing fire, were established, then in reliance on what would what be established?

original: gang yang rung ba me nyid dam bud shing nyid du mi 'grub ste zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba me nyid dam bud shing nyid du mi 'grub ste zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said that neither fire nor fuel would be established.

original: ci me la ltos nas bud shing 'grub par brtag gam 'on te bud shing la ltos nas me 'grub par brtag ste gnyi ga mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci me la ltos nas bud shing 'grub par brtag gam 'on te bud shing la ltos nas me 'grub par brtag ste gnyi ga mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is meant is that it is not tenable to investigate whether fuel is established in reliance on fire or whether fire is established in reliance on fuel, because neither is established.

original: de'i phyir rang gi rgyu las skye ba ni phan tshun ltos pa med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rgyu las skye ba ni phan tshun ltos pa med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúBecause arising from self would not be established without mutual dependence‚Äù is as follows:

original: me'i me nyid kyi rgyu ni bud shing yin la bud shing gi bud shing nyid kyi rgyu yang me yin pas /
analyzed: me'i me nyid kyi rgyu ni bud shing yin la bud shing gi bud shing nyid kyi rgyu yang me yin pas /
translated: The cause of the fire‚Äôs fireness is fuel, and the cause of the fuel‚Äôs fuelness is fire.

original: dngos po rang gi rgyu las skye ba ni rgyu ni snga la 'bras bu ni 'phyi ba'i tshul gyis rgyu la ltos te 'bras bu 'grub pa yin na khyod 'dod pa ltar dus mnyam par gyur na /
analyzed: dngos po rang gi rgyu las skye ba ni rgyu ni snga la 'bras bu ni 'phyi ba'i tshul gyis rgyu la ltos te 'bras bu 'grub pa yin na khyod 'dod pa ltar dus mnyam par gyur na /
translated: If things arise from their own causes, then effects are established in dependence on their causes, in the sense that the cause precedes and the effect follows.üîΩBut if they were simultaneous, as you assert, they would not be mutually dependent.

original: phan tshun ltos pa med pas des na de dag ni gang gi phyir me yang bud shing med na mi 'grub la /
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa med pas des na de dag ni gang gi phyir me yang bud shing med na mi 'grub la /
translated: Therefore, since fire is not established without fuel,

original: bud shing yang me med na mi 'grub pa de'i phyir me dang bud shing de dag gang la ltos nas dang por gang zhig 'grub @226b ste /
analyzed: bud shing yang me med na mi 'grub pa de'i phyir me dang bud shing de dag gang la ltos nas dang por gang zhig 'grub @226b ste /
translated: and fuel is not established without fire, then in dependence on what would either fire or fuel be established?

original: gnyi ga mi 'grub pas khyod kyis dam bcas pa mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga mi 'grub pas khyod kyis dam bcas pa mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since neither is established, your assertion is not established.

original: des na ba lang rva'i dpe nyid la yang gtam de nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na ba lang rva'i dpe nyid la yang gtam de nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the same argument applies to the example of the ox‚Äôs horns.

original: de gnyis la yang gang la ltos nas gzhan gang yang rung ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i g-yas pa'am /
analyzed: de gnyis la yang gang la ltos nas gzhan gang yang rung ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i g-yas pa'am /
translated: In dependence on what are the right or left horns of an ox established?

original: g-yon par grags pa gang yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yon par grags pa gang yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What are they in dependence on?

original: de ltar me dang bud shing dag dus mnyam du ltos te mi 'grub pa des na pha rol po'i dpe ba yang gi rva dus gcig tu skyes ba dag la g-yas pa dang g-yon pa nyid du grub pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang de bzhin du
analyzed: de ltar me dang bud shing dag dus mnyam du ltos te mi 'grub pa des na pha rol po'i dpe ba yang gi rva dus gcig tu skyes ba dag la g-yas pa dang g-yon pa nyid du grub pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang de bzhin du
translated: Thus, since fire and fuel are not established in mutual dependence, the example of the other party, ‚Äúlike the right and left horns of an ox growing at the same time,‚Äù is also not established in the same way.

original: mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what it means to say ‚Äúit is not established.‚Äù

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: dngos po ltos 'grub gang yin pa //
analyzed: dngos po ltos 'grub gang yin pa //
translated: Any thing established in dependence

original: de ma grub na ci ltar ltos //
analyzed: de ma grub na ci ltar ltos //
translated: How could it be established without that on which it depends?

original: ma grub pa ni ltos par ni byed pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: ma grub pa ni ltos par ni byed pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that that which is not established is not established in dependence.

original: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma /
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is the thesis‚Äù refers to the previous verse.

original: gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub //
analyzed: gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is established in dependence on what?‚Äù

original: ces bya bas me dang bud shing dag dus mnyam du ltos te /
analyzed: ces bya bas me dang bud shing dag dus mnyam du ltos te /
translated: refers to fire and fuel being established in mutual dependence.

original: 'grub par rtog pa'i phyogs la gnyi ga mi 'grub par bstan nas 'dir dngos po gang dngos po gzhan la ltos te 'grub po zhes brjod pa'i dngos po de ma grub cing med na ci ltar ltos par byed de /
analyzed: 'grub par rtog pa'i phyogs la gnyi ga mi 'grub par bstan nas 'dir dngos po gang dngos po gzhan la ltos te 'grub po zhes brjod pa'i dngos po de ma grub cing med na ci ltar ltos par byed de /
translated: Having shown that neither is established from the perspective of the position that things are established, here, if the thing that is said to be established in dependence on another thing is not established and does not exist, how could it be dependent?

original: ma grub pa la ltos pa med do zhes dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ston to //
analyzed: ma grub pa la ltos pa med do zhes dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa ston to //
translated: The thesis is presented: ‚ÄúThat which is not established does not depend.‚Äù

original: de'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par me ma grub pa bud shing la ltos par mi byed de me nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par me ma grub pa bud shing la ltos par mi byed de me nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inference, here the inference is stated: ‚ÄúFire that is not established ultimately does not depend on fuel because it is not established as fire itself, like something else.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na me ma grub pa de las gzhan pa lhas byin ma grub pa ni rang nyid ma grub pa'i phyir bud shing la ltos par mi byed pa de bzhin du me ma grub pa yang rang nyid ma grub pa'i phyir bud shing la ltos par mi byed
analyzed: dper na me ma grub pa de las gzhan pa lhas byin ma grub pa ni rang nyid ma grub pa'i phyir bud shing la ltos par mi byed pa de bzhin du me ma grub pa yang rang nyid ma grub pa'i phyir bud shing la ltos par mi byed
translated: For example, the nonestablishment of Devadatta, who is other than the nonestablished fire, does not rely on fuel because he himself is not established. So too, the nonestablished fire does not rely on fuel because it itself is not established.

original: do // pha rol po dag rang gi tshul la gnod pa bcab pa'i phyir ci ste grub pa ltos shen zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dngos po ma grub pa ltos par 'dod pa'i phyogs la dbu ma pas /
analyzed: do // pha rol po dag rang gi tshul la gnod pa bcab pa'i phyir ci ste grub pa ltos shen zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dngos po ma grub pa ltos par 'dod pa'i phyogs la dbu ma pas /
translated: If the opponent says, ‚ÄúWhy is it that the established relies on the other?‚Äù in order to conceal the damage to their own system, the Madhyamaka responds:

original: dngos po ltos 'grub gang yin pa //
analyzed: dngos po ltos 'grub gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever thing is established in dependence

original: de ma grub na ci ltar ltos //
analyzed: de ma grub na ci ltar ltos //
translated: How could that be established if it is not established?üîΩIn this way, the Madhyamaka refutes the nonestablished relying on the other by saying that it is not tenable that the nonestablished relies on the other.

original: zhes bya bas ma grub pa ltos par mi 'thad par sun phyung ba dang / da 'dir pha rol po dag rang gi tshul la gnod pa de bcas pa'i phyir ci ste dngos po grub pa nyid gzhan la ltos kyi ma grub na ni mi ltos la /üîΩgrub pa @227a * //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ma grub pa ltos par mi 'thad par sun phyung ba dang / da 'dir pha rol po dag rang gi tshul la gnod pa de bcas pa'i phyir ci ste dngos po grub pa nyid gzhan la ltos kyi ma grub na ni mi ltos la /üîΩgrub pa @227a * //
translated: Here, in order to conceal the damage to their own system, the opponent says, ‚ÄúWhy is it that the established thing itself relies on the other? If it is not established, it does not rely on the other.‚Äù

original: la yang gzhan dag ltos so zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: la yang gzhan dag ltos so zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: And the other is dependent on the other.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de skad ces zer na de lta na yang /
analyzed: de skad ces zer na de lta na yang /
translated: Even though you say that,

original: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //üîΩzhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de ni ltos par mi rigs so // zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: it is not tenable that it is dependent.

original: ci'i phyir grub pa ltos par mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir grub pa ltos par mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it not tenable that what is established is dependent?

original: de'i phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir des na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bar dgongs
analyzed: de'i phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir des na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bar dgongs
translated: Therefore, since nonexistence is eliminated by the existence that is inferred through having a dependence, the Proponents of Nonexistence commit the error of eliminating the nature of the subject in their thesis.

original: so zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩkhyed ni me'i dngos po da dung ma grub cing me dang bud shing la ltos te 'grub la /
analyzed: so zhes bya ba smras te / khyed ni me'i dngos po da dung ma grub cing me dang bud shing la ltos te 'grub la /
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.üîΩYou say that the entity of fire is not yet established and is established in dependence on fuel and fire.

original: me grub pa de nyid la ltos nas bud shing yod par sgrub pas /
analyzed: me grub pa de nyid la ltos nas bud shing yod par sgrub pas /
translated: And you say that fuel exists in dependence on the establishment of fire.

original: de ltar ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog na ltos pa dang bcas pa ni yod pa yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog na ltos pa dang bcas pa ni yod pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, if you infer that fire relies on fuel, then since that which relies on fuel exists,

original: yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bsal te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bsal te /
translated: existence refutes nonexistence.üîΩFor example, since a child who relies on his mother‚Äôs breast exists, existence refutes nonexistence.

original: dper na byis pa nu ma la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir yod pa nyid yin pas yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bsal ba bzhin du me bud shing la ltos pa yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir yod pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: dper na byis pa nu ma la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir yod pa nyid yin pas yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bsal ba bzhin du me bud shing la ltos pa yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir yod pa nyid yin pas /
translated: In the same way, since fire that relies on fuel exists because it relies on fuel,üîΩexistence refutes nonexistence.

original: yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir des na khyed me'i dngos po da dung ma grub cing med pa bud shing la ltos te 'grub par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can me'i dngos po ma grub cing med pa zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir des na khyed me'i dngos po da dung ma grub cing med pa bud shing la ltos te 'grub par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can me'i dngos po ma grub cing med pa zhes bya ba'i
translated: Therefore, you who assert that the nonestablished, nonexistent thing called fire relies on fuel, your thesis is undermined by the fault of the subject, the nonestablished, nonexistent thing called fire.

original: rang gi ngo bo ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa bsal ba'i skyon yod pas /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa bsal ba'i skyon yod pas /
translated: Since it is inferred that it has a nature that relies on another,

original: me'i dngos po grub cing yod par gyur na /
analyzed: me'i dngos po grub cing yod par gyur na /
translated: if the thing called fire were established and existent,

original: dngos po grub cing yod pa yang grub par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa ni don med pa'i phyir mi rigs so zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos po grub cing yod pa yang grub par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa ni don med pa'i phyir mi rigs so zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
translated: The author of the sutra intends to say that it is illogical for an existent, established thing to depend on another, because that would be pointless.

original: kha cig na re phyogs snga ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa de'i sgra dang don 'di ltar yang sbyar te /
analyzed: kha cig na re phyogs snga ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa de'i sgra dang don 'di ltar yang sbyar te /
translated: Some say that the words of the opponent‚Äôs position should be applied as follows:

original: pha rol po dag rang gi tshul la gnod pa bcab pa'i phyir /üîΩci ste ma grub ltos she na //
analyzed: pha rol po dag rang gi tshul la gnod pa bcab pa'i phyir / ci ste ma grub ltos she na //
translated: In order to conceal the faults of their own system,

original: zhes zer bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes zer bar sbyar te /
translated: the opponent says, ‚ÄúIf it is not established, what is it that depends?‚ÄùüîΩThe opponent‚Äôs position is applied as follows:

original: dpe ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: dpe ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The example is taught as follows.

original: pha rol po dag dngos po ma grub pa la ltos par 'dod pa'i phyogs la dbu ma pas /üîΩdngos po ltos 'grub ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: pha rol po dag dngos po ma grub pa la ltos par 'dod pa'i phyogs la dbu ma pas / dngos po ltos 'grub ba gang yin pa //
translated: The opponent asserts that an unestablished thing depends.

original: de ma grub na ci ltar ltos //
analyzed: de ma grub na ci ltar ltos //
translated: The MƒÅdhyamika refutes this with ‚ÄúWhatever thing is established through dependence / if it is not established, how could it depend?‚Äù

original: zhes bya bas ma grub pa ltos par mi 'thad par sun phyung ba dang / da 'dir pha rol po dag rang gi tshul la gnod pa de bcas pa'i phyir yang tshig tsam gyis spogs te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ma grub pa ltos par mi 'thad par sun phyung ba dang / da 'dir pha rol po dag rang gi tshul la gnod pa de bcas pa'i phyir yang tshig tsam gyis spogs te /
translated: showing that it is untenable that an unestablished thing depends.

original: dngos po ma grub pa @227b nyid gzhan la ltos so zhes zer bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po ma grub pa @227b nyid gzhan la ltos so zhes zer bar sbyar ro //
translated: The nonestablishment of things is dependent on another.üîΩ

original: de'i lan ni de skad zer na de lta na yang /
analyzed: de'i lan ni de skad zer na de lta na yang /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúEven if you say that,

original: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: it is not tenable that it depends on another.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba de nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de nyid yin no //
translated: That is the response.

original: ci'i phyir ma grub pa ltos par mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma grub pa ltos par mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it not tenable that an unestablished thing depends on another?

original: de'i 'thad pa yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir des na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod do ces bya
analyzed: de'i 'thad pa yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir des na med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod do ces bya
translated: The rationale is that because it is inferred that it has dependence, existence refutes nonexistence. Therefore, the fault of refuting the intrinsic reality of the subject exists in the thesis of the proponents of nonexistence.

original: bar dgongs so zhes bya ba de nyid yin te /
analyzed: bar dgongs so zhes bya ba de nyid yin te /
translated: That is the thought.

original: pha rol po dag ma grub pa ltos bar 'dod na ma grub pa ni med pa yin la /
analyzed: pha rol po dag ma grub pa ltos bar 'dod na ma grub pa ni med pa yin la /
translated: If the opponent asserts that an unestablished thing depends on another, then an unestablished thing is nonexistent.

original: ltos pa ni yod pa yin pas ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir des na /
analyzed: ltos pa ni yod pa yin pas ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir des na /
translated: Since dependence is existent, because it is inferred that it has dependence, existence refutes nonexistence. Therefore,

original: pha rol po dngos po ma grub cing med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can me'i dngos po ma grub cing med pa zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas bsal ba'i skyon yod pas
analyzed: pha rol po dngos po ma grub cing med par smra ba rnams kyis dam bcas pa la chos can me'i dngos po ma grub cing med pa zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas bsal ba'i skyon yod pas
translated: The opponent who asserts that things are not established and do not exist commits the fallacy of refuting the subject, saying, ‚ÄúThe entity of fire is not established and does not exist,‚Äù because it is inferred that the nature of the subject is dependent.

original: me'i dngos po grub cing yod par gyur na /
analyzed: me'i dngos po grub cing yod par gyur na /
translated: If the entity of fire were established and existed,üîΩit would not be unestablished. Therefore the opponent‚Äôs statement, ‚ÄúThe unestablished depends,‚Äù would be illogical. This is the intention of the s≈´tra.

original: de ma grub pa ma yin pas pha rol po dag na re ma grub pa ltos so zhes zer ba de mi rigs so zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so zhes bya bar yang sbyar du rung zhes so //
analyzed: de ma grub pa ma yin pas pha rol po dag na re ma grub pa ltos so zhes zer ba de mi rigs so zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so zhes bya bar yang sbyar du rung zhes so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is suitable to apply‚Äù can also be applied to the following.

original: yang na / de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang na / de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical that it depends.

original: med pa'i phyir nas mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir nas mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it does not exist, like a sky flower.

original: ci ste grub par ltos she na //üîΩde ni ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: ci ste grub par ltos she na // de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt depends on the established,‚ÄùüîΩit is illogical that it depends.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs yin te /
translated: This is the context of the passage.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na / nam mkha'i me tog ni med pa'i phyir bud shing la ltos par mi 'thad pa de bzhin du pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i me'i dngos po grub pa de yang don dam par med pa'i phyir bud shing la ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha'i me tog ni med pa'i phyir bud shing la ltos par mi 'thad pa de bzhin du pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i me'i dngos po grub pa de yang don dam par med pa'i phyir bud shing la ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: For example, because a sky flower does not exist, it is untenable that it depends on fuel. In the same way, because the thing fire, which is accepted by the opponent, is ultimately nonexistent, it is not tenable that it depends on fuel.üîΩHere, one should apply the following:

original: 'dir yang / ci ste ma grub ltos she na //
analyzed: 'dir yang / ci ste ma grub ltos she na //
translated: If it does not exist, on what would it depend?üîΩIt is untenable that it depends on that.üîΩIf one applies the following:

original: de ni ltos par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni ltos par mi 'thad do //
translated: It is untenable that it depends on that,

original: zhes bya ba ltar sbyar na ni chos can pha rol po dag 'dod pa me'i dngos po grub pa de las bzlog ste ma grub pa de dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ltar sbyar na ni chos can pha rol po dag 'dod pa me'i dngos po grub pa de las bzlog ste ma grub pa de dang sbyar ro //
translated: then one should apply it to the subject, the thing fire, which is accepted by the opponent, in the opposite sense of not being established.

original: yang na / de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang na / de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: Or, one should apply it as follows:üîΩIt is untenable that it depends on that.

original: bud shing de ni me la ltos par mi rigs te me bzhin du med pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bud shing de ni me la ltos par mi rigs te me bzhin du med pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is untenable that fuel depends on fire because, like fire, it does not exist, like something else.

original: ci ste grub pa ltos she na //
analyzed: ci ste grub pa ltos she na //
translated: But if you say that the established depends on the other,

original: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //üîΩzhes bya ba'i @228a * //üîΩskabs des bud shing phyogs su bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni ltos par mi rigs so // zhes bya ba'i @228a * // skabs des bud shing phyogs su bya ba yin te /
translated: it is not tenable that it depends on the other.üîΩIn this context, the fuel is the subject, the established is the property to be proven, the fire is the proving property, and the example is the fire.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, the established pot, which is other than the established fuel that is asserted by the opponent, does not exist ultimately, like fire. Therefore it is not tenable that it depends on fire.

original: dper na pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i bud shing grub pa de las gzhan pa bum pa grub pa ni don dam par me bzhin du med pa'i phyir me la ltos par mi rigs pa de bzhin du pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i bud shing grub pa de
analyzed: dper na pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i bud shing grub pa de las gzhan pa bum pa grub pa ni don dam par me bzhin du med pa'i phyir me la ltos par mi rigs pa de bzhin du pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i bud shing grub pa de
translated: In the same way, the established fuel that is asserted by the opponent

original: yang don dam par me bzhin du med pa'i phyir me la ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang don dam par me bzhin du med pa'i phyir me la ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: does not exist ultimately, like fire. Therefore it is not tenable that it depends on fire.

original: 'dir yang / ci ste ma grub ltos she na //
analyzed: 'dir yang / ci ste ma grub ltos she na //
translated: Here also, if you say that the unestablished depends on the other,

original: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: it is not tenable that it depends on the other.

original: zhes bya ba ltar sbyar na ni chos can pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i bud shing gi dngos po grub pa de las bzlog ste ma grub pa de dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ltar sbyar na ni chos can pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i bud shing gi dngos po grub pa de las bzlog ste ma grub pa de dang sbyar ro //
translated: If one applies the argument in this way, then the established thing, the fuel that is accepted by the opponent, is refuted, and one applies the argument to that which is not established.

original: de bzhin du me'i phyogs la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du me'i phyogs la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Likewise, the fire should be expressed in the same way.

original: ci ste grub pa ltos she na //
analyzed: ci ste grub pa ltos she na //
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúThe established depends,‚Äù

original: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: it is not tenable that it depends.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs des me phyogs su bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs des me phyogs su bya ba yin te /
translated: This is the context for the fire,

original: me ni bud shing la ltos par mi rigs te /
analyzed: me ni bud shing la ltos par mi rigs te /
translated: because it is not tenable that fire depends on fuel,

original: bud shing bzhin du med pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bud shing bzhin du med pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: because it does not exist like fuel, just as it is different from that.üîΩFor example, it is like a pot that is established as different from the established fire that is accepted by the opponent. Because it does not exist ultimately like fuel, it is not tenable that it depends on fuel.

original: dper na pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i me grub pa de las gzhan pa bum pa grub pa ni don dam par bud shing bzhin du med pa'i phyir bud shing la ltos par mi rigs pa de bzhin du pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i me grub pa de
analyzed: dper na pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i me grub pa de las gzhan pa bum pa grub pa ni don dam par bud shing bzhin du med pa'i phyir bud shing la ltos par mi rigs pa de bzhin du pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i me grub pa de
translated: Likewise, the established fire that is accepted by the opponent

original: yang don dam par bud shing bzhin du med pa'i phyir bud shing la ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang don dam par bud shing bzhin du med pa'i phyir bud shing la ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that fire relies on fuel because, like fuel, it does not exist ultimately.üîΩHere, one should apply the following:

original: 'dir yang / ci ste ma grub ltos she na //
analyzed: 'dir yang / ci ste ma grub ltos she na //
translated: If it does not exist, what would be relied upon?

original: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not tenable that it relies on that.

original: zhes bya ba ltar sbyar na ni chos can pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i me'i dngos po grub pa de las bzlog ste ma grub pa de dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ltar sbyar na ni chos can pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i me'i dngos po grub pa de las bzlog ste ma grub pa de dang sbyar ro //
translated: If one applies this to the present context, then one should apply it to the nonestablished thing that is the opposite of the established thing that is fire as it is accepted by the opponent.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni me dang bud shing dag grub pa dang ma grub pa ltos par mi 'thad pa'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu ston te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni me dang bud shing dag grub pa dang ma grub pa ltos par mi 'thad pa'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu ston te /
translated: Therefore, the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThus, when analyzed . . .‚Äù concludes the section on the untenability of the establishment and nonestablishment of fire and fuel relying on each other and presents the result of valid knowledge.

original: shing la ltos pa'i me med de //
analyzed: shing la ltos pa'i me med de //
translated: Fire does not rely on fuel.

original: sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis bud shing me la mi ltos pa bud shing nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis bud shing me la mi ltos pa bud shing nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, as previously explained, fuel that does not rely on fire is not established as fuel. This is because it is not tenable that fire and fuel are established or not established in reliance on each other.

original: shing la ma ltos me yang med //
analyzed: shing la ma ltos me yang med //
translated: Fire does not exist without depending on fuel.üîΩBecause a difference of continuum is not established as another, and because another is refuted.

original: rgyud tha dad pa dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dang gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba @228b ni gzhan la ltos pa med pa dang 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang rtag tu 'bar bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dang gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba @228b ni gzhan la ltos pa med pa dang 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang rtag tu 'bar bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The consequence is that it would arise without a cause, and it would burn eternally without the fuel that is the cause of its burning.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: me la ltos pa'i shing med de //
analyzed: me la ltos pa'i shing med de //
translated: Fuel does not exist in dependence on fire.

original: me la ma ltos shing yang med //
analyzed: me la ma ltos shing yang med //
translated: Fire does not exist without depending on fuel.üîΩBecause dependence is refuted and because another is refuted.

original: ltos pa bkag pa'i phyir dang gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / me med cing sreg bzhin ma yin na bud shing nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa bkag pa'i phyir dang gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / me med cing sreg bzhin ma yin na bud shing nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that fire and fuel are established or not established in dependence, and because it is untenable that fuel is fuel if fire does not exist and it is not burning.

original: yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni me gzhan las kyang mi 'ong la /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni me gzhan las kyang mi 'ong la /
translated: Moreover, if fire were to come from another,

original: bud shing la yang med par ston to //
analyzed: bud shing la yang med par ston to //
translated: fuel would also exist without fire.üîΩIf fire were to come from another, fuel would also exist without fire.

original: de la re zhig gzhan las mi 'ong ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig gzhan las mi 'ong ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: First, in order to demonstrate that fire does not come from another, he says:

original: me ni gzhan las mi 'ong ste //
analyzed: me ni gzhan las mi 'ong ste //
translated: Fire does not come from another,

original: gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: because another is refuted and because substantial existence is refuted.üîΩIf one imagines that fire comes with fuel or without fuel, in neither case is it established that it comes from another.üîΩIf one imagines that fire comes from another, then it would come with fuel or without fuel.üîΩIf it comes with fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because it is not tenable that fire and fuel arise simultaneously.üîΩIf it comes without fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because fuel does not exist without fire.

original: bud shing dang bcas par ram bud shing med par 'ong bar brtags na gnyi ga la yid 'ong ba mi 'grub ste zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar me de gzhan las 'ong bar brtags na de bud shing dang bcas par 'ong nga ma bud shing med par 'ong
analyzed: bud shing dang bcas par ram bud shing med par 'ong bar brtags na gnyi ga la yid 'ong ba mi 'grub ste zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar me de gzhan las 'ong bar brtags na de bud shing dang bcas par 'ong nga ma bud shing med par 'ong
translated: If it comes with fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because it is not tenable that fire and fuel arise simultaneously.üîΩIf it comes without fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because fuel does not exist without fire.

original: grang na / gnyi ga la yang 'ong ba mi 'grub po //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: grang na / gnyi ga la yang 'ong ba mi 'grub po // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it comes with fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because it is not tenable that fire and fuel arise simultaneously.üîΩIf it comes without fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because fuel does not exist without fire.üîΩIf it comes with fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because it is not tenable that fire and fuel arise simultaneously.üîΩIf it comes without fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because fuel does not exist without fire.üîΩIf it comes with fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because it is not tenable that fire and fuel arise simultaneously.üîΩIf it comes without fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because fuel does not exist without fire.üîΩIf it comes with fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because it is not tenable that fire and fuel arise simultaneously.üîΩIf it comes without fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because fuel does not exist without fire.üîΩIf it comes with fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because it is not tenable that fire and fuel arise simultaneously.üîΩIf it comes without fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because fuel does not exist without fire.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / ltos pa med na bud shing med pas gzhi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / ltos pa med na bud shing med pas gzhi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If it comes with fuel, then it is not established that it comes from another, because it is not tenable that fire and fuel arise simultaneously.

original: gang gi phyir me dang bud shing grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir me dang bud shing dag med pas bud shing dang bcas par 'ong bar mi 'grub po //
analyzed: gang gi phyir me dang bud shing grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir me dang bud shing dag med pas bud shing dang bcas par 'ong bar mi 'grub po //
translated: Because it is untenable that fire and fuel are established or not established in dependence, therefore, since fire and fuel do not exist, it is not established that fire comes into contact with fuel.

original: gang gi phyir me dang bud shing dag ltos pa med na bud shing med pa de'i phyir me'i gzhi med pas bud shing me'i gzhi 'ong ba mi 'grub po //
analyzed: gang gi phyir me dang bud shing dag ltos pa med na bud shing med pa de'i phyir me'i gzhi med pas bud shing me'i gzhi 'ong ba mi 'grub po //
translated: Because fire and fuel are not established in dependence, since fuel does not exist, since the basis of fire does not exist, it is not established that fire comes into contact with fuel as its basis.

original: da ni me bud shing la yang med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni me bud shing la yang med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that fire does not exist in fuel,

original: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
translated: Fire does not exist in fuel.

original: gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because difference is refuted.

original: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
translated: Fire does not exist in fuel.

original: zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba yin la /
translated: This is the thesis.

original: gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Because difference is refuted, this is the proof.

original: me las gzhan pa'i shing med pa'i phyir gzhi bud shing des  me gzhag pa yod par brtag tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: me las gzhan pa'i shing med pa'i phyir gzhi bud shing des  me gzhag pa yod par brtag tu mi rung ngo //
translated: Because there is no fuel that is different from fire, it is not tenable to conceive that fire is established in dependence on the basis, fuel.

original: yang na bud shing me med pa nyid phyogs su byas te bshad pa zhes bya bas ni yang na kun rdzob tu 'bar ba dang bcas pa ni me zhes bya la /
analyzed: yang na bud shing me med pa nyid phyogs su byas te bshad pa zhes bya bas ni yang na kun rdzob tu 'bar ba dang bcas pa ni me zhes bya la /
translated: Or, it is explained from the perspective of fuel that is not fire.üîΩOr, in terms of the conventional, that which is burning is called ‚Äúfire,‚Äù

original: 'bar ba la sogs pa tsha ba med pa'i shing ni bud shing zhes bya bas de phyogs su byas te /üîΩtshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa @229a * //
analyzed: 'bar ba la sogs pa tsha ba med pa'i shing ni bud shing zhes bya bas de phyogs su byas te / tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa @229a * //
translated: and that which is not hot, such as wood that is burning, is called ‚Äúfuel.‚Äù

original: ba de rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: ba de rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston to //
translated: This is how the root text should be explained in another way.

original: de'i phyir / shing la'ang me ni yod pa yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir / shing la'ang me ni yod pa yin //
translated: Therefore, fire exists in fuel,

original: skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dper na rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dper na rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is that which arises, like consciousness.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na rnam par shes pa ni skye ba can yin pa'i phyir de la me yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bud shing yang skye ba can yin pa'i phyir de la yang me yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes pa ni skye ba can yin pa'i phyir de la me yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bud shing yang skye ba can yin pa'i phyir de la yang me yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, fire does not exist in consciousness because consciousness is that which arises, and fire does not exist in fuel because fuel is that which arises.

original: gang dag me ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dpe la yang de yod par smra ba de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag dbu ma pa'i dpe rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de sgrub par
analyzed: gang dag me ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dpe la yang de yod par smra ba de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag dbu ma pa'i dpe rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de sgrub par
translated: For those who say that fire exists in an example because fire has the characteristics of sattva, rajas, and tamas,
