original: bya ba chos kyis stong pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: bya ba chos kyis stong pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i phyogs yin te /
translated: the Madhyamikas say that the example is not established because it is empty of its property.

original: de dag na re snying stobs la sogs pa yon tan gsum ni rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba yin pa'i phyir me ni yon tan gsum las snying stobs dang rdul gyi shas che ba yin pas khyed kyi dpe rnam par shes pa la yang me de
analyzed: de dag na re snying stobs la sogs pa yon tan gsum ni rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba yin pa'i phyir me ni yon tan gsum las snying stobs dang rdul gyi shas che ba yin pas khyed kyi dpe rnam par shes pa la yang me de
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the three qualities of sattva and so on are permanent and all-pervading, and since fire is an abundance of the qualities sattva and rajas, fire exists in the example of consciousness that you Madhyamaka use.

original: yod pa'i phyir bud shing la me yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i dper rnam par shes pa mi rung ngo zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir bud shing la me yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i dper rnam par shes pa mi rung ngo zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, consciousness is not suitable as an example to prove that fire does not exist in fuel because it exists.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de la bsal ba'i khyad par can gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩrnam par shes pa de la 'bar ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa bsal ba'i khyad par can gyi me'i dngos po med pa'i phyir bud shing la me bsal ba'i khyad par can gyi dngos po med pa dang chos mthun pas rnam par shes pa dper rung ste
analyzed: de la bsal ba'i khyad par can gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te / rnam par shes pa de la 'bar ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa bsal ba'i khyad par can gyi me'i dngos po med pa'i phyir bud shing la me bsal ba'i khyad par can gyi dngos po med pa dang chos mthun pas rnam par shes pa dper rung ste
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not that there is no example because there is no thing that is the opposite of that.‚ÄùüîΩBecause fire does not exist in consciousness, which has the special attribute of being the opposite of that, it is suitable to use consciousness as an example because it is similar to fuel in that it lacks the thing that is the opposite of fire.

original: / 'di ltar rnam par shes pa la 'bar ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i me dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / 'di ltar rnam par shes pa la 'bar ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i me dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because fire, which has the attributes of being hot and burning, is not observed in consciousness.

original: gal te de'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag 'di skad ces rnam par shes pa la me bsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du me mod kyi 'on kyang me de'i nus pa rnam par shes pa la
analyzed: gal te de'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag 'di skad ces rnam par shes pa la me bsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du me mod kyi 'on kyang me de'i nus pa rnam par shes pa la
translated: if the Samkhyas say: The nature of fire is not cleared away in consciousness, but the potential of fire exists in consciousness.

original: yod pa'i phyir khyed kyi dper mi rung bas kho bo cag gi sgrub pa la skyon med do zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir khyed kyi dper mi rung bas kho bo cag gi sgrub pa la skyon med do zhes zer na'o //
translated: Therefore, your example is not suitable and our proof is not erroneous.üîΩIf they say that, the reply to that is this.

original: de skad ces zer na de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer na de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The author of the commentary says:

original: lan de ni rtog ge ba sgra'i mtshan nyid mngon par mi shes pa la @229b de mngon par mi shes pa nyid du bstan pa ni rtog ge'i bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyis sgra'i mtshan nyid la mkhas so zhes phyir zlog par byed pa bzhin no zhes bya
analyzed: lan de ni rtog ge ba sgra'i mtshan nyid mngon par mi shes pa la @229b de mngon par mi shes pa nyid du bstan pa ni rtog ge'i bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyis sgra'i mtshan nyid la mkhas so zhes phyir zlog par byed pa bzhin no zhes bya
translated: That reply is like a logician who does not understand the characteristics of sound but claims to be skilled in the characteristics of sound because he understands the treatise on logic.

original: ba bzhad gang du 'gyur ba'i dpe dang bcas pa 'di smras te /
analyzed: ba bzhad gang du 'gyur ba'i dpe dang bcas pa 'di smras te /
translated: This is the example that is said.

original: rtog ge ba sgra'i mtshan nyid la mi mkhas pa la la zhig la /
analyzed: rtog ge ba sgra'i mtshan nyid la mi mkhas pa la la zhig la /
translated: Some logicians are not skilled in the definition of sound.

original: smra ba po 'ga' zhig gis khyod sgra'i mtshan nyid la mi mkhas pa yin no zhes bstan pa de na re kho bo rtog ge'i bstan bcos la mkhas pa nyid yin na ci'i phyir sgra'i mtshan nyid la mi mkhas pa yin zhes lan 'debs pa de ni /
analyzed: smra ba po 'ga' zhig gis khyod sgra'i mtshan nyid la mi mkhas pa yin no zhes bstan pa de na re kho bo rtog ge'i bstan bcos la mkhas pa nyid yin na ci'i phyir sgra'i mtshan nyid la mi mkhas pa yin zhes lan 'debs pa de ni /
translated: If someone says to them, ‚ÄúYou are not skilled in the definition of sound,‚Äù they reply, ‚ÄúIf we are skilled in the treatises of logic, why are we not skilled in the definition of sound?‚Äù

original: kun gyi bzhad gad du 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar 'dir kho bos bud shing me med pa nyid phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: kun gyi bzhad gad du 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar 'dir kho bos bud shing me med pa nyid phyogs su byas te /
translated: This is laughable for everyone.

original: de'i dper rnam par shes pa la me'i bsal ba med pa nye bar bzhag pa na de la khyod na re me'i bsal ba med kyang nus pa yod pas dper mi rung ngo zhes zer ba de yang kun gyi bzhad gang du 'gyur bas lan de ni lan
analyzed: de'i dper rnam par shes pa la me'i bsal ba med pa nye bar bzhag pa na de la khyod na re me'i bsal ba med kyang nus pa yod pas dper mi rung ngo zhes zer ba de yang kun gyi bzhad gang du 'gyur bas lan de ni lan
translated: In the same way, here, when we take the position that fuel does not exist without fire, and we posit the example of consciousness, which lacks the exclusion of fire, you say, ‚ÄúAlthough the exclusion of fire does not exist, its capacity exists, so it is not a suitable example.‚ÄùüîΩThis is also laughable for everyone.üîΩTherefore that reply is

original: du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: not suitable.

original: gzhan dag ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni /
translated: Others say:

original: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
translated: Fire does not exist in fuel.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba 'di la 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba 'di la 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta
translated: This is explained by the master BuddhapƒÅlita in his commentary on this root text.üîΩ

original: ni 'di skad ces rnam par bshad pa byed de /
analyzed: ni 'di skad ces rnam par bshad pa byed de /
translated: This is explained by the commentary:üîΩBecause fire does not exist in fuel, and because it would be pointless to initiate activity.üîΩThe elder Buddhapalita explains this root verse as follows:

original: bud shing la yang me yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bud shing la yang me yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Fuel does not have fire.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not observed and because it would be pointless to initiate activity.

original: gal te bud shing la me yod par gyur na de la dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa de'i phyir bud shing la me yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te bud shing la me yod par gyur na de la dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa de'i phyir bud shing la me yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If fire existed in fuel, it would be observed. But because it is not observed, fire does not exist in fuel.

original: gzhan yang gal te bud shing la me yod par gyur na bud shing gzhug pa dang spar ba dang bsgul ba la sogs pa'i rtsom pa don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir bud shing la me yod pa ma yin no zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te bud shing la me yod par gyur na bud shing gzhug pa dang spar ba dang bsgul ba la sogs pa'i rtsom pa don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir bud shing la me yod pa ma yin no zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do //
translated: Therefore fire does not exist in fuel.

original: gzhan ma yin pa na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But Paramadibuddha says that is illogical,

original: mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / rtsom pa don yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don yod pa nyid du ston pa mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gzhan ma yin pa ni rang nyid de /üîΩ'grel pa byed pa rang nyid kyis gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin par @230a * //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / rtsom pa don yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don yod pa nyid du ston pa mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gzhan ma yin pa ni rang nyid de / 'grel pa byed pa rang nyid kyis gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin par @230a * //
translated: because nonobservation is not established as a reason, and because it would contradict the explanation that the reason for the point of effort is the existence of the point.

original: sun 'byin pa ston to //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ston to //
translated: Thus Paramadibuddha himself explains that the explanation of the elder Buddhapalita is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir de rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it illogical?

original: mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because non-apprehension is not established as a logical reason.

original: gang gi phyir sreg bzhin pa bud shing zhes bya ba de'i phyir de la yang me nyid dmigs bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sreg bzhin pa bud shing zhes bya ba de'i phyir de la yang me nyid dmigs bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is called ‚Äúfuel that is being burned,‚Äù therefore fire is apprehended in it.

original: gzhan yang rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de yang glags yod pa'i tshig yin pas rtsom pa ni don med pa nyid ma yin te don yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de yang glags yod pa'i tshig yin pas rtsom pa ni don med pa nyid ma yin te don yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚Äúbecause the undertaking would be pointless‚Äù is also a statement that provides an opportunity for an opponent to respond. Therefore, the undertaking is not pointless, but rather it is meaningful.

original: des na rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog na skabs kyi don rtsom pa don yod pa nyid ces bya ba de gtan tshigs yin par mngon no//
analyzed: des na rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog na skabs kyi don rtsom pa don yod pa nyid ces bya ba de gtan tshigs yin par mngon no//
translated: Thus, the statement ‚Äúthe undertaking would be pointless‚Äù is a statement that provides an opportunity for an opponent to respond. When that is reversed, the meaning of the context, ‚Äúthe undertaking is meaningful,‚Äù is clearly seen to be the logical reason.

original: rtsom pa don yod pa nyid gtan tshigs yin na des bsgrub par bya ba yang bud shing la me yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba las bzlog pa bud shing la me yod pa zhes bya bar 'grub pas /
analyzed: rtsom pa don yod pa nyid gtan tshigs yin na des bsgrub par bya ba yang bud shing la me yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba las bzlog pa bud shing la me yod pa zhes bya bar 'grub pas /
translated: If the undertaking is meaningful, the logical reason, then the proposition, ‚Äúfire does not exist in fuel,‚Äù is reversed and established as ‚Äúfire exists in fuel.‚Äù

original: de lta na khyod kyis sngar mdo mdzad pa'i lung las bud shing las me yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa de khas blangs la /
analyzed: de lta na khyod kyis sngar mdo mdzad pa'i lung las bud shing las me yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa de khas blangs la /
translated: In that case, you accept the statement in the sutra you cited earlier that ‚Äúfire does not exist in fuel.‚Äù

original: da 'dir bud shing la me yod par bsgrubs pas mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: da 'dir bud shing la me yod par bsgrubs pas mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But now you are proving that fire exists in fuel, and so you contradict your own thesis. Therefore the elder BuddhapaÃÑlita‚Äôs explanation is not correct.

original: me dang bud shing dag ci skad bstan pa'i dgag pa dag 'ba' zhig gis dgag par bya ba yin par ma bsams kyi /
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag ci skad bstan pa'i dgag pa dag 'ba' zhig gis dgag par bya ba yin par ma bsams kyi /
translated: We do not think that fire and fuel are to be refuted only by the negations stated above.

original: 'di ltar dgag pa gzhan dag gis kyang dgag par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dgag pa gzhan dag gis kyang dgag par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Rather, they are to be refuted by other negations as well.üîΩTherefore, the remaining negations should be stated in the same way.

original: de'i phyir dgag pa lhag ma dag kyang 'dra bar bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing dag dgag pa ni gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dang ltos pa dang ltos pa med pa dang gzhan las mi 'ong ba dang bud shing la med
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag pa lhag ma dag kyang 'dra bar bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing dag dgag pa ni gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dang ltos pa dang ltos pa med pa dang gzhan las mi 'ong ba dang bud shing la med
translated: The negations of fire and fuel are: they are not identical, they are not different, they are not dependent, they are not independent, they do not come from another, fire does not exist in fuel, fuel does not exist in fire, fire does not exist in fire, and fuel does not exist in fuel.

original: par dgag pa'i rnam pa ci skad bstan pa de dag 'ba' zhig gis dgag par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: par dgag pa'i rnam pa ci skad bstan pa de dag 'ba' zhig gis dgag par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The words ‚Äújust as‚Äù indicate that the refutations are not limited to the refutations that have been taught.

original: dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan dag gis kyang 'dra bar dgag par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan dag gis kyang 'dra bar dgag par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: The words ‚Äúin the same way‚Äù indicate that other refutations should be understood as similar.üîΩWhat are those other refutations?

original: dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan de dag kyang gang zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan de dag kyang gang zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: The root text states:üîΩThe remaining should be explained in the same way

original: song dang ma song bgom pa yis //üîΩde bzhin shing la lhag ma bstan //
analyzed: song dang ma song bgom pa yis // de bzhin shing la lhag ma bstan //
translated: with respect to fire and fuel.

original: zhes bya ba smras te rnam pa de dag gis de bzhin du bud shing la yang brjod pa lhag ma dag bstan par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te rnam pa de dag gis de bzhin du bud shing la yang brjod pa lhag ma dag bstan par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The remaining should be explained in the same way with respect to fire and fuel by means of the same modes of refutation.

original: rnam pa gang dag gis she na //
analyzed: rnam pa gang dag gis she na //
translated: By what modes of refutation?

original: song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa'i rnam par dag gis so //
analyzed: song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa'i rnam par dag gis so //
translated: By the modes of refutation that apply to the gone, the not-gone, and that being gone over.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ci ltar rjes su dpag pa las song ba @230b dang ma song ba dang bgom pa la 'gro ba med pa de bzhin du bsregs pa dang ma bsregs pa dang sreg bzhin pa la yang sreg pa med de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ci ltar rjes su dpag pa las song ba @230b dang ma song ba dang bgom pa la 'gro ba med pa de bzhin du bsregs pa dang ma bsregs pa dang sreg bzhin pa la yang sreg pa med de /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said: Just as going does not exist on that being gone over, not yet gone over, and the path over which one has gone, so too burning does not exist on that being burned, not yet burned, and that being burned.

original: bsreg par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bsregs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bsregs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Just like that being burned, because it is that being burned, it is said that the same goes for that being cooked, that not yet cooked, and that being cooked.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And those are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.

original: ci ltar dper na don dam par song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa'i lam dag ni 'grod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de dag la 'gro ba'i bya ba med pa de bzhin du don dam par bsregs pa dang ma bsregs pa dang sreg bzhin pa'i
analyzed: ci ltar dper na don dam par song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa'i lam dag ni 'grod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de dag la 'gro ba'i bya ba med pa de bzhin du don dam par bsregs pa dang ma bsregs pa dang sreg bzhin pa'i
translated: For example, just as ultimately the path on which one has gone, on which one has not yet gone, and on which one is going do not have the action of going because they are that being gone over, so too ultimately that being burned, that not yet burned, and that being burned

original: las dag kyang bsreg par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bsregs zin pa'i las la yang sreg pa'i bya ba med pa bzhin du de dag la yang sreg pa'i bya ba med par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: las dag kyang bsreg par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bsregs zin pa'i las la yang sreg pa'i bya ba med pa bzhin du de dag la yang sreg pa'i bya ba med par brjod par bya'o //
translated: and because the object to be burned is also the agent of burning, just as the object to be burned is not burned again, so too they should be described as not burned.

original: ci ltar rjes su dpag pa las 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa dang de dag las gzhan pa 'gro bar mi byed par bstan pa de bzhin du don dam par sreg pa po dang sreg pa ma yin pa dang de dag las gzhan pa
analyzed: ci ltar rjes su dpag pa las 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa dang de dag las gzhan pa 'gro bar mi byed par bstan pa de bzhin du don dam par sreg pa po dang sreg pa ma yin pa dang de dag las gzhan pa
translated: Just as it is shown by way of inference that the goer, the nongoer, and one other than those do not go, so too it should be shown that ultimately the burner, the nonburner, and one other than those

original: yang sreg par mi byed par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: yang sreg par mi byed par bstan par bya ste /
translated: do not burn.üîΩBecause they do not possess two actions, because they are not burners, and because both errors would ensue, they are like a donkey.

original: bya ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang sreg pa po ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir bong pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
analyzed: bya ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang sreg pa po ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir bong pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum,

original: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the property of the probandum, and the example should be applied in order.

original: ci ltar dper na don dam par bong pa ni bya ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed pa de bzhin du 'gro ba po yang bya ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed pa dang / bong pa ni 'gro ba po ma yin pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed pa de bzhin du 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang 'gro ba po ma yin pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: ci ltar dper na don dam par bong pa ni bya ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed pa de bzhin du 'gro ba po yang bya ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed pa dang / bong pa ni 'gro ba po ma yin pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed pa de bzhin du 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang 'gro ba po ma yin pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed pa dang /
translated: For example, just as a donkey does not go because it does not possess two actions, so too the goer does not go because he does not possess two actions.üîΩJust as a donkey does not go because it is not a goer, so too that which is not a goer does not go because it is not a goer.üîΩJust as a donkey does not go because it would have the fault of both, so too that which is and is not a goer does not go because it would have the fault of both.

original: bong pa ni gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed pa de bzhin du 'gro ba po yin pa dang ma yin pa yang gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dper na don dam
analyzed: bong pa ni gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed pa de bzhin du 'gro ba po yin pa dang ma yin pa yang gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gro bar mi byed par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dper na don dam
translated: Just as a donkey does not go because it would have the fault of both, so too that which is and is not a goer does not go because it would have the fault of both.

original: par bong pa ni bya ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir sreg par mi byed pa de bzhin du sreg pa po yang bya ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir sreg par mi byed la /
analyzed: par bong pa ni bya ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir sreg par mi byed pa de bzhin du sreg pa po yang bya ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir sreg par mi byed la /
translated: Similarly, because the burner does not possess two actions, it does not burn.

original: bong pa ni sreg pa po ma yin pa'i phyir sreg par @231a * //
analyzed: bong pa ni sreg pa po ma yin pa'i phyir sreg par @231a * //
translated: Because a clod of earth is not a burner, it does not burn.

original: mi byed pa de bzhin du sreg pa po ma yin pa yang sreg pa po ma yin pa'i phyir sreg par mi byed cing /
analyzed: mi byed pa de bzhin du sreg pa po ma yin pa yang sreg pa po ma yin pa'i phyir sreg par mi byed cing /
translated: Similarly, because that which is not a burner is not a burner, it does not burn.üîΩBecause a clod of earth has the fault of both, it does not burn.

original: bong pa ni gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir sreg par mi byed pa de bzhin du sreg pa po yin pa dang ma yin pa gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir sreg par mi byed do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bong pa ni gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir sreg par mi byed pa de bzhin du sreg pa po yin pa dang ma yin pa gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir sreg par mi byed do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, because that which is and is not a burner has the fault of both, it does not burn.

original: de bzhin du rtsom pa dgag pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyang drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsom pa dgag pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyang drang bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the remaining refutations of beginning, etc. should be interpreted.

original: da ni bud shing nyid me ma yin pa dang / bud shing las gzhan la me med pa dang / me dang bud shing dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / me la bud shing med pa dang / bud shing la me med par dgag pa rnam pa lnga ston te /
analyzed: da ni bud shing nyid me ma yin pa dang / bud shing las gzhan la me med pa dang / me dang bud shing dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / me la bud shing med pa dang / bud shing la me med par dgag pa rnam pa lnga ston te /
translated: Now, the fivefold refutation of fire and fuel is presented: fire is not fuel, fire does not exist apart from fuel, fire does not possess fuel, fire does not exist in fuel, and fuel does not exist in fire.

original: de la gcig pa nyid dgag pa sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang las dag gcig pa nyid kyi skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gcig pa nyid dgag pa sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang las dag gcig pa nyid kyi skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As for the refutation of identity, it is because the error of the identity of agent and action would ensue.

original: shing las gzhan la me yang med //
analyzed: shing las gzhan la me yang med //
translated: Fire does not exist apart from fuel.

original: gzhan nyid dgag pa sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid dgag pa sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As for the refutation of difference, it is because the error of not depending on fuel and so on would ensue.

original: me ni shing dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: me ni shing dang ldan pa yin //
translated: Fire possesses fuel.

original: ci ltar tse tra ba lang dang ldan pa ltar ro zhes bya ba dang / mi la shing med /
analyzed: ci ltar tse tra ba lang dang ldan pa ltar ro zhes bya ba dang / mi la shing med /
translated: Just as a Caitra possesses a cow, a man has a tree.

original: ci ltar rdza bo na rgya shug dag ltar ro zhes bya ba dang / der de med /
analyzed: ci ltar rdza bo na rgya shug dag ltar ro zhes bya ba dang / der de med /
translated: Just as a clay pot is different from jujubes,üîΩand just as a lotus is different from water.

original: ci ltar chu na padma dag ltar te zhes bya ba de gsum gyi sgrub pa'i chos ni gzhan nyid dgag pa sngar bstan pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar chu na padma dag ltar te zhes bya ba de gsum gyi sgrub pa'i chos ni gzhan nyid dgag pa sngar bstan pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The property to be proven in those three is just the negation of difference, because it was previously explained.

original: gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i skabs kyis bstan to //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar me dang bud shing dag ma grub pas dpe med pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i skabs kyis bstan to // de'i phyir de ltar me dang bud shing dag ma grub pas dpe med pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Because the error of not depending on the other and so on would ensue.üîΩThus, since fire and fuel are not established, since the example does not exist, the response that the first chapter is incomplete is difficult to rebut.

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir dper na me dang bud shing bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de'i dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi lan gdab dka'o zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir dper na me dang bud shing bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de'i dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi lan gdab dka'o zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since fire and fuel are not established, since the example does not exist, since the response that the first chapter is incomplete is difficult to rebut, the response that the first chapter is incomplete is difficult to rebut.üîΩThis is the summary of the chapter.

original: des na don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: des na don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, ultimately the aggregates and so on do exist,üîΩbecause the BhagavƒÅn taught the appropriator and the appropriated in dependence on them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i rtsa ba ma grub po zhes bya ba ni spyi'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i rtsa ba ma grub po zhes bya ba ni spyi'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the general result of valid cognition, that the root of the proof is not established.

original: sngar nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i dang por pha rol pos de skad smras pa'i sgrub pa'i rtsa ba ma grub pas /
analyzed: sngar nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i dang por pha rol pos de skad smras pa'i sgrub pa'i rtsa ba ma grub pas /
translated: Previously, in the first chapter, the opponent said that,

original: dbu ma pas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag @231b ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: dbu ma pas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag @231b ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas pa grub pa'o //
translated: since the root of the proof is not established, the MƒÅdhyamika‚Äôs thesis that ultimately the aggregates and so on are essenceless is established.

original: da ni me dang bud shing dag gi gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa dag ci ltar bkag pa'i rim pa de dag nyid kyis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi dgag pa rim pa thams cad kyang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa
analyzed: da ni me dang bud shing dag gi gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa dag ci ltar bkag pa'i rim pa de dag nyid kyis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi dgag pa rim pa thams cad kyang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa
translated: Now, one should understand that just by the process of refuting the sameness and difference of fire and fuel, all the processes of refuting the self and the appropriated are explained in their entirety, just like the refutation of the pot and cloth, etc.

original: dag dang lhan cig tu ma lus par rnam par bshad par khong du chud par bya'o zhes thams cad 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩci ltar me dang bud shing dag gi de nyid dang gzhan nyid bkag pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dag dang lhan cig tu ma lus par rnam par bshad par khong du chud par bya'o zhes thams cad 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir / ci ltar me dang bud shing dag gi de nyid dang gzhan nyid bkag pa de bzhin du /
translated: In order to demonstrate that all are similar, it says:üîΩJust as the sameness and difference of fire and fuel are refuted,

original: me dang shing gis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: me dang shing gis bdag dang ni //
translated: so the self and the appropriated

original: nye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //
translated: are explained in their entirety,

original: bum snam la sogs lhan cig tu //üîΩma lus par ni rnam par bshad //üîΩces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bum snam la sogs lhan cig tu //üîΩma lus par ni rnam par bshad //üîΩces bya ba smras te /
translated: just like the pot and cloth, etc.

original: me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi gcig pa nyid dang gzhan pa nyid dang / phan tshun ltos par mi 'thad pa'i rim pa thams cad bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dang lhan cig tu ma lus par rnam par bshad par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi gcig pa nyid dang gzhan pa nyid dang / phan tshun ltos par mi 'thad pa'i rim pa thams cad bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dang lhan cig tu ma lus par rnam par bshad par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: through fire and fuel are explained in their entirety together with the pot, cloth, and so on.

original: bum snam la sogs lhan cig tu //üîΩzhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag dgag pa'i rim pa gang dag rnam par bshad pa de dag bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dang yang lhan cig tu rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: bum snam la sogs lhan cig tu // zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag dgag pa'i rim pa gang dag rnam par bshad pa de dag bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dang yang lhan cig tu rnam par bshad de /
translated: The pot, cloth, and so on are together.üîΩThe stages of the refutation of the self and the appropriated through fire and fuel are explained together with the pot, cloth, and so on.

original: bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that all the stages of the refutation of the self and the appropriated and of the pot, cloth, and so on are explained in their entirety.

original: de la re zhig me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad par khong du chud par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad par khong du chud par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: First, in order to demonstrate that fire and fuel completely explain the process of refuting the self and that appropriated,

original: rim pa zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rim pa zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: the process is synonymous with the process of refutation.

original: thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /üîΩme dang shing gis bdag dang ni //üîΩnye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //
analyzed: thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te / me dang shing gis bdag dang ni // nye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //
translated: Everything is completely explained.üîΩFire and fuel completely explain

original: ma lus par ni rnam par bshad //
analyzed: ma lus par ni rnam par bshad //
translated: the process of refuting the self and that appropriated.

original: ces bya ba la rim pa zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la rim pa zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The process is synonymous with the process of refutation.

original: de dag thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Everything is completely explained.

original: de la re zhig bdag phyogs su byas nas bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig bdag phyogs su byas nas bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: First, in order to demonstrate the process of refuting the identity of the self and that appropriated, taking the self as the first

original: don dam par bdag ni nye bar blang ba dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /üîΩbyed pa @232a * //
analyzed: don dam par bdag ni nye bar blang ba dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te / byed pa @232a * //
translated: Ultimately, the self is not the same as the appropriated aggregates,üîΩbecause it is the agent and the aggregates are the object.

original: po dang las yin pa'i phyir dper na gcod pa po dang gcad pa dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: po dang las yin pa'i phyir dper na gcod pa po dang gcad pa dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like the one who cuts and that which is cut.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the proposition, the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, the one who cuts and that which is cut are not ultimately the same because the one is the agent and the other is the object.

original: dper na gcod pa po dang gcad pa dag ni byed po dang las yin pa'i phyir don dam par gcig pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag kyang byed pa po dang las yin pa'i phyir don dam par gcig pa nyidüîΩma yin no //
analyzed: dper na gcod pa po dang gcad pa dag ni byed po dang las yin pa'i phyir don dam par gcig pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag kyang byed pa po dang las yin pa'i phyir don dam par gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the self and the appropriated aggregates are not ultimately the same because the one is the agent and the other is the object.

original: da ni bdag phyogs su byas nas bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bdag phyogs su byas nas bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the sequence of the refutation of the self and the appropriated being different, he says:

original: don dam par bdag ni nye bar blang ba las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par bdag ni nye bar blang ba las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the self is not different from the appropriated aggregates,üîΩbecause it is not tenable that that which is appropriatedüîΩis appropriated by that which is appropriated.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na nye bar blang ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na nye bar blang ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is dependent and because it is a thing, like the self of that appropriated.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And these are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na nye bar blang ba rang gi bdag nyid ni ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yin pa'i phyir don dam par rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang dngos po yin pa'i phyir don dam par nye bar blang ba las gzhan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na nye bar blang ba rang gi bdag nyid ni ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yin pa'i phyir don dam par rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang dngos po yin pa'i phyir don dam par nye bar blang ba las gzhan nyid ma yin no //
translated: For example, the self of that appropriated is not ultimately different from itself because it is dependent and because it is a thing. In the same way, the self is not ultimately different from that appropriated because it is dependent and because it is a thing.

original: da ni nye bar blang ba phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nye bar blang ba phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the sequence of the refutation of sameness and difference in terms of the appropriated,üîΩhe says:

original: de bzhin du don dam par nye bar blang ba ni bdag dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par nye bar blang ba ni bdag dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: So too, ultimately the appropriated is not the same as the self,

original: las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na gcad pa dang gcod pa po dag bzhin no //
analyzed: las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na gcad pa dang gcod pa po dag bzhin no //
translated: because it is the object and the agent, just like, for example, the object of cutting and the cutter.

original: don dam par nye bar blang ba ni bdag las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nye bar blang ba ni bdag las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately the appropriated is not different from the self,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bdag gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag smras te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bdag gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag smras te /
translated: because it is dependent and because it is not a thing, just like, for example, the self of the self.üîΩThese are the assertions.

original: de dag ni nye bar blang ba phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i rim pa la dam bcas pa'i khyad par yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni nye bar blang ba phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i rim pa la dam bcas pa'i khyad par yod par zad kyi /
translated: In the context of refuting sameness, the only difference is that the object of refutation is the appropriated.

original: sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The remaining parts of the syllogism are the same as before.

original: da ni bdag phyogs su byas nas nye bar len pa po dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag ni /
analyzed: da ni bdag phyogs su byas nas nye bar len pa po dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag ni /
translated: Now, in order to teach the steps of the refutation of the appropriator in the context of the self, the text says, ‚ÄúSo too, ultimately, the self of Lhejin,‚Äù and so on.

original: lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed de /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed de /
translated: Devadatta does not take up that which is to be appropriated.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i @232b phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i @232b phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is dependent, like something else.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the proposition, the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na lhas byin las gzhan pa mchod sbyin gyi bdag ni ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na lhas byin las gzhan pa mchod sbyin gyi bdag ni ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the self of a sacrifice, which is different from Devadatta, does not ultimately take up that which is to be appropriated by Devadatta because it is dependent.

original: lhas byin gyi bdag kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed do //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi bdag kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, the self of Devadatta does not ultimately take up that which is to be appropriated by Devadatta because it is dependent.

original: da ni nye bar blang ba phyogs su byas nas nye bar blang ba dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nye bar blang ba phyogs su byas nas nye bar blang ba dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the order of the refutation of the appropriator having made the object of refutation the appropriated,üîΩthe root text says:

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba ni lhas byin gyi bdag gi nye bar blang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba ni lhas byin gyi bdag gi nye bar blang ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, Devadatta's appropriated aggregates are not the self of Devadatta.üîΩ

original: nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar blang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar blang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Ultimately, Lhejin‚Äôs appropriated aggregates are not the self of Lhejin because they are appropriated aggregates, just like the appropriated aggregates of Yaj√±a.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar blang ba ni nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba ma yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba yang nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir don dam par
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar blang ba ni nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba ma yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba yang nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir don dam par
translated: Here, the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, ultimately, Yaj√±a‚Äôs appropriated aggregates are not the appropriated aggregates of Lhejin because they are appropriated aggregates.

original: lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, ultimately, Lhejin‚Äôs appropriated aggregates are not the appropriated aggregates of Lhejin because they are appropriated aggregates.

original: da ni bdag phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bdag phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to indicate the order in which the self is refuted in terms of the relata,

original: de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa ni lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba la ltos par mi byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa ni lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba la ltos par mi byed de /
translated: So too, ultimately, whether Devadatta‚Äôs self is established or not is not dependent on Devadatta‚Äôs appropriated aggregates,

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is the self, just like the self of Yaj√±adatta.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin bar go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa ni bdag yin pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba la ltos par mi byed pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa yang bdag yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin bar go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa ni bdag yin pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba la ltos par mi byed pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa yang bdag yin pa'i phyir
translated: These are to be applied in order to the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, whether the self of Yaj√±adatta is established or not is not ultimately dependent on Devadatta‚Äôs appropriated aggregates, because it is the self.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba la ltos par mi byed do //
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba la ltos par mi byed do //
translated: So too, whether Devadatta‚Äôs self is established or not is not ultimately dependent on Devadatta‚Äôs appropriated aggregates, because it is the self.

original: da ni nye bar blang ba phyogs su byas na ltos pa / dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nye bar blang ba phyogs su byas na ltos pa / dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the sequence of refuting the dependence of the appropriated in terms of the appropriator,

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba ni lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin te nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar blang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras teüîΩ/ de dag kyang @233a * //
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba ni lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin te nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar blang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te / de dag kyang @233a * //
translated: it is said, ultimately, Devadatta‚Äôs appropriated is not the object of dependence of Devadatta‚Äôs self, whether it is established or not, because it is appropriated, just like, for example, the appropriated of Yaj√±a.

original: chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.üîΩFor example, ultimately, the appropriated of Yaj√±a is not the object of dependence of Devadatta‚Äôs self, whether it is established or not, because it is appropriated.

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar blang ba ni nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba yang nye bar blang
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar blang ba ni nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba yang nye bar blang
translated: In the same way, Devadatta‚Äôs appropriated is not the object of dependence of Devadatta‚Äôs self, whether it is established or not, because it is appropriated.

original: ba yin pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ba yin pa'i phyir don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, the self of Devadatta is not the referent of the relation of established or not established in Devadatta‚Äôs appropriation.

original: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa lhas byin gyi bdag lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed de zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa lhas byin gyi bdag lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed de zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
translated: Here, someone says: What is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe self of Devadatta does not appropriate the appropriation of Devadatta‚Äù?

original: ci gzhan nye bar len par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci gzhan nye bar len par byed pa yin nam /
translated: Does it mean that something else appropriates it?üîΩOr does it mean that nothing at all appropriates it?

original: 'on te ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga mas /
analyzed: 'on te ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga mas /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs response to the above reductio

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa ni lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed do zhes bya ba de'i don /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa ni lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed do zhes bya ba de'i don /
translated: The meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe self of Devadatta does not ultimately appropriate the appropriation of Devadatta,‚Äù

original: ci lhas byin gyi bdag lhas byin nyid kyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed na de la gzhan gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci lhas byin gyi bdag lhas byin nyid kyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed na de la gzhan gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed pa yin nam /
translated: is this: If the self of Devadatta does not appropriate the appropriation of Devadatta, does it mean that something else appropriates it?

original: 'on te ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa yin zhes gal gnyis su rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa yin zhes gal gnyis su rtog pa yin no //
translated: Or does it not take up anything at all?üîΩWhat is the point of this?

original: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshul dri ba yin no //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshul dri ba yin no //
translated: This is a question about the method.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: gal te gzhan nye bar len par byed pa yin na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan nye bar len par byed pa yin na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: if it takes up something else, then the former position is undermined.

original: de lta na sngar dbu ma pas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag dgag par dam bcas la /
analyzed: de lta na sngar dbu ma pas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag dgag par dam bcas la /
translated: In that case, the Madhyamika previously committed to refuting the appropriator and that which is to be appropriated.

original: da 'dir lhas byin gyi nye bar len pa pos gzhan gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par byed par khas blangs pas sngar rang gi dam bcas pa'i phyogs snga ma la gnod do //
analyzed: da 'dir lhas byin gyi nye bar len pa pos gzhan gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par byed par khas blangs pas sngar rang gi dam bcas pa'i phyogs snga ma la gnod do //
translated: Now, here, since it is accepted that Devadatta‚Äôs appropriator takes up the appropriated aggregates of another, the former position previously committed to by him is undermined.

original: ci ste ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa yin na ni dpe med do /
analyzed: ci ste ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa yin na ni dpe med do /
translated: But if it does not take up anything at all, then there is no example.

original: mchod sbyin gyi bdag ni rang gi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta na nye bar len pa pos ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa'i dpe sngar mchod sbyin las blangs pa de mi
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi bdag ni rang gi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta na nye bar len pa pos ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa'i dpe sngar mchod sbyin las blangs pa de mi
translated: If that is so, then the example of the sacrificer that you previously cited to show that the appropriator does not appropriate anything is not

original: rung ste / mchod sbyin gzhan gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed kyang rang gi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed pas ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ste / mchod sbyin gzhan gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed kyang rang gi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed pas ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: tenable, because although the sacrificer does not appropriate the appropriated aggregates of another, it is not the case that it does not appropriate anything, since it appropriates its own appropriated aggregates.

original: des na dbu ma pa'i dpe snga ma dag bsgrub par bya bas stong pas mi rung ngo zhes @233b zer ba yin na //
analyzed: des na dbu ma pa'i dpe snga ma dag bsgrub par bya bas stong pas mi rung ngo zhes @233b zer ba yin na //
translated: Therefore, since the former examples of the Madhyamaka are empty of the probandum, they are untenable.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it has already been answered.

original: brtag pa snga ma ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa med la brtag pa phyi ma la yang bdag mchod sbyin zhes bya ba lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed pa nyid du grub pa nyid
analyzed: brtag pa snga ma ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa med la brtag pa phyi ma la yang bdag mchod sbyin zhes bya ba lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed pa nyid du grub pa nyid
translated: In the latter analysis, it is established that Devadatta does not appropriate what is to be appropriated in the continuum of Yaj√±adatta.

original: dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin no zhes sngar lan btab zin pa'i phyir klan ka de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin no zhes sngar lan btab zin pa'i phyir klan ka de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since this is presented as an example, it is not the case that there is no example.

original: de ltar de dag gis ni me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dang ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa brgal ba'i lan dang bcas par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gis ni me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dang ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa brgal ba'i lan dang bcas par bstan to //
translated: Thus, these passages explain the refutation of the position that fire and fuel are identical or different, along with a response to objections.

original: ci ltar me dang bud shing dag gi skabs su /
analyzed: ci ltar me dang bud shing dag gi skabs su /
translated: As was said in the context of fire and fuel,

original: me ni gzhan las mi 'ong ste //
analyzed: me ni gzhan las mi 'ong ste //
translated: Fire does not come from another,

original: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
translated: Nor is fire in fuel.

original: song dang ma song ba gom pa yis //
analyzed: song dang ma song ba gom pa yis //
translated: One does not step with the same foot

original: de bzhin shing la lhag ma bstan //
analyzed: de bzhin shing la lhag ma bstan //
translated: So too, the remaining [aggregates] are taught with respect to the tree.

original: shing nyid me ni ma yin te //
analyzed: shing nyid me ni ma yin te //
translated: The tree itself is not fire,

original: shing las gzhan la me yang med //üîΩme ni shing dang ldan ma yin //
analyzed: shing las gzhan la me yang med // me ni shing dang ldan ma yin //
translated: and fire is not apart from the tree.üîΩFire is not possessed by the tree,

original: me la shing med der de med //
analyzed: me la shing med der de med //
translated: and the tree is not in fire, nor is it in the tree.

original: ces bstan pa de dag thams cad 'dir bdag dang nye bar blang ba dgag pa'i skabs su yang ci rigs par sbyar te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bstan pa de dag thams cad 'dir bdag dang nye bar blang ba dgag pa'i skabs su yang ci rigs par sbyar te brjod par bya'o //
translated: All of these teachings should be applied here in the context of refuting the self and the appropriated [aggregates], as appropriate.

original: re zhig de dag ni //üîΩme dang shing gis bdag dang ni//üîΩnye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni // me dang shing gis bdag dang ni// nye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //
translated: For now,üîΩthe stages of the self and the appropriated

original: ma lus par ni rnam par bshad //
analyzed: ma lus par ni rnam par bshad //
translated: have all been explained without exception.

original: ces bya ba'i tshul bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshul bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the manner in which it is taught.üîΩNow,

original: da ni / bum snam la sogs lhan cig tu /
analyzed: da ni / bum snam la sogs lhan cig tu /
translated: the pot, cloth, and so on, together with

original: ma lus pa ni rnam par bshad //
analyzed: ma lus pa ni rnam par bshad //
translated: all of them, have been explained without exception.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang sbyar te dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir me dang bud shing de dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi rim pa gang dag rnam par bshad pa de dag bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dangüîΩyang lhan cig tu rnam par bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang sbyar te dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir me dang bud shing de dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi rim pa gang dag rnam par bshad pa de dag bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dang yang lhan cig tu rnam par bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the sequence of refutations in connection with the meaning of the words, ‚Äúfirewood and fire,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúThe sequence of self and appropriation that was explained in terms of firewood and fire is also explained in terms of pots, cloth, and so on.‚Äù

original: me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi rim pa gang dag rnam par bshad pa de dag bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dang yang lhan cig tu rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi rim pa gang dag rnam par bshad pa de dag bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dang yang lhan cig tu rnam par bshad de /
translated: The sequence of self and appropriation that was explained in terms of firewood and fire is also explained in terms of pots, cloth, and so on.

original: bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that all the sequences of refutations of self and appropriation and of pots, cloth, and so on are explained without exception.

original: de la bum pa dang snam bu la @234a * //
analyzed: de la bum pa dang snam bu la @234a * //
translated: In this context, ‚Äúpots, cloth, and so on‚Äù refers to

original: sogs pa dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dang / yan lag dang yan lag can du gyur pa dang / yon tan dang yon tan can du gyur pa dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa rnam pa de lnga bu dag tu shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la 'jig rten na smra ba sum brgya drug cu rtsa gsum yod pa dag las /
analyzed: sogs pa dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dang / yan lag dang yan lag can du gyur pa dang / yon tan dang yon tan can du gyur pa dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa rnam pa de lnga bu dag tu shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la 'jig rten na smra ba sum brgya drug cu rtsa gsum yod pa dag las /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù should be understood to refer to the five types of relationships: cause and effect, part and whole, quality and qualified, definition and definiendum, and so on.

original: kha cig ni de dag rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'o zhes smra /
analyzed: kha cig ni de dag rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'o zhes smra /
translated: Some say that things such as pots and cloth exist in the world as cause and effect.

original: kha cig ni yan lag dang yan lag can du gyur pa'o zhes smra /
analyzed: kha cig ni yan lag dang yan lag can du gyur pa'o zhes smra /
translated: Some say that they exist as part and whole.

original: kha cig ni yon tan dang yon tan can du gyur pa'o zhes smra /
analyzed: kha cig ni yon tan dang yon tan can du gyur pa'o zhes smra /
translated: Some say that they exist as quality and qualified.üîΩSome say that they exist as definition and definiendum.

original: kha cig ni mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa'o zhes smra zhing de dag la yang la la ni gcig pa nyid ces zer /
analyzed: kha cig ni mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa'o zhes smra zhing de dag la yang la la ni gcig pa nyid ces zer /
translated: Some say that they are identical.

original: la la ni gzhan nyid ces zer /
analyzed: la la ni gzhan nyid ces zer /
translated: Some say that they are different.

original: la la ni phan tshun ltos so zhes zer bas /
analyzed: la la ni phan tshun ltos so zhes zer bas /
translated: Some say: They are mutually dependent.

original: da 'di man chad me dang bud shing dag gis de dag dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad pa'i tshul bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: da 'di man chad me dang bud shing dag gis de dag dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad pa'i tshul bstan par bya'o //
translated: Now, from here on, the method of explanation of the entire process of refuting fire and fuel will be presented.

original: de la dang por me dang bud shing dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad pa'i tshul bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por me dang bud shing dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad pa'i tshul bstan par bya ste /
translated: First, the method of explaining the entire process of refuting cause and effect in terms of fire and fuel will be presented.

original: de la re zhig 'bras bu phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'bras bu phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: First, in order to demonstrate the refutation of sameness by positing the effect,

original: de la re zhig don dam par bum pa ni 'jim pa dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig don dam par bum pa ni 'jim pa dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: it is said: First, ultimately, a pot is not the same as clay,

original: las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir gcad pa dang gcod pa po bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir gcad pa dang gcod pa po bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is the object and agent, like that cut and the cutter.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na gcad pa dang / gcod pa po dag ni las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir don dam par gcig pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du bum pa dang 'jim pa dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na gcad pa dang / gcod pa po dag ni las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir don dam par gcig pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du bum pa dang 'jim pa dag kyang /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the proposition, the reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, the object cut and the cutter are not ultimately one, because they are the object and the agent.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i sgo nas las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir don dam par gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i sgo nas las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir don dam par gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the pot and clay are not ultimately one, because they are the effect and the cause.

original: da ni 'bras bu phyogs su byas nas gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'bras bu phyogs su byas nas gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the sequence of the refutation of difference in terms of the effect,

original: don dam par bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te //
analyzed: don dam par bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te //
translated: the text says: Ultimately, the pot is not different from the clay,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is dependent and because of the reasons such as being the effect. For example, like the self of the clay.

original: @234b de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: @234b de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, because of being the intrinsic nature of clay, being a product, being material, being obstructive, being derived from the elements, and being included in the form aggregate, and so on, ultimately it is not different from itself.

original: dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid mi ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang gzugs can yin pa'i phyir dang thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir don dam par rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du bum pa yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang gzugs can yin
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid mi ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang gzugs can yin pa'i phyir dang thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir don dam par rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du bum pa yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang gzugs can yin
translated: Likewise, because of being dependent, being material,

original: pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir don dam par 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir don dam par 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin no //
translated: because it is an effect, because it is obstructed, because it is derived from the elements, and because it is included in the form aggregate, etc.üîΩSimilarly, one should say with regard to the parts of the clay, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'jim pa'i phyogs la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni rgyu phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rnam pas sbyor ba'i tshig gnyis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jim pa'i phyogs la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni rgyu phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rnam pas sbyor ba'i tshig gnyis brjod par bya ste /
translated: By taking the cause as the topic, one should state two statements of application that negate identity and difference:

original: don dam par 'jim pa ni bum pa dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te byed pa po dang las yin pa'i phyir dper na gcod pa po dang gcad pa dag bzhin no //
analyzed: don dam par 'jim pa ni bum pa dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te byed pa po dang las yin pa'i phyir dper na gcod pa po dang gcad pa dag bzhin no //
translated: ultimately, clay is not identical to the pot, because it is the agent and the pot is the action, like, for example, the cutter and the cut.

original: don dam par 'jim pa ni bum pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par 'jim pa ni bum pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: ultimately, clay is not different from the pot,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'bras bu la sogs pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir dper na bum pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'bras bu la sogs pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir dper na bum pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are dependent‚Äù is the reason, and ‚Äúfor example, like the self of a pot‚Äù is the example.

original: de dag kyang dam bcas pa'i khyad par yod par zad kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang dam bcas pa'i khyad par yod par zad kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: These are just the particular theses; the remaining parts of the syllogism are the same as before.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rgyu phyogs su byas nas rgyu dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par rgyu 'jim pa ni 'bras bu bum pa skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rgyu phyogs su byas nas rgyu dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par rgyu 'jim pa ni 'bras bu bum pa skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that, having taken the cause as the subject, the process of refuting the cause is as follows: Ultimately, clay is not the cause that produces the effect, a pot,üîΩbecause it is dependent, for example, like anything else.üîΩHaving taken the effect as the subject, the process of refuting the effect is as follows: Ultimately, a pot is not the effect that is produced by the cause, clay,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu phyogs su byas nas 'bras bu dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par 'bras bu bum pa ni rgyu 'jim pas bskyed par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu phyogs su byas nas 'bras bu dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par 'bras bu bum pa ni rgyu 'jim pas bskyed par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: because it is dependent, for example, like anything else.

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par 'bras bu bum pa grub pa dang ma grub pa ni rgyu 'jim pa la ltos par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par 'bras bu bum pa grub pa dang ma grub pa ni rgyu 'jim pa la ltos par mi byed de /
translated: and from the effect-side, ‚ÄúUltimately, a vase that is either already established or not yet established does not rely on its cause, clay,

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu bzhin no zhes bya @235a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu bzhin no zhes bya @235a * //
translated: because it is the effect, like a cloth.‚Äù

original: ba dang / rgyu phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par rgyu 'jim pa ni 'bras bu bum pa grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ba dang / rgyu phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par rgyu 'jim pa ni 'bras bu bum pa grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: and from the cause-side, ‚ÄúUltimately, clay is not something that relies on a vase that is either already established or not yet established as its effect,üîΩbecause it is the cause, like the cause, the threads.‚Äù

original: rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun dag bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun dag bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
translated: Now, what is the meaning of that thesis?

original: ci rgyu 'jim pas 'bras bu gzhan skyed par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci rgyu 'jim pas 'bras bu gzhan skyed par byed pa yin nam /
translated: Does the cause, clay, generate another effect?

original: 'on te ci yang skyed par mi byed pa yin gal te gzhan skyed par byed pa yin na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do //
analyzed: 'on te ci yang skyed par mi byed pa yin gal te gzhan skyed par byed pa yin na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do //
translated: But if it does not generate anything, then the former position is undermined.

original: ci ste ci yang skyed par mi byed pa yin na ni dpe med do zhes rgol ba la /
analyzed: ci ste ci yang skyed par mi byed pa yin na ni dpe med do zhes rgol ba la /
translated: But if it does not generate anything, then there is no example.

original: de'i lan du de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan du de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In response to this objection, it should be said:

original: brtag pa snga ma ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa med la /
analyzed: brtag pa snga ma ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa med la /
translated: This is not correct, because the first hypothesis is not accepted, so the first position is not undermined.

original: brtag pa phyi ma la ni rgyu spun la sogs pa rgyu gang dag 'bras bu bum pa skyed par byed pa ma yin par grub pa dag dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin no zhes bya bas lan gdab pa dag bsdu bar
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma la ni rgyu spun la sogs pa rgyu gang dag 'bras bu bum pa skyed par byed pa ma yin par grub pa dag dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin no zhes bya bas lan gdab pa dag bsdu bar
