translated: And in the second hypothesis, since the cause, such as the threads, which are established as not generating the effect, the pot, are posited as the example itself, there is no lack of an example.

original: bya'o // grangs can dag ni sgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bya'o // grangs can dag ni sgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say: A pot is not different from clay because of the mode of proof.

original: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid dang yod pa nyid du rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid dang yul la sogs pa gcig pa nyid kyi phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes bya bas ni sngarüîΩdbu ma pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig nyid ma yin par bkag pa de la /
analyzed: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid dang yod pa nyid du rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid dang yul la sogs pa gcig pa nyid kyi phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes bya bas ni sngar dbu ma pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig nyid ma yin par bkag pa de la /
translated: The Samkhyas say that the effect is not different from the cause because they are the same nature, because they are existent, because they are cause and effect, because they are the same universal and particular, and because they are the same object, just as the nature of clay is in the vase.

original: 'dir grangs can dag dang dngos po thams cad rang bzhin gcig par sgrub pa'i tshul gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid ma yin zhing rang bzhin gcig pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gzhung ston te /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag dang dngos po thams cad rang bzhin gcig par sgrub pa'i tshul gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid ma yin zhing rang bzhin gcig pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gzhung ston te /
translated: This passage teaches the Samkhya scriptures that prove that the effect is not different from the cause and that they are the same nature, by way of proving that all things are the same nature.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are to be applied in order to the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason and the example.

original: dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jim pa'i rdzas spyi dang kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa khyad par dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jim pa'i rdzas spyi dang kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa khyad par dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: For example, the nature of clay is not different from itself because it is the nature of clay, because it exists, because it is cause and effect, because it possesses the attributes of the substance, color, shape, and so on of clay,

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du bum pa yang 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du bum pa yang 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: and because it is the same in terms of place, time, and nature. In the same way, a pot is not different from clay because it is the nature of clay, because it exists, because it is cause and effect,

original: 'jim pa'i rdzas spyi dang kha dog dang dbyibs la @235b sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi phyir 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i rdzas spyi dang kha dog dang dbyibs la @235b sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi phyir 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the substance of clay possesses the features of color, shape, and so on, and because it is of the same nature, place, and time, it is not different from clay.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /üîΩde dag gi 'jim pa'i bdag nyid dang bum pa'i bdag nyid rang gi bdag nyid gcig pa nyid du dbu ma smra ba rnams la ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis / de dag gi 'jim pa'i bdag nyid dang bum pa'i bdag nyid rang gi bdag nyid gcig pa nyid du dbu ma smra ba rnams la ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here says:üîΩSince the identity of clay and the identity of the pot are not established as the same for the Followers of the Middle Way, there is no example.

original: grangs can de dag gi 'jim pa'i bdag nyid rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan nyid ma yin par dbu ma pa la ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med la /
analyzed: grangs can de dag gi 'jim pa'i bdag nyid rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan nyid ma yin par dbu ma pa la ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med la /
translated: Since the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas‚Äô claim that the identity of clay is not different from the identity of the pot is not established for the Followers of the Middle Way, there is no example.

original: 'jim pa dang bum pa dag gnyi ga don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir chos can yang ma grub pas rgyu dang 'bras bu rang bzhin gcig par sgrub pa de ma grub bo //
analyzed: 'jim pa dang bum pa dag gnyi ga don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir chos can yang ma grub pas rgyu dang 'bras bu rang bzhin gcig par sgrub pa de ma grub bo //
translated: Because neither the clay nor the pot are ultimately established, the subject is not established. Therefore, the proof that cause and effect have the same nature is not established.

original: dam bcas pa'i don kyang rnam par brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar grangs can dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid du dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes brtag pa ston to //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don kyang rnam par brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar grangs can dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid du dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes brtag pa ston to //
translated: The meaning of the thesis should also be analyzed.üîΩIf cause and effect are one, the thesis is undermined.üîΩIf cause and effect are one, the thesis is undermined.üîΩIf cause and effect are one, the thesis is undermined.üîΩIf cause and effect are one, the thesis is undermined.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid ces bya ba dus gcig na'o zhe na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do zhes bya ba ni ci grangs can dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid du dam bcas pa de dus gcig na gcigüîΩpa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid ces bya ba dus gcig na'o zhe na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do zhes bya ba ni ci grangs can dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid du dam bcas pa de dus gcig na gcigüîΩpa nyid du 'dod de /

original: gal te gang kho na'i dus na rgyu yin pa de kho na'i dus na 'bras bu yang yin par dam 'cha' na ni des na phyogs snga ma la gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gang kho na'i dus na rgyu yin pa de kho na'i dus na 'bras bu yang yin par dam 'cha' na ni des na phyogs snga ma la gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that at whatever time it is a cause, at that time it is also an effect, then you contradict your own tenets.

original: 'di ltar khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha' las kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus tha dad pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha' las kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus tha dad pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in your tenets you assert that cause and effect are different.

original: ci ste rgyu'i gsal ba 'bras bu la yod do zhe na ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu'i gsal ba 'bras bu la yod do zhe na ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that the manifestation of the cause exists in the effect, then it is undermined by what is commonly accepted.üîΩBecause milk does not exist in curd.

original: zho la 'o ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci ste grangs can dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid du dam bcas pa de snying stobs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la 'dra bar khyab pas /
analyzed: zho la 'o ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci ste grangs can dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid du dam bcas pa de snying stobs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la 'dra bar khyab pas /
translated: If the SƒÅ·πÉkhya asserts that cause and effect are the same, then because the cause and effect are pervaded by similarity in terms of their nature of being sattva and so on,

original: rgyu'i bsal ba nyid 'bras bu la yang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu'i bsal ba nyid 'bras bu la yang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: the manifestation of the cause exists in the effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid du 'dod na ni des na grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur te //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid du 'dod na ni des na grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur te //
translated: If you assert that cause and effect are the same, then it is undermined by what is commonly accepted.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na zho la 'o ma med par grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na zho la 'o ma med par grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the world, milk is known to be absent in curd.

original: gal te zho'i gnas skabs na yang drug ldan la sogs pa'i khyad par dang bral ba'i sgra la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir grags pa'i gnod par yang mi 'gyur la khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag rgyu
analyzed: gal te zho'i gnas skabs na yang drug ldan la sogs pa'i khyad par dang bral ba'i sgra la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir grags pa'i gnod par yang mi 'gyur la khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag rgyu
translated: If you say that because sound and so on exist in the state of curd, free from the specific attributes of the six tastes and so on, then the fault of contradicting what is commonly acknowledged does not arise and the fault of contradicting your own beliefs does not arise,üîΩthe SƒÅ·πÉkhya respond:

original: @236a * // dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin gcig pa nyid yin yang /
analyzed: @236a * // dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin gcig pa nyid yin yang /
translated: Although cause and effect are the same nature,

original: grags pa'i gnod pa dang khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur bar sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ston te /
analyzed: grags pa'i gnod pa dang khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur bar sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ston te /
translated: we will demonstrate a reason that proves that the fault of contradicting what is commonly acknowledged and the fault of contradicting your own beliefs do not arise.

original: de dag na re rgyu'i rang bzhin 'bras bu la yang yod de /
analyzed: de dag na re rgyu'i rang bzhin 'bras bu la yang yod de /
translated: They say: The nature of the cause exists in the effect.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu zho'i gnas skabs na gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg de tsam dag gi spyi khyad par dang bral ba yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu zho'i gnas skabs na gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg de tsam dag gi spyi khyad par dang bral ba yod la /
translated: Thus, in the state of the effect, curd, the mere universals of form, smell, taste, and tactility, free from specific attributes, exist.

original: rgyu 'o ma la yang de dag yod par 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'o ma la yang de dag yod par 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the cause, milk, is similar to it in having those.

original: de yang ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: me'i sgra dang rnga'i sgra zhes bya ba ni sgra'i spyi yin la /
analyzed: me'i sgra dang rnga'i sgra zhes bya ba ni sgra'i spyi yin la /
translated: The terms sound of fire and sound of a drum are universals,üîΩbut the terms possessing the six modes of singing, ·πõ·π£i, dharana, madhyama, pa√±cama, sphu·π≠ƒÅ and paryƒÅpta are particulars.

original: sgra las glu dbyangs kyi sna grangs drug ldan dang / drang srong ba dang / sa 'dzin pa dang / bar ma pa dang / lnga ba dang / blo gsal dang / 'khor nyan zhes bya ba dag ni sgra'i khyad par yin pas 'bras bu zho'i gnas skabs na sgra'i spyi khyad par dang bral ba dang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa'i spyi khyad par dang bral ba'i sgra de tsam dang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang regüîΩde tsam dag yod la /
analyzed: sgra las glu dbyangs kyi sna grangs drug ldan dang / drang srong ba dang / sa 'dzin pa dang / bar ma pa dang / lnga ba dang / blo gsal dang / 'khor nyan zhes bya ba dag ni sgra'i khyad par yin pas 'bras bu zho'i gnas skabs na sgra'i spyi khyad par dang bral ba dang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa'i spyi khyad par dang bral ba'i sgra de tsam dang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg de tsam dag yod la /
translated: Therefore, when curd is the result, the universal sound is devoid of particulars, and sound is devoid of the universals of form, smell, taste and tactility, and those mere entities of form, smell, taste and tactility are present.

original: rgyu 'o ma la yang de dag yod par 'dra bas des na zho'i gnas skabs na yang 'o ma'i de tsam dag yod la /
analyzed: rgyu 'o ma la yang de dag yod par 'dra bas des na zho'i gnas skabs na yang 'o ma'i de tsam dag yod la /
translated: Because the cause, milk, is similar to it in having those, the mere entities of milk are present when curd is the result.

original: 'o ma'i gnas skabs na yang zho'i de tsam dag yod pas de'i phyir grags pa'i gnod par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o ma'i gnas skabs na yang zho'i de tsam dag yod pas de'i phyir grags pa'i gnod par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Since the state of milk also has the same amount of curd, therefore it is not undermined by what is commonly perceived.

original: gang gi phyir zho'i gnas skabs kho na na 'o ma'i bsal ba nyid med pa de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dus gcig na yod par mi smra bas khas blangs pa'i phyogs snga ma la gnod pa yang med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zho'i gnas skabs kho na na 'o ma'i bsal ba nyid med pa de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dus gcig na yod par mi smra bas khas blangs pa'i phyogs snga ma la gnod pa yang med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the state of curd alone does not have the state of milk, therefore we do not say that cause and effect exist at the same time. Thus there is no fault in our previously stated position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /üîΩde dag la 'o ma nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir de ni lan ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩsgra de tsam la sogs pa de dag la 'o ma nyid yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir de ni lan ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis / de dag la 'o ma nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir de ni lan ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te / sgra de tsam la sogs pa de dag la 'o ma nyid yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir de ni lan ma yin te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:üîΩSince milk itself is untenable, that is not a response.üîΩSince milk itself is untenable in those mere sounds and so on, that is not a response.

original: khyed kyi zho dang 'o ma dag gcig pa nyid du smras pas zho'i gnas skabs kyi de tsam de dag la 'o ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed kyi zho dang 'o ma dag gcig pa nyid du smras pas zho'i gnas skabs kyi de tsam de dag la 'o ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since you say that curd and milk are the same, milk does not exist in those mere sounds and so on that exist in the state of curd.

original: gal te zho la sgra de tsam la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir de la 'o ma yod pa nyid du 'dod na ni de lta na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag la yang sgra de tsam la sogs pa dag yod pas bum pa dang
analyzed: gal te zho la sgra de tsam la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir de la 'o ma yod pa nyid du 'dod na ni de lta na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag la yang sgra de tsam la sogs pa dag yod pas bum pa dang
translated: If you assert that milk exists in yogurt because sound, smoothness, and so on exist in yogurt, then sound, smoothness, and so on exist in pots, cloth, and so on.

original: snam bu la sogs pa dag kyang /
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa dag kyang /
translated: Therefore pots, cloth, and so on

original: 'o ma'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ba zhig na mi byed pas de'i phyir grags pa'i gnod pa dang khas blangs pa la gnod pa dag so na gnas so //
analyzed: 'o ma'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ba zhig na mi byed pas de'i phyir grags pa'i gnod pa dang khas blangs pa la gnod pa dag so na gnas so //
translated: would also perform the function of milk, but they do not. Therefore the fault of contradicting what is commonly accepted and the fault of contradicting your own assertions remain.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas @236b rgyu ma yin pa nyid la sogs pas de dag rgyu yin pa nyid la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas @236b rgyu ma yin pa nyid la sogs pas de dag rgyu yin pa nyid la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is inferred that they are not different, noncausality and so on are refuted, and causality and so on are established.

original: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pas de dag rgyu dang 'bras
analyzed: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pas de dag rgyu dang 'bras
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúThe thesis has the fault of stating the nature of the subject and the elimination of its distinction.‚ÄùüîΩThe SƒÅ·πÉkhyas infer that cause and effect are not different, and because they are not cause and effect, they eliminate that they are cause and effect.

original: bu yin pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir de dag ni dam bcas pa la chos can rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod par ston to //
analyzed: bu yin pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir de dag ni dam bcas pa la chos can rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod par ston to //
translated: Therefore, they demonstrate that the thesis has the fault of stating the nature of the subject, cause and effect, and the elimination of its distinction.

original: 'di skad bstan te gzhan nyid ma yin par rjes su dpog pas ci ltar zho nyid zho las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir zho nyid zho'i rgyu ma yin pas zho de rgyu yin pa nyid bsal ba de bzhin du 'o ma yang zho las gzhan ma yin pa'i
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te gzhan nyid ma yin par rjes su dpog pas ci ltar zho nyid zho las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir zho nyid zho'i rgyu ma yin pas zho de rgyu yin pa nyid bsal ba de bzhin du 'o ma yang zho las gzhan ma yin pa'i
translated: This is taught: ‚ÄúSince they infer that they are not different, just as curd is not the cause of curd because curd is not different from curd, in the same way, milk is not the cause of curd because milk is not different from curd.‚Äù

original: phyir 'o ma zhing kyang zho'i rgyu ma yin pas 'o ma de rgyu yin pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir grangs can dag gi gzhan nyid ma yin par dam bcas pa la chos can 'o ma'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do //üîΩde bzhin du chos can 'o ma'i khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yang yod de /
analyzed: phyir 'o ma zhing kyang zho'i rgyu ma yin pas 'o ma de rgyu yin pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir grangs can dag gi gzhan nyid ma yin par dam bcas pa la chos can 'o ma'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do // de bzhin du chos can 'o ma'i khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yang yod de /
translated: The error of the subject being refuted would also apply to the thesis that the two are not different if the particular of milk were refuted.üîΩIf the particular of milk were easy to digest, sweet, and so on, then, like the self of milk, it would not be different from curd, and thus it would not exist in milk.

original: 'o ma'i khyad par ni sla ba dang mngar ba la sogs pa dag yin na de dag kyang 'o ma zho'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du zhi las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'o ma la med pas de ltar 'o ma'i khyad par sla ba dang mngarüîΩba la sogs pa dag bsal ba'i phyir chos can 'o ma'i khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o ma'i khyad par ni sla ba dang mngar ba la sogs pa dag yin na de dag kyang 'o ma zho'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du zhi las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'o ma la med pas de ltar 'o ma'i khyad par sla ba dang mngar ba la sogs pa dag bsal ba'i phyir chos can 'o ma'i khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the error of the subject being refuted would apply to the thesis that the two are not different if the particular of milk, easy to digest, sweet, and so on, were refuted.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos can rgyu'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos can rgyu'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that the error of the subject being refuted would apply to the thesis that the two are not different if the nature of the cause and the particular of the subject were refuted.

original: chos can 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod pa yang bsdu ste /
analyzed: chos can 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod pa yang bsdu ste /
translated: The error of the subject being excluded by the nature of the effect and by the distinction is also included.

original: zho yang 'o ma'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du 'o ma las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zho yang 'o ma'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du 'o ma las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the curd is not different from the milk, just like the nature of the milk itself.

original: zho 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid kyis zho de 'bras bu yin pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos can zho'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do //üîΩde bzhin chos can zho'i khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yang yod de zho'i khyad par ni ska ba dang skyur ba la sogs pa dag yin na de dag kyang zho 'o ma'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du 'o ma las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zho la
analyzed: zho 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid kyis zho de 'bras bu yin pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos can zho'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do // de bzhin chos can zho'i khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yang yod de zho'i khyad par ni ska ba dang skyur ba la sogs pa dag yin na de dag kyang zho 'o ma'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du 'o ma las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zho la
translated: Since the curd is not an effect, the nature of the curd as the subject is excluded because the curd is an effect.üîΩSimilarly, there is the error of the distinction of the curd as the subject being excluded. If the distinction of the curd is such things as being thick and sour, then those are not different from the milk, just like the nature of the milk itself.

original: med pas de ltar zho'i khyad par ska ba dang skyur ba la sogs pa dag gsal ba'i phyir chos can zho'i khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: med pas de ltar zho'i khyad par ska ba dang skyur ba la sogs pa dag gsal ba'i phyir chos can zho'i khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod pa yang yin no //
translated: Since they do not exist in the curd, the distinction of the curd such as being thick and sour is excluded, and thus there is the error of the distinction of the curd as the subject being excluded.

original: da ltar dang 'das pa'i rgyu phyogs su byed na yang skyon snga ma @237a * //
analyzed: da ltar dang 'das pa'i rgyu phyogs su byed na yang skyon snga ma @237a * //
translated: If the present and past are taken to be the cause, the error would be the same as before.

original: bzhin no zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis sgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i phyogs sun dbyung ba ston te /
analyzed: bzhin no zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis sgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i phyogs sun dbyung ba ston te /
translated: This shows that the Enumerators‚Äô thesis, ‚ÄúThe pot is not different from the clay,‚Äù is refuted by the method of proof they themselves employ.

original: sngar grangs can dag gis 'bras bu bum pa phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: sngar grangs can dag gis 'bras bu bum pa phyogs su byas te /
translated: Previously, the Enumerators took the effect, the pot, as the subject.üîΩThey asserted, ‚ÄúThe clay is not different from the pot,‚Äù but that is not established.

original: bum pa las 'jim pa gzhan nyid ma yin par dam bcas pa ma grub pas da 'dir gal te rgyu 'jim pa phyogs su byed cing /
analyzed: bum pa las 'jim pa gzhan nyid ma yin par dam bcas pa ma grub pas da 'dir gal te rgyu 'jim pa phyogs su byed cing /
translated: Now, if they take the cause, the clay, as the subject,

original: 'jim pa las bum pa gzhan nyid ma yin par dam 'cha' ste /
analyzed: 'jim pa las bum pa gzhan nyid ma yin par dam 'cha' ste /
translated: they assert, ‚ÄúThe pot is not different from the clay.‚Äù

original: de la 'bras bu ma skyes pa'i tshe na rgyu ma 'das pa da ltar yod pa de phyogs su byed cing 'di skad ces rgyu 'jim pa da ltar yod pa ni 'bras bu bum pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu ma skyes pa'i tshe na rgyu ma 'das pa da ltar yod pa de phyogs su byed cing 'di skad ces rgyu 'jim pa da ltar yod pa ni 'bras bu bum pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: In that case, when the effect has not yet arisen, the cause, which has not yet ceased, exists in the present. Taking that as the subject, they say, ‚ÄúThe cause, the clay, which exists in the present, is not different from the effect, the pot.‚Äù

original: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes sgrub par byed na ni ci ltar sngar byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes sgrub par byed na ni ci ltar sngar byed pa po dang las brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su /
translated: If you prove that the effect is not different from the cause by saying, ‚ÄúBecause it has the nature of clay, like the nature of the pot,‚Äù then the previous error would ensue.üîΩIf you prove that the effect is not different from the cause by saying, ‚ÄúBecause it has the nature of the cause, like the nature of the effect,‚Äù then there is no example, because the effect is not established.üîΩIf you prove that the effect is not different from the cause by saying, ‚ÄúBecause it has the nature of the cause, like the nature of the effect,‚Äù then the previous error would ensue.üîΩIf you prove that the effect is not different from the cause by saying, ‚ÄúBecause it has the nature of the cause, like the nature of the effect,‚Äù then the previous error would ensue.üîΩIf you prove that the effect is not different from the cause by saying, ‚ÄúBecause it has the nature of the cause, like the nature of the effect,‚Äù then the previous error would ensue.

analyzed: 'di la 'bras bu skyes pas rgyu zhes tha snyad gdags pa yin la /

translated: When the effect has arisen, the cause has ceased. Therefore, if you take the position that the past cause is not different from the effect, the reason is faulty because its basis is not established.üîΩThe past cause is disintegrated and nonexistent. Therefore, the reason that you state, ‚ÄúBecause it has the nature of clay,‚Äù is not established.

translated: The example, ‚ÄúLike the nature of the effect,‚Äù is also faulty because it is not established.

original: rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa ma skyes ba dang zhig pa dag gis ma nges pa dang grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa ma skyes ba dang zhig pa dag gis ma nges pa dang grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The reason is indefinite because of the nonarisen and the disintegrated that are of a homogeneous type and a heterogeneous type. It is also damaged by what is commonly acknowledged.

original: sngar grangs can dag gis sgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar grangs can dag gis sgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas previously stated, ‚ÄúThe pot is not different from clay.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid dang grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur bar ston te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid dang grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur bar ston te /
translated: The response to that is that the reason is uncertain and it is undermined by what is commonly acknowledged.

original: rigs mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'jim pa dang bum pa lta bu rgyu dang 'bras bu rigs mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'jim pa dang bum pa lta bu rgyu dang 'bras bu rigs mthun pa'o //
translated: Homogeneous means that cause and effect are homogeneous, like clay and a pot.

original: rigs mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'jim pa dang snam bu lta bu rgyu dang 'bras bu rigs mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'jim pa dang snam bu lta bu rgyu dang 'bras bu rigs mi mthun pa'o //
translated: Heterogeneous means that cause and effect are heterogeneous, like clay and a cloth.

original: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis 'bras bu ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis 'bras bu ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Not arisen means that the effect has not arisen from the cause.

original: zhig pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gang gis rgyu zhig pa ste /
analyzed: zhig pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gang gis rgyu zhig pa ste /
translated: Destroyed means that the cause is destroyed by the effect.

original: de lta bu'i rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag gzhan nyid ma yin te rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i khyed grangs can dag sgrub par byed na khyed nyid kyi gzhung las rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag rgyu dang 'bras bu yin yang
analyzed: de lta bu'i rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag gzhan nyid ma yin te rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i khyed grangs can dag sgrub par byed na khyed nyid kyi gzhung las rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag rgyu dang 'bras bu yin yang
translated: If you SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that, then in your own scriptures you assert that prak·πõti and puru·π£a are causes and effects,

analyzed: gzhan nyid yin par 'dod pas des na ci re zhig bum pa dang 'jim pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du gzhan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: but they are different. Therefore what is the point? Either a vase and clay are not different because they are causes and effects, just like the nature of clay itself,

original: 'on te rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag bzhin du gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag bzhin du gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo //
translated: or they are different because they are causes and effects, just like prak·πõti and puru·π£a. Since it is uncertain, your reason, ‚Äúbecause they are causes and effects,‚Äù is illogical.

original: grangs can dag nyid kyi gzhung las rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag ci ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grangs can dag nyid kyi gzhung las rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag ci ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The Samkhyas say that the source for the fact that prakriti and purusha are cause and effect is taught in their scriptures.

original: skyes bu ni sgra la sogs pa dmigs par byed pa na phan gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / rang bzhin ni shes pa yod pa nyid nang gi byed par snang ba'i rgyu yin pas phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skyes bu ni sgra la sogs pa dmigs par byed pa na phan gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / rang bzhin ni shes pa yod pa nyid nang gi byed par snang ba'i rgyu yin pas phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: They say that when purusha observes sound and so on, it is the object to be benefited and prakriti is the benefit because it is the cause of the appearance of the internal agent.

original: grangs can dag nyid kyi gzhung las rang bzhin ni byed pa po yin la skyes bu ni zab po yin pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin ni rgyu yin /üîΩskyes @238a * //
analyzed: grangs can dag nyid kyi gzhung las rang bzhin ni byed pa po yin la skyes bu ni zab po yin pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin ni rgyu yin / skyes @238a * //
translated: In the Samkhya scriptures it says that prakriti is the agent and purusha is the experiencer.

original: bu ni 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: bu ni 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Prakriti is the cause and purusha is the effect.

original: long ba dang grum po bzhin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: long ba dang grum po bzhin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This is like a blind man and a cripple.

original: dper na long ba'i khur du grum po khyer na 'gro ba'i las ni long bas byed la mthong ba'i las ni grum pos byed pas bgrod pa dang mthong bar bya ba gnyi ga 'grub pa de bzhin du gang gi tshe skyes bu zhes bya ba shes pa yod
analyzed: dper na long ba'i khur du grum po khyer na 'gro ba'i las ni long bas byed la mthong ba'i las ni grum pos byed pas bgrod pa dang mthong bar bya ba gnyi ga 'grub pa de bzhin du gang gi tshe skyes bu zhes bya ba shes pa yod
translated: In the same way, when a so-called person who has consciousness

analyzed: pa de yul la longs spyod par 'dod pa'i tshe na /
translated: wishes to enjoy objects,

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba yon tan gsum cha mnyam pa des nang gi byed pa zhes bya ba blo rnams phyi rol gyi byed pa zhes bya ba dbang po rnams dang phrad par byed pa dbang po rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa de tsam lnga po dag dmigs
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba yon tan gsum cha mnyam pa des nang gi byed pa zhes bya ba blo rnams phyi rol gyi byed pa zhes bya ba dbang po rnams dang phrad par byed pa dbang po rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa de tsam lnga po dag dmigs
translated: that which is called ‚Äúnature‚Äù ‚Äî the three equal parts of the three qualities ‚Äî causes the so-called ‚Äúinternal activity‚Äù ‚Äî the mind ‚Äî to contact the so-called ‚Äúexternal activity‚Äù ‚Äî the sense faculties ‚Äî and the five objects such as form are observed by the sense faculties.

original: pa na skyes bu'i rang bzhin shes pa yod pa de nang gi byed pa dag gi rnam par skyes pas yul rnams nyams su myong bar byed pas skyes bu ni sgra la sogs pa de tsam lnga po dag dmigs par byed pa na rang bzhin gyis phan gdagsüîΩshing bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zab po yin pas 'bras bu ste grum po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: pa na skyes bu'i rang bzhin shes pa yod pa de nang gi byed pa dag gi rnam par skyes pas yul rnams nyams su myong bar byed pas skyes bu ni sgra la sogs pa de tsam lnga po dag dmigs par byed pa na rang bzhin gyis phan gdags shing bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zab po yin pas 'bras bu ste grum po dang 'dra'o //
translated: The person is the experiencer of objects because it is the nature of the person to know, and it arises in the aspect of internal activity.üîΩSince the person is the object of the five sense objects such as sound, it is the result, like a blind person, because it is naturally benefited and produced by them.

original: rang bzhin ni shes pa yod pa nyid nar gi byed pa'i rnam par snang ba skye ba'i rgyu yin pas phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir byed pa po yin pas rgyu de long ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni shes pa yod pa nyid nar gi byed pa'i rnam par snang ba skye ba'i rgyu yin pas phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir byed pa po yin pas rgyu de long ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: Since the person is the cause of the arising of the appearance of the aspect of activity of the existent consciousness, it is the agent, like a guide, because it benefits.

original: de ltar rang bzhin dang skyes bu rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par 'dod pas bum pa dang 'jim pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid ma yin par 'dod pa de'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin dang skyes bu rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par 'dod pas bum pa dang 'jim pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid ma yin par 'dod pa de'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, since the nature and the person are cause and effect, they are asserted to be different. Since a pot and clay are cause and effect, they are asserted to be different. Therefore your reason is not established.

original: gzhan yang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin la gzhan nyid ma yin par dam 'cha' ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa dang 'gal ba'i gnod par 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin la gzhan nyid ma yin par dam 'cha' ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa dang 'gal ba'i gnod par 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Moreover, it is not suitable to assert that cause and effect are different because that would contradict what is renowned in the world.

original: skyes bu dag spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag gis ma nges pa nyid de zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis sgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu dag spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag gis ma nges pa nyid de zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis sgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Since the person possesses universals and particulars, it is not definite that the person is the same as the aggregates. This is what the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say.

original: spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid yin par ston te /üîΩskyes bu zhes bya ba dag la yang spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig bum pa dang 'jim pa dang spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid yin par ston te / skyes bu zhes bya ba dag la yang spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig bum pa dang 'jim pa dang spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag
translated: The reason you gave, ‚Äúbecause it possesses generality and particularity,‚Äù is indeterminate.

original: nyid bzhin du @238b gzhan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: nyid bzhin du @238b gzhan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: Because it is seen that even things called ‚Äúpersons‚Äù are different because they possess generality and particularity, then what? Either because a pot and clay possess generality and particularity, like the intrinsic reality of clay, they are not different,

original: 'on te spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu dag bzhin du gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur ba ma nges so //
analyzed: 'on te spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu dag bzhin du gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur ba ma nges so //
translated: or because they possess generality and particularity, like persons, they are different. Your reason is indeterminate.

original: skyes bu dag spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin pa'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir skyes bu skyes bu zhes bya ba ni spyi yin la /üîΩlhas byin gyi bdag dang mchod sbyin gyi bdag ces bya ba dag ni khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skyes bu dag spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin pa'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir skyes bu skyes bu zhes bya ba ni spyi yin la / lhas byin gyi bdag dang mchod sbyin gyi bdag ces bya ba dag ni khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To demonstrate the source of that, he says, ‚ÄúPerson‚Äù is a universal.üîΩ‚ÄúLhejin‚Äôs self‚Äù and ‚ÄúYaj√±a‚Äôs self‚Äù are particulars, because Lhejin and Yaj√±a are seen to be different, since they possess a universal and a particular.

original: lhas byin dang mchod sbyin dag spyi dang khyad par ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par mthong bas bum pa dang 'jim pa dag gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: lhas byin dang mchod sbyin dag spyi dang khyad par ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par mthong bas bum pa dang 'jim pa dag gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, a pot and clay are not different, because they possess a universal and a particular.

original: spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the reason ‚Äúbecause they possess a universal and a particular‚Äù is indeterminate, it is not correct.

original: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar grangs can dag gis bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar grangs can dag gis bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause of having the nature of clay‚Äù is as follows.

original: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yin zhes brtag pa ston to //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yin zhes brtag pa ston to //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas previously said, ‚ÄúA pot is not different from clay because it has the nature of clay, just like the nature of clay itself.‚Äù This shows the analysis of what the meaning of that reason is.üîΩIf you imagine that it is ‚Äúarisen from clay,‚Äù then the example does not have the property to be proven.

original: 'jim pa las gyur pa yin par rtog na ni dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gal te 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid la mi bya'i 'jim pa las gyur pa
analyzed: 'jim pa las gyur pa yin par rtog na ni dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gal te 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid la mi bya'i 'jim pa las gyur pa
translated: If the meaning of that reason ‚Äúbecause it has the nature of clay‚Äù is not the entity of clay, but rather ‚Äúarisen from clay,‚Äù then the example does not have the property to be proven.

original: yin par rtog na ni de lta na dpe 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de 'jim pa las gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i chos de dang mi ldan pas dpe med de 'di ltar dpe 'jim pa'i rang gi

translated: If you think that it is, then in that case, the example ‚Äúthe nature of clay‚Äù is not established as the property of the subject because it is not clay.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba de ni 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba de ni 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
translated: The example ‚Äúthe nature of clay‚Äù is the intrinsic reality of clay.

original: 'jim pa las gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rtog na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gal te 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rtog na ni de lta
analyzed: 'jim pa las gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rtog na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gal te 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rtog na ni de lta
translated: It is not clay.üîΩIf you think that it is the intrinsic reality of clay, then the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: na gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: na gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: If you think that the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it is the nature of clay‚Äù is the intrinsic reality of clay, then in that case the meaning of that reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar bum pa la 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa la 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid med la /
translated: In this case, a vase does not have the intrinsic reality of clay.

original: 'jim pa las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jim pa las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not clay.

original: 'bras bu rgyu las gzhan nyid ma yin te //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu las gzhan nyid ma yin te //
translated: The effect is not different from the cause.

original: zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of that?

original: ci rang gi rgyu las sam 'on te gzhan gyi rgyu las zhes bya ba ni sngar grangs can @239a * //
analyzed: ci rang gi rgyu las sam 'on te gzhan gyi rgyu las zhes bya ba ni sngar grangs can @239a * //
translated: Is it from its own cause or from another‚Äôs cause?

original: dag gis bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: dag gis bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas previously stated, ‚ÄúA pot is not different from clay,

original: dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
translated: like, for example, the intrinsic nature of clay itself.‚Äù What is the meaning of that thesis?

original: ci 'bras bu bum pa rang gi rgyu 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin nam 'on te 'bras bu gzhan snam bu'i rgyu rgyu spun dag las gzhan nyid ma yin zhes gal gnyis su brtag pa ston to //
analyzed: ci 'bras bu bum pa rang gi rgyu 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin nam 'on te 'bras bu gzhan snam bu'i rgyu rgyu spun dag las gzhan nyid ma yin zhes gal gnyis su brtag pa ston to //
translated: Is it that the effect, the pot, is not different from its own cause, clay, or is it that the cause of another effect, a cloth, is not different from the causes of thread? Two alternatives are shown.

original: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the point?‚Äù is a question.

original: de'i lan du gal te rang gi rgyu las na ni dpe med do zhes bya ba ni gal te /
analyzed: de'i lan du gal te rang gi rgyu las na ni dpe med do zhes bya ba ni gal te /
translated: In response, ‚ÄúIf it is from its own cause, there is no example,‚Äù means if it is from its own cause, there is no example.

original: dam bcas pa de'i don bum pa 'jim pa nyid las gzhan nyid ma yin par sgrub pa yin na ni des na dpe 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de mi rung ste /
analyzed: dam bcas pa de'i don bum pa 'jim pa nyid las gzhan nyid ma yin par sgrub pa yin na ni des na dpe 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de mi rung ste /
translated: If the meaning of that thesis is to prove that the vase is not different from clay, then the example, ‚Äúlike the nature of clay itself,‚Äù is not suitable.

original: 'di ltar 'jim pa'i bdag nyid gang kho na yin pa de nyid du bum pa yin pas 'jim pa nyid phyogs su byas pas de la 'jim pa nyid dper mi rung ba'i phyir ro /üîΩci ste gzhan gyi rgyu las na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te dam bcas pa de'i don bum pa rgyu spun dag las gzhan nyid ma yin pa sgrub pa yin na ni des na rang
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jim pa'i bdag nyid gang kho na yin pa de nyid du bum pa yin pas 'jim pa nyid phyogs su byas pas de la 'jim pa nyid dper mi rung ba'i phyir ro / ci ste gzhan gyi rgyu las na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te dam bcas pa de'i don bum pa rgyu spun dag las gzhan nyid ma yin pa sgrub pa yin na ni des na rang
translated: This is because the vase is just the nature of clay itself, and since clay itself is the subject, it is not suitable as an example for that subject.üîΩIf the meaning of that thesis is to prove that the vase is not different from the cause of the cloth, then the former position is undermined and undermined by what is renowned in the world.

original: gis khas blangs pa'i phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang / 'jig rten la grags pa dang 'gal ba'i gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gis khas blangs pa'i phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang / 'jig rten la grags pa dang 'gal ba'i gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: If the meaning of that thesis is to prove that the vase is not different from the cause of the cloth, then the former position is undermined and undermined by what is renowned in the world.

original: 'di ltar khyod kyi grub ba'i mtha' las gzhan nyid med par dam bcas la da 'dir gzhan gyi rgyu zhes brjod pa'i phyir dang / bum pa rgyu spun dag las gzhan nyid yin par 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyi grub ba'i mtha' las gzhan nyid med par dam bcas la da 'dir gzhan gyi rgyu zhes brjod pa'i phyir dang / bum pa rgyu spun dag las gzhan nyid yin par 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As such, your tenet system is committed to the nondifference of the effect from the cause, but here you say that the cause is different from the effect, and the world also knows that the pot is different from the clay that is its cause.üîΩIf you say that that which is not different is not empty of the capacity for that, then there is no example.

original: gal te gzhan nyid ma yin pa ni de'i nus pas mi stong pa'o zhe na yang dpe med do zhes bya ba ni gal te dam bcas pa de'i don 'bras bu bum pa la rgyu 'jim pa'i nus pa yod pa nyid yin pa las bum pa dang 'jim
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyid ma yin pa ni de'i nus pas mi stong pa'o zhe na yang dpe med do zhes bya ba ni gal te dam bcas pa de'i don 'bras bu bum pa la rgyu 'jim pa'i nus pa yod pa nyid yin pa las bum pa dang 'jim
translated: If you say that the meaning of that assertion is that the effect, the pot, is not different from the clay that is its cause, because the pot exists due to the capacity of the clay,

original: pa las gzhan nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: pa las gzhan nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then there is no example.

original: de lta na yang dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de dper mi rung ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de dper mi rung ste /
translated: In that case, it is not suitable to say, ‚ÄúFor example, it is like the nature of clay.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu bum pa la rgyu 'jim pa'i nus pa yod pa ltar rgyu 'jim pa la yang 'jim pa nyid kyi nus pa yod do zhes byar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu bum pa la rgyu 'jim pa'i nus pa yod pa ltar rgyu 'jim pa la yang 'jim pa nyid kyi nus pa yod do zhes byar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable to say that just as the effect, the pot, exists due to the capacity of the clay that is its cause, so the cause, the clay, exists due to the capacity of the clay.

original: rgyu phyogs su bya ba'i dus la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gal te dam bcas pa de'i don rgyu 'jim pa la 'bras bu bum pa'i nus pa yod pa nyid yin pas bum pa 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin no zhe na /üîΩ@239b de lta na yang dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de dper mi rung ste /
analyzed: rgyu phyogs su bya ba'i dus la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gal te dam bcas pa de'i don rgyu 'jim pa la 'bras bu bum pa'i nus pa yod pa nyid yin pas bum pa 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin no zhe na / @239b de lta na yang dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de dper mi rung ste /
translated: If the meaning of that thesis is that the effect, the pot, is not different from the cause, clay, because the power of the pot exists in clay, then that is not a proper example.

original: 'di ltar rgyu 'jim pa la 'bras bu bum pa'i nus pa yod pa ltar rgyu 'jim pa la 'jim pa nyid kyi nus pa yod do zhes byar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu 'jim pa la 'bras bu bum pa'i nus pa yod pa ltar rgyu 'jim pa la 'jim pa nyid kyi nus pa yod do zhes byar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, it is not proper to say that the power of clay exists in clay, just as the power of the effect, the pot, exists in the cause, clay.

original: de ltar de dag gis ni me dang bud shing dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi gcig pa nyid dang gzhan pa nyid dang ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa 'gal ba'i lan dang bcas par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gis ni me dang bud shing dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi gcig pa nyid dang gzhan pa nyid dang ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa 'gal ba'i lan dang bcas par bstan to //
translated: Thus, they have presented the refutation of the identity and difference of cause and effect, and the refutation of their dependence, along with the response to the objection, in the case of fire and fuel.

original: ci ltar me dang bud shing dag gi skabs su /
analyzed: ci ltar me dang bud shing dag gi skabs su /
translated: As in the case of fire and fuel,

original: me ni gzhan las mi 'ong ste //
analyzed: me ni gzhan las mi 'ong ste //
translated: fire does not come from another.

original: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
translated: Fire does not exist in fuel.

original: song dang ma song ba gom pa yis //
analyzed: song dang ma song ba gom pa yis //
translated: The gone and not-gone are taught by means of a step.

original: de bzhin shing las lhag ma bstan //
analyzed: de bzhin shing las lhag ma bstan //
translated: So too, the remainder is taught by means of the tree.

original: shing nyid me ni ma yin te //
analyzed: shing nyid me ni ma yin te //
translated: The tree itself is not fire.

original: shing las gzhan la me yang med //
analyzed: shing las gzhan la me yang med //
translated: Fire does not exist apart from the tree.

original: me ni shing dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: me ni shing dang ldan pa yin //
translated: Fire is associated with the tree.

original: me la shing med der de med //
analyzed: me la shing med der de med //
translated: Fire does not exist in the tree, nor does it exist there.

original: ces bstan pa de dag thams cad 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu dgag pa'i skabs su yang ci rigs par sbyar te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bstan pa de dag thams cad 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu dgag pa'i skabs su yang ci rigs par sbyar te brjod par bya'o //
translated: All of these should be applied here in the context of the refutation of cause and effect, as appropriate.üîΩThis is just a brief indication

original: de dag ni phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni de ltar bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dag yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni de ltar bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dag yin la /
translated: This is just a brief indication: in this way, pots, cloth, and so on are cause and effect.

original: de dag kyang gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan pa nyid dang / ltos par mi 'thad par dgag pa'i rim pa med cing bstan pa de dag ni phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan pa nyid dang / ltos par mi 'thad par dgag pa'i rim pa med cing bstan pa de dag ni phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin no //
translated: They are refuted as being the same, different, and as not being tenable as a relation. The refutations that have been presented are just a brief indication.

original: phyogs des dgag pa'i rim pa gzhan gang dag ma lus par rnam par bshad pa shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs des dgag pa'i rim pa gzhan gang dag ma lus par rnam par bshad pa shes par bya zhe na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúBy this method, how should one understand the refutation of all other forms of cessation?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir phyogs 'dis gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi skad ma nyid la gnod pa'i phyir grangs can dag gi rjes su dpag pa smras pa rnams sun dbyung ba brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs 'dis gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi skad ma nyid la gnod pa'i phyir grangs can dag gi rjes su dpag pa smras pa rnams sun dbyung ba brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúBy this method, because the momentariness of all phenomena, both material and non-material, is undermined, the inferences of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas should be refuted.‚Äù

original: chos gzugs can ni yul dang dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: chos gzugs can ni yul dang dbang po rnams so //
translated: Material phenomena are the objects and faculties.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //üîΩde rnams kyi skad cig ma gang dag sangs rgyas pas khas blang ba dag la gnod pa bya ba'i phyir grangs can dag gi rjes su dpag pa de dag dang mthun pa gzhan gang dag smras pa de dag thams cad kyang phyogs 'dis 'dra bar dgag cing sun
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so // de rnams kyi skad cig ma gang dag sangs rgyas pas khas blang ba dag la gnod pa bya ba'i phyir grangs can dag gi rjes su dpag pa de dag dang mthun pa gzhan gang dag smras pa de dag thams cad kyang phyogs 'dis 'dra bar dgag cing sun
translated: Non-material phenomena are the mind and mental factors.

original: dbyung ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyung ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because the momentariness of those phenomena accepted by the Buddhists is undermined, the inferences of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas are stated. All of those should be refuted by this method, and their faults should be stated.

original: de ltar de dag ni me dang bud shing dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad pa'i tshul bstan pa yin no /üîΩ// / bam po bzhi bcu brgyad pa /üîΩda @240a * //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni me dang bud shing dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad pa'i tshul bstan pa yin no / // / bam po bzhi bcu brgyad pa / da @240a * //
translated: Thus, this is the method of explanation of the entire process of refuting the relationship of cause and effect in terms of fire and fuel.

original: ni me dang bud shing dag gis yan lag dang yan lag can du gyur pa dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad pa'i tshul bstan par bya ste /üîΩde la re zhig yan lag can phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan pa nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du don dam par yan lag can seng ldeng ni yan lag seng ldeng gi rtsa ba dang sdong po dang yal ga dang
analyzed: ni me dang bud shing dag gis yan lag dang yan lag can du gyur pa dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad pa'i tshul bstan par bya ste / de la re zhig yan lag can phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan pa nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du don dam par yan lag can seng ldeng ni yan lag seng ldeng gi rtsa ba dang sdong po dang yal ga dang
translated: Now, the method of explanation of the entire process of refuting the relationship of part and whole in terms of fire and fuel will be explained.üîΩTo begin, in order to demonstrate the process of refuting sameness and difference in terms of the whole, the root text says:

original: lo ma la sogs pa dag dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: lo ma la sogs pa dag dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, ultimately, the whole, the piece of wood, is not the same as the parts, the root, the trunk, the branches, the leaves, and so on, of the piece of wood.

original: de dag gi phyogs gcig chad kyang de mi chad pa'i phyir dper na rgya shug bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi phyogs gcig chad kyang de mi chad pa'i phyir dper na rgya shug bzhin no //
translated: Because even if one part of them is cut off, they are not cut off, like a fig tree.

original: don dam par yan lag can seng ldeng ni yan lag seng ldeng gi rtsa ba dang sdong po dang yal ga dang lo ma la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid ma yin te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na seng ldeng gi yan lag dag gis rang
analyzed: don dam par yan lag can seng ldeng ni yan lag seng ldeng gi rtsa ba dang sdong po dang yal ga dang lo ma la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid ma yin te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na seng ldeng gi yan lag dag gis rang
translated: Ultimately, a part-possessor, a piece of wood, is not different from its parts, the roots, the trunk, the branches, the leaves, etc., because it is related to them, like the parts of a piece of wood are related to themselves.

original: gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyor ba gnyis sgras te /
analyzed: gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyor ba gnyis sgras te /
translated: The two examples are expressed in the verse.

original: yan lag dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yan lag dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The parts are as before.

original: da ni yan lag phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde bzhin du don dam par seng ldeng gi yan lag dag ni yan lag can dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni yan lag phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir / de bzhin du don dam par seng ldeng gi yan lag dag ni yan lag can dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Now, in order to show the order of the refutation of sameness and difference, taking the parts as the subject,üîΩin the same way, ultimately, the parts of a piece of wood are not the same as the part-possessor,

original: de'i phyogs gcig chad kyang de dag mi chad pa'i phyir dper na rgya shug gi yan lag dag bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig chad kyang de dag mi chad pa'i phyir dper na rgya shug gi yan lag dag bzhin no //
translated: because even if one part of them is cut off, they are not cut off, like the parts of a fig tree.

original: don dam par seng ldeng gi yan lag dag ni yan lag can las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par seng ldeng gi yan lag dag ni yan lag can las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the parts of a k·π£atriya are not different from the possessor of parts because they are related, like the self of the possessor of parts, a k·π£atriya, for example.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na yan lag can seng ldeng gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba sbyor ba gnyis smras te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na yan lag can seng ldeng gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba sbyor ba gnyis smras te /
translated: Thus, he states two syllogisms.

original: yan lag dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yan lag dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The parts are as before.üîΩThe rest is as before.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya bas ni yan lag phyogs su byas nas yan lag dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par seng ldeng gi yan lag ni yan lag can seng ldeng rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya bas ni yan lag phyogs su byas nas yan lag dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par seng ldeng gi yan lag ni yan lag can seng ldeng rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: In the section on the parts, the order of the refutation of the parts is: Ultimately, the parts of a k·π£atriya do not create the possessor of parts, a k·π£atriya,üîΩbecause they are related, like something else.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yan lag can phyogs su byas nas yan lag dgag pa'i rim pa /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yan lag can phyogs su byas nas yan lag dgag pa'i rim pa /
translated: In the section on the possessor of parts, the order of the refutation of the parts is:

original: don dam par yan lag can seng ldeng ni seng ldeng gi yan lag gis brtsam par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par yan lag can seng ldeng ni seng ldeng gi yan lag gis brtsam par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the possessor of parts, a k·π£atriya, is not created by the parts of a k·π£atriya,üîΩbecause it is related to them, like something else.

original: yan lag can yin pa'i phyir dper na rgya shug bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yan lag can phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par yan lag can seng ldeng grub pa dang ma grub pa ni @240b seng ldeng gi yan lag la ltos par mi byed de /
analyzed: yan lag can yin pa'i phyir dper na rgya shug bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yan lag can phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par yan lag can seng ldeng grub pa dang ma grub pa ni @240b seng ldeng gi yan lag la ltos par mi byed de /
translated: The order of refuting reliance in terms of the whole is: Ultimately, the establishment or nonestablishment of the whole khadira is not to be relied on in terms of the parts of khadira.üîΩBecause it is the whole, like a cloth.

original: yan lag can yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yan lag phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par seng ldeng gi yan lag ni yan lag can seng ldeng grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yan lag phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par seng ldeng gi yan lag ni yan lag can seng ldeng grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The order of refuting reliance in terms of the parts is: Ultimately, the parts of khadira are not to be relied on in terms of the establishment or nonestablishment of the whole khadira.üîΩBecause they are parts, like the threads of a khadira cloth.

original: yan lag yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun dag bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / brgal ba dang lan la sogs pa lhag ma rnams brjod par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: yan lag yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun dag bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / brgal ba dang lan la sogs pa lhag ma rnams brjod par bya ba bstan to //
translated: The remaining replies and so on have been presented.

original: da ni me dang bud shing dag gi yon tan can dang yon tan can du gyur pa dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad pa'i tshul bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni me dang bud shing dag gi yon tan can dang yon tan can du gyur pa dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad pa'i tshul bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, all the stages of refuting the qualities and the possessor of qualities will be explained without omission.üîΩFirst, in order to demonstrate the stages of refuting sameness and difference when the possessor of qualities is taken as the subject, it is said:

original: de la re zhig yon tan can phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du don dam par snam bu ni rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig yon tan can phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du don dam par snam bu ni rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, ultimately, cloth is not the same as the forms that are the threads,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dad rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na sab ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dad rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na sab ma bzhin no //
translated: because it is dependent and because it is a substance, like a sieve.

original: don dam par snam bu ni rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par snam bu ni rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, cloth is not different from the forms that are the threads,üîΩbecause it is not tenable that a substance is different from its parts.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang de zhig na de dag kyang 'jig pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun dag gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin na zhes bya ba sbyor ba gnyis smras te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang de zhig na de dag kyang 'jig pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun dag gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin na zhes bya ba sbyor ba gnyis smras te /
translated: The two syllogisms are:

original: yan lag dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yan lag dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The parts are as before.üîΩNow, in order to teach the order of the refutation of sameness and difference in terms of the qualities, he says,

original: da ni yon tan phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du don dam par rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag ni snam bu dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni yon tan phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du don dam par rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag ni snam bu dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, ultimately, form that is the nature of the causal threads is not the same as the cloth,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang bzhin no /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang bzhin no /
translated: because it is related and because it is substantial, like a single stalk.

original: don dam par rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag ni snam bu las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag ni snam bu las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, form that is the nature of the causal threads is not different from the cloth,üîΩbecause it is related and because it is substantial, like a single stalk.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / de zhig na de dag kyang 'jig pa'i phyir dper na snam bu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba sbyor ba gnyis smras te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / de zhig na de dag kyang 'jig pa'i phyir dper na snam bu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba sbyor ba gnyis smras te /
translated: like the self of the cloth itself.

original: yan lag ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yan lag ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The parts are as before.üîΩThe rest is as before.üîΩWhen the qualities are taken as the subject, the order of the negation of the qualities is:

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni yon tan phyogs su byas nas yon tan dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par yon tan rgyu spun ni yon tan rgyu spun ni yon tan can snam bu rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni yon tan phyogs su byas nas yon tan dgag pa'i rim pa don dam par yon tan rgyu spun ni yon tan rgyu spun ni yon tan can snam bu rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: ultimately, the warp and weft, which are the causes of the qualities, do not create the cloth, which is the possessor of the qualities,üîΩbecause they are related to it, like anything else.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yon tan can phyogs su byas na yon tan can dgag pa'i @241a * //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yon tan can phyogs su byas na yon tan can dgag pa'i @241a * //
translated: When the possessor of the qualities is taken as the subject, the order of the negation of the possessor of the qualities is:

original: rim pa / don dam par yon tan can snam bu ni yon tan can rgyu spun gyis brtsam par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rim pa / don dam par yon tan can snam bu ni yon tan can rgyu spun gyis brtsam par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: ultimately, the cloth, which is the possessor of the qualities, is not created by the warp and weft, which are the possessors of the qualities,üîΩbecause it is related to them, like anything else.

original: yon tan can yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yon tan can phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa /
analyzed: yon tan can yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yon tan can phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa /
translated: and having made the possessor of the qualities the subject, the process of refuting dependence is as follows:

original: don dam par yon tan can snam bu grub pa dang ma grub pa ni yon tan rgyu spun la ltos par mi byed de /
analyzed: don dam par yon tan can snam bu grub pa dang ma grub pa ni yon tan rgyu spun la ltos par mi byed de /
translated: Ultimately, whether or not the cloth, the possessor of the qualities, is established does not depend on the yarn, the cause of the qualities,üîΩbecause it is the possessor of the qualities, like a sieve.

original: yon tan can yin pa'i phyir dper na sab ma bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yon tan phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa /
analyzed: yon tan can yin pa'i phyir dper na sab ma bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yon tan phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa /
translated: And having made the qualities the subject, the process of refuting dependence is as follows:

original: don dam par yon tan rgyu spun ni yon tan can snam bu grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par yon tan rgyu spun ni yon tan can snam bu grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the yarn, the cause of the qualities, is not something on which the cloth, the possessor of the qualities, whether or not it is established, depends,üîΩbecause it is a quality, like a single stalk.

original: yon tan yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / brgal ba dang lan la sogs pa lhag ma rnams brjod par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: yon tan yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / brgal ba dang lan la sogs pa lhag ma rnams brjod par bya ba bstan to //
translated: The remaining replies and so on have been presented.

original: da ni me dang bud shing dag gi mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni me dang bud shing dag gi mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the method of explaining all the stages of the refutation of the characteristics and the basis of characteristics of fire and fuel,

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe same should be said of characteristics and the basis of characteristics.‚Äù

original: 'dir mtshan nyid ni lkog shal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mtshan nyid ni lkog shal la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics are the dewlap, etc.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni ba lang la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni ba lang la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The basis of characteristics is the cow, etc.

original: de dag la yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa /
analyzed: de dag la yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa /
translated: With respect to them, the stage of the refutation of sameness and difference, taking the basis of characteristics as the subject,

original: don dam par mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang ni mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang ni mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: is as follows: Ultimately, the basis of characteristics, the cow, is not the same as the characteristics, the dewlap, etc.

original: ltog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na rta'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ltog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na rta'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //
translated: Because it has a belly, like the characteristics of a horse, for example.

original: don dam par mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang ni mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang ni mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, a basis possessing characteristics, such as a cow, is not different from its characteristics, such as a dewlap,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag dang / mtshan nyid phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag dang / mtshan nyid phyogs su byas nas gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rim pa /
translated: because it is dependent, like the nature of the characteristics themselves.

original: don dam par mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, characteristics, such as a dewlap, are not the same as a basis possessing characteristics, such as a cow,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang bzhin no //
translated: because they are dependent and because they are substantial, like a single blade of grass.

original: don dam par mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, characteristics, such as a dewlap, are not different from a basis possessing characteristics, such as a cow,üîΩbecause they are dependent and because they are substantial, like a single blade of grass.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / de zhig na de dag kyang 'jig pa'i phyir @241b dper na snam bu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag dang / mtshan nyid phyogs su byas nas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dgag pa'i rim pa /
