analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / de zhig na de dag kyang 'jig pa'i phyir @241b dper na snam bu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag dang / mtshan nyid phyogs su byas nas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dgag pa'i rim pa /
translated: Having taken the characteristics as the subject, the process of refuting the basis of those characteristics is as follows:

original: don dam par mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang mtshon par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang mtshon par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the characteristics such as a dewlap do not indicate the basis of those characteristics, a cow,üîΩbecause they are related, like anything else.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi phyogs su byas nas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dgag pa'i rim pa /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi phyogs su byas nas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dgag pa'i rim pa /
translated: Having taken the basis of those characteristics as the subject, the process of refuting the basis of those characteristics is as follows:

original: don dam par mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang ni mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag gis mtshon par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang ni mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag gis mtshon par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the basis of those characteristics, a cow, is not indicated by the characteristics such as a dewlap,üîΩbecause it is the basis of those characteristics, like a dewlap.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa /üîΩdon dam par mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang grub pa dang ma grub pa ni mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag la ltos par mi byed de /üîΩmtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na sab ma bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / mtshan nyid phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa / don dam par mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang grub pa dang ma grub pa ni mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag la ltos par mi byed de / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na sab ma bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / mtshan nyid phyogs su byas nas ltos pa dgag pa'i rim pa /
translated: and ‚ÄúThe basis of those characteristics does not rely on the characteristics because it is the basis of those characteristics, like a pot.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe basis of those characteristics does not rely on the characteristics such as a dewlap because it is the basis of those characteristics, like a sieve.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe characteristics such as a dewlap do not rely on the basis of those characteristics, whether it is established or not, because they are characteristics, like a single reed.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe basis of those characteristics does not rely on the characteristics, whether they are established or not, because it is the basis of those characteristics, like a pot.‚Äù

original: don dam par mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe characteristics such as a dewlap do not rely on the basis of those characteristics, whether it is established or not, because they are characteristics, like a single reed.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / brgal ba dang lan la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyang brjod par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / brgal ba dang lan la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyang brjod par bya ba bstan to //
translated: The remaining refutations and responses are also explained.

original: de ltar na me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dang lhan cig tu ma lus par rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi dgag pa'i rim pa thams cad bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dang lhan cig tu ma lus par rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the entire process of refuting self and appropriation by fire and fuel is explained without remainder together with the pot, cloth, and so on.

original: gal te gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pas ni gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa la gnod la /
analyzed: gal te gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pas ni gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa la gnod la /
translated: If the refutation of sameness is undermined by the inference of difference,

original: gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dgag pas kyang gcig pu nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa bsal ba'i phyir gang yang rung ba mi 'grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dgag pas kyang gcig pu nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa bsal ba'i phyir gang yang rung ba mi 'grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and if the inference of the refutation of difference is undermined by the inference of sameness, then neither is established.

original: pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa de gnyis kyis gcig gis gcig bsal bas gnyi ga mi 'grub bo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa de gnyis kyis gcig gis gcig bsal bas gnyi ga mi 'grub bo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the statement of the opponent who says that since these two inferences of the Madhyamika undermine each other, neither is established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: gnyi ga bkag pas 'dod pa 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩ'di ltar dbu ma pa ni phyogs de @242a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga bkag pas 'dod pa 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te / 'di ltar dbu ma pa ni phyogs de @242a * //
translated: Since both are refuted, our assertion is established.

original: dag gnyi ga dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag gnyi ga dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the Followers of the Middle Way wish to refute both of those positions.

original: da ni de ltar me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dang / bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po rnams rnam pa du mar gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pa na smra ba po rtog pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa mi mkhas pa bzhin du mkhas par rlom pa'i nga rgyal can gang dag
analyzed: da ni de ltar me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dang / bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po rnams rnam pa du mar gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pa na smra ba po rtog pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa mi mkhas pa bzhin du mkhas par rlom pa'i nga rgyal can gang dag
translated: Now, when it is not tenable for fire and fuel, or for the self and the appropriated, or for the vase and the cloth, and so on, to be the same or different in any of the above-mentioned ways, there are some who, like the unwise, are not of a speculative nature.üîΩThey are those who, out of a sense of pride, boast of being wise.

original: bdag kyang nye bar blang ba de dang bcas pa nyid na bdag yin no zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag kyang nye bar blang ba de dang bcas pa nyid na bdag yin no zhe'am /
translated: They say, ‚ÄúThe self is the appropriated, and the self is the appropriated alone.

original: nye bar blang ba de las tha dad pa nyid yin no zhe'am /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba de las tha dad pa nyid yin no zhe'am /
translated: The self is different from the appropriated.

original: dngos po rnams kyang gang gis dgag pa'i rgyu de dang bcas pa nyid yin no /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyang gang gis dgag pa'i rgyu de dang bcas pa nyid yin no /
translated: Things are the cause of their own cessation.‚Äù

original: dngos po yin no zhe'am de las tha dad pa nyid do zhes gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du ston pa de dag ni /
analyzed: dngos po yin no zhe'am de las tha dad pa nyid do zhes gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du ston pa de dag ni /
translated: The master does not think that those who teach that things are the same or different are experts in the meaning of the Sugata‚Äôs teaching.üîΩIn order to demonstrate this, the text says:

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i don la mkhas pa yin par slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas mi dgongs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na don dam par gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i don la mkhas pa yin par slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas mi dgongs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na don dam par gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid mi 'thad de /
translated: When analyzed in this way, ultimately, sameness and difference are untenable.

original: mi 'thad du zin kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis tha snyad kyi dbang gis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir de dag 'jig rten la grags pa dag gis bka' stsal pa la /
analyzed: mi 'thad du zin kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis tha snyad kyi dbang gis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir de dag 'jig rten la grags pa dag gis bka' stsal pa la /
translated: Even though they are untenable, the Transcendent Conqueror taught them in accordance with what is accepted in the world in order to help those who are to be tamed through conventional means to perfectly accomplish the accumulations of qualities such as discipline, concentration, and wisdom.

original: kha cig gis de dag ni don dam pa'o snyam du rig nas chos rnams de ltar spros pa med kyang spros par byed pa de ni rigs pa ma yin par slob dpon gyis dgongs pa na /
analyzed: kha cig gis de dag ni don dam pa'o snyam du rig nas chos rnams de ltar spros pa med kyang spros par byed pa de ni rigs pa ma yin par slob dpon gyis dgongs pa na /
translated: Some, thinking that those are ultimate, fabricate elaborations of phenomena even though they are not elaborated in that way. The Master, thinking that that is not reasonable, said:

original: gang dag bdag dang dngos po rnams //
analyzed: gang dag bdag dang dngos po rnams //
translated: Those who teach that the self and things

original: de bcas nyid dang tha dad par //üîΩston pa de dag bstan don la //
analyzed: de bcas nyid dang tha dad par // ston pa de dag bstan don la //
translated: are both the same and different,üîΩDo not think that they are wise

original: mkhas so snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: mkhas so snyam du mi sems so //
translated: in the meaning of the teaching.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus he said.

original: de'i phyir de ltar me dang bud shing dag gis dpyad na don dam par bdag dang nye bar blang ba dang / bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po rnams gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar me dang bud shing dag gis dpyad na don dam par bdag dang nye bar blang ba dang / bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po rnams gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, when fire and fuel are analyzed in that way, ultimately the self and the appropriated, and things such as pots and cloth, are not tenable as the same or different.

original: de ltar don dam par mi 'thad du zin kyang tha snyad kyi dbang gis dgos pa'i don gyi phyir 'jig rten la grags pa'i brjod pa dag gis bka' stsal to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar don dam par mi 'thad du zin kyang tha snyad kyi dbang gis dgos pa'i don gyi phyir 'jig rten la grags pa'i brjod pa dag gis bka' stsal to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Although that is not tenable ultimately, it should be applied that ‚Äúthe Teacher spoke of them with expressions renowned in the world for the sake of the purpose of conventional expressions.‚Äù

original: sus bka' stsal zhe na /
analyzed: sus bka' stsal zhe na /
translated: Who

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis te ston pa thugs rje can gyis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis te ston pa thugs rje can gyis so //
translated: taught it? The Lord, the compassionate Teacher.

original: gang gi dbang gis bka' stsal zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis bka' stsal zhe na /
translated: By whose power was it taught?

original: tha snyad kyi dbang gis te kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dbang gis te kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: By the power of convention, by the power of the system of the conventional truth.

original: @242b dgos pa'i don ci'i phyir bka' stsal zhe na /üîΩ'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: @242b dgos pa'i don ci'i phyir bka' stsal zhe na / 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: For what purpose was it taught?üîΩIn order to accomplish the mass of good qualities such as morality, concentration, and wisdom of those sentient beings to be trained.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brten nas lhag pa'i sems skye zhing lhag pa'i sems la brten nas lhag pa'i shes rab skye ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang rnam par dag pa'i lam rnams kyis bsdus pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brten nas lhag pa'i sems skye zhing lhag pa'i sems la brten nas lhag pa'i shes rab skye ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang rnam par dag pa'i lam rnams kyis bsdus pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the system that higher thought arises in dependence on higher morality, and higher wisdom arises in dependence on higher thought, and so on, all the masses of good qualities included in the path of accumulation, the path of preparation, and the path of purification are accomplished.

original: gang dag bka' stsal zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag bka' stsal zhe na /
translated: What did he say?

original: bdag dang nye bar blang ba dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po rnams gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid ces tha snyad gdags pa de dag go //
analyzed: bdag dang nye bar blang ba dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po rnams gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid ces tha snyad gdags pa de dag go //
translated: He said that things such as self and appropriation, pot and cloth, etc., are the same and different.

original: brjod pa gang dag gis bka' stsal zhe na /
analyzed: brjod pa gang dag gis bka' stsal zhe na /
translated: By what expressions did he say it?

original: 'jig rten la grags pa dag gis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa dag gis bka' stsal to //
translated: He said it by expressions that are accepted in the world.

original: de ltar bka' stsal pa la kha cig gis de dag ni don dam pa'o snyam du rig nas chos rnams de ltar don dam par gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i spros pa med kyang spros par byed pa de ni rigs pa ma
analyzed: de ltar bka' stsal pa la kha cig gis de dag ni don dam pa'o snyam du rig nas chos rnams de ltar don dam par gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i spros pa med kyang spros par byed pa de ni rigs pa ma
translated: Some people, thinking that those expressions refer to the ultimate, fabricate fabrications such as ‚Äúultimately, things are neither the same nor different,‚Äù etc., even though there are no such fabrications in the ultimate.üîΩThis is not reasonable.

original: yin par slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis dgongs pa na tshig le'ur byas pa 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yin par slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis dgongs pa na tshig le'ur byas pa 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is the thought of the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna, and it is to be applied to this verse.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni smra ba po rtog pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa mi mkhas bzhin du mkhas par rlom pa'i nga rgyal can gang dag / bdag dang nye bar blang ba de dang bcas pa nyid na bdag yin gyi 'ba' zhig
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni smra ba po rtog pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa mi mkhas bzhin du mkhas par rlom pa'i nga rgyal can gang dag / bdag dang nye bar blang ba de dang bcas pa nyid na bdag yin gyi 'ba' zhig
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows: Those who speak without being of the nature of thought, who are ignorant yet arrogant, who are conceited, who teach that the self and the appropriated are the same, saying, ‚ÄúWhen the self exists, the appropriated exist, but not the other way around,‚Äù

original: ni ma yin no zhes bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gcig pa nyid du ston par byed pa dang bdag las nye bar blang ba tha dad do zhes bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gzhan nyid du ston par byed pa dang / me dang bud shing dang /
analyzed: ni ma yin no zhes bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gcig pa nyid du ston par byed pa dang bdag las nye bar blang ba tha dad do zhes bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gzhan nyid du ston par byed pa dang / me dang bud shing dang /
translated: and who teach that the self and the appropriated are different, saying, ‚ÄúThe appropriated are different from the self,‚Äù and who teach that fire and fuel are the same and different,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / yan lag dang yan lag can dang / yon tan dang yon tan can dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po rnams kyang bud shing gang gis mer gdags pa'i bud shing de dang bcas pa nyid na me yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid du ston par byed pa
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / yan lag dang yan lag can dang / yon tan dang yon tan can dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po rnams kyang bud shing gang gis mer gdags pa'i bud shing de dang bcas pa nyid na me yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid du ston par byed pa
translated: This shows that fire and fuel are the same.

original: dang / me las bud shing dag tha dad do zhes me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du ston par byed pa dang / rgyu gang gis 'bras bur gdags pa'i rgyu de dang @243a * //
analyzed: dang / me las bud shing dag tha dad do zhes me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du ston par byed pa dang / rgyu gang gis 'bras bur gdags pa'i rgyu de dang @243a * //
translated: And it shows that fuel is different from fire, showing that fire and fuel are different.üîΩIt shows that cause and effect are the same, saying that an effect is not just an effect alone, but is an effect only when it possesses the cause by which the effect is imputed.

original: bcas pa nyid na 'bras bu yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig pa nyid du ston par byed pa dang / 'bras bu las rgyu tha dad do zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid du ston par byed pa dang /
analyzed: bcas pa nyid na 'bras bu yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig pa nyid du ston par byed pa dang / 'bras bu las rgyu tha dad do zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid du ston par byed pa dang /
translated: It shows that cause and effect are different, saying that the cause is different from the effect.

original: yan lag gang gis yan lag can du gdags pa'i yan lag de dang bcas pa nyid na yan lag can yin gyi /
analyzed: yan lag gang gis yan lag can du gdags pa'i yan lag de dang bcas pa nyid na yan lag can yin gyi /
translated: The part that is designated as the whole is the whole when it possesses the parts.

original: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes yan lag dang yan lag can dag gcig pa nyid du ston par byed pa dang / yan lag can las yan lag tha dad do zhes yan lag dang yan lag can dag gzhan nyid du ston par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes yan lag dang yan lag can dag gcig pa nyid du ston par byed pa dang / yan lag can las yan lag tha dad do zhes yan lag dang yan lag can dag gzhan nyid du ston par byed pa dang /
translated: It is not the case that the whole is a mere single unit, and it is not the case that the whole is different from the parts.

original: yon tan gang gis yon tan can du gdags pa'i yon tan de dang bcas pa nyid ni yon tan can yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes yon tan dang yon tan can dag gcig pa nyid gdon par byed pa dang / yon tan can las yon tan tha dad do zhes yon tan dang yon tan can gzhan nyid du ston par byed pa dang /
analyzed: yon tan gang gis yon tan can du gdags pa'i yon tan de dang bcas pa nyid ni yon tan can yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes yon tan dang yon tan can dag gcig pa nyid gdon par byed pa dang / yon tan can las yon tan tha dad do zhes yon tan dang yon tan can gzhan nyid du ston par byed pa dang /
translated: The quality that is designated as the possessor of the quality is the possessor of the quality when it possesses the quality. It is not the case that the possessor of the quality is a mere single unit, and it is not the case that the possessor of the quality is different from the quality.

original: mtshan nyid gang gis mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gdags pa'i mtshan nyid de dang bcas pa nyid ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang gis mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gdags pa'i mtshan nyid de dang bcas pa nyid ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin gyi /
translated: The characteristic that is imputed as the basis of the characteristic is the basis of the characteristic.üîΩIt is not the case that the basis of the characteristic is not the basis of the characteristic.

original: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag gcig pa nyid du ston par byed pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi las mtshan nyid tha dad do zhes mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag gzhan nyid du ston par byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag gcig pa nyid du ston par byed pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi las mtshan nyid tha dad do zhes mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag gzhan nyid du ston par byed pa de dag ni /
translated: Thus, the statement that the basis of the characteristic and the characteristic are the same is a demonstration that the basis of the characteristic and the characteristic are the same, and the statement that the characteristic is different from the basis of the characteristic is a demonstration that the basis of the characteristic and the characteristic are different.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i don la mkhas pa yin par kho bo mi sems so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i don la mkhas pa yin par kho bo mi sems so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: We do not think that those who make these statements are experts in the meaning of the Sugata‚Äôs teaching.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i chos gzhan dag khas len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i chos gzhan dag khas len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: They accept other phenomena that contradict valid knowledge.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i don ni gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du rnam par rtog pa mang po'i ling tog dang bral ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa dmigs su med pa yin na rang dang gzhan gyi sde pa gang
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i don ni gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du rnam par rtog pa mang po'i ling tog dang bral ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa dmigs su med pa yin na rang dang gzhan gyi sde pa gang
translated: The meaning of the Sugata‚Äôs teaching is free from the cataracts of the many misconceptions of sameness and difference, it is unobservable, and it possesses the attributes of nonarising and so on.üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna himself thought that those of our own and other schools who assert that the Followers of the Middle Way are not free from the cataracts of the many misconceptions of sameness and difference, and who assert that the Followers of the Middle Way have a logic that proves sameness and difference, are not wise.

original: dag dbu ma pas gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid ma yin par 'thad pas sgrub pa'i tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i chos gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid ces bya ba dag khas len pa'i phyir de dag shes rab dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya bar slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis dgongs so
analyzed: dag dbu ma pas gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid ma yin par 'thad pas sgrub pa'i tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i chos gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid ces bya ba dag khas len pa'i phyir de dag shes rab dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya bar slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis dgongs so
translated: They are not wise because they assert that the Followers of the Middle Way have a logic that proves sameness and difference, which is a contradiction of the valid cognition that proves sameness and difference.

original: // de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed @243b pa'i dang por smras pa'i sgrub pa dang / dpe med par bstan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don gcig pa ma yin pa dang don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: // de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed @243b pa'i dang por smras pa'i sgrub pa dang / dpe med par bstan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don gcig pa ma yin pa dang don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The result of valid cognition is the conclusion: ‚ÄúThus it is demonstrated that dependent origination possesses the feature of neither being the same nor being different.‚ÄùüîΩHere, in the context of the tenth chapter, ‚ÄúExamination of Fire and Fuel,‚Äù the meaning of the chapter should be viewed as the result of valid cognition.

original: me dang bud shing brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur blta ba ni pha rol pos sngar phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag don dam par yod par bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma don dam par
analyzed: me dang bud shing brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur blta ba ni pha rol pos sngar phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag don dam par yod par bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma don dam par
translated: The opponent‚Äôs earlier position that the aggregates, elements, and faculties ultimately exist is refuted by the following argument:

original: phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The aggregates and so on do exist.

original: phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me dang bud shing bzhin no zhes smras pa'i sgrub pa dang / dpe med par bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don gcig pa ma yin pa dang don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me dang bud shing bzhin no zhes smras pa'i sgrub pa dang / dpe med par bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don gcig pa ma yin pa dang don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that dependent origination as it is taught in the Perfection of Wisdom is not the same as and different from the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩWhat are the benefits of teaching dependent origination?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so /üîΩzhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so / zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: To dispel the claim that this teaching is a mere dry treatise of speculation,

original: 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: it is established by means of a scriptural source that inspires confidence.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Brahma‚Äôs Net Sutra says:

original: lus las gzhan pa'i chos mi mthong la chos las gzhan pa'i lus mi mthong ste /
analyzed: lus las gzhan pa'i chos mi mthong la chos las gzhan pa'i lus mi mthong ste /
translated: The body is not seen as a phenomenon other than itself, nor is a phenomenon seen as a body other than itself.

original: ci ltar gnyis ma yin pa dang gnyis ma yin pa ma yin pa de ltar mthong ngo //
analyzed: ci ltar gnyis ma yin pa dang gnyis ma yin pa ma yin pa de ltar mthong ngo //
translated: As it is neither two nor not two, so it is seen.üîΩAnd as it is seen thus, it is said that ‚Äúeven the seeing of direct perception is not seen.‚Äù

original: de ltar mthong bas mngon sum nyid du mthong ba yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs ba de dag grub pa ni 'di'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mthong bas mngon sum nyid du mthong ba yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs ba de dag grub pa ni 'di'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
translated: The fact that this is so is the quality and the source of this [seeing].

original: gnyis ma yin par mthong ba ni gzhan nyid ma yin no /
analyzed: gnyis ma yin par mthong ba ni gzhan nyid ma yin no /
translated: Seeing it as not two is not seeing it as other.

original: gnyis ma yin pa ma yin par mthong ba ni gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ma yin pa ma yin par mthong ba ni gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: Seeing it as not not two is not seeing it as the same.

original: de skad bka' stsal pa na /
analyzed: de skad bka' stsal pa na /
translated: When this was said,

original: tshangs pas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ltar mthong bas ci zhig mngon sum nyid du mthong zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshangs pas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ltar mthong bas ci zhig mngon sum nyid du mthong zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Brahma asked the Lord, ‚ÄúWhen the bodhisattva sees in this way, what is it that he sees directly?‚ÄùüîΩThe Lord replied, ‚ÄúWhen he sees in this way, he does not see even the seeing of direct perception.‚Äù

original: de ltar mthong bas mngon sum nyid du mthong ba yang mi mthong de zhes gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mthong bas mngon sum nyid du mthong ba yang mi mthong de zhes gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: This is the proof.

original: de dag la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha @244a * //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha @244a * //
translated: and so on, in limitless Mahayana sutras, that dependent origination is not a single meaning nor is it a different meaning.

original: dad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the proof of that.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin te de'i phyir kho bo rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skom po tsam gyis bsgrubs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin te de'i phyir kho bo rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skom po tsam gyis bsgrubs pa ma yin te /
translated: Since these scriptures that inspire confidence are the qualities and source of the teaching of dependent origination, I have not established it merely through my own dry logic.

original: lung de dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: lung de dag kyang yod do //
translated: These scriptures exist.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhyen rlabs dang mkhas pa nyid yin no //üîΩslob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhyen rlabs dang mkhas pa nyid yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: Because the treatises explain the teachings of the limitless MahƒÅyƒÅna s≈´tras that have the feature of not being the same in meaning and not being different in meaning, the master‚Äôs own statement that the treatises are the object to be explained is a sign of his great knowledge and skill in composing the commentary.üîΩThis completes the commentary on the tenth chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Examination of Fire and Fuel,‚Äù in the Root Verses of the Middle Way called Wisdom, composed by the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna.

original: me dang bud shing brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: me dang bud shing brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the commentary on the tenth chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Examination of Fire and Fuel,‚Äù in the Root Verses of the Middle Way called Wisdom, composed by the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna.

original: // / da ni dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas 'khor ba nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / da ni dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas 'khor ba nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the non-existence of cyclic existence itself by way of the meaning of the power of the refutation of the distinctions of the discordant class of the unreality of things, the eleventh chapter is begun.

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du lta ste tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du lta ste tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúpower‚Äù in this context should be viewed as having the meaning of the cause of engagement in the thesis and the meaning of the connection with the text that will follow. The meaning of the words is as before.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas da ni dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas da ni dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: With respect to that, in terms of the meaning of the cause of engagement in the thesis, it is said, ‚ÄúNow, in order to demonstrate the non-existence of cyclic existence itself by way of the meaning of the power of the refutation of the distinctions of the discordant class of the unreality of things.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad bya ba med par dam bcas pa mdzad pas 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ci ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad bya ba med par dam bcas pa mdzad pas 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ci ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas
translated: Here, the treatise master, in terms of the meaning of the cause of engaging in that assertion,

original: nas de skad smras te /
analyzed: nas de skad smras te /
translated: says this.

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
translated: The nonexistence of the entityness of things is his own position.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs yin te /üîΩ'di lta ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid @244b du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs yin te / 'di lta ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid @244b du smra ba yin no //
translated: The position of the opponent is the position that is incompatible with that.üîΩThat is to say, the opponent asserts that the aggregates, elements, and bases exist by way of their own entity.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'og nas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'og nas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs prior position that proves that the aggregates, elements, and bases exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa phung po la sogs pa yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs 'khor ba ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa phung po la sogs pa yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs 'khor ba ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra
translated: The BhagavƒÅn taught names and specific instances and taught the instructions for their exhaustion.

original: ba dag yin no //
analyzed: ba dag yin no //
translated: The reasonings that prove the existence of the aggregates and so on are those of the proponents of cyclic existence who assert that it inherently exists.

original: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúrefuting them‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúin order to compose the eleventh chapter from the perspective of the meaning of refuting them.‚Äù

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the meaning of the passage that will be cited below,

original: 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe eleventh chapter is composed from the perspective of the meaning of teaching that cyclic existence is essenceless.‚Äù

original: 'khor ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni 'khor ba dang 'khor ba po dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
analyzed: 'khor ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni 'khor ba dang 'khor ba po dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
translated: The meaning of the following text of the eleventh chapter, the Examination of Cyclic Existence, is that cyclic existence and the transmigrator are shown to be essenceless. Therefore, it is in terms of this that it says this.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
translated: What is the result of this chapter? By what process is that result attained?

original: 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /üîΩdngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas /
analyzed: 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la / dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas /
translated: The result of this chapter is the demonstration that cyclic existence is essenceless.

original: rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang / thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang / thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
translated: That result is attained by way of the process of refuting the specific attributes that are discordant with the essencelessness of things. Therefore, the author of the commentary first presents the method and the result that arises from the method in this context of the transition to the chapter.

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: To demonstrate that, the text says ‚ÄúHere someone might say,‚Äù and so on.

original: rang gi sde ba dag don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rang gi sde ba dag don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Our own schools say, ‚ÄúAggregates and so on exist ultimately,üîΩbecause they are mutually dependent, like fire and fuel.‚Äù

original: phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me dang bud shing bzhin no zhes zer ba'i sgrub pa dang dpe sun dbyung ba'i zhar la me dang bud shing brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su /üîΩme dang shing gis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me dang bud shing bzhin no zhes zer ba'i sgrub pa dang dpe sun dbyung ba'i zhar la me dang bud shing brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su / me dang shing gis bdag dang ni //
translated: In the context of the chapter on the analysis of fire and fuel, Candrakƒ´rti refutes the argument and example.üîΩThe text says:üîΩFire and fuel explain

original: nye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //
translated: all the stages of self andüîΩappropriation,

original: bum snam la sogs lhan cig tu //üîΩma lus par ni rnam par bshad //üîΩces @245a * //
analyzed: bum snam la sogs lhan cig tu //üîΩma lus par ni rnam par bshad //üîΩces @245a * //
translated: like a pot, a cloth, and so on.

original: smras pas / phung po la sogs pa dngos po thams cad bkag tu zin kyang de dag la mngon par zhen pa rang gi sde pa dag gis de mi bzod pas yang de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: smras pas / phung po la sogs pa dngos po thams cad bkag tu zin kyang de dag la mngon par zhen pa rang gi sde pa dag gis de mi bzod pas yang de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since the aggregates and so on, all things, have already been refuted, those who cling to them, members of our own Buddhist factions, cannot tolerate that refutation.

original: de'i phyir don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, they say, ‚ÄúAlthough you have refuted the aggregates and so on, ultimately the aggregates and so on do exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Because the BhagavƒÅn taught names and specific instances and taught instructions for their elimination.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They say that the aggregates and so on are the subject, the probandum is the property of the subject, the proof is the property of the probandum, and the example is the property of the proof.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni ming dang khyad par bstan pa dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man nga bstan par yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni ming dang khyad par bstan pa dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man nga bstan par yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that names and specific instances are taught and instructions for their elimination are taught in regard to that which does not exist.

original: dper na mgo gnyis pa'i mig gi nad med par bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: dper na mgo gnyis pa'i mig gi nad med par bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
translated: This is an example of a dissimilar class.üîΩThe instruction is taught in order to eliminate those names and distinctions.

original: de dag la ni ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dge slong dag 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med de /üîΩdam chos rnam par mi shes pa'i //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med de / dam chos rnam par mi shes pa'i //
translated: Monks, samsara is without beginning or end.üîΩFor the childish who do not know the true Dharma,

original: byis pa la ni 'khor ba ring //
analyzed: byis pa la ni 'khor ba ring //
translated: samsara is long.üîΩAnd likewise, monks, therefore you should train in this way: You should make effort to eliminate samsara.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong dag de lta bas na khyed kyis 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir nan tan bya'o zhes de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de dag yod pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong dag de lta bas na khyed kyis 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir nan tan bya'o zhes de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de dag yod pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin te /
translated: This is the application of the analogy, which exists.

original: 'khor ba zhes bya bas ni phung po la sogs pa de dag gi ming bstan te /
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya bas ni phung po la sogs pa de dag gi ming bstan te /
translated: By samsara, the names of those aggregates and so on are taught.

original: 'khor ba ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid dang / 'gro ba lnga'i bdag nyid las dang nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid dang / 'gro ba lnga'i bdag nyid las dang nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Samsara is the nature of the five aggregates, and the nature of the five destinies, together with karma and the afflictions.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med de /üîΩdam chos rnam par mi shes pa'i //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med de / dam chos rnam par mi shes pa'i //
translated: It is without beginning or end.üîΩFor the childish who do not know the holy Dharma,

original: byis pa la ni 'khor ba ring //
analyzed: byis pa la ni 'khor ba ring //
translated: samsara is long.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyad par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyad par bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching of the distinction.

original: 'khor ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi ma thong ba'i chos 'phags pa'i lam rnam par mi shes pa'i byis pa rnams la 'khor ba ring ba'i khyad par dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi ma thong ba'i chos 'phags pa'i lam rnam par mi shes pa'i byis pa rnams la 'khor ba ring ba'i khyad par dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Samsara is distinguished as being without beginning or end, and for the childish who do not know the holy Dharma, the Dharma of the noble path of the holy beings, samsara is distinguished as being long.

original: de ltar ming dang khyad par bstan nas dge slong dag de lta bas na khyed kyis 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir nan tan bya'o zhes de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa @245b yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ming dang khyad par bstan nas dge slong dag de lta bas na khyed kyis 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir nan tan bya'o zhes de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa @245b yin te /
translated: Thus, having taught the names and their distinctions, the Buddha said, ‚ÄúMonks, you should train by thinking, ‚ÄòTherefore, I will make an effort to eliminate samsara.‚Äô ‚Äù This is the instruction to make an effort to eliminate samsara.

original: 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir tshogs kyi lam la nan tan bya zhing /
analyzed: 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir tshogs kyi lam la nan tan bya zhing /
translated: You should make an effort on the path of accumulation in order to eliminate samsara.

original: sbyor ba'i lam dang rnam par dag pa'i lam rnams la bslab par bya'o zhes gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam dang rnam par dag pa'i lam rnams la bslab par bya'o zhes gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: You should train on the path of preparation and the pure paths.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smos pa'i mthus phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smos pa'i mthus phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, because of the reason stated, the aggregates and so on definitely exist. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: 'di na bcom ldan 'das kyis mgo gnyis pa'i mig la sogs pa med pa gang dag gi ming dang / khyad par dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag ma bstan pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na bcom ldan 'das kyis mgo gnyis pa'i mig la sogs pa med pa gang dag gi ming dang / khyad par dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag ma bstan pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here the BhagavƒÅn did not teach the name, characteristics, and instructions for their elimination of those non-existent things such as the eyes of a second head.

original: phung po la sogs pa gang dag gi ming dang khyad par dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa gang dag gi ming dang khyad par dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Those aggregates and so on, whose names, characteristics, and instructions for their elimination were taught, exist ultimately.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: 'jig rten gyi mgon pos skye ba'i rgyun las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu skye ba'i gnyen po ma skyes pa rgyun ma chad pa la gzigs nas byis pa rnams kyi 'khor ba'i ring ngo zhes gsungs shing /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mgon pos skye ba'i rgyun las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu skye ba'i gnyen po ma skyes pa rgyun ma chad pa la gzigs nas byis pa rnams kyi 'khor ba'i ring ngo zhes gsungs shing /
translated: The Lord of the World, seeing the uninterrupted arising of illusion-like and mirage-like cyclic existence produced by karma and afflictions, and the uninterrupted arising of the antidote to that, said that the duration of cyclic existence is long for the childish.

original: skye ba ni sdug bsngal rnam pa du ma'i gleng gzhir gyur pa yin pas 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir gus par bya ba nyid la sbyar bar bzhed pa ni de skad gsungs par zad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: skye ba ni sdug bsngal rnam pa du ma'i gleng gzhir gyur pa yin pas 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir gus par bya ba nyid la sbyar bar bzhed pa ni de skad gsungs par zad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Since birth is the basis for many kinds of suffering, the Buddha taught it in order to eliminate samsara.

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du de dag gi ming dang / khyad par dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan par zad kyi don dam par bstan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du de dag gi ming dang / khyad par dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan par zad kyi don dam par bstan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: He taught the names, characteristics, and methods for eliminating them as conventional expressions, but not as ultimate expressions.

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du de dag sus bstan zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du de dag sus bstan zhe na /
translated: Who taught them as conventional expressions?

original: 'jig rten gyi mgon pos te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mgon pos te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
translated: The Lord of the World, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: de dag gi ming ci skad bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi ming ci skad bstan zhe na /
translated: What are their names?

original: skye ba'i rgyun zhes bstan te /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyun zhes bstan te /
translated: They are taught as the ‚Äústream of birth.‚Äù

original: des ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: This teaches the characteristic of the defilement of birth.

original: de bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa zhes bstan te /
translated: In order to explain that in detail, it is said: ‚Äúproduced by karma and afflictions.‚Äù

original: des ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung bar bstan to //
analyzed: des ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that it arises from the cause of the affliction of karma and the affliction of afflictions.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu zhes bstan te /
translated: In order to teach its nature, it is said: ‚Äúlike an illusion, like a mirage.‚Äù

original: des ni ma brtags na dga' ba tsam du bstan to //
analyzed: des ni ma brtags na dga' ba tsam du bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is merely delightful when not examined.

original: de'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩskye ba'i @246a * //
analyzed: de'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir / skye ba'i @246a * //
translated: In order to teach its limit, it is said:

original: gnyen po ma skyes pa //üîΩzhes bstan te /
analyzed: gnyen po ma skyes pa // zhes bstan te /

original: des ni 'phags pa'i lam ma thob pa bstan to //

analyzed: zhes gsungs te 'phags pa'i lam ma thob pa rnams kyi'o //

original: de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag ci skad bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag ci skad bstan zhe na /

original: skye ba ni sdug bsngal rnam pa du ma'i gleng gzhir gyur pa yin pas 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir gus par bya ba nyid la sbyar bar bzhed pa na de skad gsungs par zad kyi zhes bya ba smras te /

translated: Since birth is the basis for the origin of many kinds of suffering, the Buddha said this in order to encourage those who wish to eliminate samsara.

original: skye 'di'i don med gang phyir skye ba yod na rga shi dang // nad dang sdug bsngal bsad dang bcing la sogs pa'i sgra dag yod //
analyzed: skye 'di'i don med gang phyir skye ba yod na rga shi dang // nad dang sdug bsngal bsad dang bcing la sogs pa'i sgra dag yod //

original: gal te 'jigs mang skye ba med na don med de mi 'byung //
analyzed: gal te 'jigs mang skye ba med na don med de mi 'byung //

analyzed: shing skyes med na nags med rlung gis sgyel bar mi 'gyur bzhin //
translated: If a tree does not arise, then a forest does not exist and it is not felled by the wind.

original: de zad pa ni nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba yin pas de zad par bya ba'i phyir gus bar bya ba nyid la nyan thos rnams sbyar bar bzhed pa na dge slong dag de lta bas na khyed kyis 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir nan tan bya'o

translated: Since the exhaustion of that is the bliss of complete peace, when the Buddha wishes to engage the ≈õrƒÅvakas in the practice of respectfully seeking the exhaustion of that, he says, ‚ÄúMonks, therefore you should practice to exhaust sa·πÉsƒÅra.‚Äù

original: zhes de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúYou should train in that way.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir de don dam par gsungs pa ma yin zhe na /

translated: Why is it not stated in the ultimate truth?

original: de'i phyir rtog pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyis yongs su brtags na don dam par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi khyad par 'ga' yang dmigs su med pas /

translated: Therefore, when those whose nature is to imagine thoroughly investigate, they do not observe any difference whatsoever between sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa in the ultimate truth.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba smras so //

original: de'i phyir gal te ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa de don dam pas yin par 'don na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa de don dam pas yin par 'don na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, if you maintain that the teaching of the instruction for the exhaustion of that is by way of the ultimate, then the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: kun rdzob pa'i gtan tshigs yin par rtog na ni don 'gal ba nyid dang dpe med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i gtan tshigs yin par rtog na ni don 'gal ba nyid dang dpe med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: If you imagine that the reason is conventional, then there is contradiction with the meaning and there is no example. This is the conclusion. It is the result of the valid cognition.

original: don dam par ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam par ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //

original: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni khyed don dam par 'dod pa dang 'ga' zhing phung @246b pos bsdus pa thams cad phyogs su byas pas chos mthun pa'i dpe med pa'i skyon yod do //

translated: If you prove conventionally, then there is the fault of the reason being contradictory with the probandum, and there is no example that has the property to be proven.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes gsungs pa de gang gi phyir bka' stsal pa dang / de kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du gsungs pa yin gyi don dam par gsungs pa ma yin par slob dpon gyis tshig le'ur byas pas bshad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes gsungs pa de gang gi phyir bka' stsal pa dang / de kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du gsungs pa yin gyi don dam par gsungs pa ma yin par slob dpon gyis tshig le'ur byas pas bshad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain that the master has explained that the Transcendent Conqueror‚Äôs statement, ‚ÄúCyclic existence has no beginning or end,‚Äù is a statement made in terms of conventional truth and not ultimate truth, the following verse is presented.

original: 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes gang gsungs pa ni 'di na rgyu med par smra ba bsal ba'i phyir dngos po rgyu las skye'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung rab skye ba bstan pa'i phyogs su bka' stsal pa de sun dbyung bar 'dod pa'i

translated: This and more is said.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúSamsara is without beginning or end.‚Äù The BhagavƒÅn said this in order to eliminate the assertion that this world is without cause. The BhagavƒÅn taught that things arise from causes.

original: rdzob kyi phyogs su bka' stsal pa des /

translated: All of the teachings on arising are stated from the perspective of the conventional.

translated: Since there is no beginning point for the transmission of causes from one to another, samsara is said to be without beginning.üîΩSince there is no end point for those who have not generated the antidote to birth, the ƒÅrya path, samsara is said to be without end.

original: skye ba'i gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam ma shar ba dag la tha ma grub pa'i phyir 'khor ba la tha ma med par bstan pas 'jig rten gsum po dag las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i skyon med par glo bur du mi skye ba dang /

analyzed: te / bdag cag sngon gyi rgyal po rnams dang / grong rdal  gyi mi rnams dang / ldongs kyi mi rnams kyi bar gyis mchod par gyur cing chos gos dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pa dag kyang rnyed par gyur na gang tshun chad nas dge sbyong goo tam 'di byung ba de tshun chad nas bdag cag rgyal po rnams dang grong rdal gyi mi rnams dang ljongs kyi mi rnams kyi bar gyis mchod par ma gyur cing chos
translated: ‚ÄúIn the past, we were worshipped by kings, city-dwellers, and country-dwellers, and we received Dharma robes, alms, and so forth. But since the ascetic Gautama appeared, we have not been worshipped by kings, city-dwellers, country-dwellers, and so forth.üîΩ

analyzed: gos dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pa dag kyang rnyed par ma gyur gyis /
translated: ‚ÄúWe were worshipped by the kings of the past, the people of the towns, and the people of the countryside, and we received Dharma robes, alms, and so on. But since the ascetic Gautama appeared, we have not been worshipped by the kings, the people of the towns, and the people of the countryside, and we have not received Dharma robes, alms, and so on.

original: de'i phyir bdag cag dong la de 'di ltar sun dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag cag dong la de 'di ltar sun dbyung bar bya ste /

analyzed: de skad dris pa na gal te sngon gyi mtha' mngon no zhes zer na de lta na 'khor ba la byed pa po dang 'byin pa po yod par 'gyur zhing 'jig rten gsum rgyu med pa las byung bar yang gyur pas des na dge sbyong goo tam 'khor
translated: If he says, ‚ÄúI perceive a beginning,‚Äù then it would follow that there is a creator and an instigator of cyclic existence and that the three worlds would arise without a cause.

original: de la sngon dang phyi ma med do zhes bstan te /

original: de'i don ni thog ma med pa dang ldan pa la /

translated: The meaning of that is as follows:üîΩWith regard to samsara‚Äôs possession of no beginning,

analyzed: gzhan gyis thog ma dang ldan par yongs su brtags pa bsal ba yin te /
translated: the imputation of others that it has a beginning is eliminated.üîΩIn this way, the BhagavƒÅn eliminated the two assertions of others that samsara is a descent into samsara without a cause of karma and affliction and that Brahma and so on are the creator and the one who emanates.

original: 'di ltar smra ba po gzhan dag 'khor ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu med par glo bur du ltung ba dang / byed pa po dang / 'byin pa po tshangs pa la sogs pa yod par 'dod pa de gnyi ga bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon par bka' stsal pas bsal ba'i phyir sun dbyung ba'i skabs mi rnyed de gang la sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon pa de la phyi ma'i mtha'

translated: Since the BhagavƒÅn said that the beginning is not evident, he eliminated the opportunity to refute him.

original: mi mngon pas 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: mi mngon pas 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: Since the beginning is not evident, the end is not evident.üîΩTherefore the BhagavƒÅn said that samsara has no beginning or end.

original: de la 'khor ba ni kun tu 'gro ba ste skye ba dang rga shi'i dpyad thag @247b gi rgyun ma chad pa'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de la 'khor ba ni kun tu 'gro ba ste skye ba dang rga shi'i dpyad thag @247b gi rgyun ma chad pa'o zhes bya bas ni /

analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan to //

analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med de /
translated: It is beginningless and endless.

analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma ni thog ma dang tha ma dag ste /
translated: Beginning and end are the beginning and end.üîΩSince it has neither beginning nor end, it is said to be without prior limit or posterior limit.

translated: Thus, the name ‚Äúsa·πÉsƒÅra‚Äù and its definition are taught conventionally, not ultimately.

original: de'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //üîΩde'i phyir de ni lan gdab pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med de /

translated: Therefore, the meaning of the opponent‚Äôs reason is not established.üîΩTherefore, this is a response to the question.üîΩThis is a response to the question asked by P≈´ra·πáa and so on: ‚ÄúSa·πÉsƒÅra has no beginning or end.

analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das la log pa mi gsung ba nyid du yid ches pa yang dag par skyes pa rnams la ni de la yid ches par 'gyur gyi tshad ma ltar snang bas sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa gzhan dag ni yid ches par mi 'gyur la / thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab 'di yang slob dpon gyi dpe ma khyud dang bral ba yin pas de'i phyir don 'di gzhan la bstan par nus pa'i rjes su dpag pa brjod par bya ste zhes bya bas ni de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba'i mid dang

Therefore, in order to teach this meaning to others, an inference is expressed.üîΩThus the BhagavƒÅn taught the means to eliminate the faults of sa·πÉsƒÅra, the distinctions, and the instructions for eliminating them, but they are conventional and not ultimate. Therefore, the meaning of the opponent‚Äôs reason is not established, and so on.

original: / khyad par dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa dag tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ma yin pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa dag nyan pa'i skye bo gang dag bcom ldan 'das ni log pa mi gsung
analyzed: / khyad par dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa dag tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ma yin pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa dag nyan pa'i skye bo gang dag bcom ldan 'das ni log pa mi gsung
translated: Those who listen to this should have confidence in the BhagavƒÅn as one who does not teach falsely.

original: ba yang dag pa nyid du gsung ba'o zhes bcom ldan 'das la yid ches pa yang dag par skyes pa rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyi lung de la yid ches par 'gyur bas de dag la ni @248a * //
analyzed: ba yang dag pa nyid du gsung ba'o zhes bcom ldan 'das la yid ches pa yang dag par skyes pa rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyi lung de la yid ches par 'gyur bas de dag la ni @248a * //
translated: Those who have perfect faith in the Bhagavan will have faith in his scriptures.

original: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad mas bsgrubs pas chog pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i chod mas sgrub mi dgos so //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad mas bsgrubs pas chog pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i chod mas sgrub mi dgos so //
translated: But since it is sufficient to establish them through the valid knowledge of scriptural statements that they accept, it is not necessary to establish them through the valid knowledge of inference.

original: nyan pa'i skye bo gang dag lha chen po dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbyig gi snying po dang / ser skya dang / gzegs zan dang / rkang mig dang / 'phel ba la sogs pas smras pa /
analyzed: nyan pa'i skye bo gang dag lha chen po dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbyig gi snying po dang / ser skya dang / gzegs zan dang / rkang mig dang / 'phel ba la sogs pas smras pa /
translated: But there are other beings who listen to the scriptures of the Bhagavan, such as the scriptures of Mahesvara, Vishnu, Vasu, Kapila, Kanada, Ak·π£apƒÅda, Uluka, and so on,

original: tshad ma ma yin par tshad ma ltar snang bas sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa gzhan dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis lung de la yid ches par mi 'gyur bas de dag la ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas kyang bsgrub dgos la /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin par tshad ma ltar snang bas sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa gzhan dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis lung de la yid ches par mi 'gyur bas de dag la ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas kyang bsgrub dgos la /
translated: and who are confused about the valid knowledge of the scriptures of the Bhagavan by the false appearance of valid knowledge. Since they do not have faith in the scriptures of the Bhagavan, it is necessary to establish them through the valid knowledge of inference.

original: thub pa'i dbang po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab 'di yang slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud dang bral ba yin pas 'grel pa byed pa yang gzhan la don 'di bstan pa la dbri bkol mi byed pas de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba'i ming dang
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab 'di yang slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud dang bral ba yin pas 'grel pa byed pa yang gzhan la don 'di bstan pa la dbri bkol mi byed pas de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba'i ming dang
translated: Since the scriptures of the Lord of Sages, the Bhagavan Buddha, are free from the teacher's concealment of the text, the author of the commentary also does not omit or add anything in teaching this meaning to others. Therefore, the Bhagavan taught the names of cyclic existence,

original: / khyad par bstan pa dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa de dag tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ma yin pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa la sogs pa'i don 'di gzhan la bstan par nus pa'i rjes su dpag pa brjod par bya'o
analyzed: / khyad par bstan pa dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa de dag tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ma yin pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa la sogs pa'i don 'di gzhan la bstan par nus pa'i rjes su dpag pa brjod par bya'o
translated: the teaching of its distinctions, and the instructions for exhausting it, all of which are conventional and not ultimate. Thus, one should state an inference that is able to teach others the meaning of the opponent's reason, such as unproven.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: de'i bskal pa dang po'i lus can rnams kyi lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs gang yin pa de ni tshe rabs gzhan dag tu nye bar bsags pa'i las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu can yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i bskal pa dang po'i lus can rnams kyi lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs gang yin pa de ni tshe rabs gzhan dag tu nye bar bsags pa'i las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu can yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The collection of bodies, faculties, and minds of the sentient beings of the first eon should be understood to be the cause of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma accumulated in other lives.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa la sogs pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na deng sang gi lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa la sogs pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na deng sang gi lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because they are the cause of the arising of pleasure, pain, virtue, nonvirtue, and so on, they are like the collection of bodies, faculties, and minds of sentient beings of the present day.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /

translated: For example, just as the bodies, faculties, and collections of awareness of embodied beings of today are known to be caused by virtuous and nonvirtuous karma accumulated in other past lives because they are the causes of the arising of pleasure and pain, Dharma and non-Dharma, and so on,

original: des ni 'khor ba'i rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dag la rtsom pa'i dus nges pa med pa'i phyir thog ma med pa dang / gnyen po ma shar pa dag la tha ma ma grub pa'i phyir tha ma med par shes par bya'o //

translated: Here, the passage beginning ‚ÄúThe tƒ´rthikas say‚Äù presents a slight reductio argument against the opponent, who is proving that the beginning of sa·πÉsƒÅra exists because the end of sa·πÉsƒÅra exists.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes pa skyes pa'i 'khor ba la yang tha ma yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ci skad smros pa'i mthus 'khor ba ni thog ma yod par gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /

original: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang //

analyzed: de yis gzhan ni ci ltar skyed //üîΩces ci skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: produce another?

original: de'i phyir pha rol po dag 'khor ba thog ma yod par bsgrub pa'i dpe bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pas dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol po dag 'khor ba thog ma yod par bsgrub pa'i dpe bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pas dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: Therefore, the example that the opponent uses to prove that samsara has a beginning, ‚Äúlike a pot,‚Äù is faulty because the example is incomplete, since the property of the subject is not established.

original: tha ma yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid de /üîΩ'khor ba ni mtha' dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'i dbye bas lung du ma @249b bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po 'khor ba thog ma yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs tha ma yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don ma
analyzed: tha ma yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid de / 'khor ba ni mtha' dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'i dbye bas lung du ma @249b bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po 'khor ba thog ma yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs tha ma yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don ma
translated: The meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause the end exists‚Äù is also not established.üîΩBecause samsara is indeterminate, since it is classified as having an end and so on.

original: grub pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: grub pa nyid du ston te /
translated: This shows that the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause the end exists‚Äù that the opponent uses to prove that samsara has a beginning is not established.

original: ci'i phyir ma grub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma grub ce na /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi bka' stsal pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi bka' stsal pa las /

original: 'jig rten rtag pa dang 'jig rten mi rtag pa dang / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten mtha' yod pa dang / 'jig rten mtha' yod pa ma yin pa dang /üîΩmtha' yod kyang yod la /
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag pa dang 'jig rten mi rtag pa dang / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten mtha' yod pa dang / 'jig rten mtha' yod pa ma yin pa dang / mtha' yod kyang yod la /
translated: The world is permanent, the world is impermanent, the world is both permanent and impermanent, the world is neither permanent nor impermanent, the world has an end, the world has no end,

original: med pa yang ma yin pa dang / srog de lus yin zhes bya ba dang / srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan zhes lung du bstan par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas 'khor ba yang lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin pa dang / srog de lus yin zhes bya ba dang / srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan zhes lung du bstan par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas 'khor ba yang lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: after death the self neither exists nor does not exist, the life force is the body, the life force is one thing and the body is another.üîΩSince the Buddha did not answer these questions, samsara is also unanswerable.

original: pha rol po'i gtan tshigs de'i don sgra la mig gi gzung ba yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bzhin du ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol po'i gtan tshigs de'i don sgra la mig gi gzung ba yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bzhin du ma grub pa nyid do //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re gal te 'khor ba thog ma med par 'dod na 'o na de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
