analyzed: pha rol po dag gal te 'khor ba la thog ma med na tha ma yang med par 'gyur bas de lta na rnal 'byor pa yang dag pa'i shes pa skyes pa dag la yang 'khor ba zad pa'i mtha' med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston to
translated: teaches the opponent‚Äôs position that if samsara is beginningless, it would be endless, and in that case, even for yogins who have generated correct knowledge, samsara would not end.

original: // de'i phyir de la zad pa med par yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: // de'i phyir de la zad pa med par yang shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore it should be understood that it is not exhausted,

original: thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu'am /
analyzed: thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu'am /
translated: because it possesses beginninglessness, like a person or

original: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: like space.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /

analyzed: dper na skyes bu dang / nam mkha' ni thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de dag zad pa'i mtha' yang med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, because a person and space possess beginninglessness, their end is also not exhausted.

original: 'khor ba yang thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de la zad pa'i mtha' yang med par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba yang thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de la zad pa'i mtha' yang med par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, because cyclic existence possesses beginninglessness, its end is also not exhausted.

analyzed: @250a * // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

analyzed: ma skyes pa ni tha snyad du yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /

original: pha rol po dag gis brtags pa'i skyes bu dang nam mkha' rdzas su 'dod pa dag kho bo cag dbu ma pa la kun rdzob tu yang rdzas su yod par ma skyes pas tha snyad du yang khas ma blangs na don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos
analyzed: pha rol po dag gis brtags pa'i skyes bu dang nam mkha' rdzas su 'dod pa dag kho bo cag dbu ma pa la kun rdzob tu yang rdzas su yod par ma skyes pas tha snyad du yang khas ma blangs na don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos
translated: Since they are not born as substantially existent even conventionally for us Madhyamaka, if they are not accepted even conventionally, what need is there to mention their being accepted ultimately?

analyzed: te / des na khyed kyi dpe skyes bu'am nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon yod do // kun rdzob kyi phyogs la yang 'bru la sogs pa thog ma med pa dag la gnyen po byung bas mtha' mthong ba'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya bas ni pha rol pos 'khor ba thog ma med pa de la zad pa'i mtha' med par yang shes
translated: Therefore, your example, ‚Äúlike a person or space,‚Äù has the fault of an unestablished subject.üîΩAlso, in the context of the conventional, since the end of the beginningless seeds is seen due to the arising of their antidotes, the meaning is contradictory.

original: par bya ste zhes dam bcas pa de kun rdzob kyi phyogs la yang don 'gal ba nyid du ston te /
analyzed: par bya ste zhes dam bcas pa de kun rdzob kyi phyogs la yang don 'gal ba nyid du ston te /
translated: This shows that the thesis ‚Äúone should know that the beginningless sa·πÉsƒÅra has no end of exhaustion‚Äù is contradictory in meaning even in the context of the conventional.

original: 'bru la sogs pa thog ma med pa dag la me la sogs pa gnyen po byung bas tshig pa la sogs pa'i mtha' yod par mthong ba'i phyir des na ci re zhig 'khor ba thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu'am /
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa thog ma med pa dag la me la sogs pa gnyen po byung bas tshig pa la sogs pa'i mtha' yod par mthong ba'i phyir des na ci re zhig 'khor ba thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu'am /
translated: Because we see that grains and so on, which are beginningless, have an end, since a remedy such as fire arises.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du zad pa med par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du zad pa med par 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, is samsara inexhaustible like a person or space, because it possesses no beginning?üîΩOr does it have an end, like grains and so on, which are beginningless, since a remedy arises?

original: 'on te 'bru la sogs pa thog ma med pa dag la gnyen po byung bas mtha' mthong ba bzhin du zad par 'gyur ba ma nges pas don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te 'bru la sogs pa thog ma med pa dag la gnyen po byung bas mtha' mthong ba bzhin du zad par 'gyur ba ma nges pas don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Since this is not certain, it is contradictory.

original: mkhas pa'i nga rgyal can nye bar 'khrul pa gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po bdag nyid thams cad shes pa ma yin par thams cad shes par bsnyems pa'i nga rgyal can thams cad mkhyen pa sun 'byin pa'i nye bar 'khrul
analyzed: mkhas pa'i nga rgyal can nye bar 'khrul pa gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po bdag nyid thams cad shes pa ma yin par thams cad shes par bsnyems pa'i nga rgyal can thams cad mkhyen pa sun 'byin pa'i nye bar 'khrul
translated: Others who are confused by the pride of being learned say that the opponent is not omniscient, but is proud of being omniscient, since he does not know everything.

original: pa dang ldan pa gzhan dag bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i sgo nas 'khor ba la thog ma yod par smra ba ston to //
analyzed: pa dang ldan pa gzhan dag bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i sgo nas 'khor ba la thog ma yod par smra ba ston to //
translated: Others who possess such a nature, by means of establishing that the BhagavƒÅn is not omniscient, teach that cyclic existence has a beginning.

original: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes zer bas rang nyid mi shes par khas blangs pa'i phyir dper na mi phal pa srog chags shi ba gar song mi shes so zhes zer ba bzhin no zhes
analyzed: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes zer bas rang nyid mi shes par khas blangs pa'i phyir dper na mi phal pa srog chags shi ba gar song mi shes so zhes zer ba bzhin no zhes
translated: Therefore, since it is said, ‚ÄúThe BhagavƒÅn is not omniscient because the prior limit of cyclic existence is not manifest,‚Äù it is like an ordinary person saying, ‚ÄúI do not know where the dead animal went.‚Äù

original: zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what they say.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin @250b par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin @250b par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are applied in order as the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.

original: dper na mi phal pa blun po dag na re srog chags shi ba gar song mi shes so zhes zer bas rang nyid mi shes par khas blangs pa'i phyir de dag thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyang 'khor ba'i sngon gyiüîΩmtha' mi mngon no zhes zer bas /
analyzed: dper na mi phal pa blun po dag na re srog chags shi ba gar song mi shes so zhes zer bas rang nyid mi shes par khas blangs pa'i phyir de dag thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyang 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes zer bas /
translated: Therefore they are not omniscient.üîΩIn the same way, the BhagavƒÅn does not reveal the prior limit of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: rang nyid mi shes par khas blangs pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid mi shes par khas blangs pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no //
translated: By saying that, he admits that he does not know, and therefore he is not omniscient.

original: ci ste thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin na ni 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' yang mkhyen pas des na 'khor ba la yang sngon gyi mtha' yod par grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ci ste thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin na ni 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' yang mkhyen pas des na 'khor ba la yang sngon gyi mtha' yod par grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: If he is omniscient, he knows the prior limit of sa·πÉsƒÅra, and therefore it is established that sa·πÉsƒÅra has a prior limit.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: gzhan gyi 'khor ba thog ma yod pa nyid du yongs su brtags pa bsal ba'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes gsungs pa de ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nyid du bstan pa'i tshig gi don yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma med pa
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'khor ba thog ma yod pa nyid du yongs su brtags pa bsal ba'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes gsungs pa de ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nyid du bstan pa'i tshig gi don yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma med pa
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe beginning of samsara is not evident‚Äù is a statement that samsara is beginningless.üîΩSince samsara is beginningless, the Bhagavan knows that the beginning of samsara is not evident.üîΩSince the Bhagavan taught that samsara is beginningless, he is not hindered with regard to that.

original: nyid yin pas mi mngon pa nyid du mkhyen pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba thog ma med pa nyid du bstan pas bcom ldan 'das ni de la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir de ni ma brtags par smra ba gzhan gyi 'byor pa chen po la phrag dog byed pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa yin no zhes bya ba smras
analyzed: nyid yin pas mi mngon pa nyid du mkhyen pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba thog ma med pa nyid du bstan pas bcom ldan 'das ni de la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir de ni ma brtags par smra ba gzhan gyi 'byor pa chen po la phrag dog byed pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa yin no zhes bya ba smras
translated: This is the concordant cause of those who, through jealousy, speak without analysis of the great prosperity of others.

original: te / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba'i spon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes bka' stsal pa ni gzhan gyis 'khor ba thog ma yod pa nyid du yongs su brtags pa bsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: te / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba'i spon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes bka' stsal pa ni gzhan gyis 'khor ba thog ma yod pa nyid du yongs su brtags pa bsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Bhagavan said, ‚ÄúThe beginning of samsara is not evident,‚Äù in order to eliminate the conception of others that samsara has a beginning.

original: de ni 'khor ba thog ma yod pa las mi mkhyen te /
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba thog ma yod pa las mi mkhyen te /
translated: It does not mean that the Buddha does not know that samsara has a beginning.

original: sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes gsungs pa ma yin gyi 'khor ba la thog ma med pa nyid du bstan pa'i tshig gi don yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma med pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes gsungs pa ma yin gyi 'khor ba la thog ma med pa nyid du bstan pa'i tshig gi don yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma med pa nyid yin pas /
translated: It means that the Buddha does not see a beginning, because the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúSamsara has no beginning‚Äù is that samsara has no beginning.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon pa nyid du mkhyen pa'i phyir rang nyid mi mkhyen par zhal gyis bzhes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon pa nyid du mkhyen pa'i phyir rang nyid mi mkhyen par zhal gyis bzhes pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, since samsara has no beginning, the Bhagavan knows that the beginning of samsara is not seen. He does not assert that he himself does not know.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nyid kyi chos dang ldan pa de nyid de bzhin du mkhyen te bcom ldan 'das ni 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' med pa de la mkhyen pa thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te zhes
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nyid kyi chos dang ldan pa de nyid de bzhin du mkhyen te bcom ldan 'das ni 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' med pa de la mkhyen pa thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te zhes
translated: The Bhagavan knows that samsara has the attribute of having no beginning. The Bhagavan has unobstructed knowledge of the fact that samsara has no beginning.

original: zer ba'i sgrub pa de ni skye bo ngan pa ma brtags par smra ba gzhan gyi @251a * //
analyzed: zer ba'i sgrub pa de ni skye bo ngan pa ma brtags par smra ba gzhan gyi @251a * //
translated: Therefore, the argument that the Bhagavan is not omniscient because he does not know the beginning of samsara is a statement by a fool who speaks without thinking.

original: 'byor ba chen po la phrag dog byed pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i tshig yin pas rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byor ba chen po la phrag dog byed pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i tshig yin pas rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is a word that is the natural outcome of envy of the great prosperity of others, it is not reasonable.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du grub la /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du grub la /
translated: Therefore, the Lord is established as omniscient,

original: 'khor ba la yang thog ma med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba la yang thog ma med par shes par bya'o //
translated: and it should be understood that cyclic existence is also beginningless.üîΩThe meaning of the thesis is extensively discussed in the chapter on the examination of the Tathagata.

original: dam bcas pa'i don rgyas par ni de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa las rtog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la sogs pa dngos po thams cad la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pas dngos por snang
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don rgyas par ni de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa las rtog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la sogs pa dngos po thams cad la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pas dngos por snang
translated: Since the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous is untenable for all things such as cyclic existence, the meaning of the thesis that the appearance of things

analyzed: ba sgyu ma lta bur sgrub pa'i dam bcas pa'i don rgyas par ni de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa'i skabs nas ston to //
translated: is like an illusion is extensively taught in the chapter on the examination of the Tathagata.

original: dpyad pa 'phros pas chog gis skabs gnyis brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa dang po'i skabs 'di'o //
analyzed: dpyad pa 'phros pas chog gis skabs gnyis brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa dang po'i skabs 'di'o //
translated: Enough of this digression. Let us proceed with the second chapter.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa 'dis 'khor ba'i chos ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid yin par bstan te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa 'dis 'khor ba'i chos ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid yin par bstan te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here this verse teaches that the phenomena of cyclic existence are without beginning and end.

original: 'dir / sngon mtha' mngon nam zhes zhus tshe //
analyzed: 'dir / sngon mtha' mngon nam zhes zhus tshe //
translated: Here, when asked, ‚ÄúIs the prior limit evident?‚Äù

original: thub pa chen pos min zhes gsungs //
analyzed: thub pa chen pos min zhes gsungs //
translated: The Great Sage said, ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

original: 'khor ba thog ma tha med de //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma tha med de //
translated: Cyclic existence has no beginning or end.

original: de la sngon dang phyi ma med //
analyzed: de la sngon dang phyi ma med //
translated: It has no prior or later limits.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa 'dis 'khor ba'i sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi mngon par dam bcas pa'i sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid yin par bstan to /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa 'dis 'khor ba'i sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi mngon par dam bcas pa'i sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid yin par bstan to /
translated: This verse demonstrates that the reason proving the thesis that the prior and later limits of cyclic existence are not evident is that it is without beginning and end.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par phung po rnams ci ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin te thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par phung po rnams ci ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin te thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore the inference is stated as follows: Ultimately the aggregates do not exist as they appear, because they are without beginning and end, like the person conjured by a magician.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu la ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ci ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du phung po rnams kyang thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ci ltar snang ba deüîΩltar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu la ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ci ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du phung po rnams kyang thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ci ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as the person conjured up by a magician does not exist in the way he appears, because he has no beginning or end, in the same way, the aggregates do not exist in the way they appear, because they have no beginning or end.

original: des na dngos po 'dod pa thams cad la snga phyi dang / lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pas dngos por snang ba ni sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du grub par ston to //
analyzed: des na dngos po 'dod pa thams cad la snga phyi dang / lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pas dngos por snang ba ni sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du grub par ston to //
translated: Thus, since the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous is untenable for all who assert real entities, the appearance of real entities is established as being like a magician‚Äôs illusion and so on.

original: 'dir mkhas su re ba'i blo can kha cig na re sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu la yang shes par rnam par rtog pa med @251b pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag dus phyi mar yang de bzhin du yod pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'dir mkhas su re ba'i blo can kha cig na re sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu la yang shes par rnam par rtog pa med @251b pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag dus phyi mar yang de bzhin du yod pa'i phyir
translated: Here, some who are clever in their minds say, ‚ÄúThe example is not suitable because the object, such as form, that is the object of the thought-free consciousness of a person emanated by an illusionist exists in the same way in the later time.‚Äù

original: dper bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pas med do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i dpe sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu bzhin no zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / mi ldan pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: dper bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pas med do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i dpe sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu bzhin no zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / mi ldan pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThey say, ‚ÄòThe example is not suitable because the probandum is not endowed with the property‚Äô‚Äù is the statement of the opponents, who say, ‚ÄúThe example of the illusionist‚Äôs emanated person that the MƒÅdhyamikas use is not suitable because the probandum is not endowed with the property.‚Äù

original: de dag na re rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa gang dag gis sgyu ma'i skyes bu bskyed pa'i rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa de dag la gzugs dang / ro dang dri dang reg pa gang dag yod pa de dag skyes bur snang ba'i sprul pa'i dus na yang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa nye bar gnas pa las byung ba shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa dag gi mngon sum gyis gzung bar yod pa
analyzed: de dag na re rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa gang dag gis sgyu ma'i skyes bu bskyed pa'i rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa de dag la gzugs dang / ro dang dri dang reg pa gang dag yod pa de dag skyes bur snang ba'i sprul pa'i dus na yang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa nye bar gnas pa las byung ba shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa dag gi mngon sum gyis gzung bar yod pa
translated: They say that the form, taste, smell, and tactility that exist in the grass, leaves, and so on that generate the illusory person also exist when the person appears and is emanated.üîΩThey are apprehended by the nonconceptual consciousnesses that arise from the eye consciousnesses and so on.

original: yin la / skyes bur snang ba'i sprul pa bsdus pa'i dus phyi ma'i tshe yang rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa de dag gzugs la sogs par gang dag yod pa de dag mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa de dag gi mngon sum gyis gzung
analyzed: yin la / skyes bur snang ba'i sprul pa bsdus pa'i dus phyi ma'i tshe yang rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa de dag gzugs la sogs par gang dag yod pa de dag mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa de dag gi mngon sum gyis gzung
translated: And when the person who appears and is emanated is withdrawn, the form and so on that exist in the grass, leaves, and so on are apprehended by the nonconceptual eye consciousnesses and so on.

original: ba de bzhin du yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ba de bzhin du yod pa'i phyir /
translated: They say that this is because they exist in the same way as before.

original: des na dbu ma pas phung po rnams ci ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin te zhes gang smras pa'i bsgrub par bya ba de dpe sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu zhes bya ba de la med pas dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos dangüîΩmi ldan pas med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na dbu ma pas phung po rnams ci ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin te zhes gang smras pa'i bsgrub par bya ba de dpe sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu zhes bya ba de la med pas dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pas med do zhes zer ro //
translated: because the example does not have the property of the probandum.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu log par snang ba nyid dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dang shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs la sogs pa dag la yang skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu log par snang ba nyid dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dang shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs la sogs pa dag la yang skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis
translated: That is not correct because the appearance of the illusory person emanated by the magician is asserted as the example and because the example is established by the emptiness of form and so on that is the object of nonconceptual consciousness.

original: stong pa'i phyir dpe grub pas skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: stong pa'i phyir dpe grub pas skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: There is no fault.

original: kho bos rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa gang dag gis sgyu ma'i skyes bu bskyed pa de dag la shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag phyis sgyu ma bsdus pa'i dus na yang de bzhin
analyzed: kho bos rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa gang dag gis sgyu ma'i skyes bu bskyed pa de dag la shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag phyis sgyu ma bsdus pa'i dus na yang de bzhin
translated: The magician does not posit the illusory person as an example of the negation of the existence of things such as form that are the objects of the conceptual consciousnesses that generate the illusory person from such things as grass and leaves, which exist in the same wayüîΩafter the illusion is dismantled as they did before.üîΩThe appearance of the person conjured by the magician is negated, and the nonexistence of the person‚Äôs essence is established by that.

original: du yod pa de dag dgag pa'i dper sgyu ma'i skyes bu nye bar ma bzhag gi / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bur snang ba de log par snang bas de la skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid med par grub pa de phung po rnams kun rdzob tu
analyzed: du yod pa de dag dgag pa'i dper sgyu ma'i skyes bu nye bar ma bzhag gi / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bur snang ba de log par snang bas de la skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid med par grub pa de phung po rnams kun rdzob tu
translated: The aggregates are established as

original: ji ltar snang @252a * //
analyzed: ji ltar snang @252a * //
translated: conventional in the same way.

original: ba de ltar don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dang / rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa gang dag gis sgyu ma'i skyes bu bskyed pa de dag la shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag la yang skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir de
analyzed: ba de ltar don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dang / rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa gang dag gis sgyu ma'i skyes bu bskyed pa de dag la shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag la yang skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir de
translated: Because you assert that the example of the ultimate existence of the aggregates is the person of the illusion, and because the forms and so on that are the objects of the consciousnesses of those who create the illusory person, such as grass, leaves, and so on, are also empty of the nature of the person.

original: phung po rnams kun rdzob tu ci ltar snang ba de ltar don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i dpe nyid du grub pa'i phyir kho bos sgrub pa la dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon med do //
analyzed: phung po rnams kun rdzob tu ci ltar snang ba de ltar don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i dpe nyid du grub pa'i phyir kho bos sgrub pa la dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, since the example of the aggregates existing ultimately in the way they appear conventionally is established, there is no fault of the example not being established in my proof.

original: de lta bas na 'khor ba yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba
analyzed: de lta bas na 'khor ba yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba
translated: Therefore, since samsara is not established as existing, the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause the name and its distinction are taught and because the instruction on the exhaustion of that is taught‚Äù is not established. This is the conclusion.

original: dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The result of valid cognition is the establishment of the object.

original: de ltar pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa'i phyir dbu ma pas dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan par dam bcas pa grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa'i phyir dbu ma pas dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan par dam bcas pa grub bo //
translated: Thus, since the meaning of the opponent‚Äôs reason is not established, the Madhyamaka‚Äôs thesis that cyclic existence is essenceless is established by the refutation of the features of the discordant side, that is, that things have essences.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say the following:

original: don dam par phung po'i rgyud ces bya ba'i 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par phung po'i rgyud ces bya ba'i 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Cyclic existence, called the continuum of the aggregates, definitely exists in the ultimate.

original: de'i dbus yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di la gang med pa de la ni dbus dmigs su med de /
analyzed: de'i dbus yod pa'i phyir ro // 'di la gang med pa de la ni dbus dmigs su med de /
translated: This is because its middle exists.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: That which does not exist cannot be observed to have a middle, just like the horn of a donkey.

original: 'khor ba la ni gang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag yod pa'i dbus yod pas de'i phyir 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba la ni gang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag yod pa'i dbus yod pas de'i phyir 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: But cyclic existence does have a middle, in which there is both affliction and purification. Therefore, cyclic existence definitely exists.

original: des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang 'gal ba nyid med pas 'dod pa'i don 'grub po zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'khor ba la dbus yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'khor ba yod par bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang 'gal ba nyid med pas 'dod pa'i don 'grub po zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'khor ba la dbus yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'khor ba yod par bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the statement that proves the existence of samsara by the reason that samsara has a middle.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The meaning of the reason, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, the example of the dissimilar class, the application of the proof, the conclusion, and the result of the valid knowledge are to be applied in order.

original: 'dir na ri bong gi rva lta bu gang med pa de la ni dbus dmigs su med kyi 'khor ba la ni gang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag yod pa'i dbus yod pas de'i phyir phung po'i rgyud ces bya ba'i 'khor ba yod de /
analyzed: 'dir na ri bong gi rva lta bu gang med pa de la ni dbus dmigs su med kyi 'khor ba la ni gang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag yod pa'i dbus yod pas de'i phyir phung po'i rgyud ces bya ba'i 'khor ba yod de /
translated: Here, that which does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit, is not observed to have a middle. But samsara does have a middle, where there is both affliction and purification. Therefore samsara, which is called the continuum of the aggregates, exists.

original: @252b des na kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / 'gal ba nyid med pas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i 'dod pa'i don 'grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: @252b des na kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / 'gal ba nyid med pas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i 'dod pa'i don 'grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since our reason is not unestablished and contradictory, it is established that ultimately the aggregates and so on exist. Thus the meaning of our thesis is established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gang la thog ma tha med pa //
analyzed: gang la thog ma tha med pa //
translated: That which has no beginning and end

original: de la dbus ni ga la yod //
analyzed: de la dbus ni ga la yod //
translated: How could it have a middle?

original: de la dbus yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: de la dbus yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the words is that it does not have a middle.

original: sgyu ma byas pa'i skyes bu'i rgyud la dbus med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: sgyu ma byas pa'i skyes bu'i rgyud la dbus med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The intention is that it is like the continuum of an illusory person having no middle.

original: dper na sgyu ma byas pa'i skyes bu'i rgyud gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de la dbus med pa de bzhin du phung po'i rgyud ces bya ba'i 'khor ba gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de la yang dbus med de /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma byas pa'i skyes bu'i rgyud gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de la dbus med pa de bzhin du phung po'i rgyud ces bya ba'i 'khor ba gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de la yang dbus med de /
translated: Similarly, in samsara, called the continuum of the aggregates, where there is no beginning or end, there is no middle.

original: 'di ltar thog ma dang tha ma la ltos nas dbus 'grub par 'gyur ba yin na de la thog ma dang tha ma de yang med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar thog ma dang tha ma la ltos nas dbus 'grub par 'gyur ba yin na de la thog ma dang tha ma de yang med de /
translated: If the middle were established in dependence on the beginning and end, then it would have a beginning and end.

original: de med pa'i phyir de'i dbus yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de'i dbus yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: But since it does not, how could its middle exist?

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /üîΩthog ma dbus dang tha ma rnams //
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang / thog ma dbus dang tha ma rnams //
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva also says:üîΩThe middle is not tenable

original: skye ba'i snga rol mi srid de //
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol mi srid de //
translated: Prior to the arising of the beginning and end.

original: gnyis gnyis dag ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis dag ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Without the two

original: re res rtsom par ci ltar 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: re res rtsom par ci ltar 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: How could there be a single one?

original: de ltar thog ma dang tha ma ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dpe med pa'i phyir ci skad bstan pa'i skyon ldog par mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar thog ma dang tha ma ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dpe med pa'i phyir ci skad bstan pa'i skyon ldog par mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: Thus, since neither a beginning nor an end is established, and since there is no example, it is not tenable to reverse the faults as they have been taught. This is the summary.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Because there is neither a beginning nor an end‚Äù is the Madhyamaka argument.üîΩ‚Äú Because there is no example‚Äù is the following. In the opponent‚Äôs proof, the example is like the absence of eye disease of one who has two eyes and like the horn of a rabbit.

original: dpe med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i sgrub pa la dper na mgo gnyis pa'i mig gi nad med par bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba dang dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe de
analyzed: dpe med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i sgrub pa la dper na mgo gnyis pa'i mig gi nad med par bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba dang dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe de
translated: These are examples of dissimilar classes.

original: dag las bzlog pa chos dben pa'i dpe che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba med de /
analyzed: dag las bzlog pa chos dben pa'i dpe che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba med de /
translated: There is no such example that is the opposite of these, an example of the absence of attributes.

original: de'i phyir ci skad bstan pa'i skyon log par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ci skad bstan pa'i skyon log par mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to reverse the faults as they have been taught.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir de la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa mi 'thad do //üîΩskye ba dang rga shi dag gi'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gang gi phyir 'khor ba la thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma dag med pa de'i phyir 'khor ba med pas 'khor ba de la 'khor ba po'i skye ba @253a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir de la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa mi 'thad do // skye ba dang rga shi dag gi'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gang gi phyir 'khor ba la thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma dag med pa de'i phyir 'khor ba med pas 'khor ba de la 'khor ba po'i skye ba @253a * //
translated: Therefore, since samsara is investigated in this way and is devoid of intrinsic reality, therefore the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous is untenable in that .

original: dang rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang / lhan cig dag gi rim pa dag mi 'thad par dam bca' ba yin no //
analyzed: dang rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang / lhan cig dag gi rim pa dag mi 'thad par dam bca' ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOf birth and aging-death‚Äù means that since samsara does not have a beginning, middle, or end, therefore samsara does not exist. Hence, the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous of birth and aging-death of the transmigrator in that samsara is untenable.üîΩThis is the thesis.

original: de la smra ba gang dag na re 'khor ba ni ngo bo nyid yod de skye ba dang rga shi dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la smra ba gang dag na re 'khor ba ni ngo bo nyid yod de skye ba dang rga shi dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With regard to that, some proponents say that samsara exists by intrinsic reality because it possesses birth and aging-death.

original: mo gsham gyi bu med pa ni skye ba dang rga shi dang ldan par mi rigs so zhes zer ba de dag la yang skye ba dang rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu med pa ni skye ba dang rga shi dang ldan par mi rigs so zhes zer ba de dag la yang skye ba dang rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub
translated: The meaning of the reason is not established because the sequence of earlier, later, and simultaneous with respect to birth and aging and death is not established.üîΩ  The example is not established because ultimately nothing that possesses birth and so on is established as having intrinsic reality.

original: pa nyid dang / don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa gang yang ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med pa dang / don 'gal ba nyid du yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'khor ba la thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma med pas 'khor ba med pa'i phyir 'khor ba po'i skye ba dang /
analyzed: pa nyid dang / don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa gang yang ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med pa dang / don 'gal ba nyid du yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'khor ba la thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma med pas 'khor ba med pa'i phyir 'khor ba po'i skye ba dang /
translated: The meaning is contradictory because in that way, since samsara has no beginning, middle, or end, samsara does not exist. Therefore the birth of the transmigrator and the transmigrator himself do not exist.

original: rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pas de la chos 'di pa la sogs pas smra ba gang dag 'khor ba ngo bo nyid yod par dam 'cha' ba'i gtan tshigs skye ba dang rga shi dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes
analyzed: rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pas de la chos 'di pa la sogs pas smra ba gang dag 'khor ba ngo bo nyid yod par dam 'cha' ba'i gtan tshigs skye ba dang rga shi dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes
translated: cyclic existence exists inherently possess birth and aging and death is notüîΩestablished.üîΩIf the argument is intended to establish this in an ultimate sense, then the

original: zer ba de dag gi gtan tshigs de don dam par bsgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid dang / dpe med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: zer ba de dag gi gtan tshigs de don dam par bsgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid dang / dpe med pa nyid yin la /
translated: reason is not established and there is no example.üîΩIf it is intended to establish this in a conventional sense, then the argument

original: kun rdzob tu bsgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid du yang 'gyur bas mi rung bar bstan to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bsgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid du yang 'gyur bas mi rung bar bstan to //
translated: is contradictory and therefore unacceptable.üîΩJust as the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous birth, etc., is not

original: ci ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'grub pa de ltar /
analyzed: ci ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'grub pa de ltar /
translated: established,üîΩthe following should be analyzed.üîΩThis shows that the thesis is a general one, to be analyzed in three ways.

original: 'di brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar brtag pa rnam pa gsum gyi dam bca' ba'i spyi bstan to de la re zhig brtag pa dngo po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar brtag pa rnam pa gsum gyi dam bca' ba'i spyi bstan to de la re zhig brtag pa dngo po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the actual analysis, it says:

original: gal te skye ba snga gyur la //
analyzed: gal te skye ba snga gyur la //
translated: If birth were prior,

original: rga shi'i phyi ba yin na ni //
analyzed: rga shi'i phyi ba yin na ni //
translated: If it were prior to aging and death,

original: gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: then, as the opponent asserts, etc.

original: de lta na glags yod pa'i tshig cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na glags yod pa'i tshig cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In that case, what is the point of the expression ‚Äúif it were‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir de lta na /üîΩskye ba rga shi med pa dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na / skye ba rga shi med pa dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúThere would be birth without aging and death,

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: and one would be born without having died.‚Äù

original: de la re zhig skye ba rga shi med par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir de lta na skye ba la rga shi'i ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la re zhig skye ba rga shi med par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir de lta na skye ba la rga shi'i ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, in order to demonstrate that birth would be without aging and death, he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, birth would be without the intrinsic reality of aging and death,

original: rga shi med par yang skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rga shi med par yang skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because one would be born without having died.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig gang med par skyes pa de la de'i ngo bo nyid med de dper na ba lang rta med par skyes pa de la de'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig gang med par skyes pa de la de'i ngo bo nyid med de dper na ba lang rta med par skyes pa de la de'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras
translated: In order to demonstrate the correctness of that, he says, ‚ÄúWhatever is born without that does not have the intrinsic reality of that, like a cow born without a horse does not have the intrinsic reality of a horse.‚Äù

original: te / gal te skye ba snga bar @253b gyur la rga shi 'phyi bar gyur na skye ba de la rga shi'i ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: te / gal te skye ba snga bar @253b gyur la rga shi 'phyi bar gyur na skye ba de la rga shi'i ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur te /
translated: If birth were first and aging and death were later, then that birth would not have the intrinsic reality of aging and death.

original: skye ba la rga shi med na de la phyis kyang rga shi 'ong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba la rga shi med na de la phyis kyang rga shi 'ong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If birth were without aging and death, then later aging and death would not come to it.

original: ci ste 'ong na ni rga shi gzhi med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'ong na ni rga shi gzhi med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they did come, then aging and death would be without a basis.

original: ci ste 'ongs su zin na yang skye ba de la rga shi ci yang byar med de /
analyzed: ci ste 'ongs su zin na yang skye ba de la rga shi ci yang byar med de /
translated: But if they did come, then aging and death would do nothing to that birth.

original: di la ngo bo nyid kyis rga shi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: di la ngo bo nyid kyis rga shi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would not have aging and death by intrinsic reality.

original: da ni ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir yang gzhan yang ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ni ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir yang gzhan yang ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that one would be born without dying, he says, Moreover, one would be born without dying.

original: sngar gzhan du ma shi ba kho nar skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sngar gzhan du ma shi ba kho nar skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because one would be born without having died in another life before.

original: 'di ltar skye ba snga bar brtags na skye ba der sngar gzhan du ma shi bar skyes bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba snga bar brtags na skye ba der sngar gzhan du ma shi bar skyes bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if birth were first, it would follow that one would be born without having died in another life before.

original: de lta na 'khor ba thog ma dang ldan par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta na 'khor ba thog ma dang ldan par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But that is unacceptable, because in that case cyclic existence would have a beginning.

original: de dag ni mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag ni mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They do not accept that.

original: skye ba rga shi med pa dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba rga shi med pa dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Birth, aging, and death would occur without a basis.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir mi 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir mi 'dod do //
translated: They do not accept that, because that is a statement that provides an opportunity for refutation.

original: skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba zhes bya ba dag gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba zhes bya ba dag gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristics of birth, aging, and death,

original: de la skye ba ni bskyed pa de ma byung ba las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba ni bskyed pa de ma byung ba las 'byung ba'o //
translated: he said, ‚ÄúHere, birth is the generation of that which did not previously exist.

original: rga ba ni lus yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rga ba ni lus yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Aging is the transformation of the body.

original: 'chi ba ni srog gi dbang po 'gag pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni srog gi dbang po 'gag pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Death is the cessation of the life force.‚Äù

original: de la 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir glags yod pa las bzlog pas rjes su dpag pa mngon te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir glags yod pa las bzlog pas rjes su dpag pa mngon te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, because that is a statement that provides an opportunity for refutation, the following inference is stated in order to refute the opportunity for refutation:üîΩBirth, aging, and death would occur without a basis.

original: skye ba rga shi med pa dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba rga shi med pa dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //
translated: One would be born without dying.

original: zhes bya ba de glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir de las bzlog pas skabs kyi don bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'di ltar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir de las bzlog pas skabs kyi don bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'di ltar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because this statement is open to dispute, the meaning of the present context should be inferred by way of the opposite of that statement.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / skye ba ni rga shi bas snga ba ma yin te de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me tsha ba bas snga ba ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / skye ba ni rga shi bas snga ba ma yin te de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me tsha ba bas snga ba ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Birth is not prior to aging and death, because it has that nature, just as heat is not prior to fire.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na me ni tsha ba de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir tshab bas snga ma yin pa de bzhin du skye ba yang rga shi de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rga shi bas snga ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na me ni tsha ba de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir tshab bas snga ma yin pa de bzhin du skye ba yang rga shi de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rga shi bas snga ba ma yin no //
translated: For example, just as heat is not prior to fire, because it has the nature of heat, so also birth is not prior to aging and death, because it has the nature of aging and death.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir ci ste skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas rga shi snga bar 'dod na de lta na yang /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir ci ste skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas rga shi snga bar 'dod na de lta na yang /
translated: But if you assert aging and death occur earlier,

original: gal te skye ba 'phyi gyur la /
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'phyi gyur la /
translated: then birth would occur later.

original: rga shi snga ba yin na ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: rga shi snga ba yin na ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: If aging and death occur earlier,

original: de lta na skyon @254a * //
analyzed: de lta na skyon @254a * //
translated: then birth would occur later.üîΩWhat is the error if one thinks, ‚ÄúIt is not suitable for those errors to occur‚Äù?

original: cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the error?

original: de'i phyir de lta na /üîΩskye ba med pa'i rga shi ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na / skye ba med pa'i rga shi ni //
translated: Therefore NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩHow could there be aging and death

original: rgyu med par ni ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu med par ni ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: without birth, without a cause?

original: smra ba gzhan dag kyang skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya bar 'dod pas de med na skye ba med pa'i rga shi rkyen med par ci ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: smra ba gzhan dag kyang skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya bar 'dod pas de med na skye ba med pa'i rga shi rkyen med par ci ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Other proponents of tenets assert that aging and death are called the condition of birth. Therefore, if that does not exist, how could aging and death occur without a cause, without birth?

original: skye ba med pa'i rga shi ni yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i rga shi ni yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: Aging and death without birth do not exist at all.

original: ma skyes pas gzhi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ma skyes pas gzhi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The intended meaning is that because they are not born, they are groundless.

original: de'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni rga shi ni skye ba bas snga bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni rga shi ni skye ba bas snga bar mi rigs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the measure of that, here the inference is: It is not logical that aging and death would precede birth,

original: de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir dper na gnas pa bzhin no zhes bya bar smras te /
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir dper na gnas pa bzhin no zhes bya bar smras te /
translated: because they occur when it exists, like, for example, endurance.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.

original: dper na gnas pa ni skye ba de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba bas snga bar mi rigs pa de bzhin du rga shi yang skye ba de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba bas snga bar mi rigs so//
analyzed: dper na gnas pa ni skye ba de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba bas snga bar mi rigs pa de bzhin du rga shi yang skye ba de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba bas snga bar mi rigs so//
translated: For example, it is not logical that endurance would precede birth because it occurs when birth exists. In the same way, it is not logical that aging and death would precede birth because they occur when birth exists.

original: brtag pa gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the third hypothesis, he says:

original: gal te skye ba ni rga shi dang rjes su 'brel bzhin kho nar yod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba ni rga shi dang rjes su 'brel bzhin kho nar yod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If birth were to exist in dependence on aging and death, there would be no error.üîΩBirth and aging and death

original: skye ba dang ni rga shi dag / lhan cig rung ba ma yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni rga shi dag / lhan cig rung ba ma yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: cannot reasonably occur together.

original: de lta na skyon ci 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na skyon ci 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the error if one does not assert that?üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / gang gi phyir de ltar rtog na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang gi phyir de ltar rtog na //
translated: If one imagines that,

original: skye bzhin pa na 'chi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa na 'chi 'gyur zhing //
translated: then that now arising would die,

original: gnyi ga rgyu med can du 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyi ga rgyu med can du 'gyur //
translated: and both would be causeless.

original: de gnyis ni dgag pa mi mthun pa yin pas skye ba zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni dgag pa mi mthun pa yin pas skye ba zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since those two are contradictory negations, arising would not even exist,

original: skye bzhin pa nyid na 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa nyid na 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that now arising would die.

original: de ltar skye ba med na snga ma bzhin du skye ba dang rga shi gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba med na snga ma bzhin du skye ba dang rga shi gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: If arising did not exist in that way, then, as before, both arising and aging and death would be causeless.

original: lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i phyir dper na skye ba'i rgyu rga shi ma yin pa de bzhin du de gnyis kyi rgyu yang skye ba ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i phyir dper na skye ba'i rgyu rga shi ma yin pa de bzhin du de gnyis kyi rgyu yang skye ba ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning is that, like the cause of birth, aging and death are not the cause of those two, because they occur simultaneously.

original: gal te skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig tu gyur na de lta na de skye bzhin pa nyid na 'chi bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gal te skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig tu gyur na de lta na de skye bzhin pa nyid na 'chi bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: If birth and aging and death occurred simultaneously, then that now arising would die. But that is unacceptable.

original: 'di ltar skye ba dang 'gag pa mi mthun pa gnyis gcig la dus gcig tu ci ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba dang 'gag pa mi mthun pa gnyis gcig la dus gcig tu ci ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: states of arising and ceasing occur at the same time in one thing?

original: yang gzhan yang gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, both would be causeless.

original: lhan cig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa med pas gcig gi rgyur gcig mi 'gyur bas de dag kyang mi 'dod @254b de /
analyzed: lhan cig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa med pas gcig gi rgyur gcig mi 'gyur bas de dag kyang mi 'dod @254b de /
translated: Because they would occur simultaneously, they would not be mutually dependent. Since one would not be the cause of the other, this is unacceptable.

original: slob dpon 'jig byed kyis kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'jig byed kyis kyang /
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya BhƒÅviveka also says:

original: gal te las las lus skyes la //
analyzed: gal te las las lus skyes la //
translated: If the body arises from karma,

original: lus ma gtogs par las med na //üîΩsngon lus las las ma skyes pa //
analyzed: lus ma gtogs par las med na // sngon lus las las ma skyes pa //
translated: and karma does not exist apart from the body,üîΩthen from what cause would the body arise

original: gang gi rgyus ni skyes par gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi rgyus ni skyes par gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: that did not arise from karma in the past?

original: gal te lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: If you say that coemergent states are causes,

original: mtshan dang dpe byed dang skyes bu chen po bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pas skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig nyid du rtog pa gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa de ma nges
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byed dang skyes bu chen po bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pas skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig nyid du rtog pa gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa de ma nges
translated: Madhyamaka argument that birth and aging and death occur simultaneously

original: par sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /üîΩde dag na re dper na mtshan nyid mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dag dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi skyes bu chen po dag lhan cig tu byung ba yin yang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i tshul gyis phan tshun rgyu nyid yin par mthong bas des na cir zhig lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba dang /
analyzed: par sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te / de dag na re dper na mtshan nyid mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dag dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi skyes bu chen po dag lhan cig tu byung ba yin yang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i tshul gyis phan tshun rgyu nyid yin par mthong bas des na cir zhig lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba dang /
translated: is not established.üîΩThey say that, for example, the characteristics and the secondary signsüîΩand the basis possessing those characteristics, the major marks, occurüîΩsimultaneously, but they are seen to be mutually causal in the sense that the

original: rga shi gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rga shi gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ram /
translated: characteristics are the causes of the basis possessing those characteristics. Therefore, why would birth and aging and death be causeless just because theyüîΩoccur simultaneously?

original: 'on te lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag bzhin du phan tshun rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba ma nges pas dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa de ni 'grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag bzhin du phan tshun rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba ma nges pas dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa de ni 'grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: The Madhyamikas say that this is not certain, and so their argument is established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni lan ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni lan ma yin te /
translated: This is not a response.üîΩBecause the refutation has already been presented.

original: dgag pa sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dgag pa sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Previously, it was said:

original: sngar / 'dod chags dang ni chags pa dag / lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
analyzed: sngar / 'dod chags dang ni chags pa dag / lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
translated: It is illogical for attachment and one who is attached to arise simultaneously.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags chags pa dang // phan tshun ltos pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags chags pa dang // phan tshun ltos pa med par 'gyur //
translated: In that case, attachment and one who is attached would be independent of each other.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dgag pa'i skabs su bstan zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dgag pa'i skabs su bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, in the context of refuting co-arisen causes, it was said:

original: de'i phyir yang skye ba dang rga shi dag la lhan cig nyid mi srid do zhes bya ba ni brtag pa gsum pa'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang skye ba dang rga shi dag la lhan cig nyid mi srid do zhes bya ba ni brtag pa gsum pa'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is also impossible for birth and aging and death to occur simultaneously. This concludes the third chapter.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brtag na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brtag na /
translated: Therefore, when one examines in this way,

original: gang la snga phyi lhan cig gi / rim pa de dag mi srid pa'i //
analyzed: gang la snga phyi lhan cig gi / rim pa de dag mi srid pa'i //
translated: how can one proliferate

original: skye ba de dang rga shi de //
analyzed: skye ba de dang rga shi de //
translated: birth and aging-death

original: ci yi phyir na spros par byed //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na spros par byed //
translated: which do not have a sequence of prior, posterior, or simultaneous?

original: don dam par de dag spros par bya ba mi rigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: don dam par de dag spros par bya ba mi rigs pa kho na ste /
translated: In reality, it is not at all reasonable to proliferate them,üîΩbecause they are not produced.

original: de dag ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni brtag pa gsum char gyi mjug bsdu ba ste /üîΩ'di ltar rigs pa sngon du btang ste brtags nas skye ba gang dang rga shi gang la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi srid cing med pa de la khyod skye ba ni de yin /üîΩrga shi ni de yin zhes ci'i phyir spros par @255a * //
analyzed: de dag ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni brtag pa gsum char gyi mjug bsdu ba ste / 'di ltar rigs pa sngon du btang ste brtags nas skye ba gang dang rga shi gang la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi srid cing med pa de la khyod skye ba ni de yin / rga shi ni de yin zhes ci'i phyir spros par @255a * //
translated: This is the conclusion of all three examinations.üîΩThus, when one examines with prior reasoning, how can one proliferateüîΩand say, ‚ÄúThis is birth and that is aging-death‚Äù with regard to birth and

original: byed cing rjod par byed de /
analyzed: byed cing rjod par byed de /
translated: aging-death which do not have a sequence of prior, posterior, or simultaneous?üîΩIn reality, it is not at all reasonable to proliferate them,

original: don dam par de dag spros par bya bar mi rigs pa kho na ste de dag ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: don dam par de dag spros par bya bar mi rigs pa kho na ste de dag ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because they are not produced.

original: de ltar 'khor ba bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs skye ba dang rga shi dang ldan pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyen gyi lan gdab par dka'o zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs skye ba dang rga shi dang ldan pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyen gyi lan gdab par dka'o zhes bya ba ni
translated: Thus, since the reason proving cyclic existence ‚Äî that is, possessing birth, aging, and death ‚Äî is not established, it is difficult to respond to the opponent‚Äôs argument that the meaning of the reason stated in the first chapter is not established.

original: spyi'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: spyi'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the general result of the valid cognition.

original: da ni slob dpon gyis skye ba la sogs pa dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag yod par mi 'thad pa bzhin du dngos po lhag ma rnams la yang 'dra bar bstan par bzhed nas bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyis skye ba la sogs pa dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag yod par mi 'thad pa bzhin du dngos po lhag ma rnams la yang 'dra bar bstan par bzhed nas bshad pa /
translated: Now the master wishes to show that just as the sequence of earlier, later, and simultaneous are not tenable for arising and so on, the same is true for the remaining things.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //
translated: Cause and effect,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni mtshan gzhi nyid //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni mtshan gzhi nyid //
translated: Characteristic and characterized,

original: tshor dang tshor po nyid dang ni //
analyzed: tshor dang tshor po nyid dang ni //
translated: Feeling and the feeler,

original: don yod gang dag ci yang rung //
analyzed: don yod gang dag ci yang rung //
translated: Whatever exists,

original: zhes bya bas ni ci ltar brtags na skye ba dang rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni ci ltar brtags na skye ba dang rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pa de bzhin du /
translated: This verse shows that just as the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous is untenable for birth and aging and death,üîΩso too, the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous is untenable for all other things that are imagined to be different objects by other schools, such as cause and effect, characteristic and characterized, feeling and the one who feels, and the object and the subject.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / tshor ba dang tshor ba po dang / pha rol po dag gis don gzhan gang dag yod par brtags pa de dag thams cad la yang snga phyi dang / lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad par 'dra bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / tshor ba dang tshor ba po dang / pha rol po dag gis don gzhan gang dag yod par brtags pa de dag thams cad la yang snga phyi dang / lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad par 'dra bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.

original: don yod gang dag ci yang rung //
analyzed: don yod gang dag ci yang rung //
translated: The verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.

original: zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩtshad ma dang / gzhal bya dang / shes pa dang shes bya dang / grol ba dang thar pa'i mtshan nyid dag go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir / tshad ma dang / gzhal bya dang / shes pa dang shes bya dang / grol ba dang thar pa'i mtshan nyid dag go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.

original: de dag la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad par 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩ'khor ba 'ba' zhig sngon gyi mtha'//
analyzed: de dag la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad par 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩ'khor ba 'ba' zhig sngon gyi mtha'//
translated: The verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúIf any existent thing‚Äù is stated to demonstrate this point.

original: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
translated: But it is not that it does not exist.

original: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang /
analyzed: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang /
translated: All things

original: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod ma yin //
translated: Do not have a beginning.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩgang gi phyir de ltar yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du brtags na dngos po thams cad la snga phyi dang / lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'khor ba 'ba' zhig la sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin par ma zad kyi dngos por 'dod pa thams cad la sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin pas dngos por snang ba ni sgyu ma dang smig
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te / gang gi phyir de ltar yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du brtags na dngos po thams cad la snga phyi dang / lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'khor ba 'ba' zhig la sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin par ma zad kyi dngos por 'dod pa thams cad la sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin pas dngos por snang ba ni sgyu ma dang smig
translated: This is what he said.

original: rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / gzugs brnyan bzhin du ma grub par bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / gzugs brnyan bzhin du ma grub par bstan to //
translated: Since, when properly analyzed in this way, the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous are untenable for all things, therefore not only does cyclic existence alone not have a beginning, but also all things that are asserted to be entities do not have a beginning. Therefore it is demonstrated that all things that appear as entities are like illusions, mirages, cities of gandharvas, and reflections‚Äîthey are not established.

original: de la re zhig 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu @255b dang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i dbang du byas nas phyogs tsam zhig bshad par bya ste zhes bya bas ni de dag la snga phyi dang / lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu @255b dang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i dbang du byas nas phyogs tsam zhig bshad par bya ste zhes bya bas ni de dag la snga phyi dang / lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: Here, first, a mere portion will be explained in terms of cause and effect, characteristic and characterized, and so on.

original: don dam par 'bru ni myu gu'i snga na yod pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par 'bru ni myu gu'i snga na yod pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúOne should understand that ultimately the seed does not exist prior to the sprout‚Äù teaches that the order of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous are untenable.

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i snga rol na med par ston te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i snga rol na med par ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is the effect, like the self of the sprout‚Äù teaches that it does not exist prior to the cause.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na myu gu ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid kyi snga na yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sa bon 'bru yang sa la sogs pa rkyen gzhan gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir myu gu'i snga na yod pa ma yin par shes
analyzed: dper na myu gu ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid kyi snga na yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sa bon 'bru yang sa la sogs pa rkyen gzhan gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir myu gu'i snga na yod pa ma yin par shes
translated: For example, because a sprout is an effect, it does not exist prior to itself. In the same way, it should be understood that a seed, a grain of rice, for example, does not exist prior to a sprout because it is an effect that is dependent on other conditions, such as soil.üîΩIf you say that the effect that arises earlier in a different continuum is not ascertained,

original: par bya'o // gal te rgyud tha dad pa'i 'bras bu dus sngar byung ba dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag / dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du skyon 'dogsüîΩpa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: par bya'o // gal te rgyud tha dad pa'i 'bras bu dus sngar byung ba dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag / dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: this is the opponent‚Äôs words that state the fault that the reason of the Madhyamaka, ‚Äúbecause it is an effect,‚Äù is not ascertained.

original: de dag nas 'jig rten na rgyu se'u 'bru la sogs pa'i sa bon rgyud tha dad pa dag 'bras bu nas kyi myu gu'i snga rol na yod par mthong bas des na ci re zhig 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin
analyzed: de dag nas 'jig rten na rgyu se'u 'bru la sogs pa'i sa bon rgyud tha dad pa dag 'bras bu nas kyi myu gu'i snga rol na yod par mthong bas des na ci re zhig 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin
translated: In the world, seeds of different continua, such as mango seeds, are seen to exist prior to the effect, the mango sprout. Therefore, you might say, ‚ÄúIs it the case that the effect that arises later in a different continuum, such as a mango sprout, does not exist prior to the seed of a different continuum, such as a grain of rice?

original: du sa bon 'bru myu gu'i snga na yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: du sa bon 'bru myu gu'i snga na yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: Or, because it is an effect, like the effect of a different continuum, would the seed exist prior to the sprout?

original: 'on te 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa'i 'bras bu dus sngar byung ba dag bzhin du 'bras bu snga na yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa'i 'bras bu dus sngar byung ba dag bzhin du 'bras bu snga na yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
