translated: Since it is not definite, the Madhyamaka reason is not suitable.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /üîΩde dag kyang don dam par de bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis / de dag kyang don dam par de bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:üîΩSince they are also ultimately refuted in that way, there is no counterexample, so it is not indefinite.

original: rgyud tha dad pa'i rgyu de dag kyang don dam par 'bras bu'i snga rol du med par bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa'i rgyu de dag kyang don dam par 'bras bu'i snga rol du med par bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since those causes of different continua are also ultimately refuted as not existing prior to their effects, there is no counterexample, so it is not indefinite.

original: ci ste 'bras bu rgyu bas snga bar 'dod na yang don dam par 'bras bu rgyu bas snga bar 'dod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu rgyu bas snga bar 'dod na yang don dam par 'bras bu rgyu bas snga bar 'dod par mi bya ste /
translated: But if you maintain that the effect is prior to the cause, then you should not maintain that the effect is ultimately prior to the cause.üîΩBecause the error of causelessness would ensue.

original: rgyu med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu rgyu'i snga rol na med par ston te //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu rgyu'i snga rol na med par ston te //
translated: This shows that the effect does not exist prior to the cause.

original: gal te 'bras bu rgyu bas snga bar @256a * //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu rgyu bas snga bar @256a * //
translated: If the effect were prior to the cause,

original: gyur na 'bras bu rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu yod na yang rgyus ci bya ste rgyur brtags pa don med pa nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyur na 'bras bu rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu yod na yang rgyus ci bya ste rgyur brtags pa don med pa nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the effect would be without a cause, and if the effect exists, what would the cause do? It follows that the imputation of a cause would be meaningless.üîΩThose who say that the effect exists prior to the cause in the sense of being manifest are refuted by the following passage:üîΩ‚ÄúThose who say that the effect exists prior to the cause in the sense of being manifest‚Äù and so on.

original: gang dag rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid gsal bar byed do zhes zer ba de dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grangs can dag rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa rkyen rnams kyis phyis gsal bar byed
analyzed: gang dag rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid gsal bar byed do zhes zer ba de dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grangs can dag rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa rkyen rnams kyis phyis gsal bar byed
translated: The Samkhyas say that the effect exists prior to the cause in the sense of being its potency, and that conditions manifest it later.

original: do zhes zer ba'i gzhung 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: do zhes zer ba'i gzhung 'gog par byed do //
translated: This is refuted by the following passage.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed par mi 'thad de de dag zhig pas de 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na 'jim pa la sogs pa zhig pas bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed par mi 'thad de de dag zhig pas de 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na 'jim pa la sogs pa zhig pas bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is untenable that conditions clarify an effect because it would be destroyed by the disintegration of those conditions, just as a pot is destroyed by the disintegration of clay and so on.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na 'bras bu bum pa ni rkyen 'jim pa la sogs pa dag zhig cing med na 'jig cing mi 'byung ba'i phyir rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu myu gu yang rkyen sa bon la sogs pa zhig cing med
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na 'bras bu bum pa ni rkyen 'jim pa la sogs pa dag zhig cing med na 'jig cing mi 'byung ba'i phyir rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu myu gu yang rkyen sa bon la sogs pa zhig cing med
translated: The subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, since an effect, a pot, is destroyed and does not occur if its conditions, such as clay, disintegrate and do not exist, conditions do not clarify it.

original: na 'jig cing mi 'byung ba'i phyir rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: na 'jig cing mi 'byung ba'i phyir rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed par mi 'thad do //
translated: In the same way, since an effect, a sprout, is destroyed and does not occur if its conditions, such as a seed, disintegrate and do not exist, it is untenable that conditions clarify it.

original: gang zhig gang gis gsal bar byed pa de ni de zhig pas 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis gsal bar byed pa de ni de zhig pas 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which is clarified by something is not destroyed by the disintegration of that thing.

original: dper na nyi ma dang / nor bu dang / mar me dang / sman gyi 'od zhig pas gsal bar bya ba khri'u dang / gtan pa dag zhig par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen nyi ma la sogs pa'i 'od dag zhig cing med pas ni gsal bar bya ba'i 'bras bu khri'u dang /üîΩgtan pa la sogs pa dag 'jig cing med par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma dang / nor bu dang / mar me dang / sman gyi 'od zhig pas gsal bar bya ba khri'u dang / gtan pa dag zhig par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen nyi ma la sogs pa'i 'od dag zhig cing med pas ni gsal bar bya ba'i 'bras bu khri'u dang / gtan pa la sogs pa dag 'jig cing med par mi 'gyur la /
translated: For example, it should be said that the light of the sun, jewels, lamps and medicine does not cease and does not perish when the objects illuminated, such as a bed, a measuring vessel and so on, cease and perish.üîΩThe light of the sun and so on, which are the conditions that illuminate, does not cease and does not perish when the effects that are illuminated, such as a bed, a measuring vessel and so on, cease and perish.

original: rkyen sa bon la sogs pa dag zhig cing med pas ni 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa dag 'jig cing med par 'gyur bas 'bras bu rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar mi byed par mngon pa'i dpe bstan to //
analyzed: rkyen sa bon la sogs pa dag zhig cing med pas ni 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa dag 'jig cing med par 'gyur bas 'bras bu rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar mi byed par mngon pa'i dpe bstan to //
translated: But the effect, such as a sprout, ceases and perishes when the conditions, such as a seed, cease and perish. This is the example that demonstrates that the effect is not illuminated by the conditions.

original: gsal ba yang sngon ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni grangs can rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa phyis rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed pas 'bras @256b bu sngaüîΩna yod pa yin no zhes zer ba'i gzhung sun dbyung ba ston te /
analyzed: gsal ba yang sngon ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni grangs can rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa phyis rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed pas 'bras @256b bu snga na yod pa yin no zhes zer ba'i gzhung sun dbyung ba ston te /
translated: This shows that the SƒÅ·πÉkhya position is refuted because the effect exists in the cause in the manner of a potency and later conditions manifest it.

original: 'bras bu gsal ba zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid rgyu la snga na med pa las phyis rkyen gyi mthus byung ba'i phyir des na khyed 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu snga na yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu gsal ba zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid rgyu la snga na med pa las phyis rkyen gyi mthus byung ba'i phyir des na khyed 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu snga na yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The effect called manifest has an essence that did not exist previously in the cause but later arises through the power of conditions. Therefore, as you assert, the effect does not exist before.

original: sangs rgyas pa dag 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu sngon ma byung ba las phyis rkyen gyi mthus byung bar smra ba'i gzhung ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dag 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu sngon ma byung ba las phyis rkyen gyi mthus byung bar smra ba'i gzhung ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: The treatise states that the effect arises from what did not exist previously through the power of conditions.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus mnyam pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus mnyam pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that cause and effect are simultaneous,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag na re gang gi dus kho na'i tshe rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du yod pa kho na'i dus na rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed pa nges na rgyu la 'bras bu
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag na re gang gi dus kho na'i tshe rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du yod pa kho na'i dus na rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed pa nges na rgyu la 'bras bu
translated: That is illogical.üîΩIf the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that when the effect exists in the potential state in the cause, at that time the conditions definitely manifest it, then the effect

original: snga na yod pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: snga na yod pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: would exist in the cause, just as it does prior to the conditions.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dus mnyam pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dus mnyam pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that the cause and effect are simultaneous.

original: ci ste lhan cig tu'o zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste lhan cig tu'o zhe na /
translated: But if they are simultaneous,

original: de lta na yang don dam par 'bru dang myu gu lhan cig tu 'byung ba dag / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ste lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir dper na ba lang gi rva dag bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan
analyzed: de lta na yang don dam par 'bru dang myu gu lhan cig tu 'byung ba dag / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ste lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir dper na ba lang gi rva dag bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan
translated: then in that case, ultimately, the seed and sprout would arise simultaneously, and it would be illogical for them to be the entities of cause and effect, because they would arise simultaneously, just like the two horns of an ox.

original: cig tu 'byung ba dgag pa ston te /
analyzed: cig tu 'byung ba dgag pa ston te /
translated: This shows the refutation of cause and effect arising simultaneously.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na ba lang gi rva dag lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ba de bzhin du 'bru dang myu gu dag kyang lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ste //
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi rva dag lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ba de bzhin du 'bru dang myu gu dag kyang lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ste //
translated: For example, since the horns of a cow arise simultaneously, they are not suitable as cause and effect. Likewise, since the seed and sprout arise simultaneously, they are not suitable as cause and effect.

original: ci ste rgyu dang 'bras bu dag lhan cig tu 'gyur na gnyi ga rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ba dang / rgyu 'bras bu la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur ba dang 'bras bu yang rgyu la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu dang 'bras bu dag lhan cig tu 'gyur na gnyi ga rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ba dang / rgyu 'bras bu la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur ba dang 'bras bu yang rgyu la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur bas /
translated: If cause and effect were simultaneous, they would both be causeless, and the cause would be established from itself alone, without depending on the effect, and the effect would be established from itself alone, without depending on the cause.

original: de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But that is untenable.

original: de bzhin du lkog shal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bas snga bar mi 'dod de gzhi med pa'i phyir dper na ri mo rtsig pa bas snga ba ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid snga ba ma yin par ston
analyzed: de bzhin du lkog shal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bas snga bar mi 'dod de gzhi med pa'i phyir dper na ri mo rtsig pa bas snga ba ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid snga ba ma yin par ston
translated: This demonstrates that the characteristics are not prior.

original: to // de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: to // de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason and the example.

original: dper na ri mo rtsig pa bas snga bar gyur na gzhi med pa'i phyir rtsig pa bas snga ba ma yin pa de bzhin du @257a * //
analyzed: dper na ri mo rtsig pa bas snga bar gyur na gzhi med pa'i phyir rtsig pa bas snga ba ma yin pa de bzhin du @257a * //
translated: For example, if a painting were prior to a wall, it would be without a basis and thus not prior to the wall.

original: lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bas snga bar gyur na gzhi med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bas snga ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bas snga bar gyur na gzhi med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bas snga ba ma yin no //
translated: So too, if the characteristics of the dewlap and so on were prior to the basis of those characteristics, they would be without a basis and thus not prior to the basis of those characteristics.

original: de bzhin du mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid yin pas snga bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid yin pas snga bar mi rigs te /
translated: So too, it is illogical that the basis of those characteristics is prior to the characteristics.

original: lkog shal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu chen po nyid skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams pas snga bar mi rigs pa dang / sa nyid srab bas snga bar mi rigs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi snga ba ma yin par ston te /üîΩde dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na skyes bu chen po nyid dang / sa nyid ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid pas snga bar mi rigs pa de bzhin du /üîΩmtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang yang /
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu chen po nyid skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams pas snga bar mi rigs pa dang / sa nyid srab bas snga bar mi rigs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi snga ba ma yin par ston te / de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na skyes bu chen po nyid dang / sa nyid ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid pas snga bar mi rigs pa de bzhin du / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang yang /
translated: For example, it is illogical that the state of being a great man precedes the marks of a great man, and it is illogical that the state of being the earth precedes the solidity of the earth.üîΩThese are, respectively, the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, the state of being a great man and the state of being the earth are not preceded by their marks because they are the basis of those marks.üîΩIn the same way, the basis of those marks, the cow,üîΩis not preceded by its marks.üîΩ

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag pas snga bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag pas snga bar mi rigs so //
translated: For example, it is illogical that the state of being a great man precedes the marks of a great man, and it is illogical that the state of being a great man precedes the marks of a great original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi lhan cig tu byung ba dag kyang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid du mi 'dod de lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir dper na dri dang ro lhan cig tu byung ba dag bzhin no zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi lhan cig tu byung ba dag kyang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid du mi 'dod de lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir dper na dri dang ro lhan cig tu byung ba dag bzhin no zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid
translated: And characteristics and the basis of those characteristics do not occur simultaneously, because they are coemergent, like smell and taste that are coemergent.

original: dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag lhan cig nyid du mi 'thad par ston te /
analyzed: dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag lhan cig nyid du mi 'thad par ston te /
translated: This demonstrates that it is untenable that characteristics and the basis of those characteristics are coemergent.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The basis of those characteristics and the characteristic itself are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical argument and the example.

original: dper na dri dang ro lhan cig tu byang ba dag ni lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid du mi 'dod pa de bzhin du mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi lhan cig tu byung ba dag kyang lhan cig tu 'byung
analyzed: dper na dri dang ro lhan cig tu byang ba dag ni lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid du mi 'dod pa de bzhin du mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi lhan cig tu byung ba dag kyang lhan cig tu 'byung
translated: Just as smell and taste that are coemergent are not asserted to be the characteristic and the basis of those characteristics because they are coemergent, so too characteristics and the basis of those characteristics that are coemergent are not asserted to be the characteristic and the basis of those characteristics because they are coemergent.

original: ba'i phyir / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ba'i phyir / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid du mi 'dod de /
translated: The characteristic and the basis of the characteristic are not accepted.

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag lhan cig tu gyur na gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba dang / mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur ba dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag lhan cig tu gyur na gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba dang / mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur ba dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: If the characteristic and the basis of the characteristic were simultaneous, both would be causeless, and the characteristic would not depend on the basis of the characteristic, and it would be fully established from itself, and the basis of the characteristic would not depend on the characteristic, and it would be fully established from itself. But that is unacceptable.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya bas ni tshor ba dang tshor ba po dang / tshad ma dang / @257b gzhal bya dang / shes pa dang / shes bya dang / grol ba dang / thar ba dag snga phyi dang lhan cig tu mi 'thad pa yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bstan to //
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya bas ni tshor ba dang tshor ba po dang / tshad ma dang / @257b gzhal bya dang / shes pa dang / shes bya dang / grol ba dang / thar ba dag snga phyi dang lhan cig tu mi 'thad pa yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúAs before‚Äù means that feeling and the feeler, valid knowledge and the object of valid knowledge, consciousness and the object of consciousness, liberation and the liberated one are not tenable as sequential, simultaneous, or not different.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol bos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol bos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin
translated: The meaning of this chapter is to show that cyclic existence is essenceless by stating the faults of the opponent's argument in the first chapter.üîΩThis is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: te / 'khor ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur blta ba ni pha rol pos phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por don dam par
analyzed: te / 'khor ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur blta ba ni pha rol pos phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por don dam par
translated: In this chapter, the eleventh chapter of the Treatise on the Middle Way, the meaning of the chapter should be seen as the result of the valid cognition.

original: phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The opponent argues that the aggregates and so on exist.üîΩIn the first chapter of this treatise, the opponent argues that the aggregates and so on exist ultimately.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'i sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'i sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Transcendent Lord has taught the name and the distinction, and in order to eliminate that, he has taught the esoteric instructions.üîΩWhat is the benefit of teaching that the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous is untenable for all things such as cyclic existence?

original: 'khor ba la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad par bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad par bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the claim of others that this is merely a dry treatise of sophistry,

original: 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: we prove this point by means of a scriptural citation that inspires confidence.

original: de'i phyir theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i mtha' gzhan dag las de bzhin du 'di la 'ga' yang 'khor bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i mtha' gzhan dag las de bzhin du 'di la 'ga' yang 'khor bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Thus, in other scriptures of the Mahayana, it says, ‚ÄúIn this regard, no one cycles in cyclic existence,

original: mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur /
translated: and no one attains nirvana.‚Äù

original: kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur /
translated: One will not be afflicted.üîΩOne will not be purified.

original: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: And similarly, the Questions of Brahma Vi≈õe·π£a-cinti S≈´tra says:

original: tshangs pa das 'khor ba yang ma dmigs /
analyzed: tshangs pa das 'khor ba yang ma dmigs /
translated: Brahma, I do not observe cyclic existence,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma dmigs so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma dmigs so //
translated: nor do I observe nirvana.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba 'dogs par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang 'khor bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba 'dogs par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang 'khor bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: The Tathagata designates cyclic existence, but no one cycles in it.üîΩThe Tathagata designates nirvana, but no one attains nirvana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dogs par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal @258a * //üîΩgyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /

translated: This is a syllogistic application, because the BhagavƒÅn stated in the s≈´tra that teaches the three and eight types of suffering: ‚ÄúIn brief, the five appropriated aggregates are suffering.‚ÄùüîΩAnd the Treasury of Abhidharma also states:üîΩThe five aggregates are suffering,üîΩthe origin of suffering, the world,

analyzed: phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung ba dang 'jig rten dang // lta ba'i gnas dang srid pa yin //

translated: Having presented the opponent‚Äôs position, he states the following verses.üîΩSome say that suffering is self-produced.üîΩSome say that suffering is produced by another.

original: kha cig ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas byas par 'dod /
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas byas par 'dod /
translated: Some say that suffering is produced by both.

original: kha cig ni rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod de rnam pa du mar rnam par brtags pa'i sdug bsngal de ni bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyis dang / rgyu med pa dag gis las su bya ba'i 'bras bur mi rung bas yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod de rnam pa du mar rnam par brtags pa'i sdug bsngal de ni bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyis dang / rgyu med pa dag gis las su bya ba'i 'bras bur mi rung bas yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Some assert that it arises without a cause. That suffering, which is imagined in many ways, is not real because it is not suitable as an effect that is an object of action by a self, another, both, or without a cause.

original: pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub pa nyid du dam bca' ba rnam pa bzhi ston to //
analyzed: pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub pa nyid du dam bca' ba rnam pa bzhi ston to //
translated: He shows the four theses that the opponent‚Äôs reason is not established.üîΩHow?

original: ci ltar zhe na zhes bya ba ni brtag pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag ji ltar mi 'thad ces 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na zhes bya ba ni brtag pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag ji ltar mi 'thad ces 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This phrase asks, ‚ÄúHow are those four types of imagination not tenable?‚Äù

original: de la re zhig dam bca' ba dang po bstan pa'i phyir de la re zhig ci ltar don dam par sdug bsngal ba dag gis byas par mi rung ba de ltar 'di bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig dam bca' ba dang po bstan pa'i phyir de la re zhig ci ltar don dam par sdug bsngal ba dag gis byas par mi rung ba de ltar 'di bstan par bya ste /
translated: To explain the first thesis, he says, ‚ÄúFirst, it should be shown how, ultimately, it is not suitable for suffering to be self-produced.‚Äù

original: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
translated: If it were produced by itself,

original: de'i phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur /
translated: it would not arise in dependence.

original: gang gi phyir bdag gis byas pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de la brten nas byung ba nyid kyi chos med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag gis byas pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de la brten nas byung ba nyid kyi chos med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Because what is self-produced is not produced by causes and conditions, therefore it is said that the property of being produced in dependence does not exist.

original: de ni mi 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: But this is unacceptable, etc.

original: 'o na ci ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then what is it that you accept?

original: @260a * // brten nas byung ba nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: @260a * // brten nas byung ba nyid du 'dod de /
translated: We accept the property of being produced in dependence.

original: 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi chos brten nas byung ba nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi chos brten nas byung ba nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This shows that the property of being produced in dependence is the property of the phenomenon of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i chos ni brten nas byung ba nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i chos ni brten nas byung ba nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: The property of the phenomenon of suffering that is established as not self-produced is shown to be the property of being produced in dependence.

original: gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
analyzed: gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
translated: Because those aggregates

original: brten nas phung po de dag 'byung //
analyzed: brten nas phung po de dag 'byung //
translated: arise in dependence on these aggregates.

original: gang gi phyir da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag la brten nas 'byung bar 'dod pa'i phung po de dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag la brten nas 'byung bar 'dod pa'i phung po de dag 'byung ste /
translated: Because those aggregates that are asserted to arise in dependence on these present aggregates arise.

original: gang ge phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i don du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang ge phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù should be regarded as having the meaning ‚Äúsince.‚Äù

original: de ltar na de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Thus, this is a statement of a similar example that has a property in common.

original: da ltar gyi sdug bsngal 'di sngon gyi rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas byung ba nyid yin pas bdag gis byas pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe ni da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag la brten nas /
analyzed: da ltar gyi sdug bsngal 'di sngon gyi rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas byung ba nyid yin pas bdag gis byas pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe ni da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag la brten nas /
translated: Since the present suffering arises in dependence on past causes and conditions, it is established that it is not self-created. The similar example that has a property in common is the present continuum of aggregates.

original: da ltar gyi phung po'i rgyun phyi ma dag 'byung ba yin par bstan te //
analyzed: da ltar gyi phung po'i rgyun phyi ma dag 'byung ba yin par bstan te //
translated: The present continuum of aggregates arises in dependence on the present aggregates.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga ni byed pa po lhas byin dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga ni byed pa po lhas byin dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the inference here is as follows: Ultimately, the five aggregates called ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äù are not associated with the agent Devadatta.

original: brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na srid pa gcig tu gtogs pa'i phung po lnga po phyi ma dag phung po lnga po snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na srid pa gcig tu gtogs pa'i phung po lnga po phyi ma dag phung po lnga po snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because they arise in dependence, like the later five aggregates belonging to one existence arise from the cause of the earlier five aggregates.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na da ltar gyi srid pa gcig tu gtogs pa'i phung po lnga po'i rgyun phyi ma dag ni da ltar gyi phung po lnga po'i rgyu na snga ma la brten nas byung ba'i phyir byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na da ltar gyi srid pa gcig tu gtogs pa'i phung po lnga po'i rgyun phyi ma dag ni da ltar gyi phung po lnga po'i rgyu na snga ma la brten nas byung ba'i phyir byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason and the example.üîΩFor example, the continuum of the five aggregates belonging to one existence in the present arises in dependence on the earlier five aggregates of the present, because they arise in dependence on the earlier five aggregates.

original: lhas byin zhes bya ba'i da ltar gyi phung po lnga po dag kyang tshe snga ma'i rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas byung ba'i phyir byed pa po lhas byin nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhas byin zhes bya ba'i da ltar gyi phung po lnga po dag kyang tshe snga ma'i rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas byung ba'i phyir byed pa po lhas byin nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the five aggregates of the present called Lhejin arise in dependence on the causes and conditions of his past lives, therefore they are not possessed by the creator Lhejin himself.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore suffering is not self-produced.

original: yang na tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma shos de nyid mu stegs bye brag pa dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: yang na tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma shos de nyid mu stegs bye brag pa dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Or, the earlier verse is stated from the perspective of refuting the tenets of the tƒ´rthikas, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad pa'i phyir yang na bye brag pa dag na re lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs dag zhig kyang bdag ni mi 'jig la de yang kho bo cag gi phyogs la byed pa po de dang bcas pa nyid du gnas pa gcig pu @260b yin pas de'i phyir des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag gis byas pa zhes byar rung gi /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad pa'i phyir yang na bye brag pa dag na re lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs dag zhig kyang bdag ni mi 'jig la de yang kho bo cag gi phyogs la byed pa po de dang bcas pa nyid du gnas pa gcig pu @260b yin pas de'i phyir des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag gis byas pa zhes byar rung gi /
translated: Or, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that although the collection of body, sense faculties, and mind disintegrates, the self does not disintegrate. Since it is a permanent unitary entity that exists in our position, it is suitable to say that the suffering produced by it is self-produced.

original: gang la 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i dad can yin pa de la ni sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sdug bsngal skye ba de /
analyzed: gang la 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i dad can yin pa de la ni sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sdug bsngal skye ba de /
translated: But for those who assert that compounded phenomena disintegrate moment by moment, the suffering that arises in a moment of mind

original: byed pa po de dang ldan pa ma yin pas bdag gis byas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po de dang ldan pa ma yin pas bdag gis byas pa ma yin la /
translated: is not self-produced because it is not associated with that agent.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa mi srid pas gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa mi srid pas gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, actions are not committed by another.

original: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes zer bas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes zer bas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The conclusion contradicts the premise.

original: bye brag pa dag na re tshe snga ma'i lus dang dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs dag zhig kyang bdag ni mi 'jig la /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag na re tshe snga ma'i lus dang dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs dag zhig kyang bdag ni mi 'jig la /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that although the body, sense faculties, and collection of consciousnesses disintegrate in a previous life, the self does not disintegrate.

original: bdag de yang kho bo cag gi phyogs la las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i byed pa po yang yin zhing /
analyzed: bdag de yang kho bo cag gi phyogs la las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i byed pa po yang yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, in our system, the self is the agent of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: tshe snga ma'i bdag de tshe snga ma'i las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i byed pa po yang yin la /
analyzed: tshe snga ma'i bdag de tshe snga ma'i las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i byed pa po yang yin la /
translated: The self of the previous life is the agent of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions in the previous life.üîΩSince it is also the experiencer of the effects of those actions that abide in the body of the present life, the self of the present life is not different from the self of the previous life.

original: da ltar gyi lus la gnas pa'i za ba po yang yin pas da ltar gyi lus kyi bdag ni tshe snga ma'i bdag de dang bcas pa nyid du tha mi dad par gnas pa gcig bu yin pas de'i phyir bdag des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag gis
analyzed: da ltar gyi lus la gnas pa'i za ba po yang yin pas da ltar gyi lus kyi bdag ni tshe snga ma'i bdag de dang bcas pa nyid du tha mi dad par gnas pa gcig bu yin pas de'i phyir bdag des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag gis
translated: Therefore, the self experiences the suffering that it created in the previous life.

original: byas pa zhes byar rung gi / khyed sangs rgyas pa gang la 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jug pa'i dad can yin pa de la ni sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sdug bsngal skye ba de /
analyzed: byas pa zhes byar rung gi / khyed sangs rgyas pa gang la 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jug pa'i dad can yin pa de la ni sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sdug bsngal skye ba de /
translated: but for you Buddhists, who believe that compounded phenomena are momentary, the suffering that arises in a moment of mind

original: de nyid du 'gag pas skad cig ma phyi ma la byed pa po de dang ldan pa ma yin pas sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid du 'gag pas skad cig ma phyi ma la byed pa po de dang ldan pa ma yin pas sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin no //
translated: ceases in that very moment. Since the agent does not exist in the subsequent moment, suffering is not created by itself.

original: ci ste khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces skad cig ma snga ma la las byas pa'i 'bras bu skad cig ma phyi ma la myong bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: ci ste khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces skad cig ma snga ma la las byas pa'i 'bras bu skad cig ma phyi ma la myong bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: But if you Buddhists say that the effect of an action done in a previous moment is experienced in a subsequent moment, that is also not correct.

original: skad cig ma gzhan la sems gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la skad cig ma phyi ma'i sems kyis longs spyod pa mi srid pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gzhan la sems gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la skad cig ma phyi ma'i sems kyis longs spyod pa mi srid pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is impossible for the mind of a subsequent moment to experience the effect of an action done by another mind in another moment. Therefore suffering is not created by another.

original: bdag gis byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is created by itself.

original: ci ste khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces skad cig ma'i rgyun tha dad du zin kyang snga ma las byas pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma myong bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: ci ste khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces skad cig ma'i rgyun tha dad du zin kyang snga ma las byas pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma myong bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
translated: But if you Buddhists say, ‚ÄúEven though the continuum of moments is different, the effect of an action done in the past is experienced in the future,‚Äù

original: de yang khyed nyid kyis mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bas mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang khyed nyid kyis mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bas mi rung ste /
translated: then that is also unacceptable because it contradicts your own tenets.

original: 'di ltar khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha' las rang gis byas par myong bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung la /üîΩda ni skad cig ma snga ma la gzhan @261a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha' las rang gis byas par myong bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung la / da ni skad cig ma snga ma la gzhan @261a * //
translated: In this way, your tenets state, ‚ÄúOne experiences the effect of what one has done.‚ÄùüîΩNow, you say, ‚ÄúIn the subsequent moment, another experiences the effect of what was done in the previous moment.‚Äù

original: gyis byas pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma la gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur ro zhes zer bas khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyis byas pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma la gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur ro zhes zer bas khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, your assertion is undermined.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la byed pa po bdag brtag pa gcig pu des tshe snga ma'i lus kyi gnas skabs su las byas pa'i 'bras bu da ltar gyi lus kyi gnas skabs su myong pa ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa zhes byar rung ngoüîΩzhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la byed pa po bdag brtag pa gcig pu des tshe snga ma'i lus kyi gnas skabs su las byas pa'i 'bras bu da ltar gyi lus kyi gnas skabs su myong pa ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa zhes byar rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, in our system, it is correct to say that suffering is self-produced, since the self, the producer, is the single creator of the effect of the karma committed in the state of the body in a former life, which is experienced in the state of the body in the present life.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: de dag la yang de ni bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de dag la yang de ni bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that they are produced by that.

original: sdug bsngal de ni bya bar mi rung ste bdag de dang bcas pa nyid du gnas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de ni bya bar mi rung ste bdag de dang bcas pa nyid du gnas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That suffering is not tenable as produced because it is undermined by inference, since it exists together with that self.

original: bye brag pa dag gis brtags pa'i byed pa po bdag brtag pa gcig pu de nyid byed pa po nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir des sdug bsngal de bya bar mi rung bas sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so //
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gis brtags pa'i byed pa po bdag brtag pa gcig pu de nyid byed pa po nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir des sdug bsngal de bya bar mi rung bas sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so //
translated: Since that single creator, the self imputed by the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, is not tenable as a creator, it is not tenable that suffering is produced by that. Therefore suffering is not self-produced.

original: de la 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni skyes bu ni byed pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni skyes bu ni byed pa po ma yin te /
translated: Here, the inference is: A person is not an agent

original: rtag pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: because he is permanent, like space. The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proving property, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na nam mkha' ni rtag pa'i phyir byed pa po ma yin pa de bzhin du skyes bu yang rtag pa'i phyir byed pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni rtag pa'i phyir byed pa po ma yin pa de bzhin du skyes bu yang rtag pa'i phyir byed pa po ma yin no //
translated: For example, just as space is not an agent because it is permanent, so also a person is not an agent because he is permanent.

original: de nyid brnan pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyis byed pa po nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid brnan pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyis byed pa po nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to emphasize that, since he is inferred to be permanent, he is not an agent, he is not an agent because the nature of the subject is refuted.

original: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the thesis has the fault of refuting the nature of the subject.

original: bye brag pa dag brtag pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas rtag pa ni nam mkha' bzhin du byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyis byed pa po bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag brtag pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas rtag pa ni nam mkha' bzhin du byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyis byed pa po bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas infer that the self is permanent, but because it is not an agent like space, it is refuted as an agent.

original: bye brag pa dag gis bdag byed pa po ma yin par dam bcas pa la chos can bdag gi ngo bo nyid byed pa po yin par 'dod pa byed pa po ma yin pas bsal ba'i skyon yod pas dam bcas pa'i phyogs ma grub po //
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gis bdag byed pa po ma yin par dam bcas pa la chos can bdag gi ngo bo nyid byed pa po yin par 'dod pa byed pa po ma yin pas bsal ba'i skyon yod pas dam bcas pa'i phyogs ma grub po //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas assert that the nature of the self, the subject, is an agent, but because it is not an agent, the fault of the nonestablishment of the proposition arises.

original: gzhan yang / gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
translated: Moreover, if it were created by the self,

original: de'i phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: it would not arise dependently.

original: bdag gi rkyen las byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag gi rkyen las byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not arise from the conditions of the self,üîΩbecause it is untenable that an action occurs for an unborn agent.

original: byed pa po ma skyes pa la bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong @261b ma shos 'di rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston te /
analyzed: byed pa po ma skyes pa la bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong @261b ma shos 'di rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston te /
translated: This teaches that the first half of the verse is explained in another way.

original: gal te bye brag pa dag 'dod pa ltar sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par rtog na de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gi rkyen las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bye brag pa dag 'dod pa ltar sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par rtog na de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gi rkyen las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you imagine that suffering is self-produced, as the Vaiseikas imagine, then suffering would not arise in dependence on conditions.

original: sangs rgyas pa dag gi phyogs la byed pa po bdag ces bya ba de ma skyes pa yin pas ma skyes pa la bya ba mi 'thad pas sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dag gi phyogs la byed pa po bdag ces bya ba de ma skyes pa yin pas ma skyes pa la bya ba mi 'thad pas sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The Buddhists think that since the so-called self, the agent, is unarisen, it is untenable that the unarisen performs action. Therefore, they think that suffering is not self-produced.

original: yang na gal te sdug bsngal byed pa po bdag dang ldan par 'dod na de lta na yang /
analyzed: yang na gal te sdug bsngal byed pa po bdag dang ldan par 'dod na de lta na yang /
translated: Or, if you imagine that the self that is the agent of suffering exists, then in that case:

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur /
translated: It would not arise in dependence.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la sdug bsngal nyid bdag gi sgrar brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba 'di'i don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la sdug bsngal nyid bdag gi sgrar brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba 'di'i don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston te /
translated: The Buddhists think that since suffering itself is expressed by the term self, it is untenable that suffering is self-produced. This teaches the meaning of this root verse in another way.

original: pha rol po dag na re kho bo cag gi phyogs la bdag skyes pas sdug bsngal byed par 'dod pas sdug bsngal ni byed pa po dag dang ldan no zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re kho bo cag gi phyogs la bdag skyes pas sdug bsngal byed par 'dod pas sdug bsngal ni byed pa po dag dang ldan no zhe na /
translated: The opponent says: Since we assert that the self experiences suffering that arises from itself, suffering is possessed by the agent.

original: de lta na yang brten nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang brten nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But in that case, it does not arise in dependence on other conditions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: kho bo cag sangs rgyas pa'i phyogs la sdug bsngal nyid bdag gi sgrar brjod pa'i phyir de nyid las de nyid brten nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kho bo cag sangs rgyas pa'i phyogs la sdug bsngal nyid bdag gi sgrar brjod pa'i phyir de nyid las de nyid brten nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because in our Buddhist system, suffering itself is called the self, and it is not tenable that something arises in dependence on itself.

original: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore it is not said that suffering is self-produced.

original: yang na gal te skyes bu rang gis las de byas par gyur na /
analyzed: yang na gal te skyes bu rang gis las de byas par gyur na /
translated: Again, if the person himself performs that action,

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: then it would not arise in dependence on other conditions.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan dag la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya bas kyang tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba de nyid kyi don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan dag la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya bas kyang tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba de nyid kyi don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúother coemergent causes‚Äù is implied. This also teaches that the meaning of the root text is explained in another way.

original: gal te pha rol po dag na re skyes bu de nyid byed pa po yin pas des dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las de byas la de nyid kyi 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang zad par byed pas /
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag na re skyes bu de nyid byed pa po yin pas des dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las de byas la de nyid kyi 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang zad par byed pas /
translated: If the opponent says that since that person is the agent, he performs virtuous and nonvirtuous karma and he alone experiences the result of happiness and suffering,

original: des na sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yin no zhes zer na de lta na yang skyes bu de byed pa po yin pas sdug bsngal de lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan dag la brten nas 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo zhes
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yin no zhes zer na de lta na yang skyes bu de byed pa po yin pas sdug bsngal de lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan dag la brten nas 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo zhes
translated: then in that case, since that person is the agent, suffering would not arise in dependence on other coemergent causes.

original: ston to // de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ston to // de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: sdug bsngal ni byed pa po bdag dang ldan par 'dod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni byed pa po bdag dang ldan par 'dod par mi bya ste /
translated: Suffering should not be asserted to be possessed by the self that is the agent.

original: rgyu du ma dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu du ma dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is established by many causes.

original: dper na rlung shugs drag bdag gis shing skam po'i yan lag dag bskyod do //
analyzed: dper na rlung shugs drag bdag gis shing skam po'i yan lag dag bskyod do //
translated: For example, the force of the wind moves the branches of dry trees.

original: drud pa las byung ba'i nags kyi mes @262a * //
analyzed: drud pa las byung ba'i nags kyi mes @262a * //
translated: The forest fire that arises from friction

original: nags tshal sreg pa'i las bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: nags tshal sreg pa'i las bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The meaning is that it is like the action of burning a forest.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the measure of that,

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin gyi sdug bsngal ni byed pa po lhas byin gyi bdag dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin gyi sdug bsngal ni byed pa po lhas byin gyi bdag dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúHere, the inference is: ultimately, the suffering of Devadatta is not possessed by the self of the agent Devadatta,

original: sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is suffering, like, for example, the suffering of Yaj√±adatta.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.üîΩFor example, the suffering of Yaj√±adatta is not possessed by the self of the agent Devadatta because it is suffering.

original: byed pa po lhas byin gyi bdag dang ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi sdug bsngal yang sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir byed pa po lhas byin gyi bdag dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po lhas byin gyi bdag dang ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi sdug bsngal yang sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir byed pa po lhas byin gyi bdag dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the suffering of Devadatta is not possessed by the self of the agent Devadatta because it is suffering.

original: gal te mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal skye ba la yang lan 'ga' lhas byin byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i dpe mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal bzhin no zhes bya ba
analyzed: gal te mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal skye ba la yang lan 'ga' lhas byin byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i dpe mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal bzhin no zhes bya ba
translated: If you say that the suffering of the sacrifice is also uncertain because Devadatta is the agent of the arising of suffering on some occasions, this is a statement by the opponent that the example of the Madhyamikas is not certain.

original: de ma nges pa nyid yin par bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /üîΩde dag na re lan 'ga' lhas byin gyis mchod sbyin brdegs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: de ma nges pa nyid yin par bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te / de dag na re lan 'ga' lhas byin gyis mchod sbyin brdegs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas /
translated: This is a statement proving that it is not certain.üîΩThey say that Devadatta is the agent of the arising of suffering in the sacrifice through the means of beating the sacrifice and so on on some occasions.

original: mchod sbyin la sdug bsngal skye ba'i byed pa po nyid lhas byin yin pa'i phyir des na khyed na re dper na mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir dper na byed pa po lhas byin gyi bdag dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes zer
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sdug bsngal skye ba'i byed pa po nyid lhas byin yin pa'i phyir des na khyed na re dper na mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir dper na byed pa po lhas byin gyi bdag dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes zer
translated: Therefore, you say that just as the suffering of the sacrifice is suffering, it is not the case that Devadatta, the agent, possesses a self.

original: ba de ma nges pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ba de ma nges pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: This is uncertain.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says here:

original: rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu myong ba yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩlan 'ga' lhas byin gyis mchod sbyin brdegs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas mchod sbyin la sdug bsngal skye ba ni /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu myong ba yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te / lan 'ga' lhas byin gyis mchod sbyin brdegs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas mchod sbyin la sdug bsngal skye ba ni /
translated: Because he experiences the result of the karma he himself committed, it is not indeterminate.

original: mchod sbyin rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu myong ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mchod sbyin rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu myong ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The suffering that arises in Yaj√±adatta from being beaten by Devadatta is the result of karma committed by Yaj√±adatta himself.

original: de'i byed pa po nyid lhas byin ma yin pas kho bo'i dpe la ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i byed pa po nyid lhas byin ma yin pas kho bo'i dpe la ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med do //
translated: Because Devadatta is not the agent of that, my example is not indeterminate.

original: gal te pha rol po dag na re de rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bus myong ba yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag na re de rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bus myong ba yin du zin kyang /
translated: If the opponent says that even though Yaj√±adatta experiences the result of karma committed by himself,

original: de la sdug bsngal skye ba de lhas byin gyis brdegs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin pas /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal skye ba de lhas byin gyis brdegs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin pas /
translated: the suffering that arises in him is the transformation of being beaten by Devadatta,

original: des na lhas byin de'i byed pa po yin no zhes zer @262b ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: des na lhas byin de'i byed pa po yin no zhes zer @262b ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: Therefore, the earlier opponent's position that Devadatta is the agent is drawn out from within and in response to that, the author of the commentary himself says:

original: de'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin yang byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa bong ba la sogs pa dag kyang tha snyad du lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i dngos po de'i yan lag nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin yang byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa bong ba la sogs pa dag kyang tha snyad du lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i dngos po de'i yan lag nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Even though it is a transformation of him, it is not the nature of the agent. Also, things such as the clod are the parts of that thing that is the cooperative cause conventionally.

original: mchod sbyin rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu myong ba'i rkyen lhas byin gyis brdegs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin du zin kyang de byed pa po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu myong ba'i rkyen lhas byin gyis brdegs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin du zin kyang de byed pa po nyid ma yin te /
translated: Even though the transformation of Devadatta's being struck and so on is the condition for experiencing the result of the action committed by Yaj√±a himself, he is not the agent.

original: dper na byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa bong ba la sogs pa dag kyang tha snyad du mchod sbyin rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu myong ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i dngos po de'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i yan lag nyid du 'gyur mod
analyzed: dper na byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa bong ba la sogs pa dag kyang tha snyad du mchod sbyin rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu myong ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i dngos po de'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i yan lag nyid du 'gyur mod
translated: For example, even non-agents such as a lump of clay are the things that are the cooperative conditions for experiencing the results of actions that are self-produced by Yaj√±a. They are the parts that are the transformations of that thing.

original: kyi de dag byed pa po nyid ma yin pa bzhin pas kho bo'i dpe la ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med do //
analyzed: kyi de dag byed pa po nyid ma yin pa bzhin pas kho bo'i dpe la ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med do //
translated: But they are not agents. Therefore the fault of the uncertainty of my example does not exist.

original: gang la 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa de la ni sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sdug bsngal skye ba de byed pa po de dang ldan pa ma yin pas bdag gis byas pa ma yin pa zhes bya
analyzed: gang la 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa de la ni sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sdug bsngal skye ba de byed pa po de dang ldan pa ma yin pas bdag gis byas pa ma yin pa zhes bya
translated: For one in whom the compounded phenomena are momentary and have the nature of disintegration, the moment of the mind in which suffering arises is not associated with the agent. Therefore it is said that it is not self-produced.

original: ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la yang nyon cig ces bya bas ni sngar yang na bye brag pa dag na re lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs dag zhig kyang bdag ni mi 'jig la de yang kho bo cag gi phyogs la byed pa po de dang bcas pa nyid du gnas pa gcig pu yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la yang nyon cig ces bya bas ni sngar yang na bye brag pa dag na re lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs dag zhig kyang bdag ni mi 'jig la de yang kho bo cag gi phyogs la byed pa po de dang bcas pa nyid du gnas pa gcig pu yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that although the collection of body, sense faculties, and mind disintegrates, the self does not disintegrate.üîΩSince it remains as the single entity that possesses the agent, it is suitable to say that the suffering produced by it is self-produced.

original: des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag gis byas pa zhes byar rung gi / gang la 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa de la ni sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sdug bsngal skye ba de byed pa po de
analyzed: des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag gis byas pa zhes byar rung gi / gang la 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa de la ni sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sdug bsngal skye ba de byed pa po de
translated: But for one for whom the formations are momentary and perishable, the self does not possess the agent of the suffering that arises in a moment of mind.

original: dang ldan pa ma yin pas bdag gis byas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dang ldan pa ma yin pas bdag gis byas pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore it is not self-produced.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa mi srid pas gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa mi srid pas gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Since it is impossible for one to experience the effect of an action produced by another, it is not produced by another.

original: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes zer ba'i yan sngar yang btab zin mod kyi /
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes zer ba'i yan sngar yang btab zin mod kyi /
translated: The opponent says, This contradicts the conclusion of your performance.

original: yang 'dir de'i lan rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas gdab kyis nyon cig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang 'dir de'i lan rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas gdab kyis nyon cig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: We have already stated this objection above, but here we say, Listen! I will respond to that objection from another perspective.

original: de'i phyir / don dam par ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir / don dam par ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, we say, In the ultimate, suffering is not to be described as self-produced or produced by another,

original: de dag mi srid par bstan pa mi gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩdes @263a * //
analyzed: de dag mi srid par bstan pa mi gnod do zhes bya ba smras te / des @263a * //
translated: and therefore your teaching that those are impossible does not undermine us.

original: ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i phyogs la don dam par ni dngos po thams cad la byed pa po dang las su brjod par bya ba med pas sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir khyed kyis bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa de dag mi sred par bstan pa kho bo cag gi phyogs la mi gnod do //
analyzed: ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i phyogs la don dam par ni dngos po thams cad la byed pa po dang las su brjod par bya ba med pas sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir khyed kyis bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa de dag mi sred par bstan pa kho bo cag gi phyogs la mi gnod do //
translated: This means, In our Madhyamaka position, since in the ultimate sense the agent and action are not to be described in relation to any thing, suffering is not to be described as self-produced or produced by another. Therefore your teaching that self-production and other-production are impossible does not undermine our position.

original: tha snyad du ni 'jig rten na de dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis rgyud dang 'bras bu'i rgyud tha mi dad pa la tha snyad de dag mthong ste /
analyzed: tha snyad du ni 'jig rten na de dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis rgyud dang 'bras bu'i rgyud tha mi dad pa la tha snyad de dag mthong ste /
translated: Conventionally, in the world, the continuum and the mindstream are not different, and the terms are seen to be used in that way.

original: dper na bdag gis btsugs pa'i mar me de nyid 'di yin no //
analyzed: dper na bdag gis btsugs pa'i mar me de nyid 'di yin no //
translated: For example, one says, ‚ÄúThat is the lamp I lit,‚ÄùüîΩand ‚ÄúThat is the mango tree I planted.‚ÄùüîΩIn the same way, here, because the former moment of the sentient being is not different from the latter moment of the sentient being, and because the relation of cause and effect is not different, the action is said to be ‚Äúdone by me.‚Äù

original: bdag gis bskyed pa'i shing aa mra de nyid 'di yin no zhes brjod pa de bzhin du 'di la yang sems can gyi skad cig ma snga ma sems can gyi skad cig ma phyi ma dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa tha mi dad pas byas pa la bdag gis byas pa zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa yang kun rdzob tu ni 'jig rten la ji ltar grags pa bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu rigs mthun pa'i 'brel
analyzed: bdag gis bskyed pa'i shing aa mra de nyid 'di yin no zhes brjod pa de bzhin du 'di la yang sems can gyi skad cig ma snga ma sems can gyi skad cig ma phyi ma dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa tha mi dad pas byas pa la bdag gis byas pa zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa yang kun rdzob tu ni 'jig rten la ji ltar grags pa bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu rigs mthun pa'i 'brel
translated: This shows that we Followers of the Middle Way, in the relative, speak in a way that accords with what is renowned in the world. We speak of the relation of cause and effect in terms of concordant types.

original: pa de dag khas len pas rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu dus gzhan na rang nyid kyis myong bar 'dod pas bdag gis byas pa'i tha snyad 'gog par mi byed pas khyed kyi klan ka'i skabs med do //üîΩgal te pha rol po dag na re /üîΩde lta na sems can gyi skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma gzhan nyid yin pas snga mas byas pa phyi mas myong na ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /

translated: Since they accept that, they assert that the effect of an action done by oneself is experienced by oneself at another time. original: gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i phyir sems can gyi skad cig ma snga mas dge ba dang / mi dge ba nye bar bsags pa dag gi rnam par smin pa mi myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i phyir sems can gyi skad cig ma snga mas dge ba dang / mi dge ba nye bar bsags pa dag gi rnam par smin pa mi myong ba ma yin te /
translated: Since they accept that, they assert that one experiences the results of actions committed by oneself at another time. Since they do not refute the convention of self-produced, you have no opportunity to object.

original: dper na dug gi mthu 'o ma'i skad cig mar blugs pa de'i rnam par 'gyur ba zho'i skad cig mar myong ba bzhin pas ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud za bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na dug gi mthu 'o ma'i skad cig mar blugs pa de'i rnam par 'gyur ba zho'i skad cig mar myong ba bzhin pas ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud za bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, he says that one does not encounter the results of actions one has not done and that one‚Äôs actions do not perish.

original: des ni kun rdzob tu sems can gyi skad cig ma snga ma dang / phyi ma gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyud tha mi dad pa la rnam par smin pa mi myong ba ma @263b yin pas /
analyzed: des ni kun rdzob tu sems can gyi skad cig ma snga ma dang / phyi ma gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyud tha mi dad pa la rnam par smin pa mi myong ba ma @263b yin pas /
translated: Although the previous and subsequent moments of sentient beings are different in the conventional sense, they are of a similar type, and thus the continuum of cause and effect is not different. Therefore, one does not experience the ripening of actions that one has not done.üîΩThus, he shows that the errors of encountering the results of actions one has not done and of one‚Äôs actions perishing do not arise.

original: ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud mi za ba'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur la sems can rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyud tha dad pa la rnam par smin pa mi myong bas gzhan gyis byas pa gzhan gyis myong ba
analyzed: ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud mi za ba'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur la sems can rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyud tha dad pa la rnam par smin pa mi myong bas gzhan gyis byas pa gzhan gyis myong ba
translated: Since the continuum of cause and effect is different due to the dissimilarity of the types of sentient beings, one does not experience the ripening of actions that one has not done.

original: yang ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: yang ma yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, he shows that one does not experience the results of actions done by others.

original: ci ste skad cig ma snga ma la las nye bar bsags pa'i 'bras bu ni 'du byed kyi skad cig ma phyi ma la myong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste skad cig ma snga ma la las nye bar bsags pa'i 'bras bu ni 'du byed kyi skad cig ma phyi ma la myong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if the effect of karma accumulated in a previous instant is not experienced in a later instant of formation,üîΩthen it would be like a different continuum because it would be different.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag sems can rgyud tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma snga ma dang / phyi ma gzhan nyid yin pas snga mas byas pa'i 'bras bu phyi mas mi myong ba bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag sems can rgyud tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma snga ma dang / phyi ma gzhan nyid yin pas snga mas byas pa'i 'bras bu phyi mas mi myong ba bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs argument that the effect of karma created by the previous instant of a continuum of sentient beings is not experienced by the later instant because they are different.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the proof, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na lhas byin dang mchod sbyin gyi rgyud tha dad pa ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi rgyud kyis las nye bar bsags pa'i 'bras bu mchod sbyin gyis myong bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rgyud tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma snga ma dang
analyzed: dper na lhas byin dang mchod sbyin gyi rgyud tha dad pa ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi rgyud kyis las nye bar bsags pa'i 'bras bu mchod sbyin gyis myong bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rgyud tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma snga ma dang
translated: For example, because the continuum of Devadatta and the continuum of Yaj√±adatta are different, the result of karma accumulated by Devadatta is not experienced by Yaj√±adatta.

original: phyi ma yang gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir snga ma las nye bar bsags pa'i 'bras bu phyi mas myong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi ma yang gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir snga ma las nye bar bsags pa'i 'bras bu phyi mas myong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, because the earlier and later moments of a single continuum are different, the result of karma accumulated by the former is not experienced by the latter.üîΩIf it were, the fault would arise that one would encounter the results of actions one did not do and the results of actions one did would perish.

original: gal te myong bar gyur na ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
