analyzed: gal te myong bar gyur na ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is also not good.

original: mdzad pa'i mtha' las /
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mtha' las /
translated: The conclusion of the performance of action states:

original: brten nas gang dang gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: brten nas gang dang gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence

original: re zhig de ni de nyid min //
analyzed: re zhig de ni de nyid min //
translated: is not that itself.

original: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin te //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin te //
translated: Nor is it different from that.

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: Therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause they are different‚Äù is not established.

original: khyed kyis rjes su dpag pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyed kyis rjes su dpag pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: You say that the reason of your inference is different from the thesis.üîΩFor example, it is like a different continuum.

original: dper na rgyud tha dad pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de ni kho bo cag gi lung las gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid bkag pas ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: dper na rgyud tha dad pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de ni kho bo cag gi lung las gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid bkag pas ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: But that is not established because our scriptures refute sameness and difference.

original: lung gi don de nyid rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas sgrub pa'i phyir sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la bsags pa'i mthu'i khyad par ni skye ba'i gnyen po ma skyes pa'i rgyud la 'bras bur 'gyur bar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: lung gi don de nyid rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas sgrub pa'i phyir sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la bsags pa'i mthu'i khyad par ni skye ba'i gnyen po ma skyes pa'i rgyud la 'bras bur 'gyur bar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: In order to prove the meaning of the scriptures by the valid knowledge of inference, the special power accumulated in the previous moment of mind is to be apprehended as the result in the continuum of the future antidote to birth.

original: mthu'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthu'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a special power.

original: dper na ma tu lung ga'i me tog gi ze ba dmar ba bzhin @264a * //
analyzed: dper na ma tu lung ga'i me tog gi ze ba dmar ba bzhin @264a * //
translated: For example, it is like the red stamen of a madhuka flower.

original: pas tha snyad kyi bden pa la gnod pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pas tha snyad kyi bden pa la gnod pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus conventional truth is not undermined.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proof, the example, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: dper na ma tu lung gi'i sa bon rgya skyegs kyis bskus pa ni 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i mthu'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir myu gu dang / sdong bu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bar ma dag la mi mngon yang ze ba'i gnas skabs la rgya skyegs kyi kha dog dmar bar mngon pas skad cig ma yin yang tha snyad kyi bden par rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i tshul la gnod pa med pa de
analyzed: dper na ma tu lung gi'i sa bon rgya skyegs kyis bskus pa ni 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i mthu'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir myu gu dang / sdong bu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bar ma dag la mi mngon yang ze ba'i gnas skabs la rgya skyegs kyi kha dog dmar bar mngon pas skad cig ma yin yang tha snyad kyi bden par rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i tshul la gnod pa med pa de
translated: For example, a madh≈´ka seed smeared with lac has a special potency to produce a result, so even though it is not manifest in the intermediate states of the sprout, the stem, and so on, it is manifest as the red color of the stamen. Therefore, even though it is momentary, it does not undermine the conventional truth of the relationship between cause and effect.

original: bzhin du sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la las dge ba dang mi dge ba bsags pa'i mthu'i khyad par yang 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i mthu'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bar ma dag la
analyzed: bzhin du sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la las dge ba dang mi dge ba bsags pa'i mthu'i khyad par yang 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i mthu'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bar ma dag la
translated: Therefore, although it is not manifest in the intermediate states of the second and third moments and so on,

original: mi mngon yang /
analyzed: mi mngon yang /
translated: the result of karma is not undermined.

original: skyes pa dang lan grangs gzhan gyi gnas skabs na skye ba'i gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes pa'i gang zag gi rgyud la 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur bas skad cig ma yin yang tha snyad kyi bden par rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel
analyzed: skyes pa dang lan grangs gzhan gyi gnas skabs na skye ba'i gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes pa'i gang zag gi rgyud la 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur bas skad cig ma yin yang tha snyad kyi bden par rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel
translated: Even though it is momentary, the conventional truth of the connection between cause and effect is not undermined by the experience of the results of happiness and suffering in the mindstream of a person in whom the antidote to karma that will be experienced in this life has not arisen and in whom the ƒÅrya path that is the antidote to karma to be experienced in other lives has not arisen.

original: pa'i tshul la gnod pa med de lung las /
analyzed: pa'i tshul la gnod pa med de lung las /
translated: This is stated in a sutra:üîΩEven after a hundred eons,

original: las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni //
analyzed: las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni //
translated: karma does not perish.

original: chud mi za ba'ang tshogs dang dus //üîΩrnyed na lus can rnams la ni //
analyzed: chud mi za ba'ang tshogs dang dus // rnyed na lus can rnams la ni //
translated: When the assemblage and time

original: 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid //üîΩces ci skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid //üîΩces ci skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: is gained, it will yield its result to embodied beings.

original: gal te phyogs gzhan gyis las byas pa'i 'bras bu phyogs gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur bas phyogs snga ma la byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te phyogs gzhan gyis las byas pa'i 'bras bu phyogs gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur bas phyogs snga ma la byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: If the result of the action done by one part were experienced by another part, then the error would arise that one would experience the result of what was not done by him, and what was done would perish.

original: de nyid kyis lan 'ga' yang 'bras bu myong bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis lan 'ga' yang 'bras bu myong bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, one would not experience the result even once.

original: phyogs 'brel par brtag na yang dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs 'brel par brtag na yang dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: If one analyzes the relation of the parts, the thesis is undermined.

original: phrad pa dang 'du ba dag la yang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phrad pa dang 'du ba dag la yang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is a relation in the case of contact and combination.

original: dran pa dang shes pa la sogs pa skyes pa dag dngos ma yin pas mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes pa la sogs pa skyes pa dag dngos ma yin pas mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo //
translated: The arising of memory, cognition, etc. is contradicted by the conclusion that they are not real things.üîΩIf you say that there is no error because of identity,üîΩthe opponent says:

original: bdag gcig pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag / sangs rgyas pa dag 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin par 'dod pa dag gi @264b phyogs ni ma byas pa dang phrad
analyzed: bdag gcig pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag / sangs rgyas pa dag 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin par 'dod pa dag gi @264b phyogs ni ma byas pa dang phrad
translated: The Buddhists who assert that compounded phenomena have the nature of moment-by-moment destruction would experience the result of what was not done by them, and what was done would perish.

original: pa dang / byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du 'gyur la bye brag pa la sogs pa bdag brtag pa gcig pu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs la ni skyon de dag med do zhes bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: pa dang / byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du 'gyur la bye brag pa la sogs pa bdag brtag pa gcig pu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs la ni skyon de dag med do zhes bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: But in the position that the Vai≈õe·π£ikas and so on assert that the self is a single entity, those errors do not exist.

original: de dag na re khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'dod pa ltar sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la bsags pa'i las kyi 'bras bu skad cig ma phyi ma la myong bar brtag na /
analyzed: de dag na re khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'dod pa ltar sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la bsags pa'i las kyi 'bras bu skad cig ma phyi ma la myong bar brtag na /
translated: They say that if you Buddhists imagine that the result of karma accumulated in a previous moment of mind is experienced in a subsequent moment of mind,üîΩthen the result of karma committed by one part of the previous moment of mind would be experienced by another part of the subsequent moment of mind.

original: de ni sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma'i phyogs gzhan gyis las byas pa'i 'bras bu sems kyi skad cig ma phyi ma'i phyogs gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur bas de lta na sems kyi skad cig ma phyi ma'i phyogs la ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang /
analyzed: de ni sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma'i phyogs gzhan gyis las byas pa'i 'bras bu sems kyi skad cig ma phyi ma'i phyogs gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur bas de lta na sems kyi skad cig ma phyi ma'i phyogs la ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang /
translated: In that case, one would encounter the result of karma not committed by the subsequent moment of mind,

original: sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma'i phyogs la byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma'i phyogs la byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: and the error would arise that the action committed by the previous moment of mind would perish.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma gang gis las byas pa de nyid kyis lan 'ga' yang 'bras bu myong bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma gang gis las byas pa de nyid kyis lan 'ga' yang 'bras bu myong bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: The one who performs the action in the previous moment of mind never experiences the result.

original: sems kyi skad cig ma phyi ma la gang gis las ma byas pa de nyid kyis rtag tu 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma phyi ma la gang gis las ma byas pa de nyid kyis rtag tu 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who does not perform the action in the subsequent moment of mind always experiences the result.

original: gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces rigs mthun pa nyid kyi rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud tha mi dad pa la sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma'i phyogs dang / sems kyi skad cig ma phyi ma'i phyogs 'brel pas des na ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces rigs mthun pa nyid kyi rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud tha mi dad pa la sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma'i phyogs dang / sems kyi skad cig ma phyi ma'i phyogs 'brel pas des na ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
translated: If you Buddhists say, ‚ÄúThe continuum of the cause and effect of the same type is not different, and since the previous moment of mind and the subsequent moment of mind are related, the error of meeting with that which was not done and the error of the exhaustion of that which was done do not occur,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir phyogs 'brel par brtags na yang dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs 'brel par brtags na yang dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: then, even if you imagine that they are related, your thesis is undermined.

original: phyogs 'brel par brtag pa ni nye bar btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: phyogs 'brel par brtag pa ni nye bar btags pa yin gyi /
translated: Imagining that they are related is a mere imputation.

original: dngos ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos ma yin la /
translated: It is not real.

original: khyed sangs rgyas pa'i rigs mthun pa nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyud tha mi dad par dam bcas pa ni dngos nyid yin par 'dod pas gal te phyogs 'brel par 'dod na khyed rang gis dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyed sangs rgyas pa'i rigs mthun pa nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyud tha mi dad par dam bcas pa ni dngos nyid yin par 'dod pas gal te phyogs 'brel par 'dod na khyed rang gis dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: You assert that the continuum of the cause and effect of the same type of a buddha is not different, but if you assert that they are related, then your assertion is undermined.üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúThe imputation of a relationship is not real,‚Äù

original: 'brel par brtag pa ci ltar na nye bar btags pa yin gyi dngos ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel par brtag pa ci ltar na nye bar btags pa yin gyi dngos ma yin zhe na /
translated: then how is it imputed?

original: phrad pa dang 'du ba dag la yang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phrad pa dang 'du ba dag la yang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because contact and union also exist in a relationship.

original: kho bo cag bye brag pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las phrad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don la yang 'brel pa yod do /
analyzed: kho bo cag bye brag pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las phrad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don la yang 'brel pa yod do /
translated: In our system, the meaning of the term contact exists in the tenets of the Vai≈õe·π£ika.

original: dper na lhas byin dbyug pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir dbyug pa can zhes bya ba ni phrad pa'i tshig gi don yin la /üîΩde ni dbyug @265a * //
analyzed: dper na lhas byin dbyug pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir dbyug pa can zhes bya ba ni phrad pa'i tshig gi don yin la / de ni dbyug @265a * //
translated: For example, because Devadatta is related to a stick, he is called ‚Äústick-bearer.‚Äù This is the meaning of the term contact.

original: pa dang 'brel pa tsam las dbyug pa can zhes nye bar gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: pa dang 'brel pa tsam las dbyug pa can zhes nye bar gdags par zad kyi /
translated: That is merely the relationship of a stick, and he is imputed to be a stick-bearer.

original: lhas byin dngos nyid kyang ma yin la dbyug pa dngos nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: lhas byin dngos nyid kyang ma yin la dbyug pa dngos nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Devadatta is not the reality of the stick, nor is the stick the reality of Devadatta.

original: de bzhin du 'du ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don la yang 'brel ba yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don la yang 'brel ba yod de /
translated: Likewise, the meaning of the term ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is also related to the meaning of ‚Äúconnection.‚Äù

original: dper na ba lang gi spyi 'dus pa rva dang 'brel ba'i phyir rva can zhes bya ba ni 'du ba'i tshig gi don yin la de ni rva dang 'brel pa tsam las rva can zhes nye bar gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi spyi 'dus pa rva dang 'brel ba'i phyir rva can zhes bya ba ni 'du ba'i tshig gi don yin la de ni rva dang 'brel pa tsam las rva can zhes nye bar gdags par zad kyi /
translated: For example, the universal of cow is called ‚Äúcow‚Äù because it is connected to the horn, and this is the meaning of the term ‚Äúcollection.‚Äù It is merely designated as ‚Äúcow‚Äù on the basis of the mere connection to the horn.

original: ba lang dngos nyid kyang ma yin la rva dngos nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: ba lang dngos nyid kyang ma yin la rva dngos nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: The cow is not the reality of the horn, nor is the horn the reality of the cow.

original: de'i phyir khyed sangs rgyas pa phyogs 'brel par rtog na khyed kyi dran pa dang / shes pa la sogs pa skyes pa dag dngos yin pas mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed sangs rgyas pa phyogs 'brel par rtog na khyed kyi dran pa dang / shes pa la sogs pa skyes pa dag dngos yin pas mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, if you Buddhists imagine that the position is related to the side, then the arising of memory, cognition, and so on is a reality, and so it contradicts your own tenets.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: khyed sangs rgyas pas bdag gis sngon las dge ba dang mi dge ba 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig byas so snyam du dran pa dang da ltar skyes pa dang / bdag gis da ltar 'bras bu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig myong ngo snyam du shes pa da ltar skyes pa dang /
analyzed: khyed sangs rgyas pas bdag gis sngon las dge ba dang mi dge ba 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig byas so snyam du dran pa dang da ltar skyes pa dang / bdag gis da ltar 'bras bu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig myong ngo snyam du shes pa da ltar skyes pa dang /
translated: You Buddhists think that I remember that I previously did such and such virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, that I know that I was born in the present and that I now experience such and such happiness and suffering as its effect.üîΩThe words and so on refer to the present recollection that I previously did such and such actions generated by attachment, aversion and confusion and the present knowledge that I now experience such and such effects generated by them.

original: sogs pa'i sgras bdag gis sngon 'dod chags kyis bskyed pa dang / zhe sdang gis bskyed pa dang gti mug gis bskyed pa'i las 'di lta bu zhig byas so snyam du dran pa da ltar skyes pa dang / bdag gis de dag gis bskyed pa'i 'bras bu da ltar 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig myong ngo snyam du shes pa da ltar skyes pa de dag thams cad kyang phrad pa'i tshig gi don gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa'am 'du ba'i tshig gi don gyi mtshan nyid
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras bdag gis sngon 'dod chags kyis bskyed pa dang / zhe sdang gis bskyed pa dang gti mug gis bskyed pa'i las 'di lta bu zhig byas so snyam du dran pa da ltar skyes pa dang / bdag gis de dag gis bskyed pa'i 'bras bu da ltar 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig myong ngo snyam du shes pa da ltar skyes pa de dag thams cad kyang phrad pa'i tshig gi don gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa'am 'du ba'i tshig gi don gyi mtshan nyid
translated: All of these are related by the definition of the meaning of the word contact or by the definition of the meaning of the word assembly.

original: kyis 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir de dag 'brel pa tsam las rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes nye bar gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: kyis 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir de dag 'brel pa tsam las rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes nye bar gdags par zad kyi /
translated: Because they are related, they are merely related, and it is merely designated that they are cause and effect.

original: sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma'i byed pa po dngos nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma'i byed pa po dngos nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: The former moment of mind is not the real agent,

original: sems kyi skad cig ma phyi ma'i za ba po dngos nyid kyang ma yin no /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma phyi ma'i za ba po dngos nyid kyang ma yin no /
translated: and the latter moment of mind is not the real experiencer.

original: de lta na khyed sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na khyed sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, you Buddhists would contradict your own tenets,

original: 'di ltar khyed kyi mdzad pa'i mtha' las byed pa po dang / za ba po la sogs pa de dag thams cad dngos yin par 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed kyi mdzad pa'i mtha' las byed pa po dang / za ba po la sogs pa de dag thams cad dngos yin par 'byung la /
translated: because in your tenets all agents, experiencers, and so on are real,

original: khyod kyis 'dir de dag nye bar btags pa yin par smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'dir de dag nye bar btags pa yin par smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and here you say they are merely designated.

original: gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces nged sangs rgyas pa 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig @265b pa'i ngang can yin par smra ba'i phyogs la skyon ci skad bstan pa de dag tu 'gyur bar khyed smra na /
analyzed: gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces nged sangs rgyas pa 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig @265b pa'i ngang can yin par smra ba'i phyogs la skyon ci skad bstan pa de dag tu 'gyur bar khyed smra na /
translated: If you Buddhists say, ‚ÄúWe are Buddhists who advocate that compounded phenomena are momentary and disintegrate in every instant. We are not subject to the faults you have described,‚Äù

original: bye brag pa la sogs pa khyed bdag brtag pa gcig pu nyid du smra ba'i phyogs la skyon de dag tu ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes zer na /
analyzed: bye brag pa la sogs pa khyed bdag brtag pa gcig pu nyid du smra ba'i phyogs la skyon de dag tu ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes zer na /
translated: then how could you not be subject to those faults in the position that advocates a single self that is the creator?

original: de'i phyir bdag gcig pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gcig pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, they say, ‚ÄúThere is no fault because there is a single self.‚Äù

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la dang po sprul pa po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la dang po sprul pa po nas bzung ste /
translated: In our position, from the beginning, the creator is

original: tha ma 'jigs pa chen po'i bar du bdag brtag pa gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud za ba'i skyon med do //
analyzed: tha ma 'jigs pa chen po'i bar du bdag brtag pa gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud za ba'i skyon med do //
translated: the same single self as the one at the end, who is afraid. Therefore, we are not subject to the faults of encountering what was not done and the destruction of what was done.

original: kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' las byed pa po yang de nyid yin la za ba po yang de nyid yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' las byed pa po yang de nyid yin la za ba po yang de nyid yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because in our philosophy it is said that the agent is the same as the experiencer.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /üîΩde ji ltar gcig pa nyid yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis / de ji ltar gcig pa nyid yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:üîΩHow is that one?

original: des ni khyed kyis bdag gcig pa nyid ces bya ba de ci ltar gcig pa nyid yin zhes dri ba bstan to //
analyzed: des ni khyed kyis bdag gcig pa nyid ces bya ba de ci ltar gcig pa nyid yin zhes dri ba bstan to //
translated: That shows that the question is, ‚ÄúHow is that one called the same?‚Äù

original: de skad ces dris pa ni gal te pha rol po dag na re gcig nyid kyi grangs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni zhes bya bas ni pha rol po'i gzhung nyid brnan pa ston te /
analyzed: de skad ces dris pa ni gal te pha rol po dag na re gcig nyid kyi grangs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni zhes bya bas ni pha rol po'i gzhung nyid brnan pa ston te /
translated: If you ask that, if the opponent says, ‚ÄúBecause it possesses the number one,‚Äù then the opponent‚Äôs own position is shown to be untenable.

original: bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las bdag la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ni gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las bdag la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ni gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: Because in the Vai≈õe·π£ika scriptures all things such as the self are neither one nor many.

original: gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te tshig gi don drug pas yon tan gyi grangs gcig ces bya ba dang ldan na gcig nyid bya zhing gzhan nyid dang ldan na gzhan zhes bya'o zhes 'byung bas 'dir bdag de yang yon tan gyi grangs gcig ces bya ba dngos dang
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te tshig gi don drug pas yon tan gyi grangs gcig ces bya ba dang ldan na gcig nyid bya zhing gzhan nyid dang ldan na gzhan zhes bya'o zhes 'byung bas 'dir bdag de yang yon tan gyi grangs gcig ces bya ba dngos dang
translated: It is not different because the sixth case, the genitive, is used, and it is said that if it has the number one, it is one, and if it has difference, it is different.

original: ldan pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid yin par 'dod do zhe'o //
analyzed: ldan pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid yin par 'dod do zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, here it is asserted that self is one because it has the number one.

original: da ni sun dbyung ba'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir bdag ni gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni sun dbyung ba'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir bdag ni gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the refutation by way of inference, he says: Self does not have the number one because

original: yod pa'i phyir gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it exists, like the number one.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos ni yod pa'i phyir gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos ni yod pa'i phyir gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, the number one does not have the number one because it exists.

original: de nyid de nyid dang ldan par mi rung ba de bzhin du bdag kyang yod pa'i phyir gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid de nyid dang ldan par mi rung ba de bzhin du bdag kyang yod pa'i phyir gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as it is not tenable for reality to possess reality, in the same way, since the self exists, it does not possess the nature of being a single unit.

original: yod pa nyid yod pa nyid dang ldan par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yod pa nyid yod pa nyid dang ldan par mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable for existence to possess existence.

original: ci ste pha rol po dag @266a * //üîΩ'di skad ces khyed sangs rgyas pa la don dam par bdag yod par ma grub pas yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi gzhi gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer na /
analyzed: ci ste pha rol po dag @266a * // 'di skad ces khyed sangs rgyas pa la don dam par bdag yod par ma grub pas yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi gzhi gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer na /
translated: If the opponent says,üîΩ‚ÄúSince the self does not exist ultimately for you Buddhists, the reason, ‚Äòbecause it exists,‚Äô is not established with respect to any basis,‚Äù

original: de'i lan du kho bo cag sangs rgyas pa la yang kun rdzob tu phung po'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag yod par grub pas de'i phyir gzhi grub pas gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lan du kho bo cag sangs rgyas pa la yang kun rdzob tu phung po'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag yod par grub pas de'i phyir gzhi grub pas gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: we would reply, ‚ÄúSince the self that has the characteristics of the aggregates exists conventionally for us Buddhists, therefore the reason is not flawed by not being established with respect to any basis.‚Äù

original: gcig dang gcig ma yin la gcig pa nyid du brtag na yang zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag bdag de gcig nyid kyi grangs dang ldan pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid do zhes zer ba'i gzhung de rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas sun dbyung ba ston te
analyzed: gcig dang gcig ma yin la gcig pa nyid du brtag na yang zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag bdag de gcig nyid kyi grangs dang ldan pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid do zhes zer ba'i gzhung de rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas sun dbyung ba ston te
translated: ‚ÄúEven if one were to imagine that it is one and not one‚Äù indicates that the treatise author will teach the refutation of the opponent‚Äôs position through another approach.

original: / gcig nyid la gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos dang ldan pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du brtag gam 'on te gcig ma yin pa la gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos dang ldan pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du brtag grang na /
analyzed: / gcig nyid la gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos dang ldan pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du brtag gam 'on te gcig ma yin pa la gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos dang ldan pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du brtag grang na /
translated: The opponent says that the self is one because it possesses the number one.

original: gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: The treatise author demonstrates that both of these are untenable.

original: de la brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir 'brel pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir 'brel pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To demonstrate the untenability of the first conception, the treatise states, ‚ÄúBecause the connection would be meaningless.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gcig yin pa'i phyir gcig gi ngo bo nyid yin bzhin du yang gcig nyid dang ldan par 'dod na des na 'brel ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig yin pa'i phyir gcig gi ngo bo nyid yin bzhin du yang gcig nyid dang ldan par 'dod na des na 'brel ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: As such, if one were to assert that while it is the entity of one, it also possesses oneness, then the relation would be pointless.

original: snga nas gcig gi ngo bo nyid du grub zin pa la yang gcig nyid dang sbyor ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga nas gcig gi ngo bo nyid du grub zin pa la yang gcig nyid dang sbyor ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is pointless to connect that which is already established as the entity of one with oneness.

original: ci ste gcig nyid du grub kyang gcig nyid dang ldan par bya dgos na ni thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste gcig nyid du grub kyang gcig nyid dang ldan par bya dgos na ni thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if, even though it is established as one, it must be connected with oneness, then the error of infinite regress would ensue.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the second conception is untenable, he says, because it is impossible.

original: ci ste gcig gi ngo bo nyid ma yin na ci ltar gcig nyid dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste gcig gi ngo bo nyid ma yin na ci ltar gcig nyid dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not the entity of one, how could it possess oneness?

original: mi mthun pa gnyis gcig la dus gcig tu sbyor ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa gnyis gcig la dus gcig tu sbyor ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for two incompatible things to be connected to one thing at the same time.

original: ci ste sngar gcig nyid kyi khyad par dang mi ldan pa phyis gcig nyid dang ldan pas gcig nyid du 'gyur na ni des na sngon gyi ngo bo nyid spangs pas rjes su dpag pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste sngar gcig nyid kyi khyad par dang mi ldan pa phyis gcig nyid dang ldan pas gcig nyid du 'gyur na ni des na sngon gyi ngo bo nyid spangs pas rjes su dpag pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it were to become one later on, having not previously had the nature of one, then it would follow that it would abandon its previous nature, and so it would be established as lacking intrinsic reality by inference.

original: bzang po ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: bzang po ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: ‚Äú It is not good‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: pha rol po'i gzhung ni rang gi 'dod pa nyams pas bzang po ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol po'i gzhung ni rang gi 'dod pa nyams pas bzang po ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs doctrine is not good because it undermines his own assertions.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog ste zhes bya bas ni pha rol po'i lo rgyus nyes bar smras @266b pa dag rnam par dpyad pas chog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog ste zhes bya bas ni pha rol po'i lo rgyus nyes bar smras @266b pa dag rnam par dpyad pas chog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú That is enough of this digression‚Äù means that it is enough to analyze the opponent‚Äôs bad explanations.

original: pha rol pos sngar phyogs 'brel par brtag na yang dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pha rol pos sngar phyogs 'brel par brtag na yang dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the opponent imagines a connection with the thesis earlier, the thesis would be undermined.

original: phrad pa dang 'du ba dag la yang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir dran pa dang / shes pa la sogs pa skyes pa dag dngos ma yin pas mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes gang smras pa de ni sangs rgyas pa'i gzhung gsal bar byed pa yin pas lan gdab mi dgos te /
analyzed: phrad pa dang 'du ba dag la yang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir dran pa dang / shes pa la sogs pa skyes pa dag dngos ma yin pas mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes gang smras pa de ni sangs rgyas pa'i gzhung gsal bar byed pa yin pas lan gdab mi dgos te /
translated: Since contact and conjunction also exist in relation to memory, cognition, etc., it is not the case that they are produced by non-entities. Therefore, the objection that this contradicts the conclusion of the performance of action is a clear statement of the Buddhist position, so it does not need to be answered.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag chos thams cad nye bar btags pa tsam dang / tha snyad tsam du 'dod pa ni mdzad pa'i mtha' dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag chos thams cad nye bar btags pa tsam dang / tha snyad tsam du 'dod pa ni mdzad pa'i mtha' dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, since we assert that all phenomena are mere imputation and mere convention, we do not contradict the conclusion of the performance of action.

original: de'i phyir de ltar sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te de ltar re zhig dam bcas pa dang po bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te de ltar re zhig dam bcas pa dang po bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Therefore, it is asserted that suffering is not self-produced. This is the general conclusion and the result of valid knowledge. Thus, the first thesis has been established.

original: da ni dam bcas pa gnyis pa bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dam bcas pa gnyis pa bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Now the second thesis should be established.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, suffering is not produced by another.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gal te de las 'di gzhan zhing //
analyzed: gal te de las 'di gzhan zhing //
translated: If this is different from that,

original: gal te 'di las de gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te 'di las de gzhan na //
translated: and if that is different from this,

original: gzhan de dag gis 'di byas pa //
analyzed: gzhan de dag gis 'di byas pa //
translated: then that other would create this,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: and suffering would be created by another.

original: gal te sngon gyi phung po de dag las da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag gzhan zhing /
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi phung po de dag las da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag gzhan zhing /
translated: If these present aggregates were different from those former aggregates,

original: da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag las kyang sngon gyi phung po de dag gzhan par gyur pa de ltar brtag na ni /
analyzed: da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag las kyang sngon gyi phung po de dag gzhan par gyur pa de ltar brtag na ni /
translated: and if those former aggregates were different from these present aggregates,üîΩthen that other would create this, and suffering would be created by another.

original: gzhan de dag gis 'di dag byas pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang 'gyur ba zhig na de dag las 'di dag gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan de dag gis 'di dag byas pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang 'gyur ba zhig na de dag las 'di dag gzhan ma yin la /
translated: But they are not different from those,

original: 'di dag las kyang de dag gzhan ma yin pas gzhan de dag gis 'di dag ma byas pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ma byas so zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'di dag las kyang de dag gzhan ma yin pas gzhan de dag gis 'di dag ma byas pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ma byas so zhes ston to //
translated: and those are not different from them. Therefore, since that other does not create this, suffering is not created by another.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te sngon gyi tshe rabs snga ma'i phung po de dag las da ltar gzhan du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phung po phyi ma 'di dag gzhan yin par gyur cing /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te sngon gyi tshe rabs snga ma'i phung po de dag las da ltar gzhan du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phung po phyi ma 'di dag gzhan yin par gyur cing /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says: If these later aggregates that link to a new birth were different from the former aggregates of the previous birth,

original: gal te 'di dag las kyang sngon gyi phung po de dag gzhan yin par gyur na ni de ltar brtags na gzhan de dag gis 'di dag byas pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar ni mi 'dod de zhes bya ba smras
analyzed: gal te 'di dag las kyang sngon gyi phung po de dag gzhan yin par gyur na ni de ltar brtags na gzhan de dag gis 'di dag byas pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar ni mi 'dod de zhes bya ba smras
translated: and if those former aggregates were different from these, then, when analyzed in this way, since those others would create these, suffering would be created by another.üîΩBut that is unacceptable.

original: so // ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: so // ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is that unacceptable?

original: de'i phyir gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pas de'i byed pa po nyid ma yin pas de byed pa po nyid yin pa @267a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pas de'i byed pa po nyid ma yin pas de byed pa po nyid yin pa @267a * //
translated: Because it is not the creator since it is inferred to be different.

original: bsal bas gang gi phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par dam bcas pa'i dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bsal bas gang gi phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par dam bcas pa'i dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because of that, the error of the intrinsic reality of the thesis is refuted.

original: gang gi phyir pha rol po dag sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'dod pa de'i phyir lhas byin gyi sngon gyi phung po gzhan dag gis da ltar gyi phung po dag ma byas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir pha rol po dag sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'dod pa de'i phyir lhas byin gyi sngon gyi phung po gzhan dag gis da ltar gyi phung po dag ma byas te /
translated: Because the opponent asserts that suffering is created by another, therefore the present aggregates are not created by the other former aggregates of Devadatta.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi sngon gyi phung po gzhan dag gis lhas byin gyis da ltar gyi phung po dag ma byas pa bzhin te /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi sngon gyi phung po gzhan dag gis lhas byin gyis da ltar gyi phung po dag ma byas pa bzhin te /
translated: Because they are different, for example, the present aggregates of Devadatta are not created by the other former aggregates of Yaj√±adatta,

original: sngon gyi phung po rnams gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pas de dag da ltar gyi phung po dag gi byed pa po nyid ma yin pas de dag gi dam bcas pa la sdug bsngal gyi chos gzhan gyis byas par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon
analyzed: sngon gyi phung po rnams gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pas de dag da ltar gyi phung po dag gi byed pa po nyid ma yin pas de dag gi dam bcas pa la sdug bsngal gyi chos gzhan gyis byas par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon
translated: because it is inferred that the former aggregates are different, they are not the creators of the present aggregates. Therefore the error of the intrinsic reality of the thesis is refuted, that is, the assertion that the phenomenon of suffering is created by another.

original: yod de / gzhan nyid yin na byed pa po dang las kyi mtshan nyid du 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yod de / gzhan nyid yin na byed pa po dang las kyi mtshan nyid du 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Reply: Yes, because if they were different, they would not be related as agent and object.

original: yang na / gzhan de dag gis 'di byas pas //
analyzed: yang na / gzhan de dag gis 'di byas pas //
translated: Moreover, if this is done by those others,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur //
translated: Suffering would be created by another.

original: zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgal te de las 'di gzhan zhing //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / gal te de las 'di gzhan zhing //
translated: This is the remainder of the statement:üîΩIf this is different from that,

original: gal te 'di las de gzhan na //üîΩzhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /
analyzed: gal te 'di las de gzhan na // zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /
translated: and if that is different from this,üîΩIf this were different from that and that were different from this, then suffering would be created by another, since it would be done by those others.

original: de dag las 'di dag gzhan zhing 'di dag las kyang de dag gzhan par gyur na ni gzhan de dag gis 'di dag byas pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang 'gyur ba zhig na de dag gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ma byas
analyzed: de dag las 'di dag gzhan zhing 'di dag las kyang de dag gzhan par gyur na ni gzhan de dag gis 'di dag byas pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang 'gyur ba zhig na de dag gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ma byas
translated: But since it is untenable that they are different, suffering is not created by another.

original: so zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: so zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: This is the point.

original: de dag ji ltar gzhan nyid du mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar gzhan nyid du mi 'thad ce na /
translated: How is it untenable that they are different?

original: de'i phyir 'thad pa de dag la gzhan nyid de yang mi srid pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'thad pa de dag la gzhan nyid de yang mi srid pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, since otherness is impossible in terms of those two,

original: gang gi phyir gnyi ga yod na ni phan tshun ltos pas gzhan zhes tha snyad gdags su rung grang na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyi ga yod na ni phan tshun ltos pas gzhan zhes tha snyad gdags su rung grang na /
translated: because if both exist, then they are suitable to be designated as other in dependence on each other.

original: sngon gyi phung po yod pa'i dus na ni da ltar gyi med la /
analyzed: sngon gyi phung po yod pa'i dus na ni da ltar gyi med la /
translated: When the prior aggregates exist, the present ones do not exist,üîΩand when the present aggregates exist, the prior ones do not exist.

original: da ltar gyi phung po yod pa'i dus na ni sngon gyi med pas 'thad pa de'i sgo nas de dag la gzhan nyid de yang mi srid pa kho na'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ma byas so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi phung po yod pa'i dus na ni sngon gyi med pas 'thad pa de'i sgo nas de dag la gzhan nyid de yang mi srid pa kho na'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ma byas so //
translated: Therefore, since otherness is impossible in terms of those two, suffering is not created by another.

original: gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par gzhan las skye ba med par bstan pa bzhin du de las skye ba med do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par gzhan las skye ba med par bstan pa bzhin du de las skye ba med do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang
translated: Even if they were other, it is like the explanation in the chapter on nonarising that arising from another does not exist, so it is thought that arising from that does not exist.

original: don dam par gzhan las skye ba med par bstan pa snga ma bzhin no zhes @267b bstan to //
analyzed: don dam par gzhan las skye ba med par bstan pa snga ma bzhin no zhes @267b bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the above is that ultimately arising from another does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir ci ltar gzhan nyid mi srid par dgongs she na /üîΩdon dam par lhas byin gyi sngon gyi phung po rnams ni phung po phyi ma rnams las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir ci ltar gzhan nyid mi srid par dgongs she na / don dam par lhas byin gyi sngon gyi phung po rnams ni phung po phyi ma rnams las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the logic of that, one might ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it your intention that otherness is impossible?‚Äù

original: lhas byin gyi phung po yin pa'i phyir dper na phung po phyi ma'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi phung po yin pa'i phyir dper na phung po phyi ma'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Ultimately, the former aggregates of Lhejin are not other than the latter aggregates because they are the aggregates of Lhejin, just like the latter aggregates themselves.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na lhas byin gyi phung po phyi ma rnams ni lhas byin gyi phung po yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi sngon gyi phung po rnams kyang lhas byin gyi phung po yin pa'i phyir phung po phyi
analyzed: dper na lhas byin gyi phung po phyi ma rnams ni lhas byin gyi phung po yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du lhas byin gyi sngon gyi phung po rnams kyang lhas byin gyi phung po yin pa'i phyir phung po phyi
translated: For example, because the latter aggregates of Devadatta are the aggregates of Devadatta, they are not different from his self.

original: ma rnams las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rnams las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, because the former aggregates of Devadatta are the aggregates of Devadatta, they are not different from the latter aggregates.

original: yang na gtan tshigs ni rgyud tha mi dad pa'i sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na gtan tshigs ni rgyud tha mi dad pa'i sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or the reason is because they are the suffering of an undifferentiated continuum.üîΩThe remaining limbs of the syllogism are the same as before.

original: sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma de nyid kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma snga ma bzhin du sbyar la de'i gtan tshigs ni phyi ma 'di dang sbyar du yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma de nyid kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma snga ma bzhin du sbyar la de'i gtan tshigs ni phyi ma 'di dang sbyar du yang rung ba'o //
translated: The remaining limbs of the syllogism of the previous inference are the same as before. The reason of that syllogism can also be applied to the following syllogism.

original: 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: The syllogism is applied as follows.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi sngon gyi phung po rnams ni phung po phyi ma rnams las gzhan ma yin te rgyud tha mi dad pa'i sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir dper na phung po phyi ma'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin te /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi sngon gyi phung po rnams ni phung po phyi ma rnams las gzhan ma yin te rgyud tha mi dad pa'i sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir dper na phung po phyi ma'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin te /
translated: Ultimately, the former aggregates of Devadatta are not different from the latter aggregates because they are the suffering of an undifferentiated continuum, just like the self of the latter aggregates themselves.

original: de ltar dam bcas pa gnyis pa yang bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: de ltar dam bcas pa gnyis pa yang bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Thus, the second proposition has been established.

original: da ni dam bcas pa gsum pa bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dam bcas pa gsum pa bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Now, the third proposition will be established.

original: de'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: To demonstrate the opponent‚Äôs view, it is said:

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu mi myong ba'i phyir dang / gang zag gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pas byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu mi myong ba'i phyir dang / gang zag gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pas byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yang yin la /
translated: Because one does not experience the effects of karma committed by another and because the person is created by different states, suffering is created by itself and also created by another.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin pas phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin pas phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the error of teaching both positions is not committed.

original: pha rol po dag na re gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu mi myong ba'i phyir gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin te /üîΩbdag gis byas pa yang yin la gang zag sngon gyi gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pas byas pa'i phyir bdag gis byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu mi myong ba'i phyir gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin te / bdag gis byas pa yang yin la gang zag sngon gyi gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pas byas pa'i phyir bdag gis byas pa ma yin te /
translated: The opponent says: The self does not perform karma because one does not experience the results of karma committed by another.üîΩNor does the self perform karma because the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin pas sngar dbu ma pas bdag gis ma byas pa dang gzhan gyis ma byas pa'i phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i skyon kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //üîΩde skad ces zer ba @268a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin pas sngar dbu ma pas bdag gis ma byas pa dang gzhan gyis ma byas pa'i phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i skyon kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ro // de skad ces zer ba @268a * //
translated: Since the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.

original: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: Since the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.üîΩSince the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a previous life, the self does not perform karma.

original: 'dir gang zag bdag gis sdug bsngal byas pa dang / gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas par 'dod pa'i phyogs gnyi ga dgag pa rim bzhin du ston te /
analyzed: 'dir gang zag bdag gis sdug bsngal byas pa dang / gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas par 'dod pa'i phyogs gnyi ga dgag pa rim bzhin du ston te /
translated: Since the self is different from the person who committed the karma in a

original: de la re zhig gang zag bdag gis sdug bsngal byas par 'dod pa'i phyogs dgag pa'i phyir 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgal te gang zag bdag gis ni //
analyzed: de la re zhig gang zag bdag gis sdug bsngal byas par 'dod pa'i phyogs dgag pa'i phyir 'dir bshad pa / gal te gang zag bdag gis ni //
translated: First, to refute the assertion that the self of the person creates suffering, the following is stated:

original: sdug bsngal byas na gang bdag gis //üîΩsdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal byas na gang bdag gis // sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag ni //
translated: If the person himself created suffering,üîΩwhat person is without suffering

original: sdug bsngal med pa de gang yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa de gang yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: who created the suffering?

original: gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar gang zag bdag nyid kyis rang gi sdug bsngal byas par brtag na gang zag gang gis bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal byas pa de'i sngon bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal ma byas pa'i dus na de la sdug bsngal med par
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar gang zag bdag nyid kyis rang gi sdug bsngal byas par brtag na gang zag gang gis bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal byas pa de'i sngon bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal ma byas pa'i dus na de la sdug bsngal med par
translated: If, as the opponent asserts, the person himself created his own suffering, then prior to the creation of his suffering, that person would be without suffering.

original: 'gyur te / sdug bsngal med pa'i gang zag ni mi srid de med na gang zag sdug bsngal med pa gang gis bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal ma byas pa byed pa de gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'gyur te / sdug bsngal med pa'i gang zag ni mi srid de med na gang zag sdug bsngal med pa gang gis bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal ma byas pa byed pa de gang zhig yin /
translated: This is because it is impossible for a person to be without suffering. If he were without suffering, what person who is without suffering would create his own suffering that was not created?

original: de ni med pas des sdug bsngal ma byas so zhes ston to //
analyzed: de ni med pas des sdug bsngal ma byas so zhes ston to //
translated: That is not so, and therefore it is shown that suffering is not produced by that person.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la gnod pa bcab pa'i phyir gal te gang zag gang gis phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal byas par rtog na zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩpha rol po dag sngar sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par 'dod pa ma grub par sun byung bas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la gnod pa de bcab pa'i phyir da 'dir gal te 'di skad ces gang zag bdag nyid kyis rang gi phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi
analyzed: rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la gnod pa bcab pa'i phyir gal te gang zag gang gis phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal byas par rtog na zhes bya ba smras te / pha rol po dag sngar sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par 'dod pa ma grub par sun byung bas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la gnod pa de bcab pa'i phyir da 'dir gal te 'di skad ces gang zag bdag nyid kyis rang gi phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi
translated: If you imagine that the person produces the suffering that has the characteristic of the five aggregates,üîΩsince the opponent has already been refuted in his assertion that suffering is self-produced, he is now embarrassed and seeks to conceal his defeated philosophical position.

original: sdug bsngal byas par rtog na'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal byas par rtog na'o //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIf you imagine that the person himself produces the suffering that has the characteristic of his own five aggregates,‚Äù

original: de lta na gang gis bdag gis sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag sdug bsngal med pa de gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: de lta na gang gis bdag gis sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag sdug bsngal med pa de gang zhig yin te /
translated: in that case, what is the person by whom suffering is produced if he is devoid of suffering?

original: bdag gis dngos po gang gis sdug bsngal de byas pa'i gang zag ces brjod pa sdug bsngal med pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩgang zag gang gis bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal byas pa des da dung ma byas pa'i sngon rol na gang zag sdug bsngal med pa yod par mi srid pas de sdug bsngal ma byas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bdag gis dngos po gang gis sdug bsngal de byas pa'i gang zag ces brjod pa sdug bsngal med pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te / gang zag gang gis bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal byas pa des da dung ma byas pa'i sngon rol na gang zag sdug bsngal med pa yod par mi srid pas de sdug bsngal ma byas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The person who is said to create that suffering does not exist without suffering.üîΩThe person who creates his own suffering does not exist without suffering prior to the creation of that suffering.

original: ci ste yang rang gi lta ba bskyang bar 'dod pas gang zag ni phung po rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod @268b par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du brjod na zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas pha rol po dag gi dogs pa bsu
analyzed: ci ste yang rang gi lta ba bskyang bar 'dod pas gang zag ni phung po rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod @268b par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du brjod na zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas pha rol po dag gi dogs pa bsu
translated: But if you maintain your own view and say that the person is inexpressible as the same as or different from the aggregates, then you should not say that the person creates suffering.

original: ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is a statement by a Madhyamika anticipating an objection by the opponent.

original: ci ste yang pha rol po dag rang gi lta ba gang zag bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi byed pa por bsgrub pa de bskyang zhing gzhung gzugs par 'dod pas gang zag phung po las gzhan nyid du brjod na /üîΩde bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi byed pa po ma yin par sngar dbu ma pas sun phyung ba'i skyon de bsub pa'i phyir 'dir kho bo cag gang zag ni phung po rnams dang gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: ci ste yang pha rol po dag rang gi lta ba gang zag bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi byed pa por bsgrub pa de bskyang zhing gzhung gzugs par 'dod pas gang zag phung po las gzhan nyid du brjod na / de bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi byed pa po ma yin par sngar dbu ma pas sun phyung ba'i skyon de bsub pa'i phyir 'dir kho bo cag gang zag ni phung po rnams dang gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: But if the opponent wishes to maintain and establish his view that the person is the creator of his suffering, and if he asserts that the person is different from the aggregates,üîΩthen the fault that the Madhyamika previously demonstrated, namely, that the person is not the creator of his suffering, would still apply.üîΩTherefore, here, we assert that the person is not identical to the aggregates, nor is it different from them.

original: gzhan nyid kyang ma yin par 'dod pas khyed dbu ma pas phung po'i snga rol na gang zag sdug bsngal med pa yod par mi srid do zhes bsgrub pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyang ma yin par 'dod pas khyed dbu ma pas phung po'i snga rol na gang zag sdug bsngal med pa yod par mi srid do zhes bsgrub pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer na'o //
translated: So, when you Madhyamikas prove that it is impossible for the person to exist prior to the aggregates, you are proving what is already established for us.

original: de skad ces zer na de la yang skyon yod de /
analyzed: de skad ces zer na de la yang skyon yod de /
translated: If you say this, then there is a fault in your position.

original: gal te gang zag de phung po rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang /üîΩgang zag ni phung po'i yul la yod par brtag grang na /
analyzed: gal te gang zag de phung po rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang / gang zag ni phung po'i yul la yod par brtag grang na /
translated: If the person is not described as the same as or different from the aggregates,üîΩthen it is still possible to conceive the person as existing in the domain of the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams la ni gang zag med par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: phung po rnams la ni gang zag med par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: But the Commentary explains that the person does not exist in the aggregates:

original: de lta na yang gang zag ni lhas byin zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la med par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang zag ni lhas byin zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la med par shes par bya ste /
translated: Even though this is so, one should understand that the person called ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äù does not exist in the five aggregates.

original: brten nas byung ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: brten nas byung ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because they arise in dependence, like a pot.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na bum pa ni brten nas byung ba'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la med pa de bzhin du gang zag kyang brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la med do //
analyzed: dper na bum pa ni brten nas byung ba'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la med pa de bzhin du gang zag kyang brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la med do //
translated: For example, a vase is not in the five aggregates called Devadatta because it arises in dependence on causes and conditions. Likewise, a person is not in the five aggregates called Devadatta because it arises in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: gal te yod pa nyid 'gog par byed pa'i phyir 'di ni yod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'jig rten na yod pa nyid 'gog par byed kyi med pa nyid 'gog par mi byed de /
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid 'gog par byed pa'i phyir 'di ni yod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'jig rten na yod pa nyid 'gog par byed kyi med pa nyid 'gog par mi byed de /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt exists because you refute its existence,‚Äù the opponent says, ‚ÄúYou refute the existence of a person in the aggregates, but you do not refute its nonexistence.

original: dper na lhas byin khyim na med do zhes brjod kyi nam mkha'i me tog khyim na med do zhes mi zer bas 'dir khyed kyi gang zag phung po rnams la med do zhes bkag pa las na gang zag dngos ni yod do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no
analyzed: dper na lhas byin khyim na med do zhes brjod kyi nam mkha'i me tog khyim na med do zhes mi zer bas 'dir khyed kyi gang zag phung po rnams la med do zhes bkag pa las na gang zag dngos ni yod do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no
translated: For example, you say, ‚ÄòDevadatta is not in the house,‚Äô but you do not say, ‚ÄòA sky flower is not in the house.‚Äô Therefore, since you refute the person in the aggregates, you affirm the existence of the person as a thing.‚Äù

original: // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i gtso bo dang skyes bu dang dbang phyug la sogs pa dag @269a * //
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i gtso bo dang skyes bu dang dbang phyug la sogs pa dag @269a * //
translated: Because it is not definite that the self is not like the primal substance, person, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on imputed by tƒ´rthikas,

original: gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / don dam par dpe med pa'i phyir dang yod pa nyid 'ga' yang ni 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / don dam par dpe med pa'i phyir dang yod pa nyid 'ga' yang ni 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because there is no example of the self in the ultimate, and because it is not tenable that it exists in any way.

original: 'jig rten na mu stegs byed dag gis yongs su brtag pa'i gtso bo la sogs pa med pa dag 'gog par byed pa yang mthong bas des na ci re zhig dgag pa yod pa'i phyir lhas byin khyim na med kyang dngos po yod pa bzhin du gang zag
analyzed: 'jig rten na mu stegs byed dag gis yongs su brtag pa'i gtso bo la sogs pa med pa dag 'gog par byed pa yang mthong bas des na ci re zhig dgag pa yod pa'i phyir lhas byin khyim na med kyang dngos po yod pa bzhin du gang zag
translated: Since it is seen that the world refutes the nonexistence of primal substance and so on imputed by tƒ´rthikas, does the self exist like Devadatta who is not in the house but exists outside,

original: phung po rnams la med kyang dngos po yod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: phung po rnams la med kyang dngos po yod par 'gyur ram /
translated: or does the self exist like Devadatta‚Äôs ox that does not exist?

original: 'on te dgag pa yod pa'i phyir gtso bo la sogs pa gtan med pa bzhin du gang zag kyang gtan med par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / don dam par gang zag yod pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir dang / don dam par yod pa nyid 'ga' yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir klan ka de ni bzang po ma yin no //üîΩgal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces khyed kyi gtan tshigs brten nas byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de kho bo cag la ma grags pas gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa
analyzed: 'on te dgag pa yod pa'i phyir gtso bo la sogs pa gtan med pa bzhin du gang zag kyang gtan med par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / don dam par gang zag yod pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir dang / don dam par yod pa nyid 'ga' yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir klan ka de ni bzang po ma yin no // gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces khyed kyi gtan tshigs brten nas byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de kho bo cag la ma grags pas gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa
translated: But if you say that because of the negation, the person is definitely nonexistent, like the primal substance, then there is no example for the ultimate existence of the person, and it is not tenable that anything exists ultimately. Therefore, your objection is not good.

original: byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: If the opponent says, ‚ÄúYour reason, because it is dependently arisen, is not established for me, so it is not a valid reason,‚Äù then the following is the response to that, which is drawn from the Commentary:

original: 'dir yang sngar slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: 'dir yang sngar slob dpon gyis /
translated: Here, the master has already said:

original: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
translated: If it were created by itself,

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: it would not arise dependently.

original: zhes bya ba sdug bsngal gyi chos brten nas byung ba nyid yin par bstan pa de'i dbang kho nas rjes su dpag pa bstan to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba sdug bsngal gyi chos brten nas byung ba nyid yin par bstan pa de'i dbang kho nas rjes su dpag pa bstan to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The mere power of that teaching is the teaching of the inference.

original: gang gi phyir pha rol po dag la yang gang zag dang phung po rnams brten nas byung bar grags pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir pha rol po dag la yang gang zag dang phung po rnams brten nas byung bar grags pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because for the opponent, the person and the aggregates are renowned as dependently originated, the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.

original: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par gang zag ma grub pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gang zag gang gis kyang bdag gis ma byas par grub po zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par gang zag ma grub pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gang zag gang gis kyang bdag gis ma byas par grub po zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, since the person is not established ultimately in this way, the conclusion is that it is established that suffering is not created by any person at all.

original: de ltar na re zhig gang zag bdag gis sdug bsngal ma byas so //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig gang zag bdag gis sdug bsngal ma byas so //
translated: Thus, the person does not create suffering by himself.

original: de ni gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas par 'dod pa'i phyogs dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas par 'dod pa'i phyogs dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute the position that asserts that suffering is created by another person,

original: da ni ci ltar gang zag gzhan du gyur pas sdug bsngal byas par mi 'thad par de ltar bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni ci ltar gang zag gzhan du gyur pas sdug bsngal byas par mi 'thad par de ltar bshad pa /
translated: now it is explained how it is untenable that suffering is created by another person.

original: gal te gang zag gzhan gyis ni //üîΩsdug bsngal byas na gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: gal te gang zag gzhan gyis ni // sdug bsngal byas na gzhan zhig gis //
translated: If another person created the suffering,

original: sdug bsngal de byas gang sbyin te //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de byas gang sbyin te //
translated: then another would give it to him.

original: sdug bsngal med par ci ltar rung //
analyzed: sdug bsngal med par ci ltar rung //
translated: But how could there be suffering

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa @269b smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa @269b smras te /
translated: without someone to experience it?

original: gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar sngon gyi gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas nas da ltar gyi gang zag la sbyin par brtag grang na sngon gyi gang zag gang gis sdug bsngal byas nas da ltar gyi gang zag la sbyin par byed pa des
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar sngon gyi gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas nas da ltar gyi gang zag la sbyin par brtag grang na sngon gyi gang zag gang gis sdug bsngal byas nas da ltar gyi gang zag la sbyin par byed pa des
translated: If you imagine that the suffering created by a previous person is given to the present person, as the opponent asserts, then by whom is the suffering created and given to the present person?

original: da dung de la ma sbyin pa'i dus na gang la sbyin par bya ba'i gang zag de sdug bsngal med par len pa po'i bdag nyid du yod par ci ltar rung ste mi rung ngo zhes ston to //
analyzed: da dung de la ma sbyin pa'i dus na gang la sbyin par bya ba'i gang zag de sdug bsngal med par len pa po'i bdag nyid du yod par ci ltar rung ste mi rung ngo zhes ston to //
translated: But how could it be tenable that the person to whom the suffering is given exists without suffering prior to the time when it is given? It could not!

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, If another person created the suffering, then another would give it to him.

original: gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar sngon gyi gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas nas da ltar gyi gang zag la sbyin par rtog na'o //
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar sngon gyi gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas nas da ltar gyi gang zag la sbyin par rtog na'o //
translated: If you imagine that the suffering is created by another person in the past and given to the person of the present, as the opponent believes.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: In that case,

original: gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gzhan zhig gis sdug bsngal de byas nas gang la sbyin par bya ba de sdug bsngal med par ci ltar rung ste de ni yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gzhan zhig gis sdug bsngal de byas nas gang la sbyin par bya ba de sdug bsngal med par ci ltar rung ste de ni yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: how could it be tenable that the suffering is created by another person who is a different, separate stage, and then given to the person to whom it belongs, since that person would be without suffering? It is absolutely not tenable.

original: gang zag sdug bsngal med pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / de yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang zag sdug bsngal med pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / de yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is because the person without suffering is refuted and because there is no inference that demonstrates that person‚Äôs existence.

original: tshe snga ma'i gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gang zag gzhan zhig gis sdug bsngal de byas nas da ltar gyi gang zag gang la sbyin par bya ba de la da dung ma byin pa'i dus na da ltar gyi gang zag de sdug bsngal med par len pa
analyzed: tshe snga ma'i gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gang zag gzhan zhig gis sdug bsngal de byas nas da ltar gyi gang zag gang la sbyin par bya ba de la da dung ma byin pa'i dus na da ltar gyi gang zag de sdug bsngal med par len pa
translated: If you imagine that the suffering is created by another person who is a different, separate stage in a past life and then given to the person of the present, then at the time when it is not yet given to the person of the present to whom it belongs, that person of the present would be without suffering.

original: po'i dngos por yod par ci ltar rung ste /
analyzed: po'i dngos por yod par ci ltar rung ste /
translated: How could it be tenable that the person exists as a thing?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
