translated: It does not exist at all.

original: gang zag sdug bsngal med par sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir dang / de yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa pha rol po dag la med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
analyzed: gang zag sdug bsngal med par sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir dang / de yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa pha rol po dag la med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
translated: The person does not exist because it has been refuted earlier, and because the opponent does not have an inference that demonstrates that it exists.

original: ; da ltar gyi gang zag med pa'i phyir gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na gang gi phyir des byas pa gzhan gyis byas par zhes bya bar 'gyur zhes bya bas ni glags yod pa'i tshig snga ma las bzlog nas skabs kyi
analyzed: ; da ltar gyi gang zag med pa'i phyir gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na gang gi phyir des byas pa gzhan gyis byas par zhes bya bar 'gyur zhes bya bas ni glags yod pa'i tshig snga ma las bzlog nas skabs kyi
translated: Since the present person does not exist, the otherness of the different states does not exist. Therefore, how could it be said that ‚Äúthe effect of that other is produced by another‚Äù?

original: don nyid ston te /
analyzed: don nyid ston te /
translated: This shows that the meaning of the context is the opposite of the previous statement that has an opportunity for refutation.

original: gal te gang la sbyin pa da ltar gyi gang zag len pa po zhig yod na ni de la ltos nas tshe snga ma'i gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gang zag gzhan nyid kyang yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te gang la sbyin pa da ltar gyi gang zag len pa po zhig yod na ni de la ltos nas tshe snga ma'i gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gang zag gzhan nyid kyang yod par 'gyur //
translated: If the present person who gives existed as the appropriator, then in dependence on that, the otherness of the person in the different states of the previous life would also exist.

original: des sdug bsngal byas pa ni gang zag gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya bar yang 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: des sdug bsngal byas pa ni gang zag gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya bar yang 'gyur grang na /
translated: If it were made by another, then it would be called ‚Äúmade by another person.‚Äù

original: gang la sbyin pa da ltar gyi gang zag @270a * //
analyzed: gang la sbyin pa da ltar gyi gang zag @270a * //
translated: But since there is no present person who is the recipient of the gift,

original: len pa po med pa'i phyir tshe snga ma'i gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gang zag gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin pas gang gi phyir des sdug bsngal byas pa gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: len pa po med pa'i phyir tshe snga ma'i gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gang zag gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin pas gang gi phyir des sdug bsngal byas pa gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: there is no other person who is a different stage in a previous life. Therefore, it would not be tenable to say that suffering is made by another.

original: gzhan yang sngar rjes su dpag pa la sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so zhes bya ba de bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngar rjes su dpag pa la sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so zhes bya ba de bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, it has already been demonstrated through inference that suffering is not self-made. Therefore:

original: bdag gis byas pa ma grub pas //
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa ma grub pas //
translated: Since self-production is not established,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
translated: how could suffering be produced by another?üîΩThe intended meaning is that it is impossible for suffering to be produced by another if it is not self-produced.

original: ma byas pa la gzhan gyi tha snyad mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal ma byas pa'i 'thad pa gzhan ston to //
analyzed: ma byas pa la gzhan gyi tha snyad mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal ma byas pa'i 'thad pa gzhan ston to //
translated: This demonstrates another reason that suffering is not produced by another.

original: sngar / gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
analyzed: sngar / gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
translated: If it were created by itself,

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: then it would not arise in dependence.

original: gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
analyzed: gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
translated: Because these aggregates

original: brten nas phung po de dag 'byung //üîΩzhes rjes su dpag pa las sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so zhes bya ba de bstan zin pas de'i phyir ci ltar ring po la ltos pa med na thung du yang med pa de bzhin du bdag gis byas pa med na gzhan gyis byas pa yang med
analyzed: brten nas phung po de dag 'byung // zhes rjes su dpag pa las sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so zhes bya ba de bstan zin pas de'i phyir ci ltar ring po la ltos pa med na thung du yang med pa de bzhin du bdag gis byas pa med na gzhan gyis byas pa yang med
translated: arise in dependence on those aggregates.üîΩThus it was explained that suffering is not self-created. Therefore, just as there is no short without depending on long, so too there is no other-creation without self-creation.

original: pas de'i phyir bdag gis ma byas shing bdag nyid med pa la gzhan gyi tha snyad kyang mi srid pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gang zag gzhan gyis ma byas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: pas de'i phyir bdag gis ma byas shing bdag nyid med pa la gzhan gyi tha snyad kyang mi srid pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gang zag gzhan gyis ma byas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Thus it is the intention that suffering is not created by another person because it is impossible to impute another without self-creation and without self.

original: yang na rgyud so sor nges pa la las rnam par smin pa can gzhan gyis byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na rgyud so sor nges pa la las rnam par smin pa can gzhan gyis byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, it is impossible for another to create the karma that ripens in a specific continuum.

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
translated: How could suffering be created by another?

original: zhes gsungs te zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba 'di'i don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba 'di'i don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthus it is said‚Äù indicates that the meaning of the root text is explained in another way.

original: lha dang mi la sogs pa rgyud so sor nges pa las dge ba dang / mi dge ba gang la rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang / mi 'ong ba yod pa de ni rgyud so sor nges pa la las rnam par smin pa can zhes bya ba de /
analyzed: lha dang mi la sogs pa rgyud so sor nges pa las dge ba dang / mi dge ba gang la rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang / mi 'ong ba yod pa de ni rgyud so sor nges pa la las rnam par smin pa can zhes bya ba de /
translated: Karma that is certain to be experienced by a specific continuum refers to virtuous and nonvirtuous karma that will yield pleasant and unpleasant karmic maturation, respectively, in the continuum of a specific being, such as a god or human.

original: las de ni rgyud so sor nges pa rang gis byed kyi gzhan gyis byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: las de ni rgyud so sor nges pa rang gis byed kyi gzhan gyis byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: This karma is certain to be experienced by the specific continuum that committed the action, because it is impossible for another to experience the result of karma committed by another.üîΩMaster NƒÅgƒÅrjuna said:

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
translated: How could suffering be created by another?

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: This concludes the section on the summary.

original: de'i phyir de ltar sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni skabs gyi  mjug bsdu ba yin te /üîΩde'i phyir de ltar dpyad na gang gi tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni skabs gyi  mjug bsdu ba yin te /üîΩde'i phyir de ltar dpyad na gang gi tshe /
translated: Therefore, when analyzed in this way, it is untenable that suffering is created by self or other.

original: gang zag bdag dang gang zag gzhan byed pa po nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa nyid du mi 'thad @270b do //
analyzed: gang zag bdag dang gang zag gzhan byed pa po nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa nyid du mi 'thad @270b do //
translated: When the self of the person and another person are not the agent, then it is untenable that suffering is self-produced or produced by another.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa //
translated: If another produces suffering,

original: de ni de yi bdag byas 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni de yi bdag byas 'gyur //
translated: then that would be self-produced by that person.

original: gnas skabs gzhan tha dad du zin kyang gang zag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas kyang sdug bsngal gang zag gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin pa'i gzhung bsnan pa rnam par gzhan ston te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan tha dad du zin kyang gang zag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas kyang sdug bsngal gang zag gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin pa'i gzhung bsnan pa rnam par gzhan ston te /
translated: This also teaches a different interpretation of the statement that suffering is not produced by another person, since the person is not different even though the states are different.

original: gang zag gang gis sngon gyi phung po la brten nas sdug bsngal gang byed pa de ni gang zag de'i da ltar gyi phung po'i gnas skabs su yang bdag gis byas pa zhes bya ba de dag yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang zag gang gis sngon gyi phung po la brten nas sdug bsngal gang byed pa de ni gang zag de'i da ltar gyi phung po'i gnas skabs su yang bdag gis byas pa zhes bya ba de dag yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the person who previously produced suffering in dependence on the aggregates were different from the person who is in the present state of the aggregates, then that suffering would be self-produced by that person.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not be produced by another.

original: 'di ltar tshe snga ma'i phung po'i gnas skabs gzhan dang da ltar gyi phung po tha dad du zin kyang gang zag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir de yang gzhan gyis byas par ma grub po //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe snga ma'i phung po'i gnas skabs gzhan dang da ltar gyi phung po tha dad du zin kyang gang zag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir de yang gzhan gyis byas par ma grub po //
translated: Thus, even though the present aggregates are different from the aggregates of a previous life, the person is not different. Therefore, suffering is not established as self-produced.üîΩTherefore, ‚Äúself-produced‚Äù and ‚Äúother-produced‚Äù are mere words.

original: de lta bas na bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya ba de dag ni gyi na'o zhes bya ba ni sngar pha rol po dag na re gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu mi myong ba'i phyir dang / gang zag gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pas byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya ba de dag ni gyi na'o zhes bya ba ni sngar pha rol po dag na re gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu mi myong ba'i phyir dang / gang zag gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pas byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yang yin la /
translated: Previously, the opponent said, ‚ÄúSince one does not experience the effect of an action produced by another, and since suffering is produced by the person in a different state, suffering is self-produced.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin pas phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i skyon med do zhes phung po'i mtshan nyid phyogs su byas nas sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas so zhes zer ba'i lan gyi mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin pas phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i skyon med do zhes phung po'i mtshan nyid phyogs su byas nas sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas so zhes zer ba'i lan gyi mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Since suffering is produced by another, the two positions are taught without fault.‚Äù This is the conclusion of the response to the assertion that suffering is produced by both, which is a position that attributes the characteristics of the aggregates to the person.

original: da ni dam bcas pa gsum pa de nyid sgrub pa'i phyir gang zag gi mtshan nyid phyogs su byas nas sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas byas pa dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan ston te /
analyzed: da ni dam bcas pa gsum pa de nyid sgrub pa'i phyir gang zag gi mtshan nyid phyogs su byas nas sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas byas pa dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan ston te /
translated: Now, in order to prove the third thesis, the topic of the characteristics of the person is taken up in order to demonstrate another method of refuting the self and another producing suffering.

original: de'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: To demonstrate the opponent‚Äôs position, it is said:

original: gang zag gi bdag gis byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag gis byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yang yin la /
translated: Suffering is produced by the self because it is produced by the self of the person.

original: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin te /
translated: Suffering is produced by another because that which is suffering is not the person.

original: de ltar rnam grangs las bdag dang gzhan gyis byas par grub pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam grangs las bdag dang gzhan gyis byas par grub pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, because it is established that suffering is produced by the self and by another in this way, there is no error.

original: 'dir rang gi sde pa dag las rnam par phye ste smra ba pa'i sde dang / chos srung sde dang / gos dmar sde dang / gnas ma'i bu'i sde dang / sa ston gyi sde dang / chos mchog sde dang / sar sgrogs rigs kyi sde zhes bya ba sde pa bdun po de dag ni phal cher gang zag tu smra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi sde pa dag las rnam par phye ste smra ba pa'i sde dang / chos srung sde dang / gos dmar sde dang / gnas ma'i bu'i sde dang / sa ston gyi sde dang / chos mchog sde dang / sar sgrogs rigs kyi sde zhes bya ba sde pa bdun po de dag ni phal cher gang zag tu smra ba yin te /
translated: Here, the seven schools of our own Buddhist faction‚Äîthe VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´ya, Dharmottarƒ´ya, Kaurukullaka, BhadrƒÅyanƒ´ya, Dharmaguptaka, Uttarƒ´ya, and P≈´rva≈õaila‚Äîare for the most part proponents of the person.

original: de dag las kha @271a * //üîΩcig ni phung po dang / gang zag gcig par 'dod pas gang zag bdag gis byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yin zhes zer /
analyzed: de dag las kha @271a * // cig ni phung po dang / gang zag gcig par 'dod pas gang zag bdag gis byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yin zhes zer /
translated: Here, the seven sects of our own Buddhist school‚Äîthe VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´ya, Dharmottarƒ´ya, Kaurukullaka, BhadrƒÅyanƒ´ya, Dharmaguptaka, Uttarƒ´ya, and P≈´rva≈õaila‚Äîare for the most part proponents of the person.üîΩSome of them assert that the aggregates and the person are the same, and they say that suffering is self-produced because the person is produced by itself.

original: kha cig ni phung po dang gang zag tha dad par 'dod pas sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig ni phung po dang gang zag tha dad par 'dod pas sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes zer te /
translated: Some assert that the aggregates and the person are different, and they say that suffering is produced by another because the person is not the same as suffering.

original: de'i phyir sde pa bdun po de dag na re de ltar gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i rnam grangs las sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gyis byas par grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir sde pa bdun po de dag na re de ltar gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i rnam grangs las sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gyis byas par grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the seven schools say: Since suffering is established as self-produced and other-produced in terms of the categories of sameness and difference,

original: khyed dbu ma pas gnyi gas byas pa'i phyogs sun dbyung ba'i skyon snga ma dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas gnyi gas byas pa'i phyogs sun dbyung ba'i skyon snga ma dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //
translated: the previous faults of refuting the position of production by both you MƒÅdhyamikas do not exist in our system.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
translated: Suffering is not self-produced.

original: gang zag bdag gis ma byas so //
analyzed: gang zag bdag gis ma byas so //
translated: The person is not self-produced.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i gang zag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i gang zag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Because there is no person who is not the entity of suffering.
